title: CAMBODIAN REBELS CAPTURE A VILLAGE
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, July31 (UPI)Insurgent troops overran a village 50 miles north of Phnom Penh after Government reinforcements were, stopped less than two miles away, military sources said today. Another village 35 miles northwest of the capital was reported under siege and the situation there described as desperate.

title: Goodly Audience for Mostly Mozart
description: It's not as ancient as the changing of the guard at Buckingham Palace, but it's a tradition, and it's our own the Mostly Mozart Festival each August in Philharmonic Hall. And it would seem that New York is responding to this tradition. Monday night, at the first concert of the series, the hall was sold out, and the emphasis was on youth, all anxious to hear the three composers featured this summerMozart, of course, and Handel and Bach.

title: Cut in Cancer Research Funds Scored by 2 Senate Democrats
description: WASHINGTON, July 31Two Senate Democratic leaders, Mike Mansfield of Montana and Warren G. Magnuson of Washington, charged today that President Nixon's muchpublic izedprogram to conquer cancer was more myth than reality.

title: Fish From Drained Pond End Up in Queens Homes
description: The high price of beef played a role yesterday in the rehabilitation of Bowne Park, in Flushing, Queens.

title: JAMES P. CULLEN
description: RUMSON, N. J., July 31James P. Cullen, a vice president of the New York Stock Exchange firm of Robb, Peck, McCooey & Co., Inc., died yesterday at Monmouth Medical Center in Long Branch. He was 37 years old and lived at 15 Heathcliff Road.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, July 31 (UPI)Spokesmen for hockey and basketball told Congress today they could live with ligislation intended to end blackouts of home sports games on local television. But Don Ruck, vice president of the National Hockey League, and William Alverson, president of the Milwaukee Bucks of the National Basketball Association, said they were opposed to the proposed legislation in principle.

title: A VISIT TO JAPAN PLANNED BY NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, July 31 President Nixon and Premier Kakuei Tanaka of Japan agreed this morning that the President would visit Japan within the next 18 months and that Emperor Hirohito would come to the United States during 1974.

title: Women Inmates Tell of Low Wage Outside Day Jobs
description: TRENTON, July 31Women prison inmates told a state legislative committee today that they were a source of cheap labor for homeowners who wanted housecleaners and gardeners.

title: Ban on More Parking Facilities Urged
description: Declaring there already is a significant surplus of offstreet parking facilities in midtown Manhattan, the Lindsay administration announced yesterday proposals designed to urtail sharply the development of parking lots and garages in he area.

title: Warsaw Pact Asks That Europe Parley End in 73
description: MOSCOW, July 31The Soviet Union and its East Egopean allies issued a fresh call tonight for completing the Conference on European Security and Cooperation by the end of 1973 and crowning it with an EastWest summit meeting.

title: U.N. to Receive Report By Waldheim on Bagging
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., July 31 (AP)Secretary General Waldheim announced today that he planned to submit a report on bugging early next year to the United Nations Commission on Human Rights, which would forward, it to the General Assembly.

title: American League
description: New York 5, Bostoji 4 (n) Baltimore 5, Cleveland 1 (twi) Detroit 6, Milwaukee 5 (1st, twi.).

title: Land Is Sought by Newark For ScatterSite Housing
description: NEWARK, July 31A search for available parcels of land that may be available here for lowrent public housing is beginning as a result of the release of $13.7million in Federal funds for construction of scatter site housing projects here.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEWARK, July 31Pitchers with blazing fast balls still dominate softball around the country, but their importance has been dwindling with the advent of slowpitch leagues. These leagues, which bar the speed boys, are continually growing on the national level and New Jersey is keeping pace with the trend.

title: Satellites to Spot Fires
description: MEXICO CITY, (AP)  The Agriculture Ministry said orbiting satellites would be used to spot forest fires along the U. S.Mexican border. Officials of the two countries agreed on the plan at a meeting in Guadalajara, the announcement added.

title: Bavaria Loses Suit to Void West German Pact With East
description: BONN, July 31The West German Constitutional Court in Karlsruhe today rejected a Bavarian government contention that the treaty between East Germany and West Germany was unconstitutional.

title: DR. ALFRED VOGL; N.Y.U. PROFESSOR
description: Dr. Alfred Vogl, professor of clinical medicine at the New York University School of Medi tine and widely known for his discovery of advances of diuresis, died of an apparent heart attack in Selva, Italy, on Monday. He was 78 years old and lived at 145 East 84th Street.

title: Transit Bond Issue Is Passed; Albany Special Session Ends
description: ALBANY, July 31Governor Rockefeller's $3.5billion bond plan for freezing transit fares and building new subways and highways received final passage in the Legislature late tonight, and both houses then adjourned the special legislative session.

title: CHILEAN ECONOMY PERILED BY STRIKE
description: SANTIAGO, Chile July 31Chile's embattled Marxist Government is faced with a grave new challenge as a truck owners strike threatens to paralyze the country.

title: Red Smith
description: Scholars versed in the folkways of the common American playground director (homo infantum) have been fascinated by the reaction of the Amateur Athletic Union, the National Collegiate Athletic Association, the United States Olympic Committee and the National Rifle Association of America to a bill called the Amateur Athletic Act of 1973 that has been introduced by Senator John V. Tunney of California. Frightened lest they lose their right to measure the crossbar in the pole vault, the A.A.U., N.C.A.A., U.S.O.C. and N.R.A. are all lobbying against the bill that Philip 0. Kruinm of Kenosha, Wis., president of the Olympic Committee, calls the most dangerous legislation ever put forward for passage, in the history of our country. We have it on the word of Charles Dudley Warner that politics makes strange bedfellows and Mr. W. Shakespeare has advised us that misery acquaints a man with strange bedfellows, but surely neither authority could have foreseen such a motley crew as this sharing a single kip.

title: Trucks and Buses Face a Noise Limit
description: WASHINGTON, July 31 The Environmental Protection Agency, in the first regulatory action it has taken to cut noise pollution, proposed noise limits today for interstate trucks and buses.

title: Indicted ExOfficial Of Camden Is Hired As City's Lobbyist
description: CAMDEN, July 31 (UPI)Elijah Perry, who stepped down a month ago as City Council president while under indictment, will take office tomorrow as Camden's first state lobbyist.

title: Saratoga Race Track
description: Saratoga Race Track

title: John Viertel Weds Linda Gilmore
description: OMAHA, July 31 Miss Linda Gilmore, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Maurice R. Gilmore, formerly of Great Neck, L. I., and John R1 trel,. son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Viertel of Stamford, Conn., and Christiansted, St. Croix, were married here this afternoon by Rabbi Sidney Brooks in Temple Israel.

title: Brewer Denies Nixon Aid
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., July 31 (AP)A top campaign aide to former Gov. Albert Brewer denied today knowledge of an alleged 400,000 contribution from President Nixon's campaign funds in 1970. Mr. Brewer was making a bid in 1970 to defeat Gov. George C. Wallace for the Democratic nominaion for GOVernor. Ear114 in the day, the former White House chief of staff, H. R. Haldeman, told the Senate Watergate committee that he had authorized the contribution to Mr. Brewer's campaign for the Democratic party nomination.

title: Check of Phone Lines by F.B.I. Stirs Dispute at Trial of 7 Antiwar Veterans
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., July 31 A shortlived imbroglio deeloped today on the first day of the trial of seven antiwar Tietnam veterans here after Iwo F.B.I. agents were discovered with telephone and electronic gear in a broom closet adjacent to the courtsupplied defense offices in the Federal Building.

title: Golden Mist
description: During the night the lightning had flashed, thunder had shaken the darkness and rain had poured down in awesome quantities. But now dawn had come at last, a hushed and peaceful dawn given special magic by a soft mist transformed to gold.

title: Records: Etta James back
description: Etta James, involved with personal problems, has been away from recording for two years. Now she emerges again with Etta James (Chess Records CH 50042, $5.98) with power undimmed, a singer looking over her shoulder to the future. Even in the nineteenfifties (when she recorded her first hits) Etta was, although termed a rock nroll singer, heavily into gospel sounds, a reflection of her first singing in the Baptist church. Those strong and vibrant roots are contained in this 1973 album.

title: Marcer's Hit Helps New York Snap Losing Streak
description: BOSTON, July 31The New York Yankees held onto first place by their fingertips tonight when they scored three runs in the ninth inning to defeat the Boston Red. Sox, 54, and snap a fourgame losing streak.

title: Concert
description: Herewith, from one who attempted to hear Monday evening's concert in Central Park Mall by the Naumburg Symphony Orchestra, a modest proposal: If the sponsors of the 68yearold series cannot afford megawatt amplifiers capable of matching the volume of noise poured out by the Schaefer Music Festival at the Wollman Rink, the Naumburg Concerts should go out of business.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: An interesting pattern is emerging from the Senate Watergate hearings. My very strong impression is that the tapes being sought by the committee, if released, would fail to incriminate either the President or his close associates in wrongdoing in the Watergate mess.

title: BIG BEEF HOUSES TO CLOSE FOR DAY
description: A number of the major wholesale beef houses serving New York City said yesterday they would close for the day today because the remaining supplies of beef do not warrant a fiveday operation this week. They said they aimed to conserve beef on hand for their customers for weekend business.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: BENEFIT They will be, holding benefit performances this week for John Peter Zenger, a newspaperman who languished in jail for nine months before a jury found him not guilty of libel. Zenger's ordeal ended when he was freed exactly 238 years ago next Saturday on charges of having libeled the Governor of the British royal province of New York. His trial, a civil rights landmark, took place in the City Hall that stood at the corner of Wall and Nassau Streets, where Federal Hall now stands.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Pittsburgh Pirates, twilightnight doubleheader, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 5:35 P.M. (TelevisionChannel 9, 8 P.M.) (RadloWHN, 5:35 P.M.)

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A Newark police cruiser was hit with .22caliber bullets early yesterday. The windshield was smashed but two patrolmen riding in the vehicle escaped injury.

title: SALARY OFFERS UP FOR 73 GRADUATES
description: Beginning salary offers to this year's college graduates increased noticeably for the first time in four years, the College Placement Council reported yesterday.

title: A CrewCut Dragon Acts More Like a Polite Scout
description: WASHINGTON, July 31Whether it was former White House associates talking or critics within or without the Nixon Administration, H. R. Haldeman usually seemed to be portrayed as the tough guy  a sort of crewca dragon breathing fire outside the gates to the President's Oval Office.

title: Notes on People
description: Breathes there a ballerina who would not like to do a pas de deux with Rudolf Nureyev? Yes, there does. She is Natolia Makarova who just finished dancing with Nureyev in Swan Lake in Paris. As both dancers were defectors at different times from the Soviet Union and the Kirov Ballet, their appearance together in Paris had been billed as an event of some interest. But, with out going into specifics, Miss Makarova, who sometimes dances with the American Ballet Theater, said I am used to ballet that is refined, and a partner must be refined, flexible, sensitive.

title: Roundup: Palmer Conquers Indians 5th,Time in Row as Orioles Win, 51
description: As far as the Cleveland Indians are concerned, James Alvin Palmer of the Baltimore Orioles ought to be traded  out or the American League, naturally.

title: Trip With Contractor Explained by Talmadge
description: WASHINGTON, July 31 (AP)  Senator Herman E. Talmadge, Democrat of Georgia, a member of the Senate Watergate committee, said today that he had gone on a vacation to the Caribbean with a Government contractor because the contractor was a friend of his.

title: Senate Votes Revised Farm Bill After Conferees Fail to Agree
description: WASHINGTON, July 31The Senate passed tonight a new version of a farm bill after a SenateHouse conference deadlocked and gave up on an effort to reach a compromise on an antistrike provision.

title: Dow Declines 7.37 Points On Impeachment Report
description: The stock market sold off sharply late yesterday afternoon shortly after newswires carried a report that a resolution calling for the impeachment of President Nixon had been introduced in the House of Representatives.

title: CHINATOWN FAIR DISPENSES ADVICE
description: A Chinatown street fair, which beganlast Saturday with firecrackers and a dragon dance, is providing residents of the area with information and counseling on health, housing, education, the law and programs for the elderly.

title: Israeli Humor: It's Jewish, It's a Joke, but Not a Jewish Joke
description: AFEKA, Israel, July 31Israelis know how to laugh, but they don't generate any real humor of their own. It's one of the casualties of 25 years of war and tension. Even our victories have taken a toll in the national sense of humor. Mind you, I'm not complaining. I prefer it to losing.

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:
Drunken Driver Guilty Of Taking Road Test
description: PATERSON, N.J., July 31A 41yearold man was convicted today on a charge of having driven while impaired by alcohol while taking a road test for a drivers license.

title: Two Weeks After Coup, Afghan Government Remains Paralyzed and Public Seems Mostly Apathetic
description: KABUL, Afghanistan, July 29  Nearly two weeks after a militnry coup deposed the Afghan monarchy, the Government remains paralyzed, the streets are uneasily silent and the bazaars simmer with whispered gossip.

title: Saigon Is Forcibly Moving Thousands in Delta Region
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 31Since the ceasefire began in. January the Saigon Government has forcibly moved thousands of Mekong Delta peasants out of areas frequented by the Vietcong.

title: Tanaka, Nixon and Haldeman
description: WASHINGTON, July 31We are being instructed these days by H. R. Haldeman to lift our eyes from the Watergate to the wider perspectives of the world, and with Premier Tanaka of Japan in Washington, the advice is better than its source.

title: Iran Willing to Take Over Canada's TruceUnit Role
description: WASHINGTON, July 31Iran has agreed to an American request that she take Canada's place on the fournation ceasefire commission in South Vietnam, Administration officials said today.

title: U.S. ALLOWS A STAY TO EXMANILA AIDE
description: The Immigration and Naturalization Service yesterday granted a yearlong stay of a deportation order against a former Philippine Government official who had requested political asylum here.

title: BONN SETS TALKS ON SPYING CHARGE
description: BONN, July 31West German officials are scheduled to meet later this week to study results of an investigation into news reports charging that the American military engaged in illegal intelligence activities here.

title: House Panel Cites Liddy for Contempt
description: WASHINGTON, July 31The House Armed Services Committee voted unanimously today to cite G. Gordon Liddy, a convicted Watergate conspirator, for contempt of Congress.

title: TV: Is This Progress?
description: An uncommonly thoughtprovoking documentary of the effect of burgeoning technology on three generations of Americans was shown last night over the National Broadcasting Company. But Is This Progress? was lucid, balanced and vividly presented a decided quality entry in the N.B.C. Reports series. Frank McGee was narrator, with a script by Fred Freed (the executive producer), Darold Murray directed, and Craig Leake was the producer.

title: Trucks and Buses Face a Noise Limit
description: WASHINGTON, July 31 The Environmental Protection Agency, in the first regulatory action it has taken to cut noise pollution, proposed noise limits today for interstate trucks and buses.

title: Haldeman Says He Learned of Watergate Events Before They Became Public
description: WASHINGTON, July 31H. R. Haldeman testified today that he had learned a number of details about several of the more controversial aspects of the Watergate affair long before they became public.

title: People and Business
description: Olivier Giscard d'Estaing, president of a data services company called Cornpagnie Internationale de Teleinformatique, said here yesterday that the Common Market should be able to achieve monetary union with full convertibility by 1980.

title: POLICEMAN STABBED BUT MAKES ARRESTS
description: A policeman was stabbed yesterday as he attempted to quiet a disorderly man at Ninth Avenue and 52d Street, the police said, and another man was arrested for allegedly interfering in the arrest of the assailant.

title: House Beats Move to Cut American Troops Abroad
description: WASHINGTON, July 31The House, in a vote of endorsement of the Administration's military policies, firmly opposed today any withdrawal of American troops from overseas, including Western Europe.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: AFRICAN NEPTUNE (Farrell), Monrovia Aug. 10, Abidian 12, Takoradi IS, Tema 17, Lagos 19 and Luanda 28; sails from Joralemon St., Brooklyn.

title: Sudan Sets Sept.25 Hearing In the Slaying of 3 Diplomats
description: CAIRO, July 31 (AP)A preliminary hearing will open Sept 25 for 10 Palestinians held in Khartoum for the murder of two American diplomats and a Belgian envoy, the Sudanese Information Minister, Umar alHag Musa, said today.

title: A Federal Panel Urges New Laws to Protect the Privacy
description: WASHINGTON, July 31A Government advisory committee recommended today a new code of fair information practice, backed up by law, to protect the privacy of the individual in the age of the com

title: Davalillo, J. Alou, Andrews Are Acquired by Oakland
description: OAKLAND, July 31 (UPI)The Oakland A's, struggling to retain their title in the American League West, picked up three players today for the stretch run, Vic Davalillo and Jesus Alou, outfielders and Mike Andrews, an infielder.

title: India and Pakistan Still Differ, Will Resume Talks in New Delhi
description: NEW DELHI, July 31Weeklong talks between India and Pakistan ended in Pakistan today apparently without any agreement'on the basic disputes between the two countries. A joint statement said certain issues required further consideration and the discussions would be resumed in New Delhi Aug. 18.

title: Radio
description: Talks, Sports. Events News Broadcasts

title: Giants Make First Cuts
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, N.J., July 31The New York Giants released rookies from Grambling, Iowa, Southern University and Rutgers today but held on to a freeagent tight end from Yankton College named Mark Herman.

title: Dr. Vera Douthit, Educator, Dies While on Trip to Kenya
description: Dr. Vera Butler Douthit, associate dean for student development at York College of the City University, died in Nairobi, Kenya, on Saturday while vacationing with her husband, Reginald, a research worker. She was 55 years old and lived at 35 West 93d Street.

title: U.S. Court Refuses to Rule On Obscenity Law of State
description: ALBANY, July 31 (AP)  A Federal court refused today to rule on the constitutionality of New York's obscenity law, saying it was a matter for state courts to decide.

title: Unit of American Motors Says That Union Room Was Bugged
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., July 31 The electronic buing of union room in a plant of an American Motors subsidiary last year was acknowledged today by officials of the subsidiary.during several months of 1972. The investigation also indicated this surveillance activity ceased prior to the end of 1972.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Senate Watergate committee challenged with alarm and indignation the testimony of H. R. Haldeman, former White House chief of staff, about the contents of secret White House recordings of President Nixon's Watergate conversations, Senator Sam J. Ervin, the committee's chairman, declared that Mr. Haldeman's testimony was part of a planned action by the White House to leak a favorable version of the taped conversations. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Television
FRANCIS A. RAYMALEY
description: TRENTON, July 31 (AP)Francis A. Raymaley, director of the State Agricultural Department's Division of Rural Resources, died today apparently of a heart attack. He was 69 years old.

title: Books of The Times
description: A FILE ON DEATH. By Kenneth Giles. 192 pages. Walker. $5.95.

title: Paying the Bill
description: Since political campaigns are indispensable to selfgovernment and since campaign costs have to be paid by some source, the central question is not how break the nexus between politics and money. Rather, is how to make that connection clean and open.

title: 88 Die, One Critically Hurt In Jet Crash in Boston Fog
description: BOSTON, July 31 A Delta Air Lines jetliner attempting to make an instrument landing in a thick morning fog crashed and burned at Logan International Airport here today. All but one of the 89 persons aboard were killed.

title: In Case of Jets Taylor Outside Is Inside Track
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., July 31 How do you like it outside? someone wanted to know from Mike Taylor, the New York Jets linebacker.

title: (212) 555 1212 Has Moved Out of the City
description: BABYLON, L.I., July 31  During the last three years, plagued with rising costs and an inability to find qualified personnel in the inner city, New York Telephone has quietly moved parts of its directory assistance operations, for area code 212, out of New York City.

title: Papers for. Panel Stolen From Car of Investigator
description: WASHINGTON, July 31 (AP) A briefcase containing papers to be used by the Senate Watergate committee was stolen late yesterday from the auto of a committee investigator, the Washington police said.

title: 100 Hunt ExConvict in Adirondacks
description: More than 100 state police officers, sheriff's deputies and conservation workers, aided by bloodhounds and helicopters, continued yesterday to search the Adirondicks woodlands near Wells, N. Y., for the former convict sought in the murder Sunday of an 18yearold camper.

title: First Dutchman at Helm of I.M.F.
description: Economist and politician First Dutchman to head I.M F Pronounces his name VITtuhvane Born in Zeist, the Nertherlands, 52 years ago Married L De Vries Freijens Has four children Educated at the Netherlands School of Economics at Rotterdam Later taught there and gained reputation as brilliant professor Authority on economic cycles and management Served in Dutch Government in various capacities Member Central Planning Office Member of First (Lower) Chamber of Parliament, 195863, and Second Chamber since 1965 Member of Liberal party Served twice as finance minister, 1963 to 1965 and 1967 to 1971 Condoned high Government spending Wellknown in his country as a lea ling member of the Sofei religious sect Seeks meeting ground between Christianity and Eastern religions Fond of classical music and English and French literature Serves as advising director of Unilever, the AngloDutch multinational giant Predecessor, PierrePaul Schweitzer, is French Witteveen said he was available July 12 France asked him to be European candidate July 13.

title: NETWORKS DISAGREE ON PRIMETIME RULE
description: WASHINGTON, July 21 (AP)  The three national, TV networks took different views today on whether the Federal Communications Commission should repeal its controversial primethne access rule.

title: Arthur F. Wright, 60, Dies; Obstetrician, Gynecologist
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., July 31 Dr. Arthur F. Wright, former chief of the obstetricalgynecological service at Nassau Hospital, died yesterday in Southampton Hospital. He was 60 years old and lived at 1 Devereux Place.

title: Iran Willing to Take Over Canada's Truce Unit Role
description: Iran Willing to Take Over Canada's Truce Unit Role

title: American Motors Increases Earnings 162% to a 13Year High
description: DETROIT, July 31  The American Motors Corporation today reported operating profits of $40.5million for the first nine months of its 1973 fiscal year, highest for the period in 13 years.

title: PRESIDENT'S GOAL
description: WASHINGTON, July 31The White House said today that President Nixon, acting alone, would decide who should be given access to the tape recordings of his conversations about the Watergate case.

title: FEDERAL OFFICIAL SCORES PATH RISE
description: The top Federal environmental protection official in this area called yesterday for the suspension of the proposed fare increase on Port AuthorityTrans Hudson (PATH) trains, describing it as unjust, unreasonable and unlawful.

title: Onion Sets Track Mark With 8Length Spa Victory
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., July 31Although the attendance faltered for the second day in a row compared with last year's figures, racing at Saratoga today was first class. The 9,835 fans were impressed by the showing contributed by Onion of the Hobeau Farm, in the feature event of 6 furlongs.

title: Bedford Injures Thigh
description: LONDON, July 31 (UPI) Britain's 10,000  meter worldrecord holder; David Bedford, saiti tonight he had a badly strained thigh ligament and would miss the World University Games in Moscow Aug. 15 to 25. He said he aggravated the injury during a 5,000meter race in Helsinki, Finland, last night.

title: COUNCIL APPROVES DISTRICTING PLAN
description: Mid fresh charges of gerrymandering, the City Council late yesterday approved a reapportionment plan designed to make all City Council districts compact, convenient and contiguous, as ordered by the state's Court of Appeals last May 3.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS.
description: Combustion Engineering, Inc., reported yesterday receipt of an order valued at close to $100million from the Westinghouse Electric Corporation for 22 nuclear reactor pressure vessels. The units which will be built at Combustion's Chattanooga, Tenn., facility, are scheduled for delivery over an extended period. The award includes an option program for additional vessels.

title: BARTLETT UPSETS ASHE, 63, 26, 64
description: LOUISVILLE, July 31 (AP)Unseeded John Bartlett of Australia upset topseeded Arthur Ashe, the 1972 winner, 6.3, 26, 64, tonight in the first round of the Pro Tennis Classic at the Louisville Tennis Center.

title: CODES ARE UPSET IN PIPELAYING SUIT
description: NEWARK, July 31 (AP)A settlement has been reached in a Federal court suit brought against the state's 567 municipalities that could result in marked decrease in the cost of public contracts.

title: Exxon Comments on Suit
description: A spokesman for the Exxon Corporation said yesterday that the company had not been served with a copy of the classaction antitrust suit filed in Brooklyn Federal Court on Monday against five oil companies including Exxon Corporation. He said the company was confident that any allegations of wrongdoing on the part of Exxon would not be supported by the facts as they are developed in the case. The complaint alleged violation of antitrust laws and the Sherman Act in raising prices of gasoline and oil.

title: Brooklyn Woman Seized as Suspect In Wolves Killing
description: A 70yearold Brooklyn woman was arrested at her home last night as a suspect in the poisoning last Sunday of two wolves.

title: House Beats Move to Cut American Troops Abroad
description: WASHINGTON, July 31The House, in a vote of endorsement of the Administration's military policies, firmly opposed today any withdrawal of American troops from overseas, including Western Europe.

title: PRESIDENT'S GOAL
description: WASHINGTON, July 31The White House said today that President Nixon, acting alone, would decide who should be given access to the tape recordings of his conversations about the Watergate case.

title: Siderowf Among 10 Named to U.S. Walker Cup Team
description: Dick Siderowf, the 36yearold Westport, Conn., stockbro ker, who recently won the British Amateur golf championship, was among 10 players named yesterday to the United States Walker Cup team that will face amateurs from Britain in the biennial series Aug. 24 and 25 at Brookline, Mass.

title: PHILIPPINE VOTE BEING DENOUNCED
description: MANILA, July 31The referendum whereby President Ferdinand E. Marcos tested public feeling toward his martiallaw regime in a twoday vote on Friday and Saturday was called fictitious today by a former Senator.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Committee on Colonialism, subcommittee on Pacific Ocean territories3 P.M.

title: Policeman Kills Youth
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 31 (AP) A plainclothes policeman shot and killed a youth who attempted to rob him on a moving elevated train in West Philadelphia during the rush hour, the police reported today. The officer, Charles Allen, shot 20yearold John 0. Robinson last night after he threatened the officer with a jagged piece of glass, the police said.

title: Space Making Skylab Minnows Swim As If They're Confused
description: HOUSTON, July 31Even the two minnows, part of scientific experiment, are having trouble getting used to life aboard Skylab. They keep swimming, pitched down, in tight little circles, apparently disoriented by the weightlessness of space.

title: FiveStory GarageTerminal Planned at Kennedy
description: The effort to relieve traffic congestion on the roadways at Kennedy International Airport will move forward this fall when Construction starts on a fivestory structure combining passenger terminals and parking facilities, the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey announced yesterday.

title: Crafts Books: It's a Bonanza For Everyone
description: The way new books on crafts and oollectibles are piling up, the stack will tower over Wilt Chamberlain well before it's time to start worrying about what to buy Aunt Agatha or Uncle Bob for Christmas.

title: Spa's Waters Bad? Patrons Tell of Cures
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., July 31  I drink 10 to 15 glasses of this water a day, said Charles Minowitz. What are they talking about?

title: Humility at the Fed
description: WASHINGTON, July 31A pair of important conclusions are emerging at high leirels of the Federal Reserve Board. Both are, in a sense, pessimistic. But it can be argued that they are also realistic.

title: No Beef Today
description: Beef shortages are growing around the nation, as the freeze on wholesale and retail beef prices, which is supposed to last until Sept. 12, prompts cattle raisers to hold their animals off the market to wait for higher prices the fall. In the New York area, retailers are predicting that supplies this week will be cut almost in half. Many wholesale beef houses will be kept closed today because there is not enough beef to warrant a full work week.

title: H. R. von Dehn Is Dead at 58; Founded Hyatt House Hotels
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., July 31 (AP) Hyatt Robert von Dehn, founder of the Hyatt House hotel chain, died of a head ailment in Pebble Beach on Saturday. He was 58 years old.

title: Connecticut Court Orders Equal Wages for Women
description: HARTFORD, July 31 (UPI),  The Connecticut Supreme Court has ruled that the VeederRoot Company of Hartford must pay a woman employe the higher wages of her male ooworkers.

title: SENATORS IRATE
description: WASHINGTON, July 31The Senate Watergate committee challenged, in terms of alarm and indignation, the testimony today of H. R. Haldeman about the contents of secret White House recordings of President Nixon's Watergate conversations.

title: Partial Disclosure
description: President Nixon's use of the tape recordings of his White House conversations is growing ever stranger, serving only to erode further the bulwark of Presidential responsibility and dignity behind which he has sought refuge. While taking the extreme position before courts and Congress that none of the tapes has been transcribed or made public and none will be, Mr. Nixon was at the same time giving one of the principals in the Watergate morass the opportunity to use the tapes in his own defense.

title: Disney on Parade Fun
description: DISNEY ON PARADE, starring Mickey Mouse and his friends. Produced and directed by Michel M. Gillikhes; choreography by Marc Breaux and Dee Dee Wood; costumes by Bill CarmsbeII; character costume design by Bill Justice; musical supervision by Paul Weston.

title: Ellis and Hernandez Combine To Pitch Pirates to 41 Triumph
description: The outcome41 in favor of Pittsburgh  didn't necessarily reflect a onesided contest, but last night's game at Shea Stadium represented a clear example of two teams pursuing sharply contrasting courses.

title: Briefs On The Arts
description: The executors for the estate of the late David Smith, an American sculptor who pioneered in the use of welded iron for sculpture, plan to change the dealership for his works from Marlborough Galleries to Knoedler Contemporary Arts, a new subsidiary of M. Knoedler & Co. The move, which will involve some 200 works by the artist, was confirmed yesterday by Ira M. Lowe, a New York and Washington attorney who is administrator for the Smith estate, and Lawrence Rubin, an art dealer who has formed a partnership with Knoedler's and will manage Knoedler Contemporary Art.

title: Major League Leaders
description: BATTING HOME RUNS RUNS BATTED IN PITCH ING

title: Film System to Speed City Fight on Crime
description: A microfilm system that will vastly speed the tracking of crime suspects will be introduced into the Police Department on a citywide basis as a result of a secret, successful trial that has been going on in Queens since March.

title: S MEN HERE STEAL $112,000 IN METAL
description: Three men, one armed with a handgun, pushed their way into the Essex Refining Corporation yesterday morning, handcuffed the owner and an employe, and walked away pushing a rolling suitcase filled with $112,000 worth of gold and silver.

title: Spa's Waters Bad? Patrons. Tell of Cures
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., July 31  I drink 10 to 15 glasses of this water a day, said Charles Minowitz. What are you talking about?

title: Burtons Planning To Seek Divorce, Spokesman Says
description: Richard Burton and Elizabeth Taylor have instructed New York lawyer to draw up papers for their divorce, spokesman for the two film stars announced last night.

title: Events Today
description: JEREMY, a drama starring Robby Benson, directed by Arthur Barron, at Loews Tower East Theater.

title: Patrick's Deprograming Is Recounted
description: A young woman testified at Ted Patrick's trial yesterday that she had been seized, separated from her child and held in a motel room for more than 10 days last October while Mr. Patrick and others tried unsuccessfully to deprogram her.

title: Business Briefs
description: Mortgage lending by the savings banks of New York State in June was the largest so far this year, but commitments to provide future mortgage financing declined, the Savings Banks Association of New York State reported yesterday.

title: DATA ARE SOUGHT ON NIXON'S HOMES
description: WASHINGTON, July 31The chairman of the House Government Operations Subcommittee said today that he would seek to subpoena Government records relating to work done at President Nixon's homes in Florida and California to make them safe, secure and palatial.

title: Congress Asked to Break A.T.&T.Western Electric Tie
description: WASHINGTON, July 31 (Reuters)The Congress was asked today to consider breaking off the American Telephone & Telegraph Company from its equipment makers, the Western Electric Company, because of alleged anticompetitive practices.

title: Soviet Visitors Tour 7 U.S. Cities for Art Exchange
description: WASHINGTON  In a threeweek tour of American art collections, four representatives of Soviet Union museums are exploring the possibility of an unprecedented future exchange of art between the Soviet Union and the United States.

title: DISORDER MARKS ULSTER ASSEMBLY
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, July 31 (Reuters)  Hardline Protestants brought the first session of Northern Ireland's new Assembly to a disorderly close today, reinforcing the pledge to make the Assembly unworkable.

title: Depositer Accused in Theft
description: ROCHESTER, N. Y., July 31 (AP)A teenaged bank depositer has been accused of stealing $1,650 from the main office of the Security Trust Company. The police accused Walter Prather Jr. of reaching through tellers cages and taking cash while his deposit we being recorded yesterday.

title: Name Change Approved
description: Shareholders of Franklin Stores Corporation at a special meeting yesterday approved change of name to Slater, Walker of America, Ltd. Slater, Walker in May acquired 44.9 per cent of Franklin Stores through a tender offer while acting as agent for Slater. Walker Securities, Ltd. and certain of its associates. Slater, Walker of America is the American affiliate of Slater, Walker Securities, a leading London international merchant bank.

title: Court Ends Erie Jail Strike
description: ERIE, Pa., July 31 (AP)A court order forced striking guards at the Erie County Jail back to work today, but the rest of the county's 800 employes remained on picket duty in a contract dispute. Judge Lindley McClelland ordered the guards and other jail employes pack on the job after a county request.

title: Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: 1684 Offers Urban Traffic Jam In a Pleasant Pastoral Setting
description: If your daily traffic jam has lost its sting  if those gas fumes in the tunnel or out there on the Long Island Expressway no longer intoxicate  then try Interstate 84.

title: Marcer's Hit Helps New York Snap Losing Streak
description: BOSTON, July 31The New York Yankees held onto first place by their fingertips tonight when they scored three runs in the ninth inning to defeat the Boston Red. Sox, 54, and snap a fourgame losing streak.

title: Penske Devises 12Driver World Series
description: If you think there's not enough show business in motor racing, the reason is that there are not enough Roger Penskes to go around. In his younger days he was one of the best drivers; as a car owner, he is a giant; as a businessman he is a oneman conglomerate (dealerships, car rentals, tires); recently he became a track owner with the acquisition of Michigan International.

title: Council Approves Hiring of 500 Civilians To Replace Police on Traffic Duties
description: The City Council yesterday approved a bill that allows the airing of 500 civilians to take the place of policemen in directing traffic.

title: New Greek Republic Strains Lie Ahead Despite Big Yes Vote
description: ATHENS, July 31Three young students, two the sons of farmers, met with a visitor here last night to talk about the future problems of Greece.

title: Advertising: Productivity Quest
description: Advertising can get people to buy things. But can it make people work? Or is that, asking too much?

title: Bridge: 2 Teams Led by Sponsors  Clash in the Spingold Final
description: WASHINGTON, July 31 Teams headed by Malcolm Brachman of Dallas and Bud Reinhold of Highland Park, Ill., clashed here this afternoon in the final of the spingold knockout team championship

title: City Authorizes Volunteer Registering
description: The new 10member Board of Elections voted yesterday to permit the registration of voters by volunteer registrars this summer.

title: Soviet Says Trapped Vessel Has Sailed Free in Antarctic
description: MOSCOW, July 31:The Soviet Union said today that its Antarctic supply ship Ob had reached open water after having been trapped in ice off the Antarctic Continent for three months.

title: Shutdown Here. Is Aimed at Conserving a Supply for Weekend Customers
description: A number of the major whole sale beef houses serving New York City said yesterday they would close for the day today because the remaining supplies of beef do not warrant a fiveday operation this week. They said they aimed to conserve beef on hand for their customers for weekend business.

title: 3 MEN HERE STEAL $112,000 IN METAL
description: Three men, one armed with a handgun, pushed their way into the Essex Refining Corporation yesterday morning, handcuffed the owner and an employe, and walked away pushing, a rolling suitcase filled with $112,000 worth of gold and silver.

title: SENATE SUPPORTS PROGRAM ON JOBS
description: WASHINGTON, July 31The Senate voted 74 to 21 today to continue the public service jobs program for two more years, although the Nixon Administration had not budgeted any funds for it.

title: Major League Leaders
description: Major League Leaders

title: Aaron Connects
description: ATLANTA, July 3 (AP)Joe Morgan and Tony Perez belted tworun homers in a fourrun seventh inning, giving the Cincinnati Reds a 9.5 triumph over the Atlanta Braves tonight despite Henry Aaron's 701st career homer in the ninth.

title: Police Seize 4 After Chase In a HitandRun Accident
description: Three girls and a youth in stolen car were seized following a chase yesterday after they struck the wife of African diplomat at West 79th Street and Riverside Drive, the police reported.

title: East German Officer Flees, Then Decides to Go Home
description: LUNEBURG, Germany, July 31 (AP)A young East German army lieutenant defected by swimming 150 yards across the Elbe River.today, then changed his mind and voluntarily returned to East Germany.

title: WOMEN INMATES TESTIFY IN JERSEY
description: TRENTON, July 31Women prison inmates told a state legislative committee today that they were a source of cheap labor for homeowners who wanted housecleaners and gardeners.

title: For the Children, City Amusements
description: Films Puppet Shows Stories Plays Music and Dance Exhibitions Crafts Fair

title: Deaths
description: Deaths

title: No Overturn Is Indicated For HighInterest Savings
description: WASHINGTON, July 31Despite heavy pressure from the savings and loan industry, Congress will apparently not try to abolish for the time being the new highinterest wild card savings certificates with no interest ceiling offered since early this month by banks and thrift institutions.

title: U.S. Memos on Argentine Financial Bills Touch Off an Incident
description: BUENOS AIRES, July 31The American Embassy here has touched off a diplomatic incident by handing the Argentine Government a series of memorandums warning that new legislative bills about to be passed by the Peronistcontrolled Congress will have a detrimental effect on foreign investment in Argentina.

title: Excerpts From Haldeman's Testimony Before the Senate Committee on Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, July 31Following are excerpts from the transcript of testimony today by H. R. Haldeman, former White House chief of staff, on the 32d day of hearings on the Watergate case before the Senate Select Committee on Presidential Campaign Activities:

title: A NEW SYSTEM 7 DEVELOPED BY I.B.M.
description: The International Business Machines Corporation announced yesterday development of

title: WAR DRESS GAINS LEAD IN HUNTING
description: MIDDLETOWN, N. Y., July 31  Nancy Baroody's War Dress, a nationally ranked foxchaser, and RiArm Farm's Wintippit, a newcomer to the equine circuit, took commanding leads today in the two divisions of the junior working hunter competition at the Orange County horse show.

title: GRUMMAN OPENS TALKS WITH BEECH
description: BETHPAGE, LI., July 31The Grumman Corporation announced today It had begun acquisitioh talks with the Beech Aircraft Corporation, general aviation designer and builder.

title: U.S. Financial, in Court, Seeks Escape From Being Forced Into Receivership
description: SAN DIEGO, July 31U. S. Financial, Inc., which has called itself the Sears Roebuck of housing, sought before a Federal bankruptcy judge today to escape being forced into receivership because of its rapidly mounting debts. They already exceed $260million.

title: Transit Bond Issue Is Passed; Albany Special Session Ends
description: ALBANY, July 31Governor Rockefeller's $3.5billion bond plan for freezing transit fares and building new subways and highways received final passage in the Legislature late tonight following a week of minor adjustments to attract a bipartisan show of strength.

title: Nets Acquire Erving
description: The New York Nets, in the most significant trade in their sixyear history, have acquired Julius Erving, the American Basketball Assoc'sdares leading scorer, from the Virginia Squires, Page 37.

title: The Bavarians Still March Slowly, and to Their Own Oompahpah
description: MUNICH, West Germany In the country of Willy Brandt and warming EastWest relations, there is one important section that does not want to go along: Bavaria. The state government there so strongly distrusted the treaty establishing relations between East Germany and West Germany that it took it to the courts to make sure it would not be interpreted as sealing the division of the old Reich.

title: Man's First Flight: Over Manhattan, 1876
description: MILL VALLEY, Calif.Attached to what looks like a pair of flying ironingboards in the Smithsonian, is a sign identifying it as man's first flying machine. Well, maybe. But could it be at least possible that the thing in the picture above, nuttylooking but no more so than the Wright brothers contraption, is the real one? That it actually flew across the skies of New York a hundred years ago?

title: Nets Acquire Erving
description: The New York Nets, in the most significant trade in their sixyear history, have acquired Julius Erving the American Basketball Association's leading scorer, from the Virginia Squires. Page 37.

title: Sterilization of Black Mother of 3 Stirs Aiken, S.C.
description: AIKEN, S. C.,Marietta Williams is 20 years old and sterile.

title: U.S. and Canada Reported To Have Reached Air Pact
description: OTTAWA, July 31 (Canadian Press)American and Canadian negotiators have reached agreement on new air routes to be divided among airlines of the two countries, informed sources said today. However, obstacles remain before the two countries can sign an agreement  among them Washington's objections to certain Canadian air charter rules and the dispute over the United States termination of customs pretlearance in Canadian airports.

title: Rhodesia Seizes Members Of a Black Political Group
description: SALISBURY; Rhodesia, July 31Six members of the leading black political organization in Rhodesia have been arrested by the Rhodesian authorities during the last few days, according to Bishop Abel Muzorewa, leader of the African National Council.

title: Nets Get Erving From Squires for Carter, Cash andDr. J Coming Home To Do His Aerial Act
description: Nets Get Erving From Squires for Carter, Cash and Julius Erving, probably pro basketball's most exciting player, is coming home to Long Island, where he grew up. The New York Nets have acquired Erving, the American Basketball Association's leading scorer, from the Virginia Squires.

title: Passaic Asks $20Million To Revitalize Its Economy
description: Mayor Gerald Goldman of Passaic said today that the city needed $20million in Federal funds to revitalize the economy of a city that was facing social and economic problems, including an outflow of industry.

title: Tito's Halfway House
description: ASPEN, Colo.  It is frequently, said that the most heavily armed powers are paralyzed by their military strength because they cannot use it to any sensible political purpose. It is also said the superpowers have discovered that underdeveloped nations are difficult to deal with, as America found in Vietnam and Russia found in the Congo, Indonesia and Egypt.

title: ExHouse Member Admits Mail Fraud; Face15Year Term
description: WASHINGTON, July 31 (AP)  Former Representative J. Irving Whalley of Pennsylvania pleaded guilty today to charges of mail fraud and obstruction of justice. He faces a possible maximum sentence of 15 years] in prison and $11,000 fine. No sentencing date was set.

title: GUARD IS KILLED AT LEAVENWORTH
description: LEAVENWORTH, Kan., July 31 (UPI)  Two inmates whc took advantage of a brief but violent riot in the Federal penitentiary to take four hostages and barricade themselves in the prison laundry released the hostages late tonight in return for a bargaining session with prison officials and nine specified inmates.

title: MERCER PLANNED BY FLORIDA PHONE
description: United Telecommunications, Inc., the nation's second largest independent (nonBell) telephone company, announced yesterday that it had agreed in principle to acquire the Florida Telephone Corporation for stock valued at about $142million. Under terms of the agreement, which is subject to required corporate, regulatory and other approvals, United will issue 1.2 million shares of its common stock for the approximately 6.1 million outstanding common shares of Florida Telephone.

title: Major League Box Scores
description: Major League Box Scores

title: Judge Orders Release of Funds To Resume Rural Housing Aid
description: WASHINGTON, July 31A United States District Court judge ordered the Nixon Administration today to resume program, discontinued last January, that assists people with low incomes to buy housing in rural areas.

title: Meat Scarcity Reaches White House Kitchen
description: WASHINGTON, July 31 (AP) If Mrs. Housewife feels the meat shortage, so should the White House, says Bernard Goldstein. They started the shortage and don't deserve any better treatment than anyone else.

title: Army Spying Assailed
description: WASHINGTON, July 31 (AP) A Senate investigating unit today condemned what it called the Army's massive and unrestrained surveillance of civilians during the explosive climate of dissent in the late 1960's. The Senate constitutional rights subcommittee, said the surveillance violated First Amendment rights and was not authorized by law.

title: WILBUR M. COLLINS
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., July 31 Wilbur Mausly Collins, who retired in 1958 as president of Canada Dry Ginger Ale, Ltd., and International, died yesterday at Nassau Hospital in Mineola. He was 80 years old and lived at 119 Stratford Ave.

title: WILLIAM T. EMMET
description: William T. Emmet, a retired securities analyst, died yesterday in Phelps Memorial Hospital, Tarrytown, N. Y. He was 66 years old and lived in Canaan, N. Y.

title: Ellis and Hernandez Combine To Pitch Pirates to 41 Triumph
description: The outcome41 in favor of Pittsburgh  didn't necessarily reflect a onesided contest, but last night's game at Shea Stadium represented a clear example of two teams pursuing sharply contrasting courses.

title: People in Sports: Knicks Sign Another McGuire
description: A third McGuire will wear the uniform of the Knicks. Allie McGuire Jr., the son of the Marquette basketball coach and New York's thirdround draft choice, was signed yesterday. His father played in the Knick backcourt from 1951 through 1954 and his uncle, Dick, the chief scout of the Knicks, played guard from 1949 until he was traded in 1957 to the Detroit Pistons.

title: PRESIDENTIAL BAR ON DISSENT EASED
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., July 31 A United States District Court judge enjoined the Secret Service today from barring dissenters at public appearances of the President unless the President's personal safety was at stake.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS DOWN

title: Senate Panel Further Cuts Military Aid for Indochina
description: WASHINGTON, July 31 (AP) The Senate Armed Services Committee voted today to reduce military aid for South Vietnam and Laos to $952million for the current fiscal year.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: MRS. JOHN J. EMORY
description: CINCINNATI, July 31Mrs. Irene Langhorne Emory, the wife of John J. Emory, president of Thomas Emory's Sons, Inc., a realestate company, and retired chairman of Emory Industries, Inc., a chemicals producer, died yesterday of a stroke at her summer home in Isleboro, Me. She was 76 years old.

title: A View on. Watergate
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 31, (UPI)Prime Minister Norman Kirk of New Zealand says that his countrymen have generally taken a philosophical view to ward the Watergate scandal., The scandal, he said, shows, that democracy in America is strong enough to be able to cope with anything that arises.

title: Long Lines Of A.T.&T. Disrupted
description: Long  distance telephone calls into and out of the metropolitan area were severely disrupted through most of the working day yesterday by the breakdown of two of the five switching centers operated by the A.T.&T. Long Lines Department.

title: L. I. Slaying Is Linked to Mafia Inquiry
description: The sexfilm distributor found beaten and shbt to death on Long Island Sunday had been willing to talk about reports of a mob takeover of his business, an assistant Manhattan district attorney said yeserday.

title: Equity Financing
description: The Winter Park Telephone Company, a Florida phone company with $19.5million of revenues, sold 800,000 shares of common stock yesterday at $14.50 apiece. An underwriting syndicate headed by Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith made the offering.

title: A Consumer Advocate Too Busy To Practice What She Preaches
description: SPRING VALLEY, N. Y.Ellen Zawel hasn't made her bed for two weeks. Her rock garden has gone to weeds, her lawn needs mowing and her refrigerator is absolutely filthy.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: In the first of a series of hearings being conducted by the Public Service Commission, a half dozen speakers voiced strong opposition to a proposed 43 per cent increase in rates in parts of Nassau County by the Merrick Division of the New York Water Corporation.

title: A 71 Plan to Leak Ellsberg File Reported
description: WASHINGTON, July 31Despite assertions by President Nixon and some of his top aides that Dr. Daniel Ellsberg's psychiatric records were sought only to assist a national security investigation, some key figures in the White House intended to leak the confidential material to the press to discredit Dr. Ellsberg and damage his image, according to sources familiar with the operation.

title: Doctor, Family, Businessmen Invited to Dinner for Tanaka
description: WASHINGTON, July 31The guest list for tonight's state dinner at the White House for Japan's Premier, Kakuei Tanaka, was fairly routine, as state dinners go.

title: 2 Sentenced to Die
description: FORSYTH, Mont., July 31 (AP)Two men who escaped from an Idaho jail have been sentenced to be hanged for thel kidnapping and murder of a Mmitana jeweler. Wallace L. Rhodes Jr., 25 years old and James M. Shields, 21 were sentenced to be executed on or before Sept. 13.

title: SENATORS IRATE
description: WASHINGTON, July 31The Senate Watergate committee challenged, in terms of alarm and indignation, the testimony today of H. R. Haldeman about the contents of secret White House recordings of President Nixon's Watergate conversations.

title: Ulasewicz Tells of Investigating ExRep. Poll and Speaker Albert
description: WASHINGTON, July 31 A former New York City policeman who has acknowledged conducting about 30 private investigations a year for the White House gave some details tonight on a few of them.Anthony T. Ulasewicz, a retired detective who worked on White House assignments from 1969 to 1972, insisted in a telephone interview from his home in Hadley, N. Y., that the importance of his work had often been exaggerated.

title: Earnings Up by 12% at WarnerLambert
description: The WarnerLambert Company increased earnings in the quarter and six months ended June 30 by 12 per cent to records for the periods, the company reported yesterday. It also announced yesterday an extra 4cent dividend along with the regular quarterly dividend of 18 cents a share, which had been increased from 16 cents a share in April. The current declarations are payable Sept. 10 to shareholders of record on Aug. 10.

title: Bicycle for a Poor Child Is Stolen From Church
description: The theft of a bicycle that had been donated to a small Catholic church for the use of a poor child was discovered yesterday.

title: House Gets ImpeachNixon Resolution
description: WASHINGTON, July 31Representative Robert F. Drinan, Democrat of Massachusetts, introduced a resolution today calling for the impeachment of President Nixon for high crimes and misdemeanors.

title: A COED IN COLORADO HAS HEAVYDUTY JOB
description: PUEBLO, Colo. (AP) It wears me out a bit, says 21yearold Miss Denice Boschen, about her summer job as a beer cooler stocker. But I'm building up muscles so quick that by the end of summer I should be able to handle anything.

title: Kalmbach and Satire Reportedly Sought Gulf Western Services for Nixon's Campaign
description: Gulf & Western Industries, Inc., was asked last year to contribute services to President Nixon's campaign, company sources said yesterday. They said that the request had been made first by Herbert W. Kalmbach, then the President's personal lawyer, and later by William L. Satire, a special assistant to President Nixon and now a columnist for The New York Times.

title: COTTON IN ALABAMA IS DAMAGED BY PEST
description: MOULTON, Ala., July 31 (UPI)Heavy damage to the Alabama cotton crop has been blamed on the invasion of pest known as the tarnished plant bug.pest by using pesticides effective on the weevil, but a different insecticide was now being used and it was starting to work.

title: Penske Devises 12 2Driver World Series
description: If you think there's not enough show business in motor racing, the reason is that there are not enough Roger Penskes to go around. In his younger days he was one of the best drivers; as a car owner, he is a giant; as a businessman he is a oneman conglomerate (dealerships, car rentals, tires); recently he became a track owner with the acquisition of Michigan International.

title: Laotian Sides Make Progress on Details Of Capital Security
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, July 31 (UPI)Negotiators for the Government of Premier Souvanna Phouma and the Communistled Pathet Lao conferred again today on the details of their reported agreement for a coalition government. Informed sources said they worked out security arrangements for Vientiane, the administrative capital.

title: 110,000 Crowd Park For Tchaikovsky Concert
description: About 110,000 people, said to be the largest crowd ever to attend a concert in Central Park, jammed the Shep Meadow last night for an allTchaikovsky program performed by the New York Philharmonic.

title: 88 Die, One. Critically Hurt In Jet Crash in Boston Fog
description: BOSTON, July 31  A Delta Air Lines jetliner attempting to make an instrument landing in a thick morning fog crashed and burned at Logan Interntional Airport here today. All but one of the 89 persons aboard were killed.

title: Meat Business in New York Is Grinding to a Halt
description: Wes, we have no meat today, the man in the bloodstained white coat said as he pointed to the nearlyempty storage hooks he said were normally filled to capacity with loins. And we probably won't have any next week, he added.

title: Suit By Girls in Sterilization Is Dismissed
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., July 31 (AP)A Federal judge dismissed a suit today by two black girls who say they were involuntarily sterilized. The action will not prevent refiling the suit against some of the defendants.

title: Sniper Is Arraigned
description: Purcell McPhaul, who held about 50 police officers at bay with a shotgun for almost an hour from a basement on west 38th Street, Manhattan, Monday, was arraigned in Manhattan Criminal Court yesterday, and held in lieu of $30,000 bail on charges of attempted murder, assault, reckless endangerment, resisting arrest and possession of a dangerous weapon. Judge George Vale set Aug. 6 for a hearing.

title: INTEGRATION SAID TO AID EDUCATION
description: WASHINGTON, July 31 Local school desegregation, rather than lowering the quality of education, has contributed substantially to its improvement in a number of communities, according to a study by the United States Commission on Civil Rights.

title: Western Union Negotiates 3Year Pact With 13,000
description: WASHINGTON, July 31 (UPI)  Agreement was reached last night between the Western Union Telegraph Company and the bargaining committees of two unions representing 13,000 employes nationwide.

title: Minor Leagues
description: Minor Leagues

title: class wlntlpplt.
description: CAPITALSigned Nick Weatherspoon, Illinois forward, and Tom Kozelko, Toledo forward.

title: National League Wednesday, August 1, 1973
description: Pittsburgh 4, New York 1 (n.).

title: SCM SUES XEROX FOR $436MILLION
description: The SCM Corporation filed $435million antitrust suit yesterday against the Xerox Corporation, charging the giant copier company with violating both the Sherman and the Clayton antitrust acts. It was the fifth such suit filed against Xerox in slightly more than year.

title: 2 Convicted in Slaying of a Jersey Assemblyman
description: FREEHOLD, July 31 (UPI)An admitted prostitute and a Jailed felon were convicted toby by a Superior Court jury here of murdering Assemblyman Silvio J. Failla last Sept. 16.

title: Agnew Assures Aides Government Proceeds
description: WASHINGTON, July 31 Vice President Agnew assured some United States representatives abroad today that the nation's Government was being carried forward despite Watergate.

title: FUTURES PRICES CLOSE NEAR HIT
description: The doller took a pounding on the nation's commodity markets yesterday as prices of most key raw materials closed at or near their daily permissible advances.

title: HANOI ACCUSES U.S. OF VIOLATING TRUCE
description: LONDON, July 31 (Reuters) North Vietnam today accused the United States and South Vietnam of serious breaches of the Indochina peace accords.

title: PRICES ARE LOWER ON AMEX AND 0TC
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and on the overthecounter market declined yesterday in slightly steppedup trading.

title: Witteveen to Be I.M.F. Chief; Ministers Agree on S.D.R. Use
description: WASRINGTON, July 31The executive directors of the International Monetary Fund unanimously appointed today Dr. H. Johannes Witteveen of the Netherlands as the fund's new managing director to succeed PierrePaul Schweitzer of France.

title: Witness to Boy's Slaying Restored to Police Duty
description: Police Officer Walter Scott of the Jamaica Precinct, who was suspended June 13 for giving false and misleading statements, impeding the investigation into the death of 10yearold Clifford Glover in Queens, was restored to duty, effective today, in compliance with an order of the New York County Supreme Court, Police Headquarters announced yesterday.

title: Whitlam Here for Brief Stay.
description: Prime Minister Gough Whitlam of Australia arrived in New York yesterday on a oneday stopover before attending the Commonwleath heads of government conference in

title: 2 Convicted in Asserpblyman's Slaying
description: FREFOOLD, July 31 (UPI)An admitted prostitute and a jailed felon were convicted today by a Superior Court jury here of murdering Assemblyman Silvio J. Failla last Sept. 16.

title: U.S. STEEL PROFIT UP 62% IN QUARTER
description: The nation's largest steel maker, the United States Steel Corporation, reported yesterday new highs in sales for the second quarter and first half. But while production, shipments and net income for both periods soared above the like 1972 periods, all remained behind previous highs.

title: ALKASELTZER SET FOR WARNING ON USE
description: WASHINGTON, June 31 (UPI) The makers of AlkaSeltzer have told the Government they are prepared to start warning consumers that the product should not be taken just to cure upset stomach.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: Incident at La Junta, by Oliver Lange (Stein & Day, $6.95). An American girl trapped in a Mexican village by strange events. Lydia, or Love in Town, by Clare Darcy (Walker, $5.95). Romance in Regency England.

title: COURT CURBS CHOICE OF ATTICA LAWYERS
description: BUFFALO, July 31 (AP)A State Supreme Court justice has ruled that no outofstate lawyers will be assigned to represent any of the defendants charged in connection with the Attica prison riot.

title: PBW SETS A GOAL: TRADING IN CALLS
description: The PBW Stock Exchange disclosed yesterday it hopes to start a trading market in call, options before the end of 1973.

title: SOME CITY AIDES WILLING TO STAY
description: WASHINGTON, July 31Some members of the Lindsay administration have indicated a willingness to continue in city government if Controller Abraham D. Beame, the Democratic candidate for Mayor, wins in November.

title: A VISIT TO JAPAN PLANNED BY NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, July 31 President Nixon and Premier Kakuei Tanaka of Japan agreed this morning that the President would visit Japan within the next 18 months and that Emperor Hirohito would come to the United States during 1974.

title: Greek Overreach
description: The latest mockery of an electoral process conducted by George Papadopoulos bears all the signs of a dangerous overreach. It seems that close to 80 per cent Greeks have voted yes, to grant the former colonel dictatorial powers over the land of democracy's birth, through at least 1981.

title: 100 Hunt ExConvict in Adirondacks
description: More than 100 state police officers, sheriff's deputies and conservation workers, aided by bloodhounds and helicopters, continued yesterday to search the Adirondacks woodlands near Wells, N. Y., for the former convict sought in the murder Sunday of an 18yearold camper.

title: Bond Prices Drop In Gloomy Market
description: Bond prices crumbled yesterday under the weight of two major financings, both indifferently received, while money rates continued to soar.

title: Police Contract in Nassau Ratified by an 8to1 Vote
description: MINEOLA, L. I., July 31A $9.6million, twoyear contract between Nassau County and the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association was ratified by the police today by an 8to1 vote, The vote was 2,487 in favor and 302 opposed.

title: Vitamin Sales and Labeling Face Tighter Regulation by the F.D.A.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 The Food and Drug Administration took final action today on a subject that has caused nationwide debate and controversy for at least a decade the labeling, promotion and sales of vitamins and minerals.

title: COLL AND SOWINSKI DANCE FANCY FREE
description: Two new sailors on leave hit town Tuesday night at the State Theater as American Ballet Theater presented Fancy Free. David Coll and Johnl Sowinski joined John Prinz to form the warmly harmonious trio of men on the make.

title: M'GILL TESTIFIES AT PATRICK TRIAL
description: Dr. William J. McGill, president of Columbia University, said yesterday that he regarded attempts to kidnap members of the conservative New Testament Missionary Fellowship as a threat to civil liberties.

title: Todd Named Head Coach
description: LAFAYETTE, La Aug, 1 (AP)Rolland Todd, 39yearold former head coach of the National Basketball Association's Portland Trail Blazers, was named head basketball coach today at the University of Southwestern Louisiana Todd will replace Beryl Shipley who resigned May 15.

title: News Summary and Index THURSDAY, AUGUST 2, 1973
description: The Senate Watergate committee disclosed a 1972 White House memorandum warning of the existence of documents that could directly involve the President in the controversial settlement of antitrust actions against the International Telephone and Telegraph Company. The memorandum was from Charles W. Colson to H. R. Haldeman, who told the committee that he was not familiar with it. [Page 1 Col. 8; Text, P. 20.]

title: DR. CHRISTOS DEMIRIS
description: FREEPORT, L. 1., Aug. 1Dr. Christos Demiris, a general practitioner and member of the staff of Doctors Hospital, in charge of residents, died, apparently of a heart attack, at his home, 146 Mount Joy Avenue, on Friday. He was 49 years cold.

title: Football Transactions
description: CLEVELANDReleased Rich Jackson, defensive end, and George Greenfield, Murray State running back.

title: A Wholesale Holdup of Consumers Suspected
description: A special Federal grand jury has been impaneled to investigate a possible wholesale holdup of consumers in the current shortage of beef in the metropolitan area, United States Attorney Robert A. Morse announced yesterday.

title: LIQUOR LICENSE
description: NOTICE Is hereby alyen that beer license No, RW25729 has been issued to the undersinned to sell beer under the Alcoholic Baverage Control Law at 228 West 12nd Street, New York, New York, for on Premises consumption.

title: Advertising: Mailing List Users
description: National List Protection System doesn't sound much like part of cottage industry and it isn't now, but it was.

title: Wife and Son Aid Hunt for Adirondack Suspect.
description: SPECULATOR, N. Y., Aug. 1All day today the voices of a fugitive's wife and son boomed down from helicopters, urging the man to come out of the thick woods north and east of this small town and give himself up.

A Wholesale Holdup of Consumers Suspected
description: A special Federal grand jury has been impaneled to investigate a possible wholesale holdup of consumers in the current shortage of beef in the metropolitan area, United States Attorney Robert A. Morse announced yesterday.

title: Gian Francesca Malipiero Dies; Innovative Italian Composer, 91
description: TREVISO, Italy, Aug. 1Gian Francesco Malipiero, the Italian composer, died of heart attack at the civil hospital of this northeastern Italian city today. He was 91 years old.

title: James Earl Jones Meets the Challenge of King Lear
description: James Earl Jones has the physical presence, power and emotional depth to play kings and giants. The problem has been for him to find roles that are large enough to challenge his sizable talent  although there have also been times, such as last summer, when he played Claudius to Stacy Keach's Hamlet, that he has made a lesser character achieve new importance.

title: PRINCE OF TRUTH SCORES BY A NECK
description: OCEANPORT, N. J., Aug. (AP)Prince of Truth, appearing beaten when Windtex passed him on the last turncame on strongly again approaching the wire today to win the $27,325 Salvator Mile Handicap at Monmouth Park.

title: Sic Transit Gloria
description: Governor Rockefeller's proposed $3.5billion transportation bond issue and its accompanying commitment for precedent  shattering mass  transit operating subsidies sailed to surprisingly easy passage in the windup hours of the State Legislature's special session at Albany. Initially stalled in controversy, the program won with strong bipartisan support.

title: British Raise Loan Rate To 10%, Peak Since 1914
description: LONDON, Aug. 1 (AP)Britain's big commercial banks raised their base lending rates by two full percentage points today to 10 per cent, the highest level since 1914.

title: 18,000 AT REOPENING OF RELIGION PAGEANT
description: PALMYRA, N.Y., Aug. 1 (AP)A crowd estimated at 18,000 braved overcast and threatening skies to attend the reopening of the 36th annual Hill Cumorah Pageant last night.

title: Environmental Chief Bars Adirondack Home Project
description: ALBANY, Aug. 1New York State's Commissioner of Environmental Conservation today rejected the first application for a major development for second homes in the wild Adirondack Park.

title: HENRY M. JAMES
description: HUDSON, N.Y., Aug. 1 (AP) Henry M. James, editor of the former Hudson Daily Star and four years a Republican Assemblymgn from Columbia County, died yesterday. He was 87 years old.

title: Dozen Chilean Professional Groups Form Front to Oust Allende
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 1A dozen private business and professional associations announced today that they had formed a civic front and indicating that its aim was to oust the Government of President Salvador Allende Gossens.

title: S.E.C. Is Considering Insider Changes
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1The Securities and Exchange Commission asked today for comments from the securities industry and from the investing public on how it should change its rules relating to trading of stocks that is based on information not available to the general public.

title: Sea Scouts Shake Down a Ship
description: ABOARD THE SEA SCOUT VESSEL CHARLES H. BRANDNER. Aug. 1  Despite a broken throttle cable, this former Navy fleet tender, her crew of 20 Sea Scouts and a party of guests put out to sea this morning on a preliminary shakedown cruise from Caven Point, Jersey City, to the foot of Wall Street, Manhattan. She returned without incident. The dowdy craft was acquired by the Sea Scouts of Ship 25 of Bayonne from the Government, which had declared her surplus and consigned her for destruction along with a 63foot former airsea rescue boat and the former Coast Guard cutter Agassiz.

title: PowerLine Approval Asked
description: ALBANY, Aug. 1 (AP)The state's Public Service Commission said today that the Niagara Mohawk Power Corporation had applied for permission to build a 115,000volt power line along a 38.5mile route between Ogdensburg and Massena. The commission will hold the first in a series of public hearings on Sept. 13 in Wssena.

title: Sotheby and Christie's Report ArtSales Records for 197273
description: Buying art at public sales reached an alltime high in the last year, according to figures released yesterday by Sotheby & Co. and Christie's, the world's leading auction houses, based in London.

title: ULBRICHT IS DEAD IN EAST GERMANY
description: BERLIN, Aug. 1Walter UI\bricht, East German head of state, died today after having suffered a stroke on July 19. He was 80 years old.

title: Long Delay Seen on New Laos Coalition
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Aug. 1The installation of a new coalition government in Laos could take several months, a highly informed Western diplomatic source said today, despite reports that the Vientiane Government and the CommunistledPathet Lao were near agreement.

title: INVENTORIES POST STRONG JUNE GAIN
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 Manufacturers inventories in June showed their largest increase since the current expansion of the economy got under way in 1971, the Commerce Department reported yesterday.

title: HOUSE CURBS WORK ON NIXON'S HOMES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 The House agreed today to bar further security improvements on President Nixon's private homes at Key Biscayne, Fla., and San Clemente, Calif., without specific Congressional approval.

title: Inmate, 16, Hangs Himself in Jail for Adults Here
description: A teenager who reportedly concealed his true age and identity from the authorities was found hanged by his bedsheet yesterday in his cell at the city's House of Detention for Men on Rikers Island after writing a note disclaiming responsibility for the robbery that led to his jailing.

title: JUDGE VOIDS PLEA BY GAINESVILLE 8
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Aug. 1Judge Winston E. Arnow again turned down this morning in Federal District Court a motion by attorneys for the Gainesville Eight for an evidentiary hearing into what two F.B.I. agents were doing when they were discoverea In a broom closet next to the defense attorney offices, !Ewen with telephone and electronic equipment.

title: Amex Bars Short Sales Of T.W.A. Warrants Today
description: The American Stock Exchange announced yesterday that short sales of Trans World Airlines warrants would be prohibited effective at the opening of trading today.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: C & C/Bohrer, Inc., a subsidiary of the Westinghouse Electric Corporation, has been, awarded a $23.5million contract for construction of additions to the Mill Creek waste water treatment plant in Cincinnati, Ohio. Construction is scheduled for completion in about 30 months.

title: NEWAFGHANCHIEF REVIVES DISPUTE
description: KABUL, Afghanistan, July29 Lieut. Gen. Mohammad Daud Khan yearns for a greater Af ghanistan. The new ruler of this impoverished, landlocked nation, half desert and half mountains, has revived the dream of Afghanistan's enveloping a slice, of Pakistan to create a separate client state along the border.

title: New Rates Will Widen Blue Shield Coverage
description: TRENTON, Aug. 1 (UP1)State Insurance Commissioner Richard C. McDonough today approved rates for a new Blue Shield plan to give more coverage for medical and surgical expenses incurred by moderateincome individuals and families. Mr. McDonough said the new program, to take effect Oct. 1, would have Blue Shield pay benefits to a subscriber averaging between 75 and 90 per cent of the current medical and surgical charges of doctors.

title: Pennsy Abandons Plan To Sell NonRail Assets
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 1 (UPI)The Penn Central Railroad is scrapping a plan to sell $1billion worth of nonrail assets, retaining them instead to maximize their value through development, a trustee of the bankrupt carrier testified today.

title: 13 Resurfaced Tennis Courts Open in Central
description: After a delay of one season, the first 13 Central Park tennis courts to be resurfaced were opened yesterday and dedicated in a characteristic fashion  two players quarreled over their right to a court.

title: Haldeman's Lawyer Terms Inouye That Little Jap
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 (UPI)  H. R. Haldeman's lawyer referred today to Senator Daniel K. Inouye, Democrat of Hawaii, as that little Jap and said later he saw nothing wrong with the comment, adding: I wouldn't mind being called a little American.

title: IRENE IS WARNED ON STAGE REPAIRS
description: Actors Equity has warned the management of Irene, the hit Broadway musical revival starring Debbie Reynolds, that the show's dancers will not be allowed to perform after Aug. 13 unless repairs are made in the stage of the Minskoff Theater. The action by the performers union would mean that the show would have to close, since Irene employs 20 dancers and depends heavily on them.

title: 2 POLICEMEN KILLED BY CAR IN ROCKLAND
