description: Mercury levels

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday

title: A Pro Is Inspiring Gig at Guild Hall
description: EAST HAMPTON, L.I. When Marian McPartland's jazz trio appears at Guild Hall here next Sunday it will share the stage with Petrus, a group fresh from the Newport Jazz Festival where it won one of three of the first annual Louis Armstrong awards.

title: Mary T. Smith Becomes Bride Of Law Student
description: BETHLEM, Pa., Aug. 4 Miss Mary Treadwell Smith, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Donald U. Smith, was married here this afternoon in Trinity Episcopal Church to George Morrison Hubbard 3d, The Rev. Herbert W. Stevens performed the ceremony.

title: Drivein Church Is Ending Summer Services
description: GREENPORT, L. I.  For the last several weeks, the Rev. Fred Myers of this village's First Baptist Church has been conducting an innovative drivein church here. Tonight, he will hold his last such service of the summer.

title: Ecumenic Chapel Used By Youths Off to Israel
description: Nearly 200 Jewish youths from across the United States and Canada gathered at Kennedy International Airport last Tuesday for advice and spiritual guidance before leaving for Israel.

title: Spirit of Watergate
description: Important as it is to determine exactly who was guilty of what wrongdoing in the Watergate scandals, Watergate's true significance concerns more than an episode of political espionage and burglary. The deeper issues go to the heart of the American people's relations with their government. The spirit of Watergate has permeated the atmosphere of the White House in which governmental power Is wielded.

title: Bombing Crews Just Want to Go Home
description: U TAPHAO, Thailand, Aug.3Capt. Gregory Gamp, a boyishly goodlooking B52 pilot from Garden City, L. I., is eagerly looking forward to the end of the bombing of Cambodia.

title: Our Native, $17.60, Wins Jersey Race
description: OCEANPORT, N.J., Aug. 4 While Secretariat was losing at Saratoga, Linda's Chief, thought by some to be the second best 3yearold in the nation, finshed fifth today in $100,000 Monmouth Invitational Handicap at Monmouth Park. Linda's Chief carried top weight of 126 pounds and was an oddson favorite.

title: STEVE WILLIAMS WINS AFRICAN MO
description: DAKAR, Senegal, Aug. 4 (AP)An American runner fell in fatigue and another lost points through a fast starter's gun today, but the United States men's team an through bongo drumming and bugle calls to lead Africa, 5848, on the first day of their track and field competition. The Africans still have a good chance to win the meet because tomorrow's program has three distance events in which they may take all the points.

title: Monday's Entries at Roosevelt
Preseason Football
description: FRIDAY NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Heather Edward s Bride of Student
description: RYE, N. Y., Aug. 4Miss Heather Conant Edwards and Charles Edward Lalanne 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Lalanne Jr. of Scarsdale, were married here at noon today. The Rev. Dr. Lee Belford of the Epiphany Episcopal Church in New York performed the ceremony at the Shenorock Shore Club

title: The Rentzel Case:
description: In a bittersweet career of golden dreams and recurring nightmares, 29yearold Lance Rentzel has always had more success grasping reality on the football field than in his widely publicized private life.

title: Dumping Plagues Site in Gravesend
description: A war of wits is being waged in Brooklyn between the Parks Department and truckers disposing of their trash in a 73acre landfill area on Gravesend Bay, where permits to dump expired more than a year ago.

title: Nudist Resorts Called Biased
description: PATERSON  Unless the wheels of justice begin to turn a little faster, Ralph Bellefonte might not get a chance to spend a weekend at a New Jersey nudist resort this summer.

title: Graffiti Ranks With Bonnie and Clyde
description: SUPERLATIVES are dangerous, but sometimes hard to resist. George Lucas's American Graffiti is easily the best movie so far this year. Beyond that, I think it is the most important American movie since Five Easy Piecesmaybe since Bonnie and Clyde. The nostalgia boom has finally produced a lasting work of art.

title: Suzanne M. Shannon Has Nuptials
description: WILTON, Conn., Aug. 4 Miss Suzanne Marie Shannon, daughter of Mr. and William James Shannon, was married here this morning to Jeffrey Creighton Watt, son of Mr. and Mrs. Philip Creighton Watt of New Canaan and Waretown, N. J. Msgr. Jean Tetreault performed the ceremony in the Our Lady of Fatima Roman Catholic. Church jointly with the Rev. David Cox, an Episcopal priest.

title: Diane M. Lisle Has Nuptials
description: PELHAM MANOR, N. Y., Aug. 4Miss Diane Mesia Lisle, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert Allen Lisle of Pelham Manor and Boca Raton, Fla., was married here this afternoon to Frederick Andrew Huttner Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Huttner of New Hyde Park, L. I.

title: A Fly Whisk Is a Must for Beholding Egypt's Awesome Works
description: BUYING a ticket to Luxor on the overnight sleeping car from Cairo is a major undertaking not to be approached lightly. It involves many clerks, various offices In farflung reaches of the station, arguments, hired lackeys and runners.

title: Politicians Make Milk an Issue
description: TRENTONWith the two gubernatorial candidates still feeling each other out and no major statewide issue in view, a group of legislative candidates are trying to force a fight over milk prices.

title: The Rebels Chip Away
description: From Eleanor Holm to Joe Namath, strongminded athletes have been chipping away with increasing effectiveness at the traditional authoritarianism of the sports establishment.

title: News Summary and Index SUNDAY, AUGUST 5, 1973
description: Justice William O. Douglas of the Supreme Court ordered an immediate halt to the American bombing of Cambodia. Hours later, the Court overruled him in an order issued by Justice Thurgood Marshall and supported by the seven other justices. Justice Douglas's decision upheld an injunction ordered in Federal Court in Brooklyn on July 25. On Wednesday, Justice Marshall ruled against that injunction by refusing to vacate a stay. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Young, Black and Fashionable
description: It seemed an unlikely time and place for a fashion show, but latenight customers at the Island Bar, dimly lit dance club at 1203 Nostrand Avenue in Brooklyn, greeted the appearance of each new creation with genuine enthusiasm and goodnatured banter.

title: Martha Belle Triumphs
description: PAWTUCKET, R. I., Aug. 41 (AP)Martha Belle, won the $4,000 Scituate Purse at Narragansett Park Race Track today, covering five furlongs in 0:59 2/5 to score a 1 length victory over favored Umbrella Chief.

title: PHILLIES HOMERS ROUT PIRATES, 115
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 4 (AP) Bill Robinson drove in three runs with a pair of homers and Mike Schmidt drove in three with his 12th of the year tonight to lead the Philadelphia Phillies to an 11.5 victory over the Pittsburgh Pirates.

title: SMITH GIVES U.S. 20 LEAD ON CHILE
description: NORTH LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Aug. 4 (UPI)  Stan Smith, getting stronger as he went along, downed Pat Cornejo of Chile today, 79, 6.2, 86, 64, to give the United States a 20 lead in the American Zone final of the Davis Cup.

title: Dance
description: THE kindly critic, as a Frenchman once said, should look at his oneeyed friends in profile. This approach does much for human relations but it does not deal entirely with the question of standards.

title: Trouble in the South's first industry
description: ROANOKE RAPIDS, N. C. Yesterday, said Crystal Lee Jordan, a cottonmill worker, I took my three children, Mark, Jay and Elizabeth, and my husband was in the room, and I sit down and I told them the story of my life.

title: Mortar Attack in Hue Area Reported by South Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sunday, Aug. 5 (AP)Communistled troops shelled positions around the old imperial capital of Hue for the first time in months, and 78 soldiers were killed in fighting elsewhere in Vietnam, the South Vietnamese command said today.

title: Passaic: Burlesque Is Returning
description: PASSAICBurlesque, that old show biz combination of stripteasers and slapstick comedy, is scheduled to return here tomorrow, and it is already receiving mixed reviews.

title: Nance Rushesto Rescue of Jet Runners
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 4  Although he was charged with one fumble on a kickoff return and had two of Joe Namath's passes bounce off him for Houston interceptions, almost everyone agreed that Jim Nance, the former Patriot star, had a very good evening in his first performance for the New York Jets.

title: DECLINE OF URDU FEARED IN INDIA
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 4  Urdu, an elegant, supple language shaped by poets and peasants, has slipped into darkness in its Indian homeland.

title: ElectricTaxi Study by P.S.C. Is Termed Superficial by City
description: A report released yesterday on the feasibility of using electric taxis and buses in New York City to cut down on air pollution has pointed up some sharp differences between government agencies concerned with protecting the environment and those concerned with providing power.

title: Janice L. Sawin Becomes Bride Of G. L. Keen Jr.
description: GLADWYNE, Pa., Aug. 4Miss Janice Louise Sawin and Gordon Lithgow Keen Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Keen of Haverford, were married here this afternoon in St. John Vianney Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Ignatius C. Reynolds. The Rev. S. Sturgis Poorman assisted.

title: Florist Is a FullFledged Entrepreneur
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif., Don't lose that Southern accent, Hedda Hopper once warned an Arkansas  born florist who had just come to town in a trailer from Texas. You can cornpone your way into a fortune.

title: NO U.S. GAIN SEEN IN VIETNAM ROLE
description: Leading figures of 70 nations believe that the United States did not gain by its involvement in Vietnam, according to a Galhip Poll.

title: Sydney's Milk Sales Drop In Scare After ATests
description: SYDNEY, Aug. 4 (AP)Milk sales in Sydney have dropped by 18,000 gallons a day in the last three weeks in a panic reaction to the French nuclear tests at Mururoa atoll, authorities have reported.

title: Goldenrod Season
description: We tend to think of goldenrod as an autumn flower and an appetizer of October's chromatic Feast, It really Isn't. Goldenrod Is a flower of late summer and it usually is in bloom by early August. There are, to be sure, early and late species, but in most places one can find at least half a dozen species in bloom before Labor Day. September is full of goldenrod, but before October the asters have taken over almost completely and goldenrod has gone to seed.

title: ALLENDE FACING A GROWING CRISIS
description: SANTIAGO, Chile Aug. 4President Salvador Allende Gossens is facing what is probably the most serious crisis in nearly three years of troubled rule.

title: Paterson Is Battling To Keep a Hospital
description: PATERSON  Although municipal officials contend that an ongoing urbanrenewal program will revitalize the downtown area of this city and bring in thousands of new workers who will need a variety of services, Paterson General Hospital, one of the three medical facilities here, is waging a court battle to close its local outlet.

title: Man Wounded in Ulster; Irish Troops Shoot Youth
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug. 4 (UPI)A gunman shot and seriously wounded a man in the crowded streets of Dunvoannon, 35 miles west of Belfast today.

title: $25 Sale of MarijuanaDeportation
description: BLACK RIVER FALLS, Wis. This is dairy farm country, so each afternoon at 5 Felix Bendier goes to the barn and herds the heifers to the feeder. Then he goes back to the tiny house where he lives with his bride and waitsfor some word from his lawyers, for some news from the Government, for some unknown act that will somehow save him from being evicted from the country where he has lived for 21 of his 24 years.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: THE WHOLESALE PRICE INDEX for July dropped 1,4 per cent from June (after seasonal adjustment) to 134.9 per cent of the 1967 base. Industrial prices, at 128.9 per cent, were unchanged. Farm, process food and feed prices fell from 163,6 in June to 156.9 in July. The Treasury said that subscriptions for its new 20 year 7 per cent bond fell short of the $500 million it sought to raise, the first time since World War II that such an issue was not fully sold out.

title: The World
description: NEW DELHITwenty months ago, the precarious friendship between India and the United States, born in the 1950's and 60's, turned sour over Washington's tacit support of Paidstan in the 1971 Bangladesh war.

title: U.S. AND SAIGON SIGN A LOAN AGREEMENT
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 4 (Reuters)South Vietnam and the United States this week signed an agreement for a $50million loan, the first development loan from the United States since 1961.

title: Major League TeamAgainstTeam Records
description: Major League TeamAgainstTeam Records

title: Nixon Friend Says U.S. Harasses Him
description: SAN DIEGO, Aug. 4C. Arnholt Smith, the San Diego financier who has aided President Nixon's political campaigns for 25 years, said today that the income tax lien filed against him was another in a series of misleading and contrived actions by the United States Government to harass and intimidate me.

title: PERON AND WIFE ARE CANDIDATES
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 4The Peronist party today unanimously chose Juan Perlin and his wife, Isabel, as their presidential and vice presidential candidates, respectively, in the national elections scheduled for Sept. 23.

title: 38 Survivors of ABombing Die in Hiroshima Hospital
description: HIROSHIMA, Japan, Aug 4 (AP)Thirtyeight persons exposed to the United States atomic bombing of Hiroshima in 1945 died in the Hiroshima atomic bomb hospital in the first six months of this year, hospital authorities reported today.

title: New Scout Booklet Advises on Pollution
description: NORTH BRUNSWICKA new booklet, Save Our Water Resources, has been published for the Boy Scouts of America by the American Fishing Tackle Manufacturers Association.

title: Woman Named U.S. Judge.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 4 (AP) A 45yearold Bethesda, Md., lawyer, Charlotte Murphy, has become the first woman to be appointed as a trial judge of the United States Court of Claims in its 118year history. Miss Murphy, appointed by the court, will be sworn in Monday by Justice Lewis P. Powell Jr. of the Supreme Court.

title: STATE WILL HIRE WOMEN TROOPERS
description: ALBANY, Aug. 4The first woman troopers of the state police will be appointed net week in time to become members of the September class at the State Police Academy here.

title: Tanya Thomas Fiancee of William Smith
description: Mr. and Mrs. Harry W. Havemeyer of Park Avenue have announced the engagement of their niece, Miss Tanya Diane Thomas, to William Harmon Smith of Greensboro, Vt. The wedding will take place Aug. 25 in Greensboro.

title: Kathleen Adams a Bride
description: UPPER SADDLE RIVER, N. J., Aug. 4  The Roman Catholic Church of the Presentation was the setting here this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Kathleen Adams, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edwin C. Adams of Ridgewood, to Paul K. Becker, son of Mrs. Charles H. Becker of Verona, and the late Mr. Becker. The pastor, the Rev. David James Pathe performed the ceremony.

title: Agents Under Inquiry in Gainesville
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Aug.  A hearing began today into the discovery of two agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, who were laden with electronic equipment, in broom closet next to the defense offices in the Gainesville 8 trial.

title: VENUS UNMASKED BY ASTRONOMERS
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 4  Highresolution radar probes have broken through the thick clouds of Venus and for the first time distinguished features on the planet's surface, which presents a landscape of huge, shallow craters.

title: Pro Football's Position
description: Do two arrests for indecent exposure and one for drug possession represent a player's lifestyle?

title: Debtors win, lenders lose
description: The President considers it the nation's No. 1 problema judgment in which he is joined by journalists, politicians, business commentators and virtually every housewife. That inflation has been an economic disaster is part of the conventional wisdom, subscribed to even by economists who ought to know better.

title: Grant Mills, Actor, Is Dead; Played Here and in London
description: SKOWHEGAN, Maine, Aug. 4Grant Mills, a veteran actor who was from 1946 to 1971 president of Lakewood Inc., which includes the theater and summer resort facilities here, died today.

title: Idle Dice and Willie Wonderful Will Meet Again
description: The Sussex County horse show starts a weeklong run in Branchville, N.J., tomorrow with the $10,000added jumper classic, scheduled for next Sunday, the main drawing card.

title: Betting Tops $1Million at Daytime Trotting
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Aug. 4 The sun, finally shone on the bettors at Roosevelt Raceway today as the track became the first major harness oval in the metropolitan area to stage daytime racing.

title: MRS. RANKIN'S 140 LEADS BY 4 SHOTS
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Aug. 4 (UPI)Mrs. Judy Rankin overcame possible disaster on the ninth hole today to shoot a oneunderpar 71 for a fourshot secondround lead in the $35,000 Ladies Professional Golf Association Pabst classic.

title: Watergate Leaves Scars On Young Nixon Loyalist
description: LAGUNA NIGUEL, Calif., Aug. 4  For two brief days in June Herbert L. Porter was a national figure, testifying about his rather small role in the Watergate drama. Then, as the major characters took over the Senate hearings, he faded rapidly from public view.

title: BARRETO DEFEATS BACKUS AT FORUM
description: Miguel Barreto, a relatively unknown fighter from Puerto Rico, effectively solved the southpaw style of Billy Backus, a former welterweight champion, yesterday and earned a majority 12round decision in a nationally televised bout at Madison Square Garden's Felt Forum. Barreto used jarring righthand leads and left hooks to penetrate against Backus.

title: Miss Thomas Attended by 5 At Her Bridal
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Aug. 4Miss Beatrice Frances Thomas, granddaughter of the late Norman Thomas, the Socialist leader who headed his party's ticket for the Presidency in several campaigns, was married here this afternoon to Chester T. Dziobkowski.

title: Patricia Sinnott Wed to Dean Kerr
description: RUMSON, N. J., Aug. 4Miss Patricia Luce Sinnott, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. John Sinnott Jr. of Rumson, was married here today to Dean Steven Kerr, son of Mr. and Mrs. Dean M. Kerr of San Jose, Calif.

title: Notes: A Transit Plan For the Bicentennial
description: DURING the nation's bicentennial celebration year of 1976 more than 40million people are expected to visit Washington, D.C., and fan out from there to historical sights of the BaltimoreAnnapolis area of Maryland and the YorktownWilliamsburg area of Virginia. In an effort to create an attractive, convenient means of transportation to handle the 40million tourists, Senator J. Glenn Beall Jr., Republican of Maryland, along with 15 other Senators, has sponsored a bill calling for an investigation into the feasibility of building a highspeed land and sea system to link the Maryland and Virginia points and Washington by 1976.

title: AROUND THE
description: Be alert for squash vine borer; a wire probe into the base of the plant will kill it. Be on the lookout for mildew on lilac, phlox. Cut back raspberry canes that have borne fruit. Finish dividing and planting iris this month . Dry stray/flowers for bouquets . Continue herb drying and freezing.  Tend lawns.

title: An Unexpected Ploy Adds a Question to a Dilemma
description: WASHINGTON  The threeway legal contest for possession of President Nixon's tapes, confused and uncertain from the beginning, was further complicated last week when a key witness at the Senate Watergate hearings made his own versions of parts of the recordings public.

title: Mark Donnelly Weds Miss Hourwich
description: Miss Abigail Acheson Hourwich, daughter of George Kennan Hourwich of New York and the late Mrs. Hourwich, was married here yesterday afternoon to Mark Edward Donnelly, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Donnelly of Stamford, Conn. The Rev. Thomas Foley, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's father.

title: MRS. KING BEATS KAREN KRANTZKE
description: DENVER, Aug. 4 (AP)  Mrs. Billie Jean King served an ace that left Karen Krantzcke of Australia smiling in defeat to win the secondset tiebreaker and their quarterfinal match, 62, 76, last night in the $30,000 Denver tennis tournament.

title: Jazz/Rock/Folk/Pop
description: Jazz/Rock/Folk/Pop

title: Consumer Anger Is Rising Over Soaring Meat Prices
description: Soaring prices, not shortages of beef or pork or chicken, are triggering a massive buildup of anger among supermarket shoppers across the nation.

title: Arthur Faubel, 76, Taught Economics, Tariff Expert
description: RIDGEFIELD, Conn., Aug. 4 Arthur L. Faubel, professor of economics at New York University and later secretary of the American Tariff League, died last evening in the New Milford Hospital. He was 76 years old and lived here.

title: Corrections
description: In the review of Steven Lukes's Emile Durkheim: His Life and Work (Book Review, July 15, 1973) a quotation from Mr. Lukes's book was distorted by a typographical error. The quotation on page 22 of that issue should read These, then, were Durkheim's views about the issues of his time. He was in many ways both a moralistic conservative and radical social reformer, who would qualify, on most definitions, as a socialist of sorts.

title: Yorty Joins Law Firm And Will Travel Widely
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 4 (UPI)Former Mayor Sam Yorty has a new Job.

title: Four Mayoral Hopefuls Press Efforts for Publicity and Votes
description: While most New Yorkers relaxed in yesteeday's sunshine, the four major candidates for Mpyor pressed their efforts to get publicity and votes.

title: North Koreans Reject A Volleyball Invitation
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 4North Korea has returned to South Korea a letter inviting North Koreans to an international course in Seoul for volleyball coaches, on the ground that the document did not refer to the Communist country by its official name.

title: 2,000 at Birthday Party
description: MANTUA, N. J., Aug. 4 (UPI) William Hangsterfer, the New Jersey financier, celebrated his 77th birthday today with 2,000 guests and a rodeo in his country estate here. The rodeo, Towtown Rodeo of Salem County, entertained politicians and friends of Mr. Hangsterfer's during the day. Attending the daylong event were the gubernatorial candidates, Brendan T. Byrne and Representative Chares W. Sandman Jr.

title: Motor Sports Calendar
description: Aug. 8Triumph Sports Car Club of New Jersey first of three August MiniSeries T.S.D. night rallies (others on Aug. 15 and 23). Start at Bowlero, junction of Routes 3 and 46, Clifton, N.J. Registration: 7 P.M., first car off 8:01. Information: Bob Shedlin, Club and Vintage Sports Car Club of America summer fling at Jug End Resort, South Egremont, Mass. Friday: dinner, 8 P.M.; Saturday: lowkey rally, dinner and concert at Tanglewood; Sunday; breakfast. Information: Don phone (212)UN 16986.

title: 4 Counties To Get 1,300 New Beds For Health
description: ALBANY  The State Health Commissioner announced last week that close to 1,300 new beds would be available within the next few weeks in hospitals, nursing homes and health related facilities in Brooklyn, Queens and Long Island.

title: The Chief Awards
description: The Chief Awards

title: So, if Earnings Are Up, Why Not Stock Prices?
description: Although not all the reports are in, profits of most corporations in the second quarter of 1973 confirmed that the economy continued to enjoy a broadbased boom, reflected in almost all segments of business.

title: Anne F. Edgerton Becomes Engaged
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Aug. 4 Mr. and Mrs. Malcolm J. Edgerton Jr. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Anne Fischer Edgerton, to Jose Ramon Lemos Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Lemos of Long Beach, Calif.

title: Queen Flies to London
description: OTTAWA, CP Aug. 4  (Canadian Press)Queen Elizabeth left for London ending a quiet fiveday visit in which she met with heads of state during meeting of the Commonwealth.

title: Pennsylvania Board Fines Army Plant for Pollution
description: SCRANTON, Pa., Aug. 4The discharge of untreated industrial waste from the factory owned by the United States Army in this city has led to a state board ruling that the state has the power to regulate a federally owned installation on pollution matters.

title: Uganda to Lift Tourist Ban
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Aug 4 (Agence FrancePresse)President Idi Amin today announced that a yearold ban on tourists would be lifted Sept. 17.

title: Letters: Humor Is The Best Passport
description: To the Editor: In reference to A Bureaucratic Welcome to Afghanistan, by Fergus M. Bordewich (Travel Section, July 15):

title: Road Repair Boon To Homeowners
description: MONTCLAIR  When Essex County proposed that a fourblock stretch of Watchung Avenue here be widened, some residents objected because the project would have meant denuding the street of the trees that line it.

title: Elderly Will Get HalfFare Cards
description: TRENTON  In its latest program to provide economic help for the elderly, New Jersey is introducing a new twist to the old custom of requiring identification cards as proof of age.

title: Antiwar Veterans on Trial Say Disillusionment Set In on Return
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Aug. 5In another time, another war, they might have been greeted as returned heroes. Scattered among the seven young men are 57 campaign medals, citations and decorations.

title: ISRAELIS TO HALT JORDAN'S DIVERSION
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 5Israel is to halt diversion of the Jordan River, whose water levels has been sinking in two years of drought, after Sept. 1 when the irrigation of cotton fields ends and the pressure for water needs eases somewhat.

title: In Rome, the Bathroom Is Truly a Place to See
description: ROME  Roman baths haven't yet achieved the communalcountry club status they enjoyed in Caesar's day, but they're on the road back. Among the fashionable set here, the bathroom is gaining ground over, say, the bedroom. It's regarded less as a utility room and more as a place to relax, revive oneself and even to do some work.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: It was surprising and disturbing to read in Drew Middleton's July 15 news report that American military strategists are discussing preparations for intervention in small wars. Have we learned nothing from Vietnam?

title: Meat Plant's Cattle Pens Empty and Workers Reduced
description: RUSHVILLE, III., Aug. 1Normally we're short of beef hooks, Robert E. Bartiow said glumly as he stared at a cart containing dozens of gleaming, menacinglooking metal hooks from which the carcasses of newly slaughtered cattle are hung.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The city's Human Resources Administrator, Jule M. Sugarman, announced yesterday that Mayor Lindsay's goal of zero growth in the welfare rolls during fiscal 1972 had been surpassed. In fact, Mr. Sugarman declared, a further drop of 7,441 in Junethe ninth successive monthly declinebrought the number of welfare recipients in the city down to 1,198,179, from 1,270,475 at the start of the fiscal year on July 1, 1972.

title: Levi Strauss Rations Jeans In CottonDenim Shortage,
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5Levi Strauss & Co., the bluejean maker, has begun rationing jeansnot the regular kind, but those new ones with the big, wide bell bottoms.

title: Springer Residence Burns
description: ISLE OF SYLT, West Germany, Aug. 5 (AP)The summer residence of Axel Springer, the publisher, was partly destroyed by fire today and the police said that they found six incendiary devices, triggered by clocks and batteries, in the building's thatched roof. No one was reported injured.

title: Elizabeth Wheeler Becomes a Bride
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I., Aug. 5  Miss Elizabeth Anne Wheeler and Vincent Richard De Lucia, teachers who were graduated from Wagner College, were married here this afternoon. The Rev. A. Gary Angleberger of Granville, Ohio, brotherinlaw of the bride, performed the ceremony in the Old First Presbyterian Church.

description: Racing Entries

title: GrassRoots Opinion on New Council Lines Is Sought
description: Members of the Lindsay administration have begun consultations with communityboard chairmen and other local leaders to get some grassroots reaction to the new City Council reapportionment plan.

title: I.R.S. SAID TO HAVE UNIT ON EXTREMISTS
description: Time magazine said in its current issue that the White House ordered creation of a special unit within the Internal Revenue Service in 1969 to collect data on extremist groups and individuals.

title: Chile Advances in Soccer
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 5 (AP)Chile defeated Peru, 2.1, today and won the right to play the Soviet Union in one of the 16 qualification games for the 1974 world soccer championship to be held in Germany.

title: Fishermen Resuming Talks
description: NEW BEDFORD, Mass., Aug. 5 (AP)  Negotiations were scheduled to resume tomorrow in an effort to end a monthlong strike by fishermen against seafood producers here.

title: Pollution Linked to Large Kill of Maine's Salmon
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Aug. 5Water pollution, high temperatures, and low water levels have caused the largest kill in recent years of Atlantic salmon in Maine, the only state with such a fish population.

title: ANTONIS MEXIS
description: ATHENS, Aug. 5 (AP)Antonis Mexis, a retired colonel and Greece's undersecretary of social welfare, died of a heart attack early yesterday. He was 52 years old.

title: Brooklynite Killed in Fire
description: A woman died in a onealarm fire that burned for 15 minutes and heavily damaged her Brooklyn apartment early yesterday. The police identified the victim tentatively as Lucy McQueen, 50 years old, of 14 Putnam Avenue.

title: Radio
description: 8:0510 A.M., WNCN. Chacony in 3 minor for Strings, Purcell; Two Aquarelles, Dilius; Ave Maria, Hoist; Mazeppa: Cossack Dance, Tchailtovsky; Danse, Debussy; Brandenburg Concerto No. 4 in 3, Bach; Symphony No. 4 in F minor, Tchaikovsky.

title: U.S. Triumphs in African Track
description: DAKAR, Senegal, Aug. 5 1(AP)The United States defeated Africa, 111101, in track and field today on the strength of four victories to none in the field events and three straight triumphs in the jumping competition during the twoday meet.

title: FASHION TALK
description: There's no telling where fashion is coming from next. The labels in some of the new dresses on Saks Fifth Avenue's fifth floor say Made in Seoul.

title: Ballet: London Production of The Sleeping Beauty
description: LONDON, Aug. 5 Of all the ballets in the Royal Ballet repertory perhaps, ironically enough, the most revered, even the most typical, is the 19thcentury Russian classic The Sleeping Beauty. For years the Royal Ballet has given this work a foster home, and for years it has been the most authentic version of the ballet in the world. In 1946 it was with a production of The Sleeping Beauty that the company opened its first season at the Royal Opera House, Covent Garden. When, three years later, it paid its first visit to New York's Metropolitan Opera House, once again The Sleeping Beauty was chosen to open the season.

title: A Good Samaritan, Who Aided a Girl, Is Shot in Stomach
description: A 19yearold good samaritan was in fair condition in a Brooklyn hospital yesterday after being shot in the stomach by an assailant from a passing car.

title: Troops in Ulster Disperse Crowd Attacking Army Post
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug. 5 (Reuters)British troops fired rubber bullets today to disperse a crowd of 250 stonethrowing youths who broke away from a demonstration to attack an army and police post.

title: VIRGIN ISLANDS JURY IS STILL DEADLOCKED
description: CHRISTIANSTED, St. Croix, V. I., Aug. 5 (UPI)The jury in the murder trial of five Black Muslims concluded its second day of deliberations today without reaching verdicts on a series of charges stemming from the slaying last Sept. 6 of eight persons at a Virgin Islands golf course.

title: Miss Levine Wed To Robert O'Brien
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Aug. 5 Miss Martha Ann Levine, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Julian Levine of Stamford, was married here this afternoon to Robert Terrell O'Brien, son of. Mrs. Harry O'Brien of Delmar, N.Y., and the late Mr. O'Brien.

title: Experimental Plane Crashes
description: EDWARDS AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., Aug. 5 (AP)A Boeing Compass Cope, an experimental, remotely piloted aircraft that made its maiden flight a week ago, crashed yesterday while landing here, an Air Force spokesman said. The extent of damage to the craft was not immediately known, he said, and no one was injured.

title: City Triples the. Amount of Buy Money, To Net Bigger Fish in Narcotics Battle
description: In an attempt to crack, down on narcotics trafficking by catching bigger fish with bigger bait, the city has almost tripled the amount of buy, money far the purchase of illicit drugs, to $2.4million a year, from $90,000 annually.

title: 250 Make Night Tour Of Newark
description: NEWARK, Aug. 5In some ways, it was a typical guided tour: People wore sneakers and comfortable clothes, cooed over the architectural remnants of ages past and asked each other, Which church is this?

title: CITY'S BEEF ADVICE IS FORGET ABOUT IT
description: Predicting that the dwindling supply of available beef would send prices soaring once controls were removed, Betty Furness, the city's Consumer Affairs Commissioner, yesterday advised that metropolitanarea shoppers forget about buying beef until this hysteria has passed.

description: TFLEMINGTON, N. J., Aug. 5 America's topwinning Great Dane keeps right on the vietorious trail.

title: Tenafly Tract in Dispute Is Sold for Home Building
description: The largest privately owned undeveloped tract of land within 10 miles of New York City has been sold for residential development, ending a dispute over whether it should be developed as a park or as an apartmentandoffice complex.

title: The Course Is Fun, So They Come Early, Stay Late and Do Lots of Homework
description: It would be hard to find more enthusiastic students. They come to class ahead of time, they stay after the class is over and, although no one has told them to, they do a lot of homework.

description: The following is a supplementary weekly list of mutual funds prepared by the National Association of Securities Dealers. The range shown reflects prices at which securities could have been sold (bid) or bought (asked) last Friday.

title: POLICEMAN FOILS HOLDUP A 2D TIME
description: A Queens policeman who interrupted a liquor store holdup while off duty last July 14, shooting one of the holdup men and being wounded in a shootout with the gunmen, foiled another holdup in Queens late last; night.

description: Racing Entries

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Workers on the Lindenwold High Speed Line are expected to end their 11day strike today, but service is not expected to resume until Thursday. John Greeley, president of Teamsters Local 676, urged the workers on the shorthaul commuter railroad to return to their jobs at a meeting Saturday.

title: Blackmun Decries Pall of Watergate; Talmadge Sees No Impeachment Basis
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5Supreme Court Justice Harry A. Blackmun said today that under the pall of the Watergate scandal, the very glue of our ship of state seems about to become unstuck.

description: A twoalarm fire early yesterday destroyed the Church of St. Eleftherios, 359 West 24th Street, one of the oldest Greek Orthodox churches in the United States.

title: Drive to Close East Side Addict Clinic Gains as City Urges Denial of License
description: A campaign by some Uppel East Side residents to oust a private methadonemaintenancs clinic from their community is gaining momentum now that a city agency has recommended to the state that the clinic's application for a permanent license be denied.

title: 45 Cities Forfeit a Share In Oil Refiners Millions
description: Confusion has deprived 45 cities and one county, Warren, across New Jersey from sharing in a $28million settlement of an antitrust suit against eight major oil companies, The Associated Press reports.

description: Mets vs. St. Louis Cardinals, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 8;05 P.M.

title: Kissinger Meets at Airport With Singapore's Leader
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5 (AP) President Nixon's national security adviser, Henry A. Kissinger, held a private meeting in New York this weekend with Prime Minister Lee Kuan Yew of Singapore to review the situation in Southeast Asia, the White House confirmed today.

title: A Surge of Fighting In Disputed Areas Reported by Saigon
description: SAIGON. South Vietnam, Aug. 3 (Reuters)The South Vietnamese command today reported a fresh upsurge of fighting across the country with heavy clashes in areas where both sides dispute control.

title: Gypsy Moth Caterpillar Leaves for Other Parts
description: The gypsy moth caterpillar, which has stripped millions of trees and frightened homeowners in the metropolitan region in recent years, has all but disappeared from large areas here.

title: SCHOOLS MOVING TO ALLYEAR USE
description: ROMEOVILLE, Ill. Aug. 5Jolie Lentz is getting only threeweek summer vacation this year, while most high school students across the country get three months. But then, most students don't get winter, spring and fall vacations either, and Jolie does.

title: ECONOMICS BOOKS IN SCHOOLS SCORED
description: A survey of social studies textbooks used in schools throughout the country has found that their treatment of economics is pretty good in the first, second and third grades, but keeps getting worse as you go tip the ladder.

title: 3 Die in CycleTruck Crash.
description: NORTH PETERSBURG, N. Y., Aug. 5 (UPI)  Three persons were killed last night when their motorcycles collided head on with a pickup truck on. Route 22 neair this Rensselaer County hamlet, the state police said. Troopers identified the victims as Mark Carey, 17 years old, and his sister Phyllis, 23, both of West Rindge, N. H. and Gregory Clark, 21, of Pennington, N. J. The police said the truck driver, George Blowers, 30 of North Petersburg apparently swerved across the road into the opposite lane. He was taken to Putnam Memorial Hospital fifties.

title: PERIL SEEN HERE TO HOSPITAL CARE
description: Hospital officials have said that hospital programs in the New York City area would be sharply set back if Congress did not override President Nixon's veto of a bill providing funds for mariners hospitals and for upgrading emergency medical services.

title: A President's Troubled Spokesman
description: WASHINGTON  All who have done it agree that it is nearly an impossible job, being the President's press secretary, but Ronald L. Ziegler, who does it for President Nixon, feels that he is perhaps under a special handicap. For he has to ride out the Watergate mess, which has made him the most controversial of the six men who have held the position since the Eisenhower years.

title: A Predawn Tour of Newark Made by 250 History Buffs
description: NEWARK, Aug. 5  In some ways, it was a typical guided tour: People wore sneakers and comfortable clothes, cooed over the architectural remnants of ages past and asked each other, Which church is this?

title: Ohio Swindler of $14Million Is Freed but Faces New Trial
description: AKRON, Ohio, Aug. 5Don Lowers, a former lawyer who masterminded a $14million investment swindle, has been paroled from Federal prison after serving nine months of a twoyear sentence.

title: U.S. Loses a 3937 Set To Chile in Cup Doubles
description: NORTH LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Aug. 5 (AP)The Chilean doubles team of Jaime Fillol and Pat Cornejo won the longest set in Davis Cup tennis history today en route to a 21 lead in sets over Stan Smith and Erik Van Diller of the United States in the American Zone final before darkness suspended play.

title: Herbert E. Stern Dead; An Investment Banker, 77
description: Herbert E. Stern, an investment banker, died Saturday at this home in Roslyn Harbor, L.I. He was 77 years old and lived also in Boca Raton, Fla.

title: Hard Times in Pleiku: Easy Money Missed
description: PLEIKU, South Vietnam, July 29Life was better for Nguyen Duc Thang when the American soldiers were here in this dusty Central Highlands city. Not becattse they ever bought the boiled duck eggs he peddles for a living but because his Vietnamese customers had more money then.

description: WASHINGTONIf an avid football fan cannot buy a ticket to see his home team play because the stadium is sold out, shouldn't he be able to watch that team play on local television?

description: ALMETYEVSK, U.S.S.R.The Siberian oil fields have had al 1the glamour lately but for the last 16 years the backbone of the Soviet oil industry has been out here in the wide open spaces of the Tatar Autonomous Republic, just southwest of the Ural Mountains at the outer edge of European Russia.

description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5 (AP) Attorney General Elliot L. Richardson has appointed three longtime personal aides to Justice Department positions.

title: 7 Killed as Auto Plunges Into West Virginia Creek
description: ST, MARYS, W. Va., Aug. 5 (UPI)Seven persons, four of them children, drowned when a car plunged into a creek near here, the state police said today, One youth survived.

title: And the Home Front
description: Mapping effective action to combat inflation in the United States is complicated by the fact that prices such other major countries as Japan, West Germany and Italy are climbing even more steeply than they are here. Indeed, the most difficult problem facing conventional economic policy in the United States is that it cannot cope with the worldwide scramble for food, energy and other resources. Nor can it insulate itself from world monetary pressures.

description: SENDAI, Japan, Aug. 5 (AP) Masashi (Jumbo) Ozaki of Japan coasted to a threestroke victory over Lu LianhHuang of Taiwan in the $45,000 Tohoku golf tournament today. He shot a finalround 73 for a 273 total.

Peron's Doctors Will Rule On His Fitness for the Race

title: Marjorie S. Geller Wed in Roslyn

Her husband's father, who is former president of the University of New Hampshire, teaches economics and industrial labor relations at Cornell University and Ithaca College.

title: A Spirited Miller Band Recaptures Bygone Era
description: The most remarkable thing about the Glenn Miller Orchestra, which is playing under the direction of Buddy De Franco on the roof of the St. Regis Sheraton Hotel, is the degree to which it projects the mood, the feeling and the general aura with which the original Miller band filled hotel clubs such as this more than 30 years ago.

title: truck Striker in Chile Says Issue Is Freedom
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 5Aysen is rough country, nothing but fjords, mountains and sharp valleys, where winters are five months long and a man has to be independent and work hard if he wants to get ahead, Homar Chible Bergogne says.

title: Fredda Wellin Has Nuptials
description: OAK PARK, Mich., Aug. 5  Miss Fredda Wellin and Bruce Charney Vladeck were married here this afternoon at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Martin Wellin. Rabbi Sherwin Wine performed the ceremony.

description: WELLS, N. Y., Aug. 5A member of a local fish and game club was tracked down in Adirondack State Park by state troopers a few miles north of here around noon today, briefly mistaken for fugitive they have been seeking for a week.

title: A Feud Costs Brooklyn 6 Supreme Court Posts
description: The hottest political feud in town has already cost Brooklyn six new Supreme Court judgeships and has insured that Democrats will sweep four existing Supreme Court judgeships in November rather than sharing them with Republicans in the spirit of a bipartisan judiciary. The feuders are the borough's top political leaders, Meade H. Esposito, the 64yearold Democratic county leader, and George Clark Jr., 32, his Republican counterpart. Their dispute contrasts with the often cozy relations between Democratic and Republican leaders in other counties. Mr. Clark says he and Mr. Esposito don't get along because he refuses to be a patsy. The G.O.P. leader even went so far as to recount publicly, at the recent BrooklynStaten Island judicialdistrict convention, an incident at a luncheon meeting with Mr. Esposito last year. At that meeting, he said, the Democratic leader complained that Mr. Clark and his fellow Republicans were exerting too much effort in the election campaign against Democratic Representative Hugh L. Carey of Brooklyn, who runs in a district that could be marginal.

title: DENT BREAKS 2D 73 SWIM MARK
description: MISSION VIEJO, Calif., Aug. 4 (UPI)Rick DeMont of the Marin Aquatic Club scored his third victory as the threeday 15th Los Angeles invitation swim meet wound up last night when he swam the 1,500meter freestyle in 16 minutes 5.17 seconds, the fastest time in the world this season.

title: Events Today
description: SCHAEFER MUSIC FESTIVAL, Waltman Rink, Central Park, 7 and 10.

title: TRACT IN DISPUTE SOLD IN TENAFLY
description: The largest privately owned undeveloped tract of land within 10 miles of New York City has been sold for residential developirgnt, ending a dispute over whether it should be developed as a park or as an apartmentandoffice complex.

title: ECONOMICS BOOKS IN SCHOOLS SCORED
description: A survey of social studies textbooks used in schools throughout the country has found that their treatment of economics is pretty good in the first, second and third grades, but keeps getting worse as you go lip the ladder.

title: CONNORS DEFEATS PASARELL IN FINAL
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Aug. 5 (AP)Jimmy Connors of Belleville, Ill., won the singles championship in the $25,000 Buckeye tennis championships today for the second straight year.

title: Decision, Decision
description: It has been my trying lot of late to explain to wellmeaning liberal friends why a feminist finds much to applaud in the Burger Court's obscenity opinion, and why far from thinking it a regressive action, I find it wholly consistent with the landmark abortion decision and other rulings on women's rights.

title: Space Agency Gives Plans For Skylab Recovery Ship
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 5 (UPI)The space agency announced today sailing changes for the U.S.S. New Orleans, prime recovery ship for the Skylab 2 flight.

title: A President's Troubled Press Agent
description: WASHINGTON  All who have done it agree that it is nearly an impossible job, being the President's press secretary, but Ronald L. Ziegler, who does it for President Nixon, feels that he is perhaps under a special handicap. For he has to ride out the Watergate mess, which has made him the most controversial of the six men who have held the position since the Eisenhower years.

title: Save the Merritt
description: By modern engineering standards the 35yearold Merritt Parkway, whose four lanes snake through 38 miles of rolling, wooded Connecticut countryside, is an anachronismsome say a dangerous anachronism.

title: Stewart First at Ring; 27th Grand Prix Victory
description: ADENAU, West Germany, Aug. 5 (AP)Jackie Stewart of Scotland registered his 27th Formula One victory today, leading a 1, 2 TyrrellFord finish in the German Grand Prix at the Nuerburgring.

title: Brooklynite Killed in Fire
description: A woman died in a onealarm fire that burned for 15 minutes and heavily damaged her Brooklyn apartment early yesterday. The police identified the victim tentatively as Lucy McQueen, 50 years old, of 14 Putnam Avenue.

title: Sidewalks
description: Although geared for children, a street show put on Saturday afternoon at a Greenwich Village intersection by the Theater for the New City proved a pleasant diversion for all. Judging by the smiling reactions, the doublebill of two 30minute plays scored a hit.

title: Pentagon Assailed For Cash Outlays On 72 Promotions
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5 (AP) The General Accounting Office says the Defense Department spent $24million on promotional activities that were not included in its 1972 publicaffairs budget.

title: Stewart First at Ring'; 27th Grand Prix Victory
description: ADENAU, West Germany, Aug. 5 (AP)Jackie Stewart of Scotland registered his 27th Formula One victory today leading a 1, 2 TyrrellFord finish in the German Grand Prix at the Nuerburgring.

title: The Dance
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., Aug. 5The short, hot and damp summer of the American Dance Festival's 26th season ended at Connecticut College's Palmer Auditorium Saturday evening with the Inner City Dance Company. This is a company with great energy but little finesse, and one longed to see the artistic hand of a knowing and autocratic director.

title: DR. THOMAS E. JONES, EARLHAM EXHEAD,85
description: RICHMOND, Ind., Aug. 5 Dr. Thomas Elsa Jones, president emeritus of Earlham College here and head of Fisk University from 1926 to 1946, died here today at the age of 85.

title: Soviet Union, Britain Gain European Cup T rack Final
description: OSLO, Norway, Aug. 5 (AP) The Soviet Union and Britain qualified today for the final of the European Cup in track and field with a 1, 2 finish in semifinal competition that was overshadowed by Italian tempers.

title: REV. FRANCIS T. COOKE
description: LIVINGSTON, N.J., Aug. 5The Rev. Dr. Francis T. Cooke, minister of the Highland Avenue Congregational Church in Orange from 1948 until his retirement in 1964, died yesterday at St. Barnabas Medical Center. He was 74 years old and lived in Chatham.

title: John Eaton, Canadian Who Led Family Store Chain, Dies at 63
description: TORONTO, Aug. 5 (Canadian Press) John David Eaton, president of T. Eaton and Company, Ltd., one of Canada's largest merchandisers, died Saturday at his home here. He was 63 years old.

title: PACE OP BUSINESS HELD OVERLY FAST
description: Business in the United States is operating at a very high and perhaps unhealthy pace according to the National Association of Purchasing Management, Inc., and as a result there are frustrating distortions and dislocations.

title: More Schools Adopt Fullrear Basis
description: ROMEOVILLE, IILJolla Lentz is getting only a threeweek summer vacation this year, while most high school students across the country get three months, But then, most students don't get winter, spring and fall vacations either, and Jolie does.

title: NICHOLS CAPTURES WESTCHESTER GOLF
description: HARRISON, N.Y., Aug. 5Bobby Nichols became the surprise winner of the $250,000 Westchester Golf Classic today. Two tremendous putts, the first for an eagle to force a tie at the 72d hole and the other for a birdie at the first hole of a suddendeath playoff, enabled Nichols to walk away with the first prize of $50,000.

title: Deaths
description: Deaths

title: Patriots Rally to Tie Raiders, 1717
description: FOXBORO, Mass., Aug. 5 (UPI)John Tarver ran 3 yards for one touchdown and Jim Plunkett passed 21 yards to Tom Reynolds for another tonight in the fourth quarter as the New England Patriots tied the Oakland Raiders, 1717, in an American Football Conference preseason game.

title: Last Grade Crossing on Subway System Is Closed
description: The city subway system closed its last grade crossing yesterday.

title: Bridge: Summer National Tourney Biggest Played Anywhere
description: The Summer National Championships in Washington at the end of July proved to be the biggest tournament ever played anywhere.

title: Intelligence G.I. in Germany Faces Quiz
description: BERLIN, Aug. 5United States Army investigators have begun administrative proceedings against a soldier in an intelligence unit, accusing him of giving information on Army wiretaps on civilian telephones in West Germany to unauthorized sources, according to his lawyer.

title: Officials Tour FloodDamaged Areas Awaiting Aid
description: Federal officials took a closer look at flooddamaged northern New Jersey yesterday as the state awaited word on whether the stricken section would be declared a Federal disaster area.

title: Data Banks and Privacy
description: A complex industrial society like the United States is becoming increasingly impossible to operate without vast data banks of computerized information covering many facets in the lives of millions of Americans. The very fact of that dependence has brought in its train a growing fear that these computerized files may abolish personal privacy and permit the inflicting of numerous types of injustices upon individuals whose personal rights are violated through misuse of computerized information.

title: Scouts of 13 Sects Attend Services at Idaho Jamboree
description: FARRAGUT STATE PARK, Idaho, Aug. 5 (AP)  Religious services for more than 20,000 youths of 13 faiths or sects marked the fifth day of the National Scout Jamboree West today.

title: Boom Economy in Europe Feared Heading for Crash
description: PARIS, Aug. 5Even as Western Europe is barreling along at its fastest rate of economic expansion in two decades, the warnings of an abrupt slowdown, perhaps deteriorating into recession, are being heard with increasing frequency in business circles of the Continent.

title: Body of Elderly Man Found in Ruins of Broadway Central Hotel
description: The body of an elderly, unidentified man was uncovered in the rubble of the old Broadway Central Hotel, the first known fatality since a portion of the 102yearold building collapsed on Friday.

title: Arabs Kill 3 and Wound 55 In Athens Airport Lounge
description: ATHENS, Aug. 5Two men identified by the, police as Black September guerrillas hurled grenades and fired machine guns, killing three people and wounding 55 in the crowded transit lounge of the Athens airport today.

title: Text of Rogers Affidavit to High Court on Cambodia
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5Following is the text of an affidavit of Secretary of State William P. Rogers submitted to the Supreme Court yesterday:

title: Body Recovered in Hudson
description: PEEKSKILL, N. Y., Aug. (UPI)The body of a man was recovered yesterday from the Hudson River 13 hours after witnesses reported seeing man jump off the Bear Mountain Bridge, the Peekskill police said. The police reported earlier that passersby had reported a man leaning over the rail of the bridge and disappearing into the water about 1:30 A.M.

title: Rudolf Friml's Children Sue His Estate for Libel
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 5 (Reuters)The children of Rudolf Friml, the composer of Rose Marie and other operettas who died here last November, have sued their father's estate, contending he libeled them in his will.

title: 68 Candidate in West Virginia Wins $750,000 in Libel Dispute
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Aug, 5A jury here has awarded the 1968 Democratic gubernatonal candidate $750,000 in libel judgment against the parent concern of The Charleston Daily Mail.

title: Subpoena for Nixon Involves Historical Precedents
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5It cannot be denied, John Marshall wrote with some prescience in 1807, that to issue a subpoena to a person filling the exalted position of the Chief Magistrate is a duty which would be dispensed with more cheerfully than it would be performed.

title: CAMBODIA REGAINS A CAPITAL SUBURB
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Aug. 5 (AP)Government forces moving behind American air attacks regained a village today in fierce fighting three miles southeast of Phnom Penh.

title: U.S. Loses a 3937 Set To Chile in Cup Doubles
description: NORTH LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Aug. 5 (AP)The Chilean doubles team of Jaime Fillol and Pat Cornejo won the longest set in Davis Cup tennis history today en route to a 21 lead in sets over Stan Smith and Erik Van Diller of the United States in the American Zone final before darkness suspended play.

title: Dividend Meetings
description: Dividend Meetings

title: Newark Airport Opening First of 3 New Terminals
description: A giant new passenger terminal at Newark International Airport, eight years in the making, has blossomed from the mud and will open to travelers Wednesday morning.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: OLDWICK, Aug. 5If the worlds Of art and horse racing seem somewhat incongruous to most people, for Richard Stone Reeves they fit very well. Since 1947, when he was commissioned to paint the horse of the year, Reeves has painted nearly every top, racer in the United States and abroad.

title: Police Report Increase in Shoplifting
description: DENVILLE, Aug. 5Shoplifting and pilferage, already a major cost factor for supermarkets, department stores and small retailers, is on the increase, according to police authorities. The reasons for this, they say, range from soaring prices, which have goaded normally honest shoppers to take revenge on retailers, to a nationwide change in morals. Angelo George, a chemical engineer who is president of Engineered Security Systems in Denville, believes that modern merchandising methods have also contributed to the security problems.

title: Arabs Kill 3 and Wound 55 In Athens Airport Lounge
description: Arabskill 3 and Wound 55 In Athens Airport Lounge

title: Red Smith
description: Thirtyfive years after his seconds threw in the towel, Max Schmeling will climb back into the ring with Joe Louis and Arthur Donovan, the referee, Thursday evening. The three principals in two of the most memorable fist fights of this century will lend their mellow presence to an amateur tournament between teams from West Germany and the United States in the Nassau Coliseum. There won't be many in the hall who saw both boutsthe one on June 19, 1936 when Schmeling, the former heavyweight champion of the world, knocked out the unbeaten youngster from Detroit in the 12th round, and the single round on June 22, 1938, when Louis destroyed the German in defense of the title he had won from Jimmy Braddock. Arthur Donovan saw them, from an arm's length away.

title: Niekro's NoHitter Defeats Padres, 90
description: Phil Niekro, the Atlanta Braves pitcher whose major league career resembles the ups and downs of his knuckleball, tossed a nohitter yesterday, defeating the San Diego Padres, 9.0, at Atlanta.

title: NICHOLS CAPTURES WESTCHESTER GOLF
description: HARRISON, N.Y., Aug. 5Bobby Nichols became the surprise winner of the $250,000 Westchester dolf Classic today. Two tremendous putts, the first for an eagle to force a tie at the 72d hole and the other for a birdie at the first hole of a suddendeath playoff, enabled Nichols to walk away with the first prize of $50,000.

title: Music Modern Worksat Tanglewood
description: LENOX, Mass., Aug. 5The suspicion that something may be happening out there somewhere that we don't know about gnaws at the heart of every representative modern man. In this country we have even institutionalized that unease into an everyday greeting: Hi, what's new? And yet in serious music, audiences somehow manage to suppress this natural curiosity so thoroughly that new compositions have to be forcefed into them. Or better, introduced out of their range of hearing under isolationward conditions at modernart fairs.

title: Hershfield Recovered
description: Harry Hershfield, toastmaster and raconteur, said yesterday he would be released from Beth Israel Hospital tomorrow, ending an 11day stay for treatment of fluid his lungs. The monologist and former radio star is 87 years old.

title: Cards Sweep Mets and Lead East by 5
description: The St. Louis Cardinals are playing so well these days they play for a split and then win a doubleheader.

title: Palermo Gunmen Kill Three
description: PALERMO, Sicily, Aug. (Reuters)Gunmen armed with rifles, pistols and a submachine gun killed three shopkeepers in an apparent Mafia slaying in a Palermo suburb late last night.

title: Spain Refuses to Impede Growth to Halt Inflation
description: MADRID, Aug. 5  Spain, which has one of the highest rates of growth in Europe, is refusing to sacrifice it in the interest of price stability.

title: Newark Airport Opening First of 3 New Terminals
description: A giant new passenger terminal at Newark International Airport, eight years in the making, has blossomed from the mud and will open to travelers Wednesday morning.

title: End of Cab Strike Urged
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 5 (UPI)Common Pleas Court Judge Leo Weinrott has taken under advisement a city request for an injunction that would return 2,200 striking Yellow Cab drivers to their jobs. The First Deputy City Solicitor, Sheldon L. Albert, said that street crime had increased since the cab strike began 13 weeks ago.

title: Because It Is There
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5Why is the United States bombing Cambodia? That is the question we ought to be asking in these last days before the Aug. 15 bombing cutoff fixed by Congress. Unfortunately, attention has been distracted from the real question by an unseemly, flurry in the Supreme Court.

title: Federal Officials Tour FloodDamaged Areas
description: Federal officials took a closer look at flooddamaged northern New Jersey yesterday as the state awaited word on whether the stricken section would be declared a Federal disaster area.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 5 (AP)The police pressed their search today for a sniper who wounded two spectators, neither seriously, during halftime of the Baltimore ColtsPittsburgh Steelers National Football League preseasbn game last night. The police said they believed the gunman, a man in his 20's and dressed in white, had gained entrance to the stadium by posing as a state Liquor Control Board agent.

title: STEEP RATE CLIMB SEEN CONTINUING
description: The steep climb in interest rates, which has already carried the price of shortterm money to record levels, shows no signs of approaching a plateau and, in all likelihood, will continue to advance toward a presently obscured summit until well past Labor Day.

title: Flying Rockette Wins $282,280 Race by Head
description: RUIDOSO DOWNS, N. M., Aug. 5 (UPI)Flying Rockette, a 72 favorite, beat Mr. Gobar in a neckandneck race and won the 10th runping of the $282,280 Rainbow Quarter Horse Futurity by head today. The winner earned $93,000.

title: Dr. Charles M. Kapp Dies; Fordham Hospital Surgeon
description: Dr. Charles M. Kapp, a surgeon who was a past secretarytreasurer of the medical board of Fordham Hospital, died of a heart attack Wednesday on a cruise ship at Grenada in the West Indies. He was 69 years old and lived at 50 Aviemore Avenue, New Rochelle.

title: NEEDS EXPLORED IN ENERGY CRISIS
description: The man who should know more about such things than anyone else at the General Electric Company doesn't feel that the socalled energy crisis justifies an enormously expensive crash program  in which we throw a lot of vaguely allocated money at every research and development opportunity.

title: Decision Amid Chaos: Jetliner Flees Athens
description: The violence at Athens airport broke out as swiftly as it did suddenly in the afternoon, said the one passenger arriving in New York who agreed to be interviewed.

title: Mrs. Rankin First in Golf After 4 Are Disqualified.
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio., Aug. 5 (UPI)Four players, including Betty Burfeindt, who was tied for second, were disqualified before the start of today's final round of the $35,000 Ladies Professional Golf Association Pabst Classic here.

title: Margo Joy Liberman Has Jersey Nuptials
description: MILLBURN, N. J., Aug. 5 Miss Margo Joy Liberman, daughter of Mrs. Philip S. Liberman of West Orange and the late Mr. Liberman, was married here today to Jeffrey Parker Ruddy, son of Mr. and Mrs. David D. Ruddy of Short Hills. Rabbi Robert Blumstein performed the ceremony at the Chanticler.

title: Survivor's Operation Set
description: BOSTON, Aug. 5 (AP)Doctors at Massachusetts General Hospital were expected to begin skin grafting tomorrow on Air Force Sgt. Leopold Chouinard, 20 years old, of Marshfield, Vt. His condition was reported today as critical, but stable. Sergeant Chouinard was the lone survivor of a Delta Airlines crash that killed 88 persons at Logan Airport Tuesday.

title: Nixon Back in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5 (UPI) President Nixon returned to the White House tonight after la leisurely weekend, including a Sunday dinner with his Ifamily, at his Camp David retreat in Maryland's Catoctin mountains.

title: Gail Winston Married To Daniel Hemerlein
description: EAST HILLS, L. I., Aug. 5 Miss Gail Jane Winston, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Jerry Winston, was married here this afternoon to Daniel John Hemerlein, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Hemerlein of Roslyn Estates. Justice Charles Margett of the State Supreme Court performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: News Summary and Index MONDAY, AUGUST 6, 1973
description: International

title: SKYLAB DEVELOPS AIR SYSTEM LEAK
description: HOUSTON, Monday, Aug. 6 A new problem, a leak in the air conditioning system, hit the Skylab space station last night. The astronauts were reported to be in no immediate danger.

title: New Books
description: Hello, GoodBye by Lynn Klamkin (Dodd, Mead, $5.95). A freshman's year at an experimental college.

title: ALBERT ROCCHIA
description: Albert Rocchia, chief editor since 1946 of the New York bureau of Agence FrancePresse, the French news agency, died Saturday of a heart attack at his home, 333 East 46th Street. He was 64 years old.

title: Television
description: 6:20 (2)News Report

title: Play in Clutch Marks Game of Akron Pro
description: HARRISON, N. Y., Aug. 5 It was a bittersweet ending, with the two principals agreeing and yet not agreeing on the justice of settling a 72hole tournament with one putt.

title: Bridal for Judy Brazelton
description: CRANE, Tex., Aug. 5Miss Judy Cheryl Brazelton and Capt. Douglas Caldwell, U.S.M.C., were married here last night in the First Baptist Church by the Rev. A. D. Kyle. The bride, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Bodine Brazelton, met Captain Caldwell in Okinawa, where she was teaching school for the Department of Defense and he was stationed. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. John H. Caldwell of New Canaan, Conn.

title: Dance: New Giselle at Ballet Theater
description: American Ballet Theater's Giselle had a newcomer to the title role Saturday afternoon at the State Theater in Zhandra Rodriguez, whose partner was John Prinz as Albrecht.

title: 4 Tiger Homers Down Yankees, 86
description: DETROIT, Aug. 5The Detroit Tigers, leading the American League in home runs, gave an exhibition of their longdistance hitting today with four circuit drives, a triple and two doubles in a 10hit output that beat the New York Yankees, 86.

title: Great Dane Earns 3d Best in Show In EightDay Span
description: FLEMINGTON, N. J., Aug. 5 America's topwinning Great Dane keeps right on the victorious trail.

title: Europe: What. Comes Next?
description: VIENNALast month, the first stage of the Conference on Security and Cooperation in Europe was concluded in Helsinki. Although the conference has just passed its initial stage, the foreign ministers accepted a number of guiding principles for the future conduct of relations between the countries of Europe. The most important of these is the inviolability of the existing frontiers in Europe.

title: IMBALANCE NOTED IN U.S.CHINA TIES
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 5A year and a half ago, during his visit to China, President Nixon expressed the hope that the Chinese and American people would have an opportunity to communicate with each other, know each other and share with each other those particular endeavors that will mean peaceful progress in the years ahead.

title: Meat Plant's Cattle Pens Empty and Workers Reduced
description: RUSHVILLE, Ill., Aug. 1Normally we're short of beef hooks, Robert E. Bartlow said glumly as he stared at a cart containing dozens of gleaming, menacinglooking metal hooks from which the carcasses of newly slaughtered cattle are hung.

title: Giants Looked Good, Yes, but They Were Playing the Chargers
description: SAN DIEGO, Aug. 5  It would be prudent not to get entirely carried away by the 28.3 pummeling the New York Giants gave the San Diego Chargers last night, because there were few extenuating circumstances. But the fact remains that the Giants looked very good on several levels in their first exhibition game of 1973.

title: Susan Maines Is Bride of Gilbert Saydah
description: TENAFLY, N. J., Aug. 5 Miss Susan Carol Maines, daughter of Mrs. Kenneth Campbell Maines and the late Mr. Maines, was married here this afternoon to Gilbert Richard Saydah, son of Mrs. Ferris M. Saydah and the late Mr. Saydah. The Revs. Harry E. Chase and Edward W. Castner performed the ceremony in the Presbyterian Church.

title: Oklahoma Officials Looking for Cause Of Prison Outbreak
description: McALESTER, Okla., Aug. 5 As several platoons of National Guardsmen left for home today after a week of riot duty here, officials were trying to understand what had caused the eightday outbreak at the Oklahoma State Prison.

title: CONNORS DEFEATS PASARELL IN FINAL
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Aug. 5 (AP)Jimmy Connors of Belleville, ill., won the singles championship in the $25,000 Buckeye tennis championships today Pm the second straight year.

title: Soul Comes Back to Lincoln Center
description: Soul at the Center 73 moved off to a strong start Saturday midnight, when two soul groups, Main Ingredient and the Four Tops, were presented in the first of six concerts at Philharmonic Hall. One of the two producer, of the series, Ellis B. Haizlip, of WNET/13's Soul program announced that this concert and one on Sunday featuring the groups War, Exuma and New Birth were both sellouts.

title: Leaders From 32 Nations Assemble in Ottawa for the Commonwealth Conference
description: SEATED, FROM LEFT: SECOND ROW: THIRD ROW

title: WRONG MAN CAUGHT IN ADIROND ACKS HUNT
description: WELLS, N. Y., Aug. 5A member of a local fish and game club was tracked down in Adirondack State Park by state troopers a few miles north of here around noon today, briefly mistaken for a fugitive they have been seeking for a week.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: REAL ESTATE Rockefeller Center is granddaddy of soaring centercity projects, just about 40 years old now and sitting on one million square feet of midtown Manhattan, at Fifth Avenue and 50th Street. On this precious plot are 17 million square feet of rentable space in 21 buildings, the highest of which is the 850foot RCA Building. Now, few New Yorkers would think in terms of touring Rockefeller Center it's just there and we all, or 175,000 visitors, walk through it daily.

title: DR. HENRY J. MASSON, ENGINEERING DEAN
description: Dr. Henry James Masson, who retired in 1959 as assistant dean of the New York University College of Engineering (recently merged with the Polytechnic Institute of New York), died Friday at his home in Delaware, Ohio. His age was 81, and he had lived in Bronxville, N. Y.

title: Casablanca Quarter Ruined
description: CASABLANCA, Morocco, Aug. 5 (UPI)Fire has destroyed the old Derb Sultan quarter next to Casablanca's Royal Palace. The police said they did not know the cause of Friday's blaze, which destroyed several shops and carpentry and construction material stores.

title: Karen Brodey Bride Of Leon Jan Wender
description: GREAT NECK, L. L, Aug. 5 Miss Karen Sue Brodey, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Marvin Brodey of Great Neck, was married here this afternoon to Leon Jan Wender. He is the son of Dr. and Mrs. Harold Wender of Boundbrook, N. J.

title: Horace Mann Coach Wins
description: William Brown of New York beat topseeded George Phillips, 61, 63, yesterday, to advance to the semifinals of the Irvington open tennis tournament in, Irvington, Pa. Brown is tennis coach at Horace Mann High School.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: David Rosenbaum's July 28 news report, Witness Defends Spying in Campaign, concerns John Ehrlichman's concept of the investigation of morals (drinking, personal habits, etc.) of candidates. Senator Weicker seems shocked that such considerations should be taken into account in attempting to assess the worth of political candidates in this country, fearing that elections would be settled on the basis of candidates private lives.

title: Music: New Satyricon at Tanglewood
description: LENOX, Mass., Aug. 6Most contemporary artists, it sometimes seems, have become convinced that the world ends not with a bang or a whimper, but a snicker. That might help explain the recent rush being given to Petronius Arbiter, whose Satyricon is known to every college sophomore as the ultimate statement about late Roman decadence. The latest to put Petronius to use is Bruno Maderna, whose oneact opera Satyricon he wrote the libretto as well as the musichad its first 4 American performance last night at Tanglewood, as part of the Berkshire Music Center's Music Theater Project at the annual Festival of Contemporary Music here.

title: Mets' Records
description: Mets' Records

title: Pitiful Giant
description: India is courting a Malthusian disaster with the decision of the Government of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi to sharply reduce spending for birth control.

title: Rev. James Moore Dead; United Methodist Executive
description: CHICAGO, Aug, 6The Rev. James G. Moore, a staff executive with the division of health and welfare of the United Methodist Board of Global Ministries, died yesterday of leukemia here. He was 45 years old and lived in Evanston, Ill.

title: F.T.C. Head Urges Code On TV Ads for Children
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 (UPI) Lewis A. Engman, chairman of the Federal Trade Commission, proposed today the development of a voluntary television code for acceptable and unacceptable advertising directed at children.

title: GRAIN EXPORTER CONCEDES ERROR
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 (AP)The Garnac Grain Company of New York admitted today that it filed 20 grossy inaccurate weekly reports with the Government last year on its transactions in wheatfutures commodities.

title: 6 Hurt in PlaneCar Crash
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., Aug. 6 (AP)One person was hospitalized and five were injured slightly yesterday when a light plane attempting an emergengency landing crashed headon into an automobile here. The authorities said that the collision occurred on the eightlane Capital Expressway. Traffic was blocked in both directions for 90 minutes. The pilot of the plane, Roger Sullivan, 42 years old, of San Jose, was reported to be in satisfactory condition after he was hospitalized for observation.

title: Cards to Lose Gibson For 4 to 6 Weeks
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 6 (AP)Bob Gibson will undergo surgery this week for a knee injury suffered last Saturday in New York and will be lost to the Cardinals for four to six weeks.

title: Table for High Tide for Waters Adjacent to New York
description: Table for High Tide for Waters Adjacent to New York

title: Batista, ExCuban Dictator, Dies in Spain
description: MARBELLA, Spain, Aug. 6 Fulgencio Batista, the Cuban dictator Fidel Castro overthrew in 1959, suffered heart attack and died early today at Guadalmina, a resort colony near Marbella, on the southern coast of Spain. He was 72 years old.

title: Interstate Stores Realigns Top Ranks
description: Interstate Stores, Inc., is realigning its top management with a new president and four other officers, approved yesterday by the executive committee. They will be formally elected by the board of directors following the shareholder meeting on Thursday.

title: Exorcising Watergate
description: Let others spend their time dealing with the murky, small, unimportant, vicious little things. We will spend our time building a better world.
