description: Dividends Announced

title: U.S. PLANES BOMB CAMBODIA TOWN IN ERROR
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Aug. 6An American bomb strike on a large Cambodian town this morning killed and wounded hundreds of people, mostly Government soldiers and their families.

title: Advertising
description: The revival of interest in oldtime radio has received another push forward with the development of a new promotion by the Sony Corporation of America.

title: U.S. Army's Plan In Germany Fights Dissenters in Ranks
description: HEIDELBERG, West Germany, Aug. 6The Army's Eighth Infantry Division has ordered its intelligence service to begin a coordinated counterdissidence effort among the division's 13,000 troops, according to copy of the plan made available to the press by a soldier who thinks it stifles political freedom.

title: Out Where Confession Stories Are Born
description: HILAND, WyoThe pretty young woman sat at her desk. She was confused. As she stared out the window, something stirred within her, something strange, something she had never before experienced.

title: CAMBODIAN TOWN HIT IN U.S. ERROR; 25 TO 65 KILLED
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Aug. 6An American bomb strike on a large Cambodian town this morning killed and wounded hundreds of people, mostly Government soldiers and their families.

title: Batista Dies in Spain
description: Fulgencio Batista, the Cuban dictator overthrown by Fidel Castro in 1959, died of a heart attack at Guadalmina, a resort colony near Marbella, on the southern coast of Spain. Details on Page 38.

title: Former Chicago Policeman Convicted in Killing of Two
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 6 (UPI)A federal jury convicted a former Chicago police sergeant yesterday of depriving two men of their civil rights by killing them. A convicted narcotics dealer also was found guilty of violating the civil rights law for hiring the sergeant to commit one of the murders.

title: Thieves With Lots of Brass Victimize Band in Encore
description: The audience was standing at attention in Damrosch Park as the Goldman Band played The StarSpangled Banner.

title: STATE PARK HERE GETS PATROLLERS
description: Guns and badges were given out yesterday to 15 men mosty blacks and Puerto Ricanswho are the first of a new type of policemen: the New York State Urban Park Patrolman.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: Entertainment Events Today

title: Weinberger Predicts Appeal On Impoundment Rulings
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 (UPI) The Administration will appeal all Federal court rulings against the withholding of appropriated health funds and will refuse to spend the money until the appeals are exhausted, Welfare Secretary Caspar W. Weinberger said today.

title: SOVIET MARS SHIP IS MAJOR PROJECT
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 6 The launching yesterday of the Soviet Union's third spaceship to Mars this year marks the beginning of the most ambitious effort yet to explore the distant planet.

title: Turner Loses Bid for Civil Stay During Trial on Fraud Charges
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 (AP) Lawyers for the Florida promoter, Glenn W. Turner, today lost a bid for a stay in civil action until after his trial on criminalmailfraud charges.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: The winning New Jemey, daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: A Fruitful Exchange
description: Our authoritative White House leak has just arrived with the secret record of President Nixon's secret talk with Premier Tanaka of Japan, which is reproduced here in the interest of refocusing public attention on the truly great world issues.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Excerpts From Testimony Before the Senate Committee Investigating. Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6Following are excerpts from testimony by L. Patrick Gray 3d, former acting director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, on the 36th day of hearings on the Watergate case before the Senate Select Committee on Presidential Campaign Activities:

title: A Fear of the Remedy
description: The Democratic party, fearing the advantage that incumbency would give Mr. Agnew in 1976, shrinks from the idea of impeachment. So do the Republicans, fearing the blow to their party. All of us shrink from the tensions and antagonisms that a trial of the President would generate. Yet this is the only means of terminating misconducted Presidency that our system provides.

title: Hoax Causes Plane Search
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 6 (UPI)A bomb hoax forced a United Air Lines DC8 to divert to Pittsburgh today& where searchers failed to find any explosives. The 87 passengers and crew of nine, who had taken off from New York, spent 2 hours on the ground at Pitlsburgs.

title: Goldwater Bids Nixon Talk
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 6 (UPI)President Nixon should tell the nation his side of the Watergate story, Senator Barry Goldwater, Republican of Arizona, said today, but the American people should be more con. cerned with problems such as inflation, runaway prices and devaluation of the dollar. Mr. Goldwater, here to address the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics, spoke at a news conference.

title: 4 Killed in U.S. Copter Crash On Okinawa Are Identified
description: NAHA, Okinawa, Aug. 6 (AP)The United States Marine Cos toda identified four men killed Thursday when their helicoter crashed in mountains about 60 miles north of Naha.

title: Mailer Threatens  Marilyn Suit; Calls for Apology From Zolotowl
description: Norman Mailer said yesterday that Maurice Zolotow's $6million law suit against him and the publishers of his best seller, Marilyn, was not worth sixty cents. And he said he would sue Mr. Zolotow, who wrote an earlier Marilyn Monroe biography, if Mr. Zolotow did not apologize for callIng him a plagiarist.

title: Park Without Walls
description: At 140th Street and Lenox Avenue a park without walls exists largely through the efforts of the Sports Foundation, Inc., which secured capital improvement funds and program money from Reader's Digest to improve the park. Where once the area was nothing but fencedin graveyard of broken glass, the Sports Foundation has now merle it a Harlem oasis filled every week day, with elderly people playing checkers, little children eating lunch, courtesy of the free daycare service, and older children playing team basketball games.

title: Mercer Arts Center Rises From Rubble
description: The Mercer Arts Center, a Lilliputiansized theater with the ambitions of a Lincoln Center, worked feverishly yesterday to salvage its total theater environment for the young from the rubble of the old Broadway Central Hotel, which collapsed Friday.

title: Track in Africa Faces a Long Road Despite Distance Strength
description: DAKAR, Senegal, Aug, 6The United States victory over Africa in two days of track and field competition lasr weekend appeared to say more about Africa's future role in the sport than it did about America's.

title: Nine Seized in Cockfight
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., Aug. 6 (UPI) Santa Clara County deputies broke up a cockfight yesterday, arresting nine persons and citing 43.

title: Penn Central Petitions On Purchase of Aida Raid
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 6 (AP) The Penn Central Transportation Company has petitioned the United States District Court here for authorization to buy 225 multilevel auto racks, the company announced today.

title: 6YearOld Apartment in Brooklyn. Shows Major Structural Defects
description: Six years after it was completed, under city supervision and with city financial aid, $47million, middleincome cooperative apartment development in the Williamsburg section of Brooklyn appears to its frustrated residents to be falling apart.

title: PATRON WOUNDED IN BAR SHOOTOUT
description: Patrolman Foils Holdup for 2d Time in Same Place.

title: 10MILLION SPENT AT NIXON HOUSES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6The Nixon Administration announced today that it had spent about $10million for Presidential security at San Clemente, Calif.; Key Biscayne, Fla., and Grand Cay in the Bahamas, and at the places where the Nixon daughters have lived.

title: GRAY SAYS NIXON SEEMED TO IGNORE HIS 1972 WARNING
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6L. Patrick Gray 3d testified today that he was mystified when President Nixon apparently paid no heed to a warning last year that White House aides were trying to mortally wound the President in the Watergate case.

title: Pig Calls By Fans Inspire U.S. to Davis Cup Victory
description: NORTH LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Aug. 6 (UPI)Stan Smith and Erik Van Dillen, inspired by pig calls from the crowd, rallied to beat Chile's doubles team of Jaime Fillol and Pat Cornejo today to clinch the victory for the United States in the American Zone Davis Cup final. The match, which included the longest set played in Davis Cup competition, was suspended because of darkness yesterday after six hours and 112 games.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 (Reuters)Two military contracts, totaling $25.7million, were awarded today to the General Dynamics Corporation and the Rockwell International Corporation General Dynamics was awarded a $14.2million contract by the Navy for guidance and control of standard missies. The Air Force awarded a $11.5million contract to Rockwell International for guidance and control subsystems for the Minuteman Two missile. Today's action modified an earlier contract btween the Air Force and Rockwell.

title: News Summary and Index TUESDAY, AUGUST 7, 1973
description: An American bomb strike on a large Cambodian town killed and wounded hundreds of people, mostly soldiers and their families. The attack occurred at Neak Luong, 38 miles southeast of Phnom Penh. The American Embassy in Phnom Penh would say only that it had heard reports of an accidental bombing in Neak Luong. [Page 1, Column 1.]

title: Bridge:
description: A player with the ace of the opponents long; strong suit will routinely delay taking it for a trick or two in a notrump contract. A similar action may be desirable in a trump contract, not so much to cut the opponents communications as to keep control and preserve options.

title: Chile Orders Protection Of Supply Convoys In Strike
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 6 (Reuters)Chilean authorities ordered the police and armed forces today to provide armed protection for supply convoys and public transport along national highways.

title: Mass Wedding in Peru
description: LIMA, Peru, Aug. 6 (UPI)A total of 134 couples were married in public today in downtown Lima. The mass wedding was sponsored by the city authorities to legalize the status of couples living out of wedlock. Many of the commonlaw couples were accompanied by their children.

title: Dairyman Urges Release Of Nixon's Data on Parity
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Aug. 6 (UPI)An official of Dairymen Inc., a cooperative that contributed to President Nixon's 1972 campaign, has urged the President to turn over memoranda or tapes relating to the 1971 dairy parity price, according to a letter released today.

title: Patrick Acquitted in Seizure of Youth
description: Ted Patrick  who helped a father seize his son to try to get him away from a religious group  was acquitted of unlawful imprisonment yesterday in Manhattan Criminal Court.

title: Baseball Inducts Six, One With Sorrow
description: COOPERSTOWN, N. Y., Aug. 6 (UPI)Her composure shaken and her voice cracking, Mrs. Vera Clemente said today, This is Roberto's last triumph, upon seeing her late husband enshrined in baseball's Hall of Fame.

title: Toughing It Out
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6President Nixon has been toughing it out for more than four months since, according to his own statement, he was told the facts about Watergate on March 21. H. R. Haldeman and John D. Ehrlichman, his two principal aides, have now told their version of events to the Senate Watergate Committee.

title: Jobless Check Repaid
description: MONTPELIER, Aug. 6 (AP) The Department of Employment Security got a check for $71.73 recently, which, the sender wrote, represented $56 he had received from the agency while unemployed in 1970, plus interest of 8 per cent per year.

title: STOCK PRICES RISE ON AMEX AND OTC
description: Stock prices on the American Stock Exchange in quiet trading yesterday closed slightly higher at 23.37, up 0.02, even though more individual issues showed decline than adances.

title: GRIFFIN CRAFTS
description: Griffin Crafts, who retired recently as chairman and president of the J. W. Wilson Glass Company of Linden, N.J., died yesterday in University Hospitaltal. He was 73 years old and lived at 220 East 19th Street.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A 22yearold New Jersey hiker who fell to his death in a Colorado mountain climbing accident Saturday was identified yesterday as William Crotty Jr., son of a vice president of the First National City Bank of New York. Authorities said the younger Crotty was climbing with two companions when they became separated. The companions waited and then reported Mr. Crotty missing rescue team recovered the body on Saturday at the foot of South Arapahoe Peak. Mr. Crotty fell about 600 feet, authorities said.

title: Survey Finds Rhode Island Can Withstand Navy Cuts
description: PROVIDENCE, RI., Aug. (AP) An economic impact survey says it appears that Rhode Island will be able to withstand major cutbacks at its naval installations with little or no effect on unemployment and no net decline in retail sales.

title: Howard Homer Off Lyle Caps a 3Run 9th
description: DETROIT, Aug. 6Just when it appeared that the Yankees were about to return to first place in the American League East tonight, along came the Detroit Tigers with a threerun outburst in the ninth inning and another tally in the 10th to beat New York, 54.

title: Health Unit Names 24 Establishments As Food Violators
description: The Health Department has listed 24 more food establishments as healthcode violators and has served notice that failure to pass a third inspection later this month could result in orders to close.

title: STOCKS REGISTER NARROW ADVANCE
description: The stock market ended its fiveday losing streak yesterday as a late upswing enabled prices to finish slightly higher in accelerated trading.

title: Army Told to Promote ExAide to Ehrlichman
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 (AP) The Pentagon confirmed today that a military aide to the former White House domestic adviser, John D. Ehrlichman, had been ordered promoted over the objections of the Army.

title: Peril Seen in HomeStoring of Beef
description: Dr. Joseph A. Cimino, City Health Commissioner, warned yesterday against excessive stocking at home for beef and other protein foods by consumers who, he said, in some cases were buying more than a sixmonth supply of very expensive cuts of meat.

title: Nader Calls on Reformist Lawyers To Take Over the Bar Association
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6Ralph Nader called on activist lawyers today to take over the American Bar Association and reform it, because, he said, whether the activists liked it or not, the association speaks for every lawyer in the country.

title: Deaths
description: Deaths

title: Major League Baseball
description: Major League Baseball

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Tomorrow, Aug. 8

title: Lakefront Gets a Shark
description: DUNKIRK, N. Y., Aug. (AP)Someone placed a dead, 35inch shark on a beach along the Lake Erie shoreline near here. Thomas Gooch, a conservation officer, said the shark had came from the Atlantic Ocean, and that the one who placed it at Lake Erie could he arrested for littering.

title: Convention Violence Plot Detailed By Informer at Antiwar Veterans Trial
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Aug. 6 The Government's key informer testified today that an antiwar veteran charged with plotting to disrupt the Republican National Convention in Miami Beach in 1972 told him he had organized political assassination squads armed by trading drugs for guns.

title: WITNESSES PAID $4,000 BY PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6H. R. Haldeman, the former White House chief of staff, rated a $25 a day payment for his testimony before the Senate Watergate Committee.

title: Roundup: Red Sox Defeat Orioles, 53
description: The Boston Red Sox scored four runs in the first inning and went on to a 53 victory over the Baltimore Orioles in Memorial Stadium last night.

title: Gray Says Nixon Seemed To Ignore Warning in 72
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6L. Patrick Gray 3d testified today that he was mystified when President Nixon apparently paid no heed to a warning last year that White House aides were trying to mortally wound the President in the Watergate case.

title: CONTRACTS GIVEN FOR GENERATORS
description: The Westinghouse Electric Corporation and Turbo Power and Marine Systems, Inc., subsidiary of the United Aircraft Corporation, announced yesterday separate contracts totaling more than $125million for gas turbine generator units.

title: Farm Union Boycott of Grapes and Lettuce Appears to Falter
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6The United Farm Workers, now losing most of its members in the California vineyards as growers sign contracts with the teamsters, is apparently also having little success with what once was its most potent weapona national boycott of grapes and lettuce.

title: Spending by Agencies On Properties Listed
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6Following are expenditures on Presidential security reported by agencies:

title: Lefkowitz Reports Stage Losses Topped $5Million for Season
description: Greatly increased production costs and greater losses to investors marked the Broadway and Off Broadway season that ended May 31.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Moriarty Gets 3 to 5 Years

title: Termites Are the Foe at Da Nand Air Base
description: DA NANG, South VietnamOn the vast Da Nang air base, a new, formidable enemy has confronted the South Vietnamese Air Force since the American pullout: termites.

title: Jerkens, Onion's Trainer, Is a Sore Loser Who Usually Wins the Big Races
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Aug. 6Unless he told you himself, you'd never believe that Allen Jerkens was a sore loser. His bearing is one of pleasantness, the faint suggestion of a smile ever present on his lips.

title: Victorious Cambodians Loot Recaptured Village
description: VEAL SBOU, Cambodia, Aug. 5A dog, a cow and a man lay dead today in the middle of this village outside Phnom Penh. Cambodian troops celetle brated around them, ignoring the villager and the dog but hacking chunks from the cow's carcass to cook for dinner or sell later.

title: Rentzel Hearing Is Set
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 6 (AP) Commissioner Pete Rozelle of the National Football League and the Los Angeles Rams were ordered today to show cause Aug.22 for the suspension of the Rams wide receiver, Lance Rentzel.

title: Bulls Gone, Pamplona Gets Down to Business
description: PAMPLONA, SpainThe bulls have run and the annual fiesta that Ernest Hemingway made famous has given way to more serious things in this northern provincial capitalsuch as Spain's industrial revolution and some of her more spectacular industrial conflicts.

title: BURGER SUGGESTS LIMIT ON APPEALS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6Chief Justice Warren E. Burger asked the organized bar today, to consider a new screening procedure that would limit the number of appeals that losing parties could take above District Court, the lowest level of the Federal system.

title: Pitiful Giant
description: India is courting a Malthusian disaster with the decisfon of the Government of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi to sharply reduce spending for birth control.

title: Radio
description: 8:05.10 A.M., WNCN. Mandolin Concerto in G, Hasse; Tournament Galop, Gottschalk; Concerto Grosso in D minor, Gemlniani; Song of the Flea, Mussorgsky; Love for Three Oranges: Scherzo and March, Prokofiev; Symphony No, 4 in C minor, Schubert; Enigma Variations, Elgar; Fantasia on a Theme by Tallis, Vaughan Williams.

title: Nearby Golf Results
description: Nearby Golf Results

title: Gas Station Bandit Slays Police Chief and Attendant
description: WOODBINE, N. J., Aug. 6Police Chief Philip De Santis of Woodbine and a Cape May Courthouse gasolinestation attendant were stabbed to death today during a robbery and attempted escape.

title: Tunnel Collapses on Train; Damage Put at $1Million
description: QUITAQUE, Tex., Aug. 6 (UPI)The last railroad tunnel in Texas collapsed on a train during the weekend. Railroad officials said yesterday that $1million would be spent extracting the wreckage and, probably, turning the tunnel into, a gorge.

title: Candidates All ProThieu in Senate Race
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 6 The campaigns for election to South Vietnam's Senate officially opened today without any senatorial candidate in the running who opposes President Nguyen Van Thieu.

title: UGANDA ATTACKS BRITAIN AT TALKS
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 6The amiable mood of the Commonwealth heads of government conference was disrupted this morning when the Acting Foreign Minister of Uganda delivered a broad and bitter attack on Britain.

title: U.S. AWARD TO AID SEWER PROJECTS
description: The United States Envitonmental Protection Agency said yesterday that it had awarded $20.7million in water pollution improvement grants to seven New Jersey sewer authorities.

title: PHOSPHATE LABEL WILL BE UNIFORM
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 6The Federal Trade Commission announced today that makers of household detergents had voluntarily agreed to a unifrom label for their packages that would list the amount of phosphates in the product.

title: N.A.A.C.P. REMOVES ATLANTA OFFICERS
description: The N.A.A.C.P. announced yesterday that it had removed from office Lonnie C. King Jr., the president, and other officers of its Atlanta branch because of their failure to oppose a controversial school desegregation plan in that city.

title: 4 Israelis Seized in a Sinai Western
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 6Four young Israelis were captured in the southern Sinai today after an 80mile chase through the desert involving army helicopters and desert command cars.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Between 75 and 100 Puerto Rican pickets marched around the Gulf & Western building at Columbus Circle yesterday, protesting the making and showing of the film Badge 373, which they charged was racist. The Paramount film, based on the reallife career of a former New York City detective, opened July 25 at neighborhood theaters. Its villian is a Harvardeducated Puerto Rican who deals in women and drugs.

title: BUSINESS BEAMED FOR FOOD PRICES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6A campaign was opened here today to convince consumers that middlemen and the increasing concentration of corporate power in the food industry are to blame for the surge in food prices.

title: AGNEW IS UNDER U.S. INVESTIGATION IN POSSIBLE CRIMINAL VIOLATIONS; INNOCENT OF WRONGDOING, HE SAYS
description: WASHINGTON, Tuesday Aug. 7Vice President Agnew announced last night that he had been informed that he was under investigation for possible violations of criminal law.

title: Brooklyn Union Granted 15Million GasRate Rise
description: The Public Service Commission of New York yesterday granted the Brooklyn Union Gas Company a $15.6million rate increase, The added income will amount to nearly 9 per cent of the company's 1972 operating revenues of $175.2million.

title: 132 Beef Price Violations Found Here Among 19 Wholesalers in U.S. Check
description: In a steppedup Federal drive, 19 beef wholesalers of 69 that were checked in the 14th Street and 135th Street market areas of Manhattan were served yesterday with notices of probable violation of beefprice ceilings.

title: CHARLES ROZMAREK, LED POLISH GROUPS
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 6 (AP)Charles Rozmarek, founder of the Polish National Alliance and the Polish American Congress, died yesterday at a hospital here. He was 76 years old.

title: Eugene W. DuFlocq Dies, Lawyer for Queens Court
description: Eugene W. DuFlocq, a lawyer and conciliation commissioner for Queens County Supreme Court since the new state divorce law went into effect in 1967, died Sunday in LaGuardia Hospital. He was 67 years old and lived at 22055 46th Avenue, Bayside, Queens.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: SPECIALTY There are tens of thousands of Japanese in New York as transient businessmen. There are scores of Japanese restaurants and even a few bookstores. Some time ago the Toho Cinema on 45th Street showed only Japanese films, but it ran out of either films or audiences and ceased operations. However, the Japanese sun has risen again in the same theater, now the Bijou, 209 West 45th Street (757.8455.6). A Japanese group has taken over the theater and once again is serving a purely Japanese film menu, featuring what appears to be Samurai and other fighting type movies. The films retain the original Japanese soundtrack but there are English subtitles, and you may get a synopsis of the plot (why do synopses always sound so much more complicated than what you actually see in front of you?) as you enter.

title: Gray, Taught to Say, Aye, Aye, Sir, Says He Failed in Post and It Hurts
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6Pat Gray is still twisting slowly, slowly in the wind.

title: Tax Study Reported On Nixon's 2 Estates
description: OAKLAND, Calif. Aug. 6 (AP)The Internal Revenue Service is studying whether President Nixon must file personal income tax returns for Governmentfinanced improvements to his California and Florida estates, The Oakland Tribune reports.

title: CAPITAL OUTFLOW OF JAPAN CLIMBS
description: PARIS, Aug. 6 (Reuters)lapan's net longterm capital outflow reached staggering levels in the first few months of 1973 and there are clear signs of an unwinding of the speculative inflow of shortterm capital, the Organization for Economy Cooperation and Development said today in its annual review of the Japanese economy.

title: Score 8 Times On Cardinals In 2 Innings
description: The St. Louis Cardinals, who in the last three months might have forgotten what it was like, rediscovered last night how less blessed teams live.

title: Stamford Is Restoring Its 1781 Fort To Be a Feature of Its Bicentennial
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Aug. 6 Fort Stamford is not noted in the annals of the Revolutionary War for deeds of bravery or for battles won and lost.

title: 2d Trial in Arson Begins
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 6 (UPI)Joel Achtenberg, 26 years old, of Kansas City, Mo., went on trial today for the second time for the burning of the R.O.T.C. building at Washington University during a campus demonstration in May, 1970. Mr. Achtenberg, a former student at the university, is one of six persons convicted under a Federal sabotage law for the burning. His conviction was reversed by the United States Court of Appeals for the Eighth Circuit because of trial errors, and the Government decided to try him again.

title: INDONESIANS STAGE ANTICHINESE RIOTS
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Aug. 6 (Reuters)Thousands of Indonesian youths went on a rampage through the streets of Bandung, the capital of West Java last night after what the authorities here said was a false report of the death of a youth in a fight with Chinese. One Chinese was killed and scores were injured in the rioting.

title: 6 War Protesters At the White House Set Free by Judge
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 6 (AP) A Superior Court judge, agreeing with an allegation that there was White House pressure behind the prosecution of recent antiwar demonstrators, declined today to sentence six women arrested at the White House.

title: First the Review and Then the Play
description: WATERFORD, Conn., Aug. 6The quiet country setting, the grassyduned beach nearby on Long Island Sound and the cool ocean breezes are reasons enough to lure city theater professionals to the ninth annual National Playwrights Conference, in its fourth and last week here, but Lloyd Richards says the true attraction is the process.

title: Nixon Lawyer Says He's Very Selective About Clients and Causes
description: WASHINGTON; Aug. 6Charles Alan Wright, the lanky Texan who will defend President Nixon in the Watergate court cases, reacted strongly to the suggestion that he had come to the White House as legal hired gun.

title: U.S. Army's Plan In Germany Fights Dissenters in Ranks
description: HEIDELBERG, West Germany, Aug. 6The Army's Eighth Infantry Division has ordered its intelligence service to begin a coordinated counterdissidence effort among the division's 13,000 troops, according to copy of the plan made available to the press by a soldier who thinks it stifles political freedom.

title: PRESEASON FOOTBALL
description: PRESEASON FOOTBALL

title: Equity Financing
description: An initial offering of 500,000 common shares of Affiliated Publications, Inc., is expected to be marketed today by underwriters headed by First Boston Corp.

title: Transamerica Expands
description: The Transamerica Corporation, San Franciscobased diversifiedservice concern, is entering the international hotel business through Trans International Airlines, its wholly owned subsidiary, which has acquired a 45 per cent interest in Melia International Hotels.

title: Nearby Golf Results
description: Nearby Golf Results

title: Jimenez Is Stopped in 10th By Villegas in Garden Bout
description: Francisco Villegas of Puerto Rico stopped Natalio Jimenez of the Dominican Republic at 44 seconds of the 10th round in a featherweight boxing match at Madison Square Garden's Felt Forum last night.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. St. Louis Cardinals, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens. 2:05 P.M. (RadloWHN, 2 P.M.)

title: Nixon Back at Camp David
description: CAMP DAVID, Md., Aug. 6 (AP)President Nixon unexpectedly returned to Camp David today to remain there overnight, after having spent a long weekend at the mountaintop retreat. The President and his chief of staff, Alexander M. Haig Jr., were driven to the camp in earl yafternoon.

title: Jets Hill Willing to Take His Pay Raise Elsewhere
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Aug. 6Winston Hill, looking like the world's biggest teddy bear while rolled under a blanket on a dormitory bed today, rejoined the Jets after refusing to play last Friday night.

title: Heating Oil Supply Quite Precarious, Industry Declares
description: The heating oil supply outlook for this coming winter is quite precarious, according to a study by the Petroleum industry Research Foundation.

title: Tramunti Sentenced to 3 Years On CriminalContempt Charge
description: Carmine Tramunti, described by District Attorney Eugene Gold as one of the most important crime figures in New York, was sentenced yesterday to three years in prison for riminal contempt.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: EDGARTOWN, Mass. A heavy surf pounded the barrier beach that separates Edgartown Great Pond from the Atlantic, and a stiff southwest windthe prevailing summer wind on Martha's Vineyard Island  soon drenched us with spray torn from the tops of the combers.

title: ADIRONDACK SEARCH SEEKING STOLEN CAR
description: SPECULATOR, N.Y., Aug. 6 The weeklong search for a suspected killer in the Adirondacks broadened tonight when a man resembling the fugitive bought gas for a car stolen earlier today near the area of the manhunt.

title: PRICES OF WHEAT TOP $4 A BUSHEL FOR FIRST TIME
description: Fourdollar wheat, the nightmare of flour millers and livestock feeders and the onceimpossible dream of the farmer, became a reality yesterday on Midwest grain exchanges.

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: To write about the pleasures of good eating at a time when beef is vanishing from the stores is an anomaly. To be sure, the shortage is temporary; when it was announced prices would be frozen until Sept. 12, it was inevitable that cattle would be held off the marLet until then. Beef will be backat higher prices. But that will not end the anomaly. Many people will find it disagreeable to read about good things they can no longer afford.

title: Asteroid Is Discovered
description: PASADENA, Calif., Aug. 6 (UPI)An asteroid that travels faster than anything else in the sky except a meteor has been discovered by scientists at the California Institute of Technology. It has a diameter of five miles, circles the sun every 34 months and travels 60,000 miles an hour, relative to the earth, a spokesman said.

title: Brooklyn Union Granted 5Million GasRate Rise
description: The Public Service Commission of New York yesterday granted the Brooklyn Union Gas Company a $15.6million rate increase. The added income will amount to nearly 9 per cent of the company's 1972 operating revenues of $175.2million.

title: Passaic Barely Notices The Revival of Burlesque
description: PASSAIC, Aug. 6Spotlights swung across the sky here tonight to add a touch of pageantry to the return of burlesque to this city after an absence of four decades.

title: 12.8% Gain in Quarter
description: The CocaCola Company re ported yesterday record second quarter and halfyear result and also announced the decla ration of an increased quarter] dividend.

title: Hart Schaffner to Market Men's Clothing in Japan
description: Hart Schaffner & Marx said yesterday that it had entered a licensing agreement with Marubeni Corporation, a Japanese trading company, to market men's apparel in Japan. The agreement, it was said, has been approved by the Japanese Government.

title: Experts Stress Profit Motive In SubsidizedHousing Proposal
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 A group of mainly nongovernment experts in housing has proposed a wholly new way by which the Federal Government can subsidize rental housing for low and moderateincome persons and families, aimed at avoiding the many problems that led President Nixon to terminate the old programs abruptly last January.

title: Canada Raises Bank Rate to 6%
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 6 (Canadian Press)The Bank of Canada announced tonight that the bank rate was being increased by onehalf of 1 per cent to 6 per cent, the fourth such increase since April.

title: Man Is Accused of Killing Woman by Running HerDown
description: ROME, N, Y. Aug. 6 (AP)Oneida County sheriff's depu ties placed murder and assault charges today against a man they said intentionally drove his automobile into his wife and a friend of her as they rode on bicycles in nearby Stanwix. The friend was killed.

title: Black Faith in Government Found on Rapid Decline
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Aug.6 (UPI) Many black citizens have lost faith in government, and it has not necessarily been because of the Watergate scan. dal, according to a University of Michigan survey.

title: Business Briefs
description: Lenders raised their interest rates on conventional home mortgage loans for the third consecutive month July, the Federal Home Loan Bank Board said yesterday. Thomas R. Bomar, chairman, attributed the trend to a drop in the flow of savings and the general increase in rates on other types of loans and securities.

title: Nixon Signs Bill Extending Crime Agency 3 Years
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 (UPI)President Nixon signed a law today that extends for three years the Federal Law Enforcement Assistance Administration with less cost and more flexibility for the states.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: CROSSWORD PUZZLE

title: Oil Concerns Plan Venture For Production of Uranium
description: The Standard Oil Company of Ohio and the Reserve Oil and Minerals Corporation said yesterday at Cleveland that they planned a $25million mining and milling complex in New Mexico. The new facility is expected to produce about 1.5 million pounds of uranium concentrates annually. The complex will be located on the 1Bar Rauch about 50 miles west of Albuquerque and will include a 600foot deep mine.

title: Training Sought for County Employes
description: PRINCETON, Aug. 6Bergen and Mercer Counties have become the first of the state's 21 counties to ask for help from the Public Service Institute here in establishing formal training programs for their employes.

title: Wheat Tops $4 a Bushel To Reach a Price Record
description: Fourdollar wheat, the nightmare of flour millers and livestock feeders and the onceimpossible dream of the farmer, became a reality yesterday on Midwest grain exchanges.

title: Television
description: Channels 2, 13, 31 live coverage starting at 9:30 A.M.

title: MESKILL CONFIRMS A RECORD SURPLUS
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 6 (UPI)Gov. Thomas J. Meskill has confirmed the existence of a $65million budget surplus the highest in Connecticut's historyfor the 197273 fiscal year.

title: Major League Baseball
description: Major League Baseball

title: Nixon Authorizes $10Million For Public Broadcasting Unit
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 (AP) President Nixon has signed legislation authorizing $110million in appropriations by the Corporation for Public Broadcasting during the next two years, the White House said today.

title: STEAMSHIP GROUP SEEKS FIRM RATES
description: Three United States steamship companies have agreed to join a group of European ocean freight concerns in an effort to stablize rates on a trade route from Europe to the United States West Coast.

title: $200 000 IN GEMS STOLEN FROM SHOP
description: Thieves made off during the weekend with $200,000 worth of gold jewelry from a Washington Heights jewelry store that was not wired with an alarm system.

title: Yields on Commercial Paper and C.D.'s Show Increases
description: The nation's biggest banks yesterday lifted their basic interest rate on loans to major corporations to 9 per cent, a record level set first last Friday by the Franklin National Bank. By the end of the afternoon yesterday, 9 per cent was the effective rate throughout the banking industry.

title: Value of Dollar Moves Up Against Currency Abroad
description: LONDON, Aug. 6 (UPI)The United States dollar climbed to a threeweek high against the West German mark today and gained against other European currencies, particularly the British pound.

title: Germans Lead Admiral's Cup In Second Leg
description: COWES, Isle of Wright, Aug. 6 (AP)West German yacht, Saudade, was given first place on preliminary corrected times in today's second leg of the Admiral's Cup, the world championship of ocean racing.

title: Crash Injures Pop Singer
description: SALISBURY, N. C., Aug. 6 (AP) Stevie Wonder, a well known pop music singer, was critically injured today in an autotruck collision here, the highway patrol said. Mr. Wonder and the driver of the car in which he was riding were admitted to Rowan Memorial. Hospital.

title: BRITISH DENY ROLE IN DUBLIN HOLDUP
description: LONDON, Aug. 6Amid mounting controversy over two brothers who were jailed after maintaining that they had robbed a Dublin bank on orders of British intelligence, the Defense Ministry denied tonight that the British authorities were in any way connected with the bank raid in Dublin.

title: Reporter Says He Saw Man Hand Over Gun at Kent State
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Aug. 6 (AP)A newsman who was at Kent State University in 1970 when four students were shot and killed said today that he had seen a man hand a pistol to the police and say: I had to do it. They were trying to kill me.

title: SIHANOUK BARS TALK WHILE U.S. SENDS AID
description: PEKING, Aug. 6 (Reuters)Cambodia's deposed leader, Prince Norodom Sihanouk, said today that his supporters would refuse to negotiate with the United States while it continued aid to Phnom Penh or sent planes over Cambodia. He said he would accept nothing less than complete victory.

title: People and Business
description: New executives of the Leadville Corporation in Colorado are in a bit of quandary, and in a development that may or may not be related, the annual meeting has been put off until lat September or early October.

title: London Insurer Seeking To Acquire DeltaLloyd
description: The Commercial Union Assurance Company or London, England, which now holds 27.8 per cent interest in DeltaLloyd Verzekeringsgroep N. V., a large insurance company In the Netherlands, yesterday offered some $81million for the 72.2 per cent it doesn't own.

title: REVENUE SHARING BENEFITS SCHOOLS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6Education programs received the major part of the first Federal revenuesharing funds returned to state governments, according to a statebystate review of the program.

title: 2 Skylab Astronauts Set Record for Space Walks
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 6Two of the Skylab 2 astronauts set endurance records in space walking today as they erected a new sunshade over their orbiting laboratory, changed film in the telescopes and performed other odd jobs in the vacuum of space.

title: Roundup: Red Sox Defeat Orioles, 53
description: The Boston Red Sox scored four runs in the first inning and went on to a 53 victory over the Baltimore Orioles in Memorial Stadium last night.

title: 2 Rob Church After Pastor Asks If They Want to Talk
description: DETROIT, Aug. 6 (UPI)The Rev. T. E. Edmonson of the Sharon Primitive Baptist Church finished his homily yesterday, then turned to the congregation of his East Side storefront church and asked if anyone had anything to say.

title: 6 Clubs Seek 2 Berths In Soccer Loop Playoffs
description: There is a lot of excitement in the North American Soccer League offices on the second floor of 101 Park Avenue because the playoffs start next week and only two teams are assured of postseason play. Six others are still battling for two other berths.

title: Black Resort at Sag Harbor Becoming YearRound Community
description: SAG HARBOR, L. L, Aug. 6As soon as the summer crowds leave this old whaling village after Labor Day, seven side streets are going to be paved for the first gime.

title: Good Appointments
description: In the currently depressing climate of Washington is particularly refreshing to note two firstclass appointments to high Government posts. While Russell E. Train and William D. Ruckelshaus are both veterans of the Nixon Administration, they should bring it added strength in their new positions as Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency and Deputy Attorney General, respectively.

title: U.S.Bangladesh Agreement
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 (AP) Bangladesh and the United States have signed their first Food for Peace agreement under which $11million worth of wheat will be sold to Bangladesh, the Agriculture Department said today.

title: Homeowners Are Urged To Itemize Flood Losses
description: NORTH PLAINFIELD, Aug. 6The cleanup of this floodravaged community ran into snag today when householders refused for a time to allow their debris to be taken away for fear that they would not be able to collect on insurance claims.

title: MADE A MISTAKE, TWO ARABS SAY
description: ATHENS, Aug. 6Two Arab terrorists told the Greek security police today that they hurled hand grenades at the wrong line of passengers at Athens airport yesterday. The toll was three killed, two of them Americans, and 55 injured.

title: MRS. DUNCAN J. KERR
description: Mrs. Elizabeth Muir Hendrie Kerr, widow of Duncan J. Kerr, former president of the Lehigh Valley Railroad Company, died Sunday in the Victoria Home, Ossining, N.Y. Her age was 88.

title: Common Market Council Puts Off Ministers Meeting
description: BRUSSELS, Aug. 6(Reuters) The Common Market council has canceled a meeting of finance ministers that was to be held in The Hague, the Netherlands, on Sept. 3, a Belgian Finance Ministry spokesman said here today.

title: Parks Department Employe, 37, Shot to Death on Randalls Island
description: A 37yearold summer maintenance employe of the Parks Department was shot to death as he changed into his work clothes yesterday morning in the locker room of the city tennis courts on Randalls Island.

title: Music: Gospel Concert
description: Black people develop, nurture, cherish and exploit the sense of rhythm that virtually everyone is born with.

title: Official Says Alleged Agent At Kent State Did Not Shoot
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 6 (UPI) A former security officer at Kent State University said that Terrence Norman was gunhappy but did not fire any shots on May 4, 1970, when four students were killed by National Guardsmen. There were reports that Mr. Norman was working on the campus as an undercover agent for the Federal Bureau of Investigation, but the F.B.I. has subsequently denied the reports.

title: Water Changes Proposed.
description: TRENTON, Aug. 6 (UPI)The Delaware River Basin Commission said today it wanted to start charging some municipalities and industries for water. The commission made public a set of proposed regulations that were drafted after one public hearing but will not be adopted until a second public hearing is held later this year.

title: U.S. Seeking Fresh Ideas From Israel on Mideast
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6The State Department has begun a lowkeyed effort to prod the Israeli Government to come up with some fresh ideas to break the stalemate in the Middle East.

title: People in Sports: Guerin, No Promoter, Needs a Job
description: Richie Guerin is looking for a job in pro basketball because he was apparently more interested in winning games than making money for the Atlanta Hawks. They told me they wanted a promotion man, said Guerin, who was dismissed with four years remaining on a fiveyear contract as general manager. He was replaced by Pat Williams, who held a similar job with the Chicago Bulls. Pat Williams is a promotion man; I guess they felt they needed someone who knows more than basketball.

title: Interest Rates Continue Their Upward Spiral as Restraint Widens
description: Interest rates continued their upward spiral yesterday under conditions of accelerating credit restraint.

title: L.I.R.R. to offer Smoother Ride Today
description: Long Island Rail Road commuters who have been known to be up in the air about one thing or another will have a new and more pleasant reason today when a smooth fivemile section of elevated track goes into service on the Babylon branch.

title: 10MILLION SPENT AT NIXON HOUSES;
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6The Nixon Administration announced today that it had spent about $10million for Presidential security at San Clemente, Calif.; Key Biscayne, Fla., and Grand Cay in the Bahamas, and at the places where the Nixon daughters have lived.

title: ISRAEL PRODDED State Department Begins an Effort to Generate New Mideast Ideas
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6The State Department has begun lowkeyed effort to prod the Israeli, Government to come up with some fresh ideas to break the stalemate in the Middle East.

title: Senator Proxmire: Campaigning for a Healthier America
description: The guest in Room 532 of the posh St. Regis Hotel leaped out of bed yesterday and began running in place. Then he opened a can of sardines he had bought in a grocery store and ate them for breakfast. He polished off the meal with a navel orange.

title: Council Calls Inquiry on Hotel Collapse
description: A second investigation into the collapse of the old Broadway Central Hotel, this one by the City Council's buildings committee, was announced yesterday. Council Majority Leader Thomas J. Cuite said the opening hearings would begin Aug. 23 in City Hall at 11 A.M.

title: Johnson After an A1 Performance, Says He's Still No. 2 Giant Passer
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, N.J., Aug. 6Despite equaling a pro record, even if it won't count, Randy Johnson still considers himself the No. 2 quarterback with the New York Giants for the present.

title: Violence Flares in South Jamaica As Policeman Kills a Black Man
description: A 27yearold black man allegedly involved in the theft of a school bus was shot and killed in a struggle with an arresting police officer last night, touching off several hours of sporadic violence in the surrounding South Jamaica section of Queens.

title: ULSTER COUPLE SLAIN', ON FARM BY GUNMEN
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland Aug. 6 (UPI)A gunman shot and killed a Roman Catholic farmer and his wife today and seriously wouned their 2year old son in County Tyrone.

title: Cox Calls on Judge to Deny Group's Bid for I.T.T. Files
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 (AP) Archibald Cox, the special Watergate prosecutor, asked a Federal judge today to deny a private organization's request for Government files on the Telegraph Corporation.

title: For Moriarty, the Number, Is 3 to 5 Years in Prison
description: JERSEY CITY, Aug. 6 (AP) Joseph (Newsboy) Moriarty, the reputed Hudson County numbers king, was sentenced today to threeandonehalf to five years in State Prison on his latest gambling conviction.

title: CYPRUS SUFFERS SEVERE DROUGHT
description: TIMOKO, Cyprus, Aug. 6 (AP)In a parched field, a goat herder sifts the dry earth through his fingers in frustration. He talks about what is on the minds of this Mediterranean island nation's farmers and shepherdsthe worst drought Cyprus has faced in a century.

title: Suit Alleges Bias in Picking Of Grand Juries in Queens
description: The Legal Aid Society filed suit in Federal court in Brooklyn yesterday to nullify the process of selecting grand juries in Queens as discriminatory on the grounds of sex, race, occupation and residence.

title: Dog Aids Mugging Hunt
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 6 (UPI) A blind man's guide dog, led the police yesterday to a man suspected of mugging his master. The police said that Lous Prather, of West Philadelphia, had been hit over the head and robbed of $237 while walking with his German shepherd, Tim. The dog also was taken but later escaped or was released. Tim returned to his master and eventually led the police to the home of Jerome Hilton, 20 years old, who after questioning was charged in the incident.

title: Flowers in the Cactus
description: PALERMO, SicilyIn the twelfthcentury Palazzo Reale where Norman kings once ruled, the president of the Sicilian Regional Assembly sits in remote splendor, glad to talk about the problems of the world instead of those at his doorstep. Around the winedark seas of the largest island in the Mediterranean, Soviet submarines and American carriers play imaginary war games but the real danger arises from industrial rather than military pollution in these waters. This wise country recognizes the perils and has created a new cabinet post for environment. Italy's main crisesunemployment, inflation, economic and social inequality coexist in microcosm on this sunscorched land.

title: American League
description: American League

title: Vice President's Meteoric Career Controversial
description: Vice President's Meteoric Career Controversial

title: Notes on People
description: Premier Kakuei Tanaka of Japan will visit Moscow in October, the Government in Tokyo announced. Mr. Tanaka returned home yesterday from a tour of the United States and talks with President Nixon. In Moscow, he is scheduled to talk with Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Communist party leader. The last Japanese Premier to visit the Soviet Union was the late Ichiro Hatoyama, whose visit in 1956 was to conclude an agreement on the reestablishment of diplomatic relations. Mr. Tanaka is to meet Mr. Brezhnev on Oct. 8, after a trip that will include stops in Britain, France and West Germany.

title: Racing Results and Entries
description: Racing Results and Entries

title: New Jersey Sports
description: PRINCETON, Aug. 6The new director of athletic medicine at Princeton University, Dr. Kiyo Tashiro, is thoracic surgeon who holds a thirddegree black belt judo. He also played professional football and for 12 years he pitched professional softball in Michigan and New York.

title: PEEP SHOW KING ROUTS A BURGLAR
description: LAWRENCE, L. I., Aug. 6Martin J. Hodas, described by the police as the peepshow king of New York City, was arrested here today and charged with illegal possession of a loaded gun after two shots were fired at an intruder in the bedroom of his $150,000 home early this morning.

title: CONGRESS RAISES OUTLAYS IBILLION
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6By the time it left town for its summer vacation last week, Congress had passed legislation that would add slightly less than $1billion to the spending total proposed by President Nixon, an official Congressional scorekeeping committee reported today.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
A Dentist in Queens Wounds an Intruder Threatening Nurse
description: A Queens dentist yesterday shot and critically wounded an alleged holdup man who made an appointment for a tooth extraction, showed up early with a butcher knife and threatened the life of a nurse in his demand for money.

title: TV: Rudd and Miss Quinn in Debut on C.B.S. News
description: Like many summer Mondays, yesterday was a relatively slow pews day, and so, perhaps understandably, there wasn't much news on the premier presentation of the newly revamped C.B.S. Morning News.

title: Steel Production Shows an Increase Of 1.1% for Week
description: Steel production for the week ended Aug. 4 rose by 1.1 per cent to 2,810,000 net tons, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. This raised the index to 115.2 from 113.9 a week earlier, when pro Auction amounted to 2,780,000 tons.

title: Burger Proposes That Bar Consider Limit on Appeal,
description: WASHINGTON, Aug, 6Chief Justice Warren E. Burge asked the organized bar toda to consider a new screenin procedure that would limit the number of appeals that losin, parties could take above District Court, the lowest leveof the Federal system.

title: Xerox Plans Expansion
description: DALLAS, Aug. 6 (UPI)The Xerox Corporation announced today that it would, open a factory in Dallas to employ 300 workers in addition to the engineering center the company recently opened here in leased space. In addition to the 3001 production workers, the company expects eventually to have 200 office workers in Dallas. The factory will also be installed in leased quarters and will open in September.

title: Dave Anderson
description: It seems so easy now. In his 12th National League season, Lou Brock is gliding through another pennant race.

title: 49ERS CAPITALIZE ON BROWN ERRORS
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 6 (AP)The San Francisco 49ers capitalized on three fumbles deep in Cleveland territory and went on to defeat the Browns, 2716, in a National Football. League exhibition game tonight.

title: Aircraft Unit Gets Order
description: FARMINGTON, Conn., Aug. 6 (UPI)The United Aircraft Corporation's Turbo Power and Marine Systems subsidiary has obtained a $22million order from the Florida Power Corporation, for a gas turbine powered generating complex with an output of 300.000 kilowatts. It will consist of six generating units powered by two Pratt & Whitney F4 gas turbine driving each aircooled generator.

title: MRS. COURT VICTOR OVER MISS ANTHONY
description: NASHVILLE, Aug. 6 (AP)Topseeded Mrs. Margaret Court, behind much of the way, defeated unranked Julie Anthony, 46, 76, 63, today in the opening round of the $35,000 Virginia Slims tennis tournament.

title: TeX asgulf Hearing Today
description: A court hearing sought by Texasgulf, Inc., to enjoin the Canada Development Corporat ion from making a $290million tender offer for 10 million shares of Texasgulf stock was postponed in Houston from yesionlay until 10 kill today.

title: Marchi for Pension Guarantees for All
description: State Senator John J. Marchi, the Republican candidate for Maycir, called yesterday for creation of a state commission to study the feasibility of a uniform retirement system that would cover all public and private employes in the state.

title: Ogden Weighs Dividend
description: Aalph E. Ablon, chairman of Ogden Corporation, said yesterday that directors will consider an increase in the common dividend before the end of this year, possibly at the September or November meetings. He made the comment in connection with the disclosure of 16.7 per cent increase in secondquarter earnings on a sales gain of 21.3 per cent.

title: Treasury. Bills Rise In the Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 Yields on United States Treasury bills rose in the Government's weekly competitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: Sales Also Increase By DAVID A. ANDELMAN
description: BETHPAGE, L. I., Aug. 6The Grumman Corporation re ported a sharp increase in boa sales and earnings for the sec and quarter this year, reflect ing, the aerospace corpora. tion's chairman noted, the in creased role of its commercial subsidiaries.

title: Crackdown on HardCore Pornography Has Followed Supreme Court Decision
description: Six weeks after the Supreme Court's entiobscenity decision, law enforcement officials across the nation are beginning a crackdown on hardcore pornography.

title: Continental Can Expands
description: The Continental Can Company said yesterday that it would build a $25million factory at Lommel, Belgium, to make cetlulose sausage casings and other food wrappers.

title: LandSea Containers Still Stir Controversy
description: The miniland bridge concept of container shipping is relatively new and of small size compared to the vast number of containers that move in international trade via the allwater route. The concept, effective on certain ocean routes  JapanNew York or EuropeWest Coastsaves up to a week in transit time by landing a container inbound from Japan, for instance, at San Francisco and then sending it here by fast transcontinental freight train.

title: Bemae Joins Group Asking Repeal of Base Rent Law
description: Elected officials, led by Controller Abraham D. Beame, yesterday joined representatives of eight tenant groups at a City Hall news conference to support the City Council's recent repeal of the maximum base rent program. The tenant groups have intervened in a State Supreme Court lawsuit brought by landords to invalidate the repeal.

title: Chess:
description: PETROPOLIS, Brazil, Aug. 6 Samuel Reshevsky of the United States checkmated Ljubomir Ljubojevic in a 43move King's Indian Defense to cut the 23yearold Yugoslay grandmaster's lead in Round 9 of the Interzonal tournament here in the Petropolitan Club.

title: Court Again Asked For Action to Stop Cambodia Bombing
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 (Reuters)Representative Elizabeth Holtzman, Democrat of Brooklyn, said today that she had filed a motion with the United States Supreme Court asking for action to stop the American bombing of Cambodia immediately.

title: Laundry Offers New Way to Age Jeans
description: Spurred by the higher prices that washedoutlooking denim garments bring at the retail counter, the business of making new blue jeans look old is expanding rapidly.

title: N.C.A.A. Reorganizes Into 3 Groups
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 6The 667 colleges and universities of the National Collegiate Athletic Association subdivided the cumbersome and in

title: Listing of Prices of Commodity Futures
description: Listing of Prices of Commodity Futures

title: SelfDefeating Terror
description: As in the case of last month's hijacking of a Japanese airliner, major Palestinian guerrilla organizations have been quick to disavow any part in the latest lunatic outrage committed by two selfproclaimed members of the Black September terrorist group.

title: Mayor Hears Shoppers FoodPrice Complaints
description: Mayor Lindsay and his Consumer Affairs Commissioner, Betty Furness, found out yesterday that supermarket shoppers were beefing about a lot more than just rising meat prices.

title: Slight Quake Hits California
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 6(Reuters)A mediumsized earthquake measuring 4.7 on the Richter scale rolled down the coast of California from Santa Barbara to Orange County, southeast of Los Angeles this afternoon, but there were no immediate reports of injuries. The California Institute of Technology said the quake had centered on the Anacapa Islands off the coast of Oxnard, about 70 miles northwest of here.

title: POLICE CHIEF RAIN IN JERSEY HOLDUP
description: WOODBINE, N.J., Aug. 6Police Chief Philip De Santis of Woodbine and a Cape May Courthouse gasolinestation attendant were stabbed to death today during a robbery and attempted escape.

title: FREEZE EXEMPTION FOR COPPER SCRAP
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 (AP) Sale of copper scrap metal today was granted an exemption from the price freeze effective immediately, Cost of Living Council Director John T. Dunlop announced.

title: Nixon Military Aide Picked
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16. (AP) President Nixon officially announced today the assignment of Brig. Gen. Richard L. Lawson, a former B52 pilot from Fairfield, Iowa, as his top military aide.

title: Batista Dies in Spain at 72
description: MARBELLA, Spain, Aug. 6 Fulgencio Batista, the Cuban dictator Fidel Castro overthrew in 1959, suffered heart attack and died early today at Guadalmina, a resort colony near Marbella, on the southern coast of Spain. He was 72 years old.

title: ARGENTINA OFFERS A CREDIT TO CUBA
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 6 The Argentine Government announced today that it would extend $200million in credits to Cuba for the purchase of trucks, tractors and agricultural machinery manufactured in Argentina.

title: 2 Arab Terrorists imathens Say They Attacked Wrong Travelers
description: ATHENS, Aug. 6Two Arab terrorists told the Greek security police today that they hurled hand grenades at the wrong line of passengers at Athens airport yesterday. The toll was three killed, two of them Americans, and 55 injured.

title: Soviet Tremor Registered
description: UPPSALA, Sweden, Aug. (Reuters)An earth tremor believed to have been caused by a Soviet underground nuclear Lest was registered by the Uppsala Seismological Observatory here today. The blast appeared to have taken place in the Ural Mountains, the observatory reported.

title: Books of The Times
description: Like disenchanted adults leaing through the family album of a happy childhood, Americans today are dosing themselves with nostalgia. For some middleaged people, the indulgence in nostalgia is the nearest thing to the pot smoking of their sons and daughters, who have no fond memories, they would say, to go back to. The growing pains of our society engender an ache, not so much in the bones, as in the heart. Freud's backtothewomb impulse comes through as a longing to turn back the clock to a cozier time, to a culture that embraced us in the arms of its conventions instead of confusing us with freedoms we cannot live up to. If we keep on progressing as we are, one imagines the family albums of the future as a sheaf of outoffocus blurs.

title: OIL SPILLS HERE TOTAL 300 IN 73
description: More than 800 oil spills occurred during the first six months of this year in the midAtlantic region, including more than 300 in the area of New York Harbor and its tributaries, according to a survey that has been made public by the Coast Guard.

title: The Calis From Beginning Called It a Double Murder
description: From the very beginning, we knew that it was murder and not suicide, John Cali said yesterday as he recalled the death of his wife and stepdaughter last May 14.

title: Strike by Seamen Spreads In Israel's Merchant Fleet
description: HAIFA, Israel, Aug. 7 (AP)A seamen's strike spread today through Israel's merchant fleet of more than 100 ships.

title: Crimes in Peace
description: Cambodia, a small country of seven million people, has been a neutral nation since the Geneva Agreement of 1954.

title: Food and Health Experts Warn Against Bringing Home the Bacon
description: Sodium nitrite is a chemical that cures meat, makes it look better and prevents botulism. But it also may lead to cancer, and pressure is growing to force producers to find an equally effective preservative for meats and other cured foods.

title: Books of The Times
description: There are many theories as to how social changes are wrought. Revolution, evolution, direct confrontation, passive resistance, civil disobedienceall have been tried at different times and with varying degrees of success. In an age when radical activism seems the most popular route to social reform, it is surprising to find that radicalism played such a minor part in the most successful social change in recent yearsthe abortion revolution.

title: Nearby Golf Results
description: Nearby Golf Results

title: Notes on People
description: Hctor J. Campora, the recently resigned President of Argentina, said his next service to Juan D. Perlin would be as an ambassadoratlarge to the rest of Latin America. Dr. Campora, who is also a dentist, was elected President in March, held the office for 50 days, then resigned, opening the possibility that former director Peron would succeed him in new elections next month. After meeting with Mr. Perlin on Monday, Dr. Campora said he had been asked to become an ambassador, but not to any particular country.

title: Knicks and Bradley, Nets And Schaeffer in Accords
description: Bill Bradley, coming off his finest season as a Knick, and Bill Schaeffer, who would like to become as valuable to the Nets, have signed their contracts.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Aug. 7 (UPI)  Rollins International, Inc., has ordered 1,300 highway tractors at a cost of $36million from five manufacturers for two of its subsidiaries. The purchases were from Mack Trucks, Inc., the International Harvester Corporation, the White Motor Company, the Butler Manufacturing Company and the Fruehauf Corporation.

title: New York Utility Plans $1.1Billion Power Outlay
description: The New York State Electric and Gas Corporation announced yesterday plans for spending $1.1billion on new power generating facilities by 1982.

title: Radio
description: Radio

title: ALICIA DE LARROCHA EXCELS IN MOZART
description: The mostly Mozart concert at Philharmonic Hall Monday night was a mostly amiable affair with Alicia de Larrocha taking top honors for her poised, wholly delicious account of Mozart's Coronation Concerto. Despite its title and late date of composition, this is rather tinselly, superficial work, but Miss de Larrocha knew exactly how to extract a maximum of charm from the notes without undue pretense or coziness.

title: MURDER SUSPECT VISITS HIS SISTER
description: Robert Garrow Sr., a fugitive who has eluded police for 10 days in the northern part of the state, visited his sister at 11:30 P.M. Monday night at her home in Mineville, N. Y., the state police said yesterday.

title: Daughter of Rabbi Brickner Killed in Mishap in France
description: 131.015, France, Aug. 7 (AP)Elise Brickner, 17  year  old daughter of Rabbi Balfour Brickner of the Union of American Hebrew Congregations, was killed in a fall from a horse near Blois last. Saturday, the police confirmed today.

title: PRICES SHOW DROP. ON AMEX AND OTC
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market finished slightly lower yesterday in continued slow trading.

title: Newspaper Halts Series
description: HONOLULU, Aug. 7 (UPI)John A. Scott, publisher of The Honolulu StarBulletin, said yesterday that the newspaper would temporarily postpone publishing a series of interviews with an underworld figure, Alfonso Morcilo, in accordance with a court injunction. However, he said the paper might resume the series after furthr court action.

title: Jets Boozer Is Silent Holdout, But Ewbank's More Talkative
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Aug. 7 Emerson Boozer knew what the question was going to he, so before it could be asked he provided the answer.

title: Goes From 6% to 6%
description: AMSTERDAM, Aug. 7 (Reuters)The Netherlands raised the bank rate to 6 per cent from 6 per cent, effective tomorrow, the central bank said today.

title: RockThrowing Mars Jamaica's Quiet Night After
description: A single, brief rockthrowing incident by a roving band of youth marred an otherwise quiet evening in Jamaica, Queens last night, according to the police who patrolled the neighborhood where young black had rampaged Monday night following the slaying of a 28yearold marl by a policeman in civilian clothes.

title: Vice President Is Silent on Inquiry As Advisers Wait for His Decision
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 Vice President Agnew contemplated his legal situation and the effect of a criminal investigation on his political career in the privacy of his office next door to the White House today.

title: Tipton's Injury Thins Ranks Of Giants Defensive Linemen
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, N.J., Aug. 7The New York Giants, who seemed to have found a surplus of talent and a stabilized defense, are faced with a shortage of defensive linemen for Sunday night's second preseason game against the New England Patriots.

title: Results of Nearby Yacht Racing
description: Results of Nearby Yacht Racing

title: SENATORS RECESS ON WATERGATE; RESUME SEPT. 10
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7The Senate Watergate Committee unceremoniously completed the first phase of its inquiry into the Watergate case today after hearing a detailed defense of the Government's muchcriticized original investigation.

title: Recently Published Books
description: Haldane Station, by Florence Engel Randall (Harcourt Brace Jovanovich, $6.95). A woman's yesterdays affect her today.

title: HotelCrash Inquiries Begun as 2d Body Is Found
description: Manhattan District Attorney Frank S. Hogan said yesterday that his Homicide Bureau had begun investigating the collapse last Friday of the old Broadway Central Hotel to determine there is any basis for criminal action.

title: Texas Ballot Opened
description: NEW ORLEANS, Aug. 7 (UPI) The United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit ruled yesterday that Socialists and Communists may be listed on the official electoral ballots in Texas. A threejudge panel, in making the ruling, upheld a decision of a United States District Court in Texas that had struck down as unconstitutional a section of the Texas loyalty oath.

title: Soldier Offers to Testify on Intelligence Activities in Germany
description: KAISERSLAUTERN, West Germany, Aug. 7An American enlisted man said today that it was, he who disclosed Army intelligence activities in West Germany to the press, and that, if asked, he would testify before a Senate investigating committee about others he believes illegal.

title: City's Car Auction Halted By Bidders Crying Foul
description: Irate bidders yesterday interrupted a city auction of 11 autos, seized from scofflaws who owed the city a total of $33,329 in unpaid parking fines, because they thought the procedure was a swindle.

title: Firestone Unit to Expand
description: AKRON, Aug. 7 (UPI)The Firestone Tire & Rubber Company said today its steel products subsidiary would build $13million plant to make truck wheels an demountable rims at Henderson, Ky. It will employe 500 when it goes in operation next year.

title: Exploring the Planets
description: With the end of the Apollo program, the era of manned exploration of the moon is over for the time being, perhaps for a generation or longer unless the Soviet Union decides to send astronauts to the lunar surface. But events this summer have demonstrated that work aimed at exploring the planets by instruments the most diverse sort continues actively.

title: LIBYA OIL SEIZURE INVALID, U.S. SAYS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7The United States has refused to accept the validity of Libya's expropriation last June of the Americanowned Nelson Bunker Hunt Oil Company because it was carried out as an act of political reprisal against Washington, counter to established principles of international law.

title: 3 of 4 in Mayoral Race Undecided on Transportation Bond Issue
description: Three of the four mayoral candidates have expressed reservations about the $3.5billion transportation bond issue and said yesterday that they had not decided whether to campaign for it, although some of the proceeds are earmarked to save the 35cent bus and subway fare.

title: 100 CUBAN EXILES AT BATISTA FUNERAL
description: MADRID, Aug. 7 (UPI) A funeral mass for Fulgencio Batista, the former Cuban dictator overthrown in 1959 by Fidel Castro, was sung in a small chapel today, attended by more than 100 Cuban exiles and family members.

title: Gas Prices May Double In Major Producing Field
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7The Federal Power Commission approved today an increase in the price of natural gas from the nation's largest producing area, a move that will more than double the price of gas flowing from wells that began producing within the last five years.

title: U.S. INDICTMENTS EXPECTED IN CASE INVOLVING AGNEW
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 7  Aederal officials said today that indictments were expected within weeks in an investigation into bribery, extortion and tax fraud charges involving Vice President Agnew and some of his closest political and financial associates.

title: Landlords Fail to Qualify For Rises on 238,000 Units
description: The city's rent agency said yesterday that the landlords of about 238,000 rentcontrolled apartments here had failed to qualify for rent increases that might otherwise be due them next Jan. 1 under the rentcontrol law's controversial maximumbaserent provision.

title: Sports Today
description: Sports Today

title: P.G.A. Will Bar Picture Taking
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 7  A suggestion by Tom Weiskopf to prevent overzealous amateur camera buffs from interfering with the contestants will be in effect here during the Professional Golfers Association championship.

title: Mrs. Streit, on 79, Leads In Canadian Amateur Golf
description: CHARLOTTETOWN, Prince Edward Island, Aug. 9 (AP) The defending champion, Mrs. Marlene Stewart Streit, took a onestroke lead today in the rainplagued first round of the Canadian women's amateur golf championships.

title: Death Is Irrevocable
description: When Congress voted five weeks ago to stop the bombing of Cambodia on Aug. 15, some members bitterly deplored the delayed cutoff date, arguing that the additional toll in Cambodian lives could not be morally justified. Supreme Court Justice William O. Douglas made the same point last Saturday when he ordered a stay in the bombinga stay promptly overruled by other members of the Court. We know that someone is about to die, Justice Douglas declared. The stay is granted because death is irrevocable.

title: F.D.A. Approves Product
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 7 (UPI)  The International Rectifier Corporation announced today the Food and Drug Administration had approved the application of its Rachelle Laboratories subsidiary to market the pigfeed premix product, Chloracelle 250. This action in effect settles a court dispute between Rachelle and the F.D.A. over the premix product, a combination of chloretetracycline, sulfamethizine and penicillin, the company said.

title: About the Giants:
description: The Giants will leave on Saturday morning for the Patriots game and stay at the Colonial Hilton Inn in Cranston, R, I. Several thousand tickets remain for the GiantsJets exhibition Aug. 19 in New Haven; tickets also are available for the Aug. 26 game at Yankee Stadium against the Steelers . Joe Walton, the Giants receiver coach, said he would continue to split the playing time of his wide receiversDon Herrmann, Rich Houston, Bob Grim and Linzy Colein exhibition games. Bob Tucker, the tight end, whose injured hand has been in a cast, may be ready to return for the Sept. 1 exhibition against the Eagles at Princeton, Walton added.

title: Foreigners in Argentina Growing Wary
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 7Behind the diplomatic incident caused by the United States Embassy's memorandums to the Argentine Government crit icizing draft legislation on in vestments is the rising discontent and insecurity in the foreign business community.

title: Senators Are Told U.S. Bombed Cambodia Secretly After Invasion in 1970
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7A former Air Force captain told the Senate Armed Services Committee today that he had participated in the widespread, falsification of reports on tactical bombing raids deep inside Cambodia for 11 months after the United States invasion in May, 1970.

title: Nixon Brief Denies Courts Can Force Tapes Release
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 White House lawyers told a Federal district judge today that the courts had no power to force President Nixon to provide a grand jury with tape recordings of his conversations if he believed it was not in the public interest.

title: Dog's Owner Gives Him to the Firemen as a Reward
description: The owner and keeper of an eightmonthold dog pulled from the debris of the lod Broadway Central Hotel yesterday, came forward last night, identified the animal and gave him to the firemen who saved him as reward.

title: Defendants in Attica Case Ask List of Jury Witnesses
description: BUFFALO, Aug. 7 (UPI)Attorneys, representing 60 people charged in connection with the 1971 Attica prison uprising, argued today that the list of witnesses who appeared before the grand jury investigating the disturbance should be made available to the defense.

description: COLUMBUS, OhioThis town has always been so Republican that a Democrat stands out like the pitchfork in Grant Wood's American Gothic.

title: Iron Ore Company vs. the Changing Times: U.S. Court Will Decide on Right to Pollute
description: SILVER BAY, Minn., Aug 7 In 1947, after extensive public hearings, Minnesota's environmental watchdogs gave the Reserve Mining Company permission to use the pristine waters of Lake Superior as a dumping ground for thousands of tons of rocky waste each day.

title: Mira Sparks Alouettes
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 7 (Canadian Press)George Mira threw touchdown passes to Larry Smith and Johnny Rodgers in the fourth quarter to give the Montreal Alouettes a 2114 victory over the Hamilton TigerCats tonight.

title: WORKERS IN BUFFALO TO GET FEDERAL AID
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (AP) President Nixon broke a tie vote of the Tariff Commission today and ordered aid to former employes of a General Electric Company plant in Buffalo. The plant was closed last year.

title: Office Workers Pick Lowe
description: William A. Lowe has been appointed secretary treasurer of the Office and Professional Employes International Union, A.F.L.C.I.O., to fill the unexpired term of J. Howard Hicks, who died on July 21. The appointment was announced yesterday by Howard Coughlin, president of the 90,000member union.

title: PACT IS EXTENDED IN STEEL INDUSTRY
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 7  The United Steelworkers of America and the major basic steel companies extended today by one year, until Aug. 1, 1975, an expedited arbitration procedure that was adopted as part of their 1971 labor agreement.
