The four painters representedClaude Yvel, Pierre Ducordeau, Henri Cadiou and Jean Maliceare newcomers to New York, but with listed prices going up to $14,000 they seem pretty sure of themselves.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Boiardo Gets Examination for Trial Anthony Boiardo, a reputed Mafia leader whose case was severed from an extortion trial in 1970, after suffering a heart attack was examined today by a Governmentappointed doctor to determine if he was healthy enough to stand trial.

title: Fugitive Released By Judge Wright Captured in Bronx
description: A 20yearold fugitive convict with a long arrest record, who was released without bail last week by Criminal Court Judge Bruce Wright in the Bronx despite an assistant district attorney's protest, was seized early yesterday by the police in his sister's apartment.

title: Flood Disaster Brings Mayor Sleepless Nights
description: NORTH PLAINFIELD, Aug. 7  Someone asked Frank Nero, who was elected to the City Council at 23 years old, elected Mayor at 24 and at 26 has been faced with major disaster, what he planned to be when he is 30.

title: Bar Group Asks Congress to Create a System for Removing Inadequate Federal judges
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7The American Bar Association asked Congress today to create a tough new system for removing misbehaving or disabled judges from the Federal judiciary.

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:
RAYMOND H. WHITE
description: Raymond H. White, a former telegrapher for The Associated Press, died Monday, apparently of a heart attack, at his home in Fort Lauderdale, Fla. He was 77 years old.

title: U.S. Is Investigating Mail Sales Of Alleged African Sex Potions
description: NEWARK, Aug. 7 (AP)The United States Attorney's office in New Jersey has begun an investigation of a nationwide chain of mail order houses selling allegedly worthless sex potions and miracle weight reducers.

title: Manila Takes Action Against Nonvoters In July Referendum
description: MANILA, Aug. 7 The Government is going after those who did not vote in last month's referendum, giving them till Sept. 8 to explain why they should not pay a fine or be jailed for one to six months, or be both fined and jailed.

title: Chemical Bank Unit Set
description: The New York State Banking Board approved yesterday the Chemical New York Corporation's plan to establish a subsidiary in Buffalo, N. Y., to be named Chemical BankBuffalo. The holding company said the plan still needs approval by the Federal Reserve Board.

title: Humanitarian Thing to Do
description: SEATTLE, Aug. 7 (UPI)Mary Harshman, about to begin the third year of a fouryear contract as the University of Washington backetball coach, has signed a new fouryear contract at a raise in salary, sports director Joe Kearney said today, describing Harshman as an outstanding coach and a great humanitarian.

title: Scandals Spur Criticism of Mrs. Gandhi's Government
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 7Scandals in several states and whispers of widespread corruption have disturbed Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's Government.

title: Need to Increase New Oil Supplies Stressed by Chase
description: New oil supplies will have to average 450,000 barrels a day higher in the second half of 1973 than they did in the first half if they are to meet demand, the Chase Manhattan Bank said yesterday in its monthly Petroleum Situation publication.

title: INTEREST RATES CONTINUE SURGE
description: The surge in interest rates continued yesterday along a broad front, with a dramatic upward leap registered by Treasury bills.

title: DOMINICK BRANCHES SOLD TO OTHER FIRMS
description: Dominick & Dominick, Inc., announced yesterday that 17 of its branch offices would be sold to other firms. The New York Stock Exchange member firm announced plans recently to phase out its domestic retail brokerage business for competitive reasons.

title: Rogers Asks Steps to End Rotten Vote Financing
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7Secretary of State William P. Rogers discussed Watergate today and said that the American system of financing political campaigns was so rotten that otherwise honorable men can be corrupted by it.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: Entertainment Events Today

title: I.T.T. LIFTS PROFIT AND SALES TO PEAK
description: Profits of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation for the quarter and six months ended June 30, increased more than 11.5 per cent in both periods to record levels, according to yesterday's midyear report. Record sales in both periods were also reported.

title: Bridge: When Reoutine Play Founders, It's Time for the Switch back
description: A rare opportunity for declarers is what might be termed the switchback play. In pursuing a routine plan, he discovers that it will fail, so he threatens another possibility that can only be countered by allowing him to revert successfully to his first scheme.

title: Rizzo Denies Using Police To Push Political Espionage
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 7 (UPI)  Mayor Frank L. Rizzo said today that he was not using a special police unit to conduct political espionage. He also promised to continue an investigation of official corruption.

title: PEROT CONTRACT IS UNDER INQUIRY
description: Four Federal or Congressional agencies areor will soon beinvestigating New York State's award of a $125,000 consulting contract to the Electronic Data Systems Corplvation, Representative Benjamin S. Rosenthal told Governor Rockefeller yesterday.

title: New Oil Contract Signed by Ecuador And a Consortium
description: CORAL GABLES, Fla., Aug. 7 Ecuador and a TexacoGulf consortium have signed a new concession contract which according to a Gulf spokesman here will give Ecuador close to 80 per cent of the gross profits of her petroleum exports.

title: New Jersey Sports An Audible Game
description: NEWARK, Aug. 7The stillness of a lazy summer afternoon is pierced by angry words reverberating from cluster of shady trees in Branch Brook Park Annex, but there is no cause for alarm.

title: Coal Expansion Program Set
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 7 (UPI)Falcon Seaboard, Inc., said today it was negotiating to sell 15 million tons of coal over the next 10 years for about $112million. The company will have to spend $4million to expand production from it mines to around 1.5 million tons yearly by 1975.

title: Harwood Belding, 64, Dies; Taught Physiology at Pitt
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 7Harwood S. Belding, a professor of environmental physiology at the University of Pittsburgh, died yesterday at his home, 5818 Howe Street, He was 64 years old:

title: Yet Another Plan for Battery City
description: The Battery Park City Authority named the developers yesterday for a sizable portion of the $1.1billion development in Lower Manhattan and in the process revealed a physical design that differs from an earlier and much more innovative one.

title: Title Won By Tinker In Sussex
description: BRANCHVILLE, N. J., Aug. 7Jess Larson's Justa Tinker, one of the leading contenders for the national highpoint award, clinched the small pony hunter championship today at the Sussex County horse show.

title: Gold Drops in London
description: LONDON, Aug. 7 (UPI)European money markets settled down to routine currency trading today, pricing the United States dollar and the British pound at almost unchanged levels.

title: Western Electric Expanding
description: The Western Electric Company, the manufacturing arm of the Bell Telphone system, said yesterday it would build a $5million warehouse and distributing center at Martinsburg, Va, It will serve Bell companies in Six states.

title: National League
description: National League

title: City to Inspect Coop With Building Defects
description: Commissioner Theodore Karagheuzoff ordered yesterday that the Buildings Department inspect a citysupervised, middle  income cooperative apartment development in Brooklyn that has shown serious building defects although it was completed only six years ago.

title: Committee Hopes To Wind Up Work By MidOctober
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7The members of the Senate Watergate committee hope to wind up the second phase of their inquiry in midOctober, however, there is no evidence that the committee favors dropping a prospective investigation into other aspects of President Nixon's 1972 campaign committee sources said today.

title: Super Day for Turcotte: Five in a Row at Saratoga
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Aug. 7  Ron Turcotte was something super today. The personable Canadian jockey registered five consecutive victories, the fifth on a filly with the most applicable name  Something Super. Turcotte is internationally famous as the rider of the Triple Crown winner, Secretariat.

title: The Old Reminders
description: DENVERNot long ago I was introduced at a cocktail party to a fairly important political figure. Noticing my Japanese features and trying to make conversation, he asked, Mr. Hosokawa, how long have you been in our country?

title: Equity Financing
description: MSL Industries, Inc., said yesterday about 307,j 000 common shares were tendered in its offer, which expired on Monday, to purchase 350,000 shares at $20 a share. The company's stock closed at 25, up  on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Committee on Colonialism 3 P.M.

title: NEVADA BARS FIRM IN FUTURES OPTIONS
description: CARSON CITY, Nev., Aug. 7 (AP)An order barring a firm from dealing in commodity options in Nevada because of alleged misuse of at least $250,000 in customers money has been issued by Secretary of State William Swackhamer.

title: M. A. KRIENDLER OF 21 CLUB DIES
description: Maxwell Arnold Kreindler, who was president of the famous 21 Club from 1947 to 1955, died yesterday at Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 65 years old and lived at 1016 Fifth Avenue.

title: Chris Evert Wins Easily At Ohio Net
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 7 (UPI) The topseeded players in the 575,000 Western tennis championships, Ilie Nastase and Chris Evert breezed to 61. 60 firstround triumphs tonight.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The question of President Nixon's involvement in the Watergate affair is serious enough, but is overshadowed by the questions raised by Gen. Earle G. Wheeler's revelation that President Nixon ordered the Cambodia bombing to be kept secret. Since the enemy certainly knew what was happening, the only purpose was to keep the information from the American people. [Editorial Aug. 5.]

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (Reuters)Total assets of the overseas branches of United States banks increased by per cenc. or $10.4billion in 1972, the Federal Reserve System reported today. At the end of 1972 total assets stood at $77.437billion, compared with $67.054billion at the end of 1971. The number of branches overseas of member banks increased by 50 to 627, the Reserve said.

title: The winning New Jersey, daily lottery number yesterday was:
Advertising: Saints and Sinners
description: Arlen D. Southern is a man who knows a thing or two about corporate advertising.

title: Pauling May Fight Ruling
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Aug. 7 (UPI)  Linus Pauling, the Nobel Prize winning scientist, says he hopes to challenge legally a Food and Drug Administration ruling curbing the use of Vitamin C. Dr. Pauling contends that the vitamin prevents colds, but the F.D.A. holds that there is no scientific proof that it does.

title: Roundup: Reds Win, 1 0 on Home Run By Morgan and TwoHitter by Gullett
description: Joe (Little Joe) Morgan has survived a fractured kneecap, strained knee ligaments and the lengthy inactivity of active military service during his 10year major league baseball career.

title: A Stairway to the Top
description: Seven years ago a young accountant decided he wanted something better than Ms $65aweek job, so he took a position with Typhoon Industries, Inc., a New York area manufacturer of fences. Yesterday he bought the company.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Puttemans Triumphs in 13:14.6 STOCKHOLM, Aug. 7 (UPI)Emile Puttemans of Belgium, holder of the world 5,000meter record of 13 minutes 13 seconds, set the year's best time for the distance today in the August Track and Field Games in the Stockholm Stadium. The 26yearold Belgian beat Dick Quax of New Zealand by 30 meters in 13:14.6.

title: Red Smith
description: Jack Nicklaus is a class guy who has stood alone for a decade as the finest golfer on earth, but because he also the infidel dog who blasphemed by deposing Arnold Plamer, the rabble known as Arnie's Army made him a target of abuse for 10 years. Gene Tunney may have been the most grievously underrated fighter of all times; when boxing was at its peak he fought everybody who was anybody and lost one decision to the carnivorous Harry Greb, whom he heat back three times. Yet taking the heavyweight championship away from the popular Jack Dempsey got him animosity and obloquy instead of acclaim. Similarly, many resented Jim Corbett because he defeated the brawling folk hero, John L. Sullivan. And hitting 61 home runs in a season was an ordeal for Roger Maris, haunted day and night by Bahe Ruth's ghost. It curdles the blood to think of the reception in store for the vandal who challenges the sainted Lou Gehrig's record of 2,130 consecutive games.

title: WITNESSES ASSAIL KOROT PRACTICES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (AP)The Government delved into the marketing techniques of Glenn W. Turner's cosmetics concern today as it sought to prove its allegations that the controversial promoter had engaged in deceptive and misleading business practices.

title: Brenda H. Fox Wed in Vienna To Peter J. Gall
description: Miss Brenda Humstone Fox, daughter of Mrs: Alan Gordon of New York, South Laguna, Calif., and East Hampton, L. I., was married yesterday in a civil ceremony in Vienna to Peter Johannes Gall, son of Mrs. Maria Gall and Prof. Hannes Gall of Vienna.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: CROSSWORD PUZZLE

title: Stennis, Wounded Jan. 30, Returns to Senate Office;
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (AP) Senator John C. Stennis returned to his office today for the first time since he was shot down in a robbery in front of his home Jan. 30.

title: New Air Terminal Opens at Newark
description: The opening of the giant new passenger terminal (Terminal A) at Newark International Airport today also involves the unveiling of an elaborate 14mile system of access and service roads. The map shows the principal turnoffs from major highways to the new terminal area and to the old terminal, which is being renamed North Terminal.

title: WILBUR COOPER
description: VAN NUYS, Calif., Aug. 7 (AP)Wilbur Cooper, a lefthanded pitcher who won 20 or more games four times for the Pittsburgh Pirates in the early nineteentwenties, died of a heart attack today at the age of 81.

title: Ulster Police Office Bombed; Passerby Averts Heavy Toll
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug. 7 (Reuters)Ten persons, including patients in a doctor's office, were injured tonight when a bomb exploded outside a police station in the border town of Newry.

title: Crumbled Elegance
description: A century ago the Broadway Central Hotel on lower Broadway had good claim to its boast of being America's most palatial hotel. Built on the site of a hall made famous by Jenny Lind and Edwin Booth, it quickly became a center of elegance in its own right. The National League was born there. James Fisk, a postCivil War rail magnate, was shot and killed on a back staircase by a rival for the affections of actress Josie Mansfield.

title: Incidents in Chile Sharpening AllendeArmed Forces Conflict
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 7President Salvador Allende Gossens asked today for the retirement of two air force officers, and the rightwing press denounced the action as an attempt to decapitate the air force.

title: Athens Airport Terrorists Are Charged With Murde.
description: ATHENS, Aug. 7  Two Arab terrorists who attacked Athens airport with hand grenades Sunday were changed today with premeditated homicide of a particularly odious nature. In the event of conviction there is a mandatory death sentence.

title: Charles J. Hardy Jr. Dies at 78; Lawyer Headed ACF Industries
description: Charles J. Hardy Jr., a retired lawyer and former chairman and chief executive of ACF Industries, Inc., died Monday at Doctors Hospital, He was 78 years old and lived at 435 East 52d Street.

title: Chris Evert Wins Easily At Ohio Net
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 7 (UPI) The topseeded players in the $75,000 Western tennis championships, the Nastase and Chris Evert breezed to 61, 60 firstround triumphs tonight.

title: Gang Confronted by Clurman Over Beating of Park Employe
description: Parks Commissioner Richard! M. Clurman, accompanied by three aides, angrily confronted 10 members of a roving teenage gangone wielding a bull whipthat was suspected of having just beaten a Parks Department employe, Monday afternoon, in a playground in St. Albans, Queens.

title: F.B.I. Studying McGovern Financing
description: NEW HAVEN, Aug. 7The Federal Bureau of Investigation said today that it was conducting a preliminary investigation of financial aspects of Senator George McGovern's 1972 Democratic presidential campaign here at the specific request of Archibald Cox, the special Watergate prosecutor.

title: State Drops Rehabilitation Plan Aimed at Disruptive Inmates
description: ALBANY, Aug. 7 (AP)Foredoomed by the longstanding opposition of the new Correction Commissioner, the state's experiment in the intensive psychological rehabilitation of disruptive convicts has ended even more quietly than it began.

title: Riders Flocking to Coast Train Spruced Up in Revival Program
description: ABOARD THE COAST STARLIGHTIn the lounge car, the Creedence Clearwater Revival was entertaining passengers over the stereo system, while John Banks, a 30yearold tourist from England, was trying to make a date with LouAnn Boehmer, an 18yearold blonde from Oregon.

title: Prayer Veto Overridden By Massachusetts House
description: BOSTON, Aug. 7 (AP)  The Massachusetts House overrode Gov. Francis W. Sargent's veto of the school prayer bill today, 171 to 50.

title: A New Crisis for Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Aug 7 President Nixon, says a man with occasional access to the Oval Office, feels as if he's living through six crises at once. The revelation that Vice President Agnew is under investigation for extortion, bribery and tax fraud in connection with Maryland building contracts seemed almost incredible to many politicians here, coming as it did on the heels of so much other bad news for the Administration.

title: Japan Is Asked to Ease Country's Rigorous Exchange Controls
description: TOKYO, Aug. 7 (Reuters)The Federation of Economic Organizations (Keidanren) said today it had asked the Government and the Bank of Japan to ease the country's present rigorous exchange control in order that the yen may be used more extensively for trade settlement than at present.

title: Vitamin C Linked to Cut In Sick Days of Students
description: STANFORD, Calif., Aug. 7 (AP)  Children taking big doses of vitamin C daily experienced significantly fewer sick days with colds than schoolmates taking fake pills in a test study in Arizona, a Federal researcher reports.

title: Stock Market and Rates
description: Soaring interest rates have stirred up deep concern in Wall Street as a relatively shortrun phenomenon that could deliver a knockdown punch to business generally and the stock market in particular.

title: SUIT BY TEXASGULF IS POSTPONED AGAIN
description: HOUSTON, Tex., Aug. 7 (AP) A suit by Texasgulf, Inc., trying to stop the Canadian Development Corporation from gaining effective control of the Texas corporation, bogged down in a procedural morass today. The hearing was postponed until 11 a.m. tomorrow.

title: Deaths
description: Deaths

title: An ExEmpire Holds a Reunion
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 7Because 32 government leaders representing 800 million people might have quite a few enemies, the security problems of the current Commonwealth conference in this sedate capital have been enormous. But most of the visiting leaders seem to admire the discreet and effective way the Canadians have done the job.

title: Braves Acquire Joe Niekro On Waivers From Tigers
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 7 (UPI)  The Atlanta Braves acquired Joe Niekro, a pitcher and the brother of Phil Niekro, who had a nohitter last Sunday, on waivers from the Detroit Tigers today.

title: People in Sports: Pitch By Peterson Is Outside
description: Fritz Peterson got kicked out of the Detroit Tigers press box Monday night. While the Yankee pitcher was trying to chart pitches, he was asked for his press credentials. At a loss for words, Peterson showed his New York Raiders card in a futile hope to remain. Peterson had worked as a color commentator on radio for the Raiders of the World Hockey Association. It did him no good. Maybe somebody in Detroit remembered the Raiders had changed their name to the Golden Blades.

title: Excerpts From Testimony Before the Senate Committee Investigating Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7Following are excerpts from testimony on the 37th day of hearings on the Watergate case before the Senate Select Committee on Presidential Campaign Activities:

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The New York State Banking Board yesterday increased the legal interestrate ceiling on homemortgage loans to 8 per cent, effective Aug. 15, from 7.5 per cent. The new limit does not affect interest rates on existing mortgages. Harry W. Albright, Jr., State Superintendent of Banks, said the action was designed to assure the continued availability of homemortgage financing at reasonable rates to New Yorkers. Permission to lift the ceiling as high as 8.5 per cent was enacted into law by the Legislature at the 1973 special session and signed by Governor Rockefeller last Friday.

title: Indian Trials Merged
description: SIOUX FALLS, S. D., Aug. 7 (UPI)  Judge Fred Nichol in United States District Court consolidated yesterday the trials of two American Indian Movement leaders, Russell Means and Dennis Banks, who are charged in connection with the armed occupation of Wounded Knee.

title: GONING OUT Gulde
description: QUICK LICKS Any day in which Teddy Wilson and Earl Hines can be heard jazzing it up on their pianos has got to be counted a good day for jazz connoisseurs, and today is just such a rare day. These agile and aged giants of the art are playing here, one for the money, the other for the show.

title: Heart Pacemakers, Recharged Through Skin, Held Successful
description: SILVER SPRING, Md., Aug. 7 (AP)The world's first rechargeable implanted cardiac pacemakers, which are recharged weekly through the surface of the skin, were reported today to be working successfully in a number of American patients.

title: A New Crisis for Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 President Nixon, says a man with occasional access to the Oval Office, feels as if he's living through six crises at once, The revelation that Vice President Agnew is under investigation for extortion, bribery and tax fraud in connection with Maryland building contracts seemed almost incredible to many politicians here, coming as it did on the heels of so much other bad news for the Administration.

title: AllisChalmers Is Awarded Contract for Nuclear Units
description: The AllisChalmers Corporation announced yesterday at Milwaukee that three Texas utilities awarded AllisChalmers Power Systems, Inc., a contract for two 1.15 million kilowatt nuclear steam turbine generators. The units will be installed at the Comanche Peak steam electric station about 60 mile southwest of the DallasFort Worth area.

title: United Nuclear Set to Sell Fuels Corp. Interest to Gulf
description: The United Nuclear Corporation announced yesterday execution of a letter of intent to sell its interest in the Gulf United Nuclear Fuels Corporation to the Gulf Oil Corporation. The agreement is subject, to completion of a definitive contract and to approval of the boards of both companies.

title: Port Authority Reports 18,000 Crimes in 1972
description: PALISADES PARK, N.J., Aug. 7 (UPI)In a move to discourage the replacement of police at Hudson River crossings with civilians, the Port Authority police of New York and New Jersey released statistics today showing that more than 18,000 crimes were committed at Port Authority facilities in 1972.

title: A U.S. PLANE HITS CAMBODIA VILLAGE IN 2D BOMB ERROE
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Aug. 7  A United States fighterbomber struck a Governmentheld village today in another bombing error near the town where a misdirected American air strike yesterday left more than 400 casualties.

title: 68 STATE OIL SPILLS IN THREE MONTHS
description: By DAVID A. ANDELMAN More than 28,000 gallons of oil were spilled into the inland and coastal waterways of New Jersey in 68 separate incidents during the second quarter of 1973, according to a survey made public yesterday by the Coast Guard.

title: Carmania and Franconia Are Being Sold by Cunard
description: LONDON, Aug. 7 (Reuters) Two of Britain's bestknown passenger liners, the Carmanial and the Franconia, are to be sold to the Panamanian associate of a New York company, the Cunard shipping line announced today.

title: Bakers Group Urges Nixon To Restrict Wheat Exports
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (Reuters)  The American Bakers Association warned President Nixon today that bread could become extremely expensive and scarce by next summer unless he acted to restrict wheat exports.

title: Unrest and Dissent, Novel in Thailand, Upset Leaders
description: BANGKOK, ThailandThere is more grumbling in Thailand these days than at any time since World War II, and the Government is worried, as are Thailand's neighbors.

title: Fishing for Pay: Menhaden
description: ABOARD THE TIDELAND, off Lido Beach  We like to see a few of those bluefish, said Norman Edwards, the slender, weatheredlooking skipper of the Tideland, his blue eyes scanning the surface of the Atlantic for turbulence, for dark apartments. He turned their patches or seagulls or other signs that might betray the presence of a school of menhaden.

title: People and Business
description: Otto N. Miller, chairman of the board of the Standard Oil Company of California, in a letter to the Jewish Community Relations Council of San Francisco, has amplified earlier remarks on the Middle East, saying that United States efforts to bring peace to the area should be based on the legitimate interests of Israel and its people as well as the interests of all other states in the area.

title: Table for High Tide for Waters Adjacent to New York
description: Table for High Tide for Waters Adjacent to New York

title: Nixon Housing Unit Urges Lifting F.H.A. Loan Limits
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (Reuters)  A housing panel appointed by the President recommended today lifting current limits on Federal backing of mortgage loans strengthen the Government's position in the mortgage market, which is increasingly dominated by private lenders.

title: Gas Prices May Double In Major Producing Field
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7The Federal Power Commission approved today an increase in the price of natural gas from the (nation's largest produoing area, a move that will more than double the price of gas flowing from wells that began producing within the last five years.

title: Women's Attire Said To Stir Verbal Abuse
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 7 (AP)  Police Chief Thomas J. Vaughan sent three policemen to this city's civic center construction site today during the lunch hour to keep an eye on construction workers accused of having subjected passing women to verbal abuse.

title: Excerpts From Brief by Nixon's Attorneys Supporting His Refusal to Yield Tapes
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7Following are excerpts from a brief filed today in Federal District Court by attorneys for President Nixon in support of the President's refusal to obey a subpoena requiring hint to give taperecordings of White House conversations and other documents to the Justice Department's special prosecutor, Archibald Cox:

title: DR. ERNST PAPANEK, OF WILTWYCK SCHOOL
description: Dr. Ernst Papanek, former executive director of the Wiltwyck School for Boys in Esopus, N. Y., and later a professor of educational psychology at Queens College, died Sunday on a visit to Vienna. He was 73 years old and lived at 1 West 64th Street.

title: MRS. JOE R. HANLEY
description: PERRY, N.Y., Aug. 7 (AP)Mrs. Henrietta Robertson Hanley, widow of Joe R. Hanley, who was Lieutenant Governor under Thomas E. Dewey, died yesterday at a hospital. She was 93 years old.

title: Box Score of Yesterday's Major League Games
description: Box Score of Yesterday's Major League Games

title: Saigon Says Level Of Fighting Rises, But Intensity Is Low
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Avig. 7 (Reuters)The South Vietnamese command today reported the highest level of fighting across the country since midJune.

title: FUTURES IN CORN BREAK $3 LEVEL
description: Corn traders took their turn yesterday to bid up prices to an historic high$3.011/4 for bushel of 56 pounds on the Midwest exchanges. The price was for corn deliverable next month.

title: Rogers Asks Steps to End Rotten Vote Financing
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7Secretary of State William P. Rogers discussed Watergate today and said that the American system of financing political campaigns was so rotten that otherwise honorable men can be corrupted by it.

title: $300Million Rise Urged In Federal Relief Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (Reuters)  President Nixon told Congress today that the high number of natural disasters caused by bad weather in the United States this year required spending four times as much in Federal relief funds as had been originally proposed.

title: Integration Upheld
description: Faith in the feasibility and even in the principle of school integration has been undermined by a variety of political and ideological countermovements. White segregationists have found their obstructive tactics aided and abetted by blackpower separatism. Earlier theorists who considered the meltingpot function of the public schools a relatively easy solution to all the problems of race and class have been displaced by a new set of sociologists who insist, with equal ideological extravagance, that the melting pot was a myth and a failure.

title: Firebombs Hurled in Area Of Grape Labor Disputes
description: BAKERSFIELD, Calif., Aug. 8 (AP)  Five firebombs were hurled at separate targets near here today in incidents officials believe were connected with the continuing grape labor strife in the San Joaquin Valley.

title: MARCOS ACTS TO END A SHORTAGE OF RICE
description: MANILA, Aug. 8 (UPI) President Ferdinand E. Marcos acknowledged a serious shortage of rice and cereal in the Philippines today by ordering the military to take control of all cereal stocks and arrest ali hoarders and pricemanipulators.

title: 2 Justice Positions Filled
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP) Attorney General Elliot L. Richardson announced today the appointments of Richard E. Mastrangelo, 35 years old, and Martin B. Danziger, 42, as Associate Deputy Attorneys General.

title: 9 East Germans Tunnel to West in Berlin
description: BERLIN, Aug. 8Nine East Germans, among them five children, have escaped to West Berlin through a tunnel they dug secretly, it was disclosed here today.

title: U.S. Aides Tried to Prevent Newsman From Visiting Town
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Aug. 8The air attach and an assistant air attach at the United States Embassy intervened yesterday to prevent correspondent of The New York Times from flying to Neak Luong, the scene of an accidental American bombing, on a Cambodian Air Force helicopter.

title: Health Violations Are Listed by City At 10 Food Outlets
description: The Health Services Administration announced yesterday the names of 10 restaurants and food stores charged with violating the health code.

title: Letter From Prosecutor
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. (AP)Following is the text of a letter from United States Attorney George Beall of Baltimore to Judah Best, attorney for Vice President Agnew. The letter, dated Aug. 1, 1973, notifies Mr. Best of the investigation of Mr. Agnew. The text was released after Mr. Agnew's news conference today.

title: B.P. and Bunker Hunt Sue Coastal States on Libya Oil
description: The British Petroleum Company and a Texas oilman, Nelson Bunker Hunt, filed a joint legal action yesterday in Houston charging the Coastal States Gas Producing Company with unauthorized and improper dealings in crude oil from Libya's Sarir field.

title: ANDREW J. PHELAN
description: Andrew J. Phelan, who retired as vice president and treasurer of Braniff International Airlines in March, died yesterday in Dallas. He was 65 years old and lived in Garden City, L. I.

title: First Visit by Concorde In U.S. Due Next Month
description: PARIS, Aug. 8 (Reuters)The Concorde supersonic airliner will make its first visit to the United States next month with the twin objective of blunting American opposition and starting a sales drive.

title: 3 TeenAge Girls Killed As Auto Burns on 3d Rail
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., Aug. 8Three teenage girls died and two others were injured when the car in which they were riding crashed through a barrier at the Long Island Rail Road tracks here, struck the highvoltage third rail and burst into flames.

title: U. of Wisconsin Halts Fiscal Aid to Black and Indian Student Centers
description: MADISON, Wis., Aug. 8 The University of Wisconsin formally withdrew its financial support from AfroAmerican and Native American student centers on the Madison campus today.

title: !Richard Boyer, 70, Biographer And New Yorker Writer, Dies
description: Richard O. Boyer, biographer of John Brown and a former profile writer for The New Yorker, died of cardiovascular disease Tuesday at University Hospital. He was 70 years old and lived in CrotononHudson, N.Y.

title: Japanese Investing Heavily in U.S. Race Horses
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Aug. 8Three decades after Pearl Harbor, Japanese traders are taking advantage of the devalued dollar by quietly buying up some of the highest priced chips in the bluechip game of thoroughbred breeding.

title: Abraham Pletman Dead at 73; Founded Lafayette Radio in 20
description: Abraham Pletman, founder and chairman of the board of the Lafayette Radio Electronics Corporation of Syosset, LI., died yesterday at his home, Fifth Avenue, after a brief illness. He was 73 years old.

title: People and Business
description: Henry Kearns, president of the United States ExportImport Bank since 1969, confirmed yesterday that he planned to resign and return to private business in southern California. Mr. Kearns, who is 62 years old, said he had informed President Nixon of his decision earlier this year. He has agreed to stay on until a successor has been named. It is understood the White House has approached several prospects but that no decision has been reached.

title: ExState Senator Is Heard by a Jury In Parole Inquiry
description: TRENTON, Aug. 8 (AP)Former State Senator James M. Turner, Republican of Gloucester, testified for more than two hours before a state grand jury today in connection with an alleged plot to fix a parole for a state prison inmate.

title: Horse Show Results
description: Horse Show Results

title: L.I.R.R. SickIn Ends
description: Long Island Rail Road signalmen, in, response to a temporary restraining order, apparently ended their oneday sickin yesterday, according to a company spokesman. On Tuesday about 150 of the 210 signalmen, who have been working without a contract since last Jan. 1, called in sick. The railroad obtained the restraining order in Federal Court, Brooklyn, and according to the spokesman, many of the men were reporting for work.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Dodgers, at Los Angeles. (RadioWHN, 10:55 P.M.)

title: The Ballet
description: In the face of boorishness, the creative artist's only defense is taste and excellence. Natalia Makarova impaled her detractors with these twin esthetic darts and triumphed in American Ballet Theater's Swan Lake on Tuesday evening at the State Theater.

title: Seeds of Tragedy
description: What with empty meat shelves and skyrocketing prices for almost everything else in the supermarket, housewives have little inclination these days to complicate their shopping problems by sitting in judgment on a farm labor dispute whose merits few even pretend to understand.

title: Chile: Again the Army?
description: President Allende has evidently decided, for the second time in nine months, to bring highranking military officers into his Cabinet in an effort to arrest the slide toward chaos and civil war in Chile. Many Chilean democrats who have little in common with Dr. Allende's Popular Unity Government will nonetheless share the reservations of his Socialist party about this reliance on the armed forces to help resolve a political crisis.

title: Boxer Put On Parole 'As a Man
description: Bobby Lee Hunter, who fought his way to boxing fame while serving a prison sentence, was paroled yesterday. The 23yearold flyweight won his freedom in a twominute hearing before the South Carolina Probation and Parole Board after serving six years of an 18year sentence for manslaughter.

title: George W. Jaques, 86, Law Partner Here, Dies
description: George W. Jaques, a consulting partner in the law firm of Milbank, Tweed, Hadley & McCloy, died Tuesday at his home, 2829 Bronson Road, Fairfield, Conn. He was 86 years old.

title: Radio
description: 8:0510 A.M., WNCN. The Art of Fugue: Group 5, Bach; Mischievous Melodies, Shchedrin; Capriccio Espagnole, RimskyKorsakov; Tirsi e Clorl, Monteverdi; Violin Concerto, Sibelius; Escales, Ibert.

title: 35Day Bills Are Sold At Treasury Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8The Treasury department disclosed tonight the results of $2billion bid on 35day taxanticipation Treasury bills:

title: 15 Killed in Explosion At Saudi Oil Refinery
description: BAHRAIN, Aug. 8 (Agence FrancePresse)  Fifteen persons were killed by an explosion at the Arabian American Oil Company's refinery at Abqaiq, Saudi Arabia, it was disclosed today.

title: COX BOLSTERS TEAM INVESTIGATING I.T.T.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8The Watergate special prosecution force confirmed today that it had shifted one of its men to strengthen its investigation of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation.

title: Proceeds From Sale of Computer Unit Will Top $137Million
description: The RCA Corporation announced yesterday that its total remuneration from the sale of its computer business to the Sperry Rand Corporation would total more than $137million.

title: Jewish Group Charges AntiSemitism in Movie
description: The film Jesus Christ Superstar, which opened yesterday in three Manhattan and three New Jersey movie theaters, is, despite its guise as a musical entertainment comparable to the antiSemitic Passion Play of Oberammergau, the American Jewish Committee charged yesterday at a press conference.

title: I.M.F. Support for Sudan Seen Aid to Fight Inflation
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (UPI) The International Monetary Fund said today it had cleared an arrangement under which The Sudan Government may draw up to $24million Special Drawing Rights in foreign exchange during the next 12 months.

title: Dr. Joseph Garland, Editor Of Medical Journal, Dead
description: BOSTON, Aug. 8Dr. Joseph Garland, physician and former editor or The New England Journal of Medicine, died Saturday at his home in suburban Chestnut Hill. He was 80 years old.

title: City Purchase Chief Sees Meat Prices Soaring 40%
description: Marvin Gersten, the city's Purchase Commissioner, yesterday foresaw meat prices skyrocketing here  up to 40 per cent for the last half of August, compared with the outset of President Nixon's Phase 4 program in midJuly.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX DECLINE SHARPLY
description: The American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market declined sharply yesterday in continued light trading.

title: Alexander, Pilic Gain At Ohio Net
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 8 (AP) John Alexander of Australia and Sharon Walsh of San Rafael, Calif., scored upsets in tonight's third round in the $75,000 Western tennis championships.

title: BIAS SUIT IS FILED IN WESTCHESTER
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 8 Four black residents of Westchester went to Federal Court today to challenge the legality of Government grants in the Town of New Castle on the grounds of discrimination.

title: Man Jumps Off S.I. Ferry And Disappears Into Water
description: A man between 55 and 60 years of age jumped off a Staten Island ferryboat last night about 200 yards off St. George, S.I., the police reported. He was still missing early this morning after extensive searches by the Coast Guard and the Police Department.

title: Notes on People
description: Ireland's new Ambassador to the United States will be John Gerald Molloy, a 57yearold diplomat who was Dublin's man in London from 1964 to 1970. Since then he has been assistant secretary to the department of foreign affairs.

title: Notes on People
description: Ireland's new Ambassador to the United States will be John Gerald Molloy, a 57yearold diplomat who was Dublin's man in London from 1964 to 1970. Since then he has been assistant secretary to the department of foreign affairs.

title: Wounded Knee After Long Siege: So me Ruins, Hundreds of Tourists Daily
description: WOUNDED KNEE, S.D., Aug. 8  The tourists come by the hundreds every day to stare at the ruins of Wounded Knee, trying to catch some hint of the 71day violent confrontation earlier this year between Indians and Federal marshals.

title: Woman, 28, Is Slain in  Village Workers Help Capture Suspect
description: A 28 yearold advertising copyw'iter at Macy's was stabbed to death at lunchtime yesterday in the entry of her Greenwich Village apartment building after she resisted an attempt to snatch her purse.

title: COURT OF APPEALS REVERSES ORDER TO STOP BOMBING
description: A court order to stop the American bombing of Cambodia was overturned here yesterday by a 2to1 decision of the United States Court of Appeals.

title: Project to Increase The Use of Airmail Is Called a Failure;
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8A Postal Service program to encourage the use of airmail has failed and should be modified or curtailed, according to a report by the General Accounting Office.

title: 20c PATH Fare Rise Is Stayed By I.C.C., Pending Added Study
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8The Interstate Commerce Commission today suspended, pending farther investigation, a 20cent fare increase requested by PATH, the Port AuthorityTrans Hudson rail commuter line between New York and New Jersey.

title: Hotel Collapse Forces Relocation of 4 Plays
description: The four stage productions of the Mercer Arts Center forced out of their theaterworkshop site by the collapse of the Broadway Central Hotel have been relocated.

title: Economic Planners Split on Grain Issue
description: The nation's top economic planners have split into three camps of thought as grain prices again reached historic highs yesterday on Midwest exchanges.

title: Biologist and Civil Rights Advocate
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 8Without an arrest warrant or any medical justification, four policemen and two doctors arrive at the home of a healthy man. The doctors declare that he is mad. The police major shouts: We are a lawenforcement agency! Get on your feet! They twist his arms behind his back and take him off to the madhouse. It was in these stark terms that the novelist Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn described the detention in 1970 of a fellow Russian, Zhores Aleksandrovich Medvedev, a biologist of repute and one of the most outspoken champions of civil rights in the Soviet Union over the last decade.

title: Coast Maritime Academy Gets First Midshipwomen
description: VALLEJO, Calif., Aug. 8 (UPI)  The deletion of one word in a California state law has enabled five young women to become the first midshipwomen in the history of the 44yearold California Maritime Academy.

title: Television
description: Television

title: A Learned Profession
description: WASHINGTON  Suppose that during the trial of Daniel Ellsberg a friend or relation of Ellsberg's had had a little talk with the trial judge, William Matthew Byrne Jr. He asked whether Judge Byrne would be interested in job paying $42,500 a year, good for life and carrying great influence and prestige in American life. He did not make a firm offer but indicated that he might laterafter the trial.

title: Mets Beat Dodgers, 10, On Matlack's TwoHitter
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 8 Jon Matlack, who had been pitching well and losing much of this season, pitched brilliantly and won tonight as he fired a twohitter in a 10 decision over the Los Angeles Dodgers.

title: Most Bond Prices Rally; ShortTerm Rates Climb
description: Bond prices rallied yesterday following weeks of virtually uninterrupted decline, with investors buying heavily from a $100million issue of Illinois taxexempts and $50million of Gulf States Utilities Company bonds. Shortterm interest rates, on the other hand, continued to rise. Meanwhile, an agency of the Federal Government Credit set, record high Markets rates on bonds scheduled to reach the market this morning. The agency, the Federal Home Loan Bank Board, will pay 93% per cent on $700million of bonds coming due next February, 9% per cent on $800million of oneyear bonds and 83% per cent on $300million of bonds due in February, 1976.

title: HUNT FOR SLAYER WIDENED UPSTATE
description: WITHERBEE, N. Y., Aug. 8 (UPI)The state police blocked roads as far north as the Canadian border today and reinforced ground patrols around Witherbee in the effort to track down an elusive exconvict wanted for murder.

title: Nicklaus, Weiskopf Favored
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 8Gary Player of South Africa minimized today his chances of retaining his title in the Professional Golfers Association championship that starts here tomorrow. Tom Weiskopf and Jack Nicklaus are rated cofavorites.

title: An Epilogue: Joe Louis and Max Schmeling Meet Again
description: Three men, once the figures in a fight that became a morality play that held the world's interest, were reunited yesterday for the first time in more than 35 years.

title: Hockey Transactions
description: CLEVELANDSioned Tom Edur of Toronto Marlboros.

title: Congressmen Drink, as Ehrlichman Said, but Few on the Hill Are Considered Drunkards
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 The Watergate investigation, permeating once hidden areas of the capital's social and political life, has focused new interest on an old subject: Congressional drinking.

title: Lindsay Off for 2 Parleys
description: Mayor Lindsay, accompanied by his wife, will leave today for eight days in Colorado to attend two conferences. Tomorrow he will participate in the third Vail Symposium on the Urban Environment in Vail. Next Monday through Wednesday he attends the executive seminar of the Aspen Institute for Humanistic Studies in Aspen. He plans to return to the city on Aug. 16.

title: Taiwanese Gets Up to 5 Years for Attempt to Kill Chiang Kaishek's Son Here
description: Cheng Tzutsai, a 35yearold dissident Taiwanese, was sentenced to a maximum of five years in Ossining State Correctional Facility yesterday for the attempted assassination of Chiang Kaishek's son here three years ago.

title: Belgrade Explosion Kills One
description: Belgrade, Yugoslavia, Aug. 8 (Reuters)  An attendant was killed by an explosion in a luggage department at Belgrade's main railway station early today, the Government news agency reported. Seven people were slightly injured.

title: Friend of Miss Kopechne Files a Wiretapping Suit
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (UPI) Margaret Carrol, a friend of Mary Jo Kopechne, filed suit in United States District Court yesterday contending that her telephone had been illegally wiretapped by former White House aides, Miss Kopechne drowned in 1969 in an automobile driven by Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts.

title: Swiss Reserves Fall in Week
description: BERNE, Switzerland Aug. 8 (Reuters)  Switzerland's Foreign Exchange reserves fell 230.6 million francs in the week ended August 7 to 10,463.7 million francs, while gold reserves remained unchanged at 11,893 million, the national hank said today.

title: A's Hunter Off List
description: DETROIT, Aug. 8 (UPI) The Oakland A's announced today that their efforts to place Jim Hunter on the 21day disabled list retroactive to the AllStar game had failed and that the pitcher would be retained on the active roster. Hunter suffered a fractured finger in the AllStar game last month, but commissioner Bowie Kuhn's office said it was not permissible to place a player on the disabled list retroactively.

title: City Forms a Task Force to Find More Compassionate Ways for Handling Rape Cases
description: Mayor Lindsay yesterday announced formation of an interagency city task force to deal with the problem of sexual assaults.

title: Chess:
description: PETROPOLIS, Brazil, Aug. 8Ljubomir Ljubojevic barely clung to a halfpoint lead in the Interzonal tournament for worldchampionship aspirants after falling prey to a wild rook sacrifice by David Bronstein of the U.S.S.R. and going down to defeat on the black side of an Alekhine Defense in Round 11. However, the 23yearold Yugoslav grandmaster held his ground by winning from Vladimir Savon of the U.S.S.R. in Round 10.

title: Another Drug Fix
description: The incredible flaws in the state's Draconian new drug laws have now been compounded by inexcusable neglect in preparing for their enforcement.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Dodgers, at Los Angeles. (RadioWHN, 10:55 P.M.)

title: Soviet Lifts Citizenship of Scientist, Bars His Return From London
description: LONDON, Aug. 8Zhores A. Medvedev, wellknown Soviet geneticist and dissident writer, has been deprived of his citizenship and told not to return to his homeland.

title: Pentagon Announces StepUp In Cambodia Bombing Attacks
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8The Defense Department reported to day that the Air Force stepped up air strikes yesterday against targets identified as Cambodian insurgent strongholds.

title: Teaneck Backs OfficeHousing Complex
description: TEANECK, Aug. 8  The Township Council approved today construction of a highrise residentialbusiness complex that would more than triple the population in the neighborhood for which it is planned. It was the borough's first approval of multifamily construction.

title: Rosenthal Tours Queens Supermarkets
description: Representative Benjamin S. Rosenthal, looking for solutions to the rising prices of food, took to the supermarket yesterday and later met with executives of some of the city's largest food chainsonly to learn that everybody thought it was Washington's problem. Going from supermarket to supermarket in his district in Queens, Mr. Rosenthal, a longtime consumer advocate in Congress and an organizer of last April's meat boycott, was told by customers and store managers alike that the Government was to blame for the rising prices.

title: 2 Radio Signals Stall Amtrak Turbo Trains
description: NEWARK, Aug. 8 (UPI)Two turbo  trains imported from, France by Amtrak do not run because an Americanmade radio installed in the trains triggers a safety device that shuts the engines off, officials said tonight.

title: Mythical Characters, but Real Recipes
description: Duck Mondor

title: Richard Kisonak, Wrote Of His Terminal Illness
description: LEWISTON, Maine, Aug. 8 (AP)Richard Kisonak, former newspaper reporter, whose story of living with the knowledge of his terminal illness brought him wide attention last winter, died yesterday at Lewiston hospithl. He was 44 years old.

title: Guyana Adds Police Powers In Face of Political Agitation
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, Aug. 8The police were given sweeping powers of arrest under legislation approved today by President Arthur Chung.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: COWES, Isle of Wight, Aug. 8 (AP)Saudade of West Germany won the third race today in the Admiral's Cup series, Britain's premier yachting event, successfully holding off Prime Minister Edward Heath's Morning Cloud. The West German craft finished nearly three minutes ahead of the British yacht on corrected time for the 35mile test in the Solent between the Isle of Wight and the English mainland.

title: Opium Poppy Gone, Turkish Farmers Ask Why Has U.S. Done This to Us?
description: AFYONKARAHISAR, Turkey, Aug. 2A stubborn sentiment among small farmers against the Americansponsored program to eradicate opium poppy planting in Turkey is being encouraged by the promises of local politicans that the ban will be repealed.

title: A Contrast With Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8Vice President Agnew has always been a blunter, more direct man at least in publicthan his boss, President Nixon. The contrast was never more evident than in his decision to hold a news conference today on the investigation of his affairs being conducted in Baltimore and in the way he handled himself at the conference. Mr. Nixon has consistently shrunk from public discussion of the Watergate case. He has held no news conference since March 15a period of almost five monthsdespite almost daily requests from White House correspondents.

title: News Summary and Index
description: A Federal Court of Appeals overturned a lowercourt order to stop the American bombing of Cambodia and cleared the way for the bombing to continue legally until Aug. 15, the cutoff date established by Congress. The appeals court, sitting in New York, voted 2 to 1 in overturning the order issued by Judge Orin G. Judd on July 25. That order had been stayed pending an appeal by the Government. [Page 1, Column 1.]

title: Bronfman Trusts Join in $23aShare Offer for Up to 1 Million
description: Investment trusts established for the four children of the late Samuel Bronfman, founder of the world's largest distiller, were disclosed yesterday to have joined a group of purchasers making a tender offer to buy up to one million shares of Signal Companies, Inc., for $23 a share.

title: The Deeper Meanings
description: WASHINGTONLike snow driven by a righteous wind, the evidence of Watergate continues to pile up, straining the limits of the nation's understanding and attention. And with it is a danger that the deeper lessons of this sordid affair will be buried under the drifts of details.

title: Bomb Error Leaves Havoc in Neak Luong
description: NEAK LUONG, Cambodia, Aug. 8The destruction in this town from the accidental bombing on Monday is extensive.

title: Mooring Uneasy At Hill's Position
description: HEMPSTEAD, Aug. 8 John Mooring, who was so unnerved in Houston last Friday when informed at the last minute he would be starting at the Jets right tackle spot in place of Winston Hill, a holdout, still hasn't completely regained his poise.

title: Rights Unit to Choose Head
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 8 (AP)A national committee was named today to choose a successor to the Rev. Ralph David Abernathy, who recently resigned as head of the Southern Christian Leadership Conference.

title: Tombs Inmate Commits Suicide While in a Psychiatric Section,
description: A 50yearold man being held for psychiatric observation before trial on a shoplifting charge hanged himself with bedsheet from a bar in his cell at the Manhattan House of Detention yesterday morning.

title: Deaths
description: Deaths

title: He Sees the Light And He Runs for It
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, g. J., Aug. 8Joe Orduna celebrated his 30th wedding anniversary today.

title: Yesterday's Racing Results and Today's Entries
description: At Roosevelt Raceway

title: Sympathy Money To Go to Japanese On Hijacked Plane
description: TOKYO, Aug. 3In accordance with an old Japanese custom that has acquired the force of an unwritten law here, the 114 Japanese passengers in the Japan Air Lines plane that was hijacked last month will each receive a sympathy payment of 500,000 yen (about $1,900) to compensate for their ordeal.

title: Mooring Uneasy At Hill's Position
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Aug. 8 John Mooring, who was so unnerved in Houston last Friday when informed at the last minute he would be starting at the Jets right tackle spot in place of Winston Hill, holdout, still hasn't completely regained his poise.

title: CABBIES DISPUTE SNARES TERMINAL
description: NEWARK, Aug. 8Passengers arriving at the new terminal at Newark International Airport, flown in across state and national boundaries today, landed in the middle of a territorial dispute between cab drivers from Essex and Union Counties.

title: Soviet Adjusts Rate
description: LONDON, Aug. R (UPI)The United States dollar dropped marginally today on most European money markets, while China and the Soviet Union both adjusted the exchange rates of their currencies.

title: 16 Suffer Burns in Bronx Courtroom; Police Say Mugging Victim Threw Lye
description: A searing jellylike substance hurled in a crowded Bronx courtroom by a man described as a disgruntled complainant against three suspected muggers sent at least 16 people to hospitals yesterday with what police called lye burns.

title: He Sees the Light And He Runs for It
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, N. J., Aug. 8Joe Orduna celebrated his 30th wedding anniversary today.

title: Personal Finance: Moving and Taxes
description: Americans on the move may not realize the tax advantages available to them when they change jobs and go on to a new areaespecially if they have not moved since 1969 when the tax allowances were liberalized.

title: Baseball Transactions
description: ST LOUISMick Kelleher, shortstop, recalled from Tulsa.

title: Balloonist Eyes. Pinpoint Landing in France or Italy
description: BAR HARBOR, Maine, Aug. 8 (AP)Bob Sparks, a former jockey, singer and comic, caught a westerly wind today in an attempt to become the first transAtlantic balloonist.

title: CYPRUS WELCOMES AN ATHENS PROPOSAL
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Aug. 8A Greek proposal that President George Papadopoulos of Greece mediate in the deepening conflict between President Makarios and Gen. George Grivas, the rightwing guerrilla leader, was welcomed today in Government circles.

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:
description: Tickets matching the number win $2,500, Tickets, with the five numbers in reverse win $225. Tickets with the first or last lour numbers in order win S225. Tickets with the first, middle or last three numbers In sequence win $25, Tickets with all five numbers scrambled win S25. Tickets matching the first and second digits, the second end third, the third end fourth or the fourth and fifth win $2,50.

title: Unilever Net Profit Advances by 23% On 14% Sales Rise
description: Unilever, N. V., and Unilever, Ltd., the twin companies that own or control more than 500 operating subsidiaries, including the United States giant, the Lever Brothers Company, showed a combined increase of 23 per cent in secondquarter profits on a sales increase of 14 per cent, according to the semiannual report issued yesterday.

title: ModPop 'Superstar' Comes to Screen
description: Broadway and Israel meet head on and disastrously in the movie version of the rock opera Jesus Christ Superstar, produced in the Biblical locale. The modpop glitter, the musical frenzy and the neon tubing of this superhot stage bonanza encasing the Greatest Story are now painfully magnified, laid bare and ultimately parched beneath the blue, majestic Israeli sky, as if by a natural judgment.

title: Youth, 17, and ExConvict Held in Thrill Killing
description: NEW CITY, N. Y., Aug. 8A teenager and a fugitive exconvict under indictment for a holdupmurder were accused today of a second slaying, committed a day later, possibly as a thrill killing, according to state police investigators.

title: Richardson Bids Aides Log T alks With Outsiders
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8Attorney General Elliot L. Richardson announced today that as part of his effort to remove the Justice Department from politics, every department employe would henceforth be required to report any conversation about Justice Department matters with outside parties  including Congressmen, their staffs and other governmental officials.

title: Da Nang Beautifies Because It Must
description: DA NANG, South Vietnam Some cities are proud of their gardens, their fountains or their cathedrals. Da Nang is proud of its sidewalks.

title: Hartford Police Cyrb GirlWatchers
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 8It is a typical American sidewalk scenethe construction workers drink their beer, eat their sandwiches and eye the women parading by on their lunch hour.

title: Kraftco Resumes Shipments
description: GLENVIEW, Ill, Aug. 8 (AP) The Kraftco Corporation resumed today shipments of vegetable oilbased products, including margaine and salad dressings. The concern temporarily halted shipments to retail outlets Aug 2 to assess its inventory because of possible product shortages under Phase 4.

title: N.B.C. Will Air A.M.A. Protest on Health Special
description: The National Broadcasting Company agreed yesterday to give the American Medical Association television air time to present its objections to an N. B. C. documentary on health care problems that the medical association has branded as distorted and unfair.

title: Agnew Suddenly Shares In Nixon Legal Dilemma
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8Vice President Agnew is suddenly contending with some of the same complex and controversial legal questions that have been taxing President Nixon and his lawyers for months.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: Entertainment Events Today

title: NIXON AIDES HOPE TO END CONTROLS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (UPI) The White House hopes to end all Government wage and price controls as soon as possible, perhaps by the end of the year, high Nixon Administration officials said today.

title: Suspect Held in Slaying
description: SYRACUSE, Aug. 8 (AP)A romantic triangle may have prompted the fatal shooting of Jimmy Lee Love, 37 years old, of Syracuse, Police Chief Thomas J. Sardino said today. Louis Singletary, 21, of Syracuse, surrendered to face a murder charge in the death of Mr. Love yesterday after a reported quarrel.

title: Civil Claims Against Koscot Delayed
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Aug 8 (AP) A Federal bankruptcy referee today prohibited courts from ordering Koscot Interplanetary Inc., to make payments in any civil actions while bankruptcy proceedings are pending.

title: Oil Pact Option Cited
description: The agreement signed between Texaco, Inc., and the Gulf Oil Corporation and Ecuador gives the Government the option, exercisable in 1977, to acquire a 25 per cent participation in the joint operation. The consortium owned jointly by Gulf and Texaco has found the only major oil deposits in Ecuador. The consortium has also built a 300mile pipeline across the Andes.

title: The Nixon Brief
description: At the heart of the Watergate controversy are the charges of John W. Dean 3d, former White House counsel, against President Nixon. Mr. Dean has testified that the President was aware last Sept. 15 that senior White House aides were engaged in a coverup of the Watergate burglary and that the coverup included the suborning of perjured testimony by Jeb Stuart Magruder and others, the destruction or aocumentary evidence, the payment of hush money to silence the Watergate defendants and, subsequently, a promise of executive clemency to those same defendants if they did not reveal the involvement of highranking officials of the Nixon Administration.

title: Judge DiLorenzo Balking In a Nadjari Investigation
description: Special State Prosecutor Maurice H. Nadjari is investigating alleged criminal violations involving Civil Court Judge Ross J. DiLorenzo, according to sources close to the investigation.

title: Bishop Kenneth Copeland Of United Methodist Church
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 8 (AP) Bishop Kenneth W. Copeland, resident Bishop for the Houston Area of the United Methodist Church, died yesterday in Methodist Hospital, apparently of heart attack. He was 61 years old.

title: Police Blame Secret Service And Haldeman in Rally Suit
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Aug. 8 (UPI)The Charlotte Police Department, facing a suit from persons ejected from a Billy Graham Day rally attended by President Nixon, has asked the United States District Court to hold the Secret Service and former White House chief of staff H. R. Haldeman responsible.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Just about the only thing James Galanos doesn't like talking about is money. His clothes, he said, speak for themselves and one should look at them and not at price tags.

title: MRS. MORRIS FLEISHER
description: Mrs. Claire Fleisher, mother of Lawrence Fleisher, general counsel of the National Basketball Players Association, died yesterday, She was 67 years old and lived at 3245 Perry Avenue, the Bronx.

title: L.P.G.A. Loses Appeal In Blalock Damages Suit
description: The Ladies Professional Golf Association's appeal in its law suit with Jane Blalock was disallowed Monday, a lawyer for the golfer announced yesterday.

title: VETERANS TESTIFY ON HOSPITAL RAIDS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8Three veterans told the Senate Armed Services Committee today that while serving in Vietnam they participated either ini the designation of North Vietnamese and Vietcong hospitals as bombing targets or in the actual destruction of them.

title: Bridge: An Insignificant PartScore Can Provide Valuable Points
description: Slam hands generally attract the attention of the bridge public, but for the tournament cognoscenti an insignificant partscore can be a source of delight. Several spectators noted a neat play by a New York expert, Philip Feldesman, in the life master pair championship in the Summer Nationals last month that netted him an important extra trick.

title: 85% Regard F.B.I. Favorably, But Poll Finds Some Slippage
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8The Federal Bureau of Investigation, despite its involvement in the Watergate scandal, is enjoying broad, but declining popularity, according to the latest Gallup Poll.

title: Theater Owner Reports Warning of Hotel Collapse
description: The owner of the Mercer Arts Center told a board of inquiry yesterday that as early as January of this year he warned the proprietors of the old Broadway Central Hotel and the city's Buildings Department that the hotel's facade was bulging dangerously and that cracks were persistently appearing throughout its interior

title: Roundup: Homer and Squeeze Bunt by Freehan Give Tigers 32 Victory Over A's
description: Bill Freehan holds a Bachelor of Science degree in history from the University of Michigan. Yet in his chosen career of major league baseball, he has worn the tools of ignorance as catcher for the Detroit Tigers for 11 years.

title: Transcript of Agnew News Conference Dealing With Investigation by Grand Jury
description: Following is a transcript of a news conference held in Washington yesterday by Vice President Agnew, as recorded by The New York Times:

title: 5 HURT IN EXPLOSION OF GAS IN VILLAGE
description: Five persons were injured yesterday when gas exploded in the basement of a Greenwich Village townhouse at 111 Bedford Street, near Christopher, causing extensive damage inside the threestory red brick building.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NORWOOD, Aug. 8When Gene Michael first heard about the plans for a Gene Michael night at Yankee Stadium, his face flushed from embarrassment.

title: Coalition Accord in Laos Reported Near
description: VIENTIANE, Aug. 8Wellplaced Western and Communist diplomats said today that the Laotian Government here and the Communistled Pathet Lao would sign a political and military agreement early next week and that a coalition government would be installed before the end of the month.

title: Scientist Hails Earth Data Collected by Skylab
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 8 (AP)In 35 minutes today, the Skylab 2 astronauts gathered information about the earth that scientists said could have taken decades to compile on the ground.

title: WOMAN, 28, SLAIN IN THE VILLAGE
description: A 28year old advertising copywriter at Macy's was stabbed to death at lunchtime yesterday in the entry of her Greenwich Village apartment building after she resisted an attempt to snatch her puse.

title: Music: An Intricate Game
description: LENOX, Mass., Aug. 8Youth was well represented on last night's program in the Festival of Contemporary Music here at Tanglewood, but the most vigorous and most adventurous work came from a delegate of the middleaged party.

title: KNOPF LEAVES POST AT PUBLISHING HOUSE
description: Alfred A. Knopf, one of the most prominent figures in American publishing, has stepped down as head of the publishing house he founded in 1915 to become its chairman emeritus. The announcement was made yesterday by Robert L. Bernstein, president of Random House, Inc., which bought Knopf in 1990 and is itself a subsidiary of RCA, Inc.

title: MRS. JOHN K. CLARK
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Aug. 8Mrs. Margaret Holbrook Clark, widow of John Clark, president of the New York State Board of Law Examiners from 1921 to 1947, died today in a nursing home here. She was 95 years old.

title: Advertising: On Store Brands
description: Harold Levine, president of Levine, Huntley, Schmidt, was watching television the other night (as a good adman should) when he saw a film clip on a news program that aroused his ire.

title: Mrs. Ryan, Extradited by Bonn, Faces a Long Inquiry and Trial
description: BONN, Aug. 8  German officials said today that the investigations and trial of Mrs. Hermine Braunsteiner Ryan, who was extradited Monday from New York to face charges of Nazi war crimes, might take months.

title: HEATH CRITICIZES UGANDA ON ASIANS
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 8Prime Minister Heath of Britain told his fellow Commonwealth heads of government today that Uganda was guilty of callous inhumanity in her expulsion last year of more than 30,000 Asian residents.

title: Yankees Triumph, 32, On Two Runs in Ninth
description: On the first pitch yesterday at Yankee Stadium, the Yankees lost Fritz Peterson. On the last pitch, they won the game.

description: Major League Baseball

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The owner of the Mercer Arts Center told a board of inquiry yesterday that as early as January of this year he warned the proprietors of the old Broadway Central Hotel in downtown Manhattan and the New York City Buildings Department that the hotel's facade was bulging dangerously and that cracks were persistently appearing throughout its interior.

title: Convention Proposal Loses
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., Aug. 8 (AP)A proposal to convene constitutional convention in Rhode Island next month was defeated by a 26vote margin statewide, unofficial reruns showed. The final unofficial tally was 21,246 against the convention and 21,220 in favor.

title: 8 BODIES FOUND IN HOUSTON LOT
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 8 (Reuters) The bodies of eight young people, most of them individually wrapped in plastic and coated with lime, were unearthed here tonight, and the police were searching the area for more.

description: The price of a loaf of bread has gone up 1 to 4 cents for the consumer following announcements of price increases by three of the nationwide bakers.

title: Two for One
description: SAN FRANCISCOThere is a new synthesis under way in psychology. It combines the scientific technology developed in the last century with ancient concepts and techniques of the traditions of the Middle and Far East. This is no idle philosophical movement, but a true translation of a most specialized and sometimes hidden knowls edge with the empirical tradition of the West. It is not a question of one culture or tradition's superiority to another, but of a differential specialization. Many of the seemingly abstruse ideas of these traditions can now he seen as statements about perception, cognition and brain function.

title: Canandaigua Lacks Water
description: CANANDAIGUA, N. Y., Aug. 8, (AP)This city proclaimed a water emergency today, banning the use of water for washing cars, filling pools and watering lawns. Mayor T. Hamilton Kennedy said dry weather had left the city's two reservoirs only 20 per cent full.

title: Reagan Sees Danger Of Inquiry Witch Hunt
description: DAVIS, Calif., Aug. 8 (AP) Gov. Ronald Reagan of California said today that. Watergate lawbreakers should be brought to justice, but not as a lynching or a witch hunt.

title: W. SPRAGUE HOLDEN
description: DETROIT, Aug. 8 (AP) W. Sprague Holden, chairman of the Wayne State University department of journalism, died today of a heart attack. He was 64 years old.

description: Business Records

title: RHEA MOBERG SWEDISH NOVELIST
description: STOCKHOLM, Aug. 8 (UPI)Vilhelm Moberg, the novelist, I was found dead near his summer home outside Stockholm today. He was 74 years old.

title: Cahill Signs Bill, Lifts Curb On Bank Branches in State
description: TRENTON, Aug. 8  Governor Cahill signed a bill into law today that enables cornmercial and savings banks to open branch offices anywhere in the state.

title: Modus Operandi Market Place: Of C.D. Buying
description: Let's say you have $100,000 and you are dissatisfied with the stock market probably for the obvious reason that you've been burned like virtually everyone else.

title: Bomb Error Leaves Havoc in Neak Luong
description: NEAK LUONG, Cambodia, Aug. 8The destruction in this town from the accidental bombing on Monday is extensive.

title: Allende to Bring Military Men Into the Cabinet to Ease Unrest
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 8President Salvador Allende Gossens will bring members of the armed forces into his Cabinet in a move to put an end to the state of sedition that reigns in the country, it was announced today.

title: Canandaigua Lacks Water

title: Federal Board Suspends Airline's Fare Proposals
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (UPI) The Civil Aeronautics Board ordered today an investigation of a proposal by Pan American World Airways that would tighten fare payment requirements during holiday periods for travelers in the mainland to Puerto Rico and Virgin Island routes.

title: Chess:
description: PETROPOLIS, Brazil, Aug. 8Ljubomir Ljubojevic barely clung to a halfpoint lead in the Interzonal tournament for worldchampionship aspirants after falling prey to a wild rook sacrifice by David Bronstein of the U.S.S.R. and going down to defeat on the black side of an Alekhine Defense in Round 11. However, the 23yearold Yugoslav grandmaster held his ground by winning from Vladimir Savon of the U.S.S.R. in Round 10.

title: DeCarlo Threatened With Jail On Failure to Pay $20,000 Fine
description: NEWARK, Aug. 8  Angelo DeCarlo, a onetime powerful New Jersey Mafia leader, failed to meet the Government's 10 A.M. deadline today to pay a $20,000 fine imposed when he was sentenced to a Federal penitentiary in 1970 for extortion. He contended that he had no assets.

title: TakeOver by City Called Harlem Prep's Only Hope
description: Harlem Prep, the tuitionfree school with a reputation for turning highschool dropouts into college graduates, will not reopen this fall unless the Board of Education agrees to take it over, the school's leading trustee said yesterday.

title: Connecticut Congressmen Seek Northeast Rail Study
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP)  Connecticut's sixmember Congressional delegation has submitted legislation calling for study of and restructuring of rail service in the Northeast. In a statement issued today, they said that national interests demanded the preservation of freight, passenger and cornmuter service while the restructuring took place.

title: Behind Antiwar Veterans Trial: Watergate, Spies and BreakIns
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Aug. 8 The case of seven antiwar veterans and a supporter on trial here for conspiring disrupt the Republican National Convention is studded with a yearlong series of occurrences that tie together figures in the Watergate scandal, undercover activities by informers and law enforcement agents, White House activities against political enemies and actions of the Justice Department's antiradical unit, the Internal Security Division.

title: REPORTED CRIME DOWN I PER CENT
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP) The total number of reported serious crimes dropped last year for the first time in 17 years but violent crimesmurder, assault and rapecontinued to rise, the Federal Bureau of Investigation said today.

title: BREAD PRICES RISE IC TO 4C A LOAF AS WHEAT SOARS
description: The price of a loaf of bread has gone up 1 to 4 cents for the consumer following announcements of price increases by three of the nationwide bakers.

title: VETERANS TESTIFY ON HOSPITAL RAIDS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8Three veterans told the Senate Armed Services Committee today that while serving in Vietnam they participated either in the designation of North Vietnamese and Vietcong hospitals as bombing targets or in the actual destruction of them.

title: Judge DiLorenzo Balking In a Nadjari Investigation
description: Special State Prosecutor Maurice H. Nadjari is investigating alleged criminal violations involving Civil Court Judge Ross J. DiLorenzo, according to sources close to the investigation.

description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 8 (AP) The $20,000 paid fo'r a horse last weekend at the annual auction at Saratoga, N. Y., has been donated to the University of Pennsylvania School of Veterinary Medicine, a school spokesman said today. The donor was Anderson Fowler of St. Michaels, Md., treasurer of Monmouth Race Track.

description: BELLPORT, L. I., Aug. 8 John J. H. Tully, purchasing agent for Brookhaven National Laboratory, died yesterday in Brookhaven Memorial Hospital. He was 60 years old and lived at 84 North Howells Point Road.

description: NEWARK, Aug. 8  Angelo DeCarlo, a onetime powerful New Jersey Mafia leader, failed, to meet the Government's 10 A.M. deadline today to pay a $20,000 fine imposed when he was sentenced to a Federal penitentiary in 1970 for extortion. He contended that he had no assets.

title: Richardson Bids Aides Log Talks With Outsiders,
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8Attorney General Elliot L. Richardson announced today that as part of his effort to remove the Justice Department from politics, every department employe would henceforth be required to report any conversation about Justice Department matters with outside parties  including Congressmen, their staffs and other governmental officials.

description: COURT OF APPEALS

description: TOKYO, Aug. 8Kim Dae Jung, a selfexiled opponent of President Park Chung Hee of South Korea, was reported to have been abducted from his Tokyo hotel today by five unidentified Koreans.

description: TOKYO, Aug. 8 (UPI) A council of highranking business leaders told the Government today that Japan's steel industry cannot be expanded and that the idea of Japan's being a world steel supplier should be dropped.
