description: MALVERNE, L.I., Aug. 11  Miss Gail Ann Grade, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James Grade, was married this afternoon to Dr. Gary Lee Warren, son of Mr. and Mrs. James Warren of Dayton, Ohio. The Rev. John Carajanes performed the ceremony in Grace Lutheran Church.

title: State Moves to Curtail Illegal Lobstering
description: HIGHLANDSNew Jersey environmental, officials are mounting a strong campaign to keep the state's growing lobster industry from being done in by illegal catches.

title: LEBANON ACCUSES ISRAEL OF PIRACY IN JET INTERCEPT
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 11Lebanon charged Israel with air piracy today for forcing a Lebanese commercial airliner with 81 people aboard to land in Israel and called for international sanctions against her.

title: Trotter Chokes, Falls, Dies In Race at Illinois State Fair
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., Aug. 11 (AP)An Illinois Colt Stakes record was broken today, but harness racing at the Illinois State Fair was marred by the death of a 3yearold trotter during one of the heats. Dez Mark, driven by Russ Bullington, choked shortly after passing the quarter pole, fell, broke his neck and died on the track. Bullington was, not injured.

title: Mogan Admitted to Hospital For PreVacation Checkup
description: District Attorney Frank S. Hogan was admitted Friday to St. Luke's hospital for routine, tests as part of a general physical examination, a hospital spokesman disclosed yesterday. According to Mr. Hogan's wife, Mary, the 71yearold prosecutor is the healthiest man in the world and expects to be released from the hospital early, in the week.

title: Sihanouk
description: With the Nixon Administration bound by agreement with Congress to halt the bombing of Cambodia this Wednesday, there is some question of whether the Phnom Penh regime of President Lon No1 can survive. Under the circumstances, the possibility no longer seems remote that Prince Norodom Sihanouk, the volatile former Chief of State who was deposed three years ago in a coup led by Lon No1, will be asked to return to Phnom Penh and head a coalition government.

title: On the Moveto Detroit
description: TWELVE days ago the New York Philharmonic had the distinction of drawing the largest crowd ever to attend an event in the city's parks. The orchestra played a Tchaikovsky program, with fireworks to enhance the climax of the 1812 Overture, and this spectacular drew an estimated 110,000 people. The man who was presiding over the orchestra that night was Aldo Ceccato, a 39yearold Italian conductor who has been making himself well known in America in the past four years and who becomes principal conductor of the Detroit Symphony this fall.

title: Dr. Iversen Is Resigning College Post In Cranford
description: CRANFORDDr. Kenneth W. Iversen, who has been president of Union College since 1970 and associated with the twoyear institution as a professor and administrator since 1946, is stepping down.

title: Agnew Aide Notes A $100,000 Outlay On Horne by U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11 (UPI) About $100,000 in public funds has been spent for security improvements to Vice President Agnew's new $190,000 home in Kenwood, Md., his office confirmed today.

title: Mediation Service to Press Collective Bargaining Moves
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11 (AP) The Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service will increase its efforts to achieve collective bargaining between unions and governmental organizations, the service's director, W. J. Usery Jr., said yesterday.

title: Jonathan Blum, Charlotte Frieze Plan Marriage
description: COLEBROOK, Conn., Aug. 11The engagement of Miss Charlotte Mason Frieze to Jonathan Phelps Blum, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Alexander Blum of Colebrook and New York, has been announced by the future bride's parents. Mr. and Mrs. Savage Crowell Frieze Jr. of Englewood, N. J., and Brookholme, Colebrook.

title: Look at all that growth fanning out there from Orlando
description: Cruising along at 41,000 feet in the little orangeandwhite Learjet (perky as a milliondollar item can be perky), I look down at DeBartolo's America. As interpreted, it is a peculiar map, cockeyed and canny as the maps Cape Codders hang over their fireplaces, in which that crooked sandspit becomes an immensity wagging at its western end a wee tail of a United States. Here, now, on DeBartolo's map, the cities shrink. Clumps of suburban sprawl spread like ground cover, stretching tendrils out across the spaces that keep Orlando from Lakeland, Lakeland from Tampa, Tampa from St. Petersburg, detouring each city as nonchalantly as ivy detours glass, twining together on the other side and creeping on. The cities, poor lumps, retreat upon themselves, no place to go, waiting to be grown over and choked out. Across this landscape zigzags trelliswork of straight, strong, skinny lines, the highways and expressways; and wherever these straight lines meet, at each convergence of asphalt, the face of Edward J. DeBartolo, master builder of shopping malls, takes on the bliss of Gully Jimson, the wacky artist of Joyce Cary's The Horse's Mouth, confronting a big blank wall.

title: Tisab Takes $129,535 Sapling for Blum's 4th Victory
description: OCEANPORT, N. J., Aug. Sometimes you have to spend money to make money, and favored Tisab showed why today in the 28th modern running of the $129,535 Sapling Stakes at Monmouth Parn.

title: SHOP TALK
State U. Dormitories Full
description: ALBANY, Aug. 11 (AP)Dormitories at the State University here are overbooked by 4 per cent for the fall term, according to Housing Director Charles Fisher. Mr. Fisher said that if some of the 5,700 students who had applied for rooms did not cancel their requests, some students would have to sleep in lounges converted to dorm rooms. Also, some students could be assigned extra roommates, Mr. Fisher said.

title: News of the Stage
description: Joseph Papp will open the new season at the New York. Shakespeare Festival Public Theater on Oct. 4 with Lotta, a comedy by Robert Montgomery in which the titlerole protagonist must prove somehow that the world is worth saving. The play has not yet been cast. David Chambers will direct.

title: Buried Alive
description: Reading Myra Friedman's rich and richly observed;biography, one is astonished to remind oneself that Janis Joplin's careerfrom her assumption into stardom to her last fatal encounter with heroin in October, 1970took less than five years. Tiflis, though she is rendered in this book with all the respect and complexity of attitude owed to a completed life, she was at best merely a figure in potentia. Her death at 27 did not resolve, but only makes egregiously tactless to ask, all the questions that time must put to an important performing artist.

title: Engineering Courses at Rutgers
description: NEW BRUNSWICKA wide range of semester courses and oneday seminars will be offered this fall by Rutgers University's Center for Continuing Engineering Studies. The programs are designed especially, for those practicing engineers who are anxious to update their knowledge of the latest developments in their areas of specialization.

title: SISTER MADELEINE, LED JERSEY COLLEGE
description: ENGLEWOOD CLIFFS, N.J., Aug. 11  Sister Madeleine Crotty, president emeritus of Englewood Cliffs College, died last night at her home on the campus after a long illness. Her age was 54.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: What Makes Salmon Run
description: SHERBROOKE, Nova Scotia After threequarters of an hour of casting for Atlantic salmon at Silver's Pool on the west branch of the St. Mary's River had produced no action, I grew careless and was watching an angler on the opposite side of the river when a good fish rose at, but did not take, my fastmoving Black Dose fly.

title: Miss Balukas, 14, Wins 2d Pocket Billiards Title
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 11 (UPI)Jean Balukas, a 14yearold high school freshman from Brooklyn, won her second consecutive United States Open pocket billiards women's championship today, defeating Donna Ries, 7572, in 42 innings.

title: Ricci Reenie Time Takes Adios Stake
description: MEADOW LANDS, Pa., Aug. 11Ricci Reenie Time swept both heats of the $86,780 Adios Stake for 3yearold pacers with no trouble at The Meadows today. Sonny Dancer guided the son of Race Time home in 1:58 45, eased up, in the first heat to beat Smog, winner of the Cane, by 200BC lengths. In the second heat the margin was 200BE lengths over J. R. Skipper.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor: One of the major determinants in my buying the Sunday New York Times is the Magazine section, with its varied and informative articles. However, to my deep dismay and utter resentment I found the whole issue of July 22, except for the puzzles, devoted to the Watergate issue ('The Story So Far by J. Anthony Lukas).

title: This Week's Highlights
description: Fighting for the lead in the American League pennant race, this week the Yankees meet the two teams at the bottom of the Westarn division. They face the California Angels on Monday (7:30 p.m.), Tuesday (7:30 p.m.) and Wednesday (2 p.m.) and then leave for a trip to four western cities. The first stop is Texas for two night games against the Rangers Friday and Saturday. See WPIXTV Channel 11 for the Texas games. WMCA Radio will broadcast all games.

title: Child to the Oppenheims
description: A daughter was born July 21 to Mr. and Mrs. E. Magnus Oppenheim of New York in the Assouta Hospital in Tel Aviv. Mrs. Oppenheim is the former Miss Rachel Eldad of Tel Aviv. The, obild has been named Michelle. Her father, an investment banker, is a member of the PBW Stock Exchange, Inc.

title: Pearson 500 Miles and $16,000 Short of $1Million
description: It's a good year for streaks and the pursuit of recordsAaron in baseball, Weiskopf in golf, Stewart in Grand Prix. And today could be the day that David Pearson, the hottest stockcar race driver this season, may pass $1million in career winnings. Pearson, just $16,000 short of the goal, hap pens to be the favorite to win this afternoon's Alabama 500 at Talladega. He has won nine of his last 10 starts; in the race he didn't win he was runnerup by 1.2 seconds.

title: Pop; Who (or What) Is David Bowie?
description: DAVID BOWIE'S best known lyrics are knotty, surrealistic scifi cryptograms that conjure up people with space faces and electric eyes. These dehumanized creatures swallow protein pills, daydream moonage daydreams, endure names like Ziggy Stardust, and are en intrinsic part of a songbook that could pass for a rock musical version of Stanley Kubrick's 2001.

title: Dog Show Calendar
description: TodaySand and Sea K.C. allbreed and obedience, Ocean County Park, Ocean Avenue, Route 88, Lakewood, N. J.; 1,852 dogs; 9 A.M.

title: Air America, C.I.A.'s Workhorse With Little to Do, Sells Planes and Cuts Pilots
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Aug. 9 Air America, a symbol of United States paramilitary involvement in Asia for two decades, is rapidly liquidating its huge operation, and this time many longtime employes feel the company may disappear.

title: Amtrak'zs French Turbo Train Is Acclaimed on American Run
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Aug. 10 A gleaming new French turbo train just acquired by Amtrak made its maiden longdistance test run in the United States today, and senior American railroaders in the cab had an allsmiles verdict: C'est si bon.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: Lingerie buyers will arrive in New York this week to complete their purchases for fall and the holiday season, The question is: How much will they be buying compared with other types of apparel now sold in lingerie departments?

title: WILLIAM P. HOFFMANN
description: William Paul Hoffmann, who retired in 1958 as executive director of the former Jacob Hoffmann Brewery here, died Wednesday in Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 85 years old and lived at 900 Fifth Avenue.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: AN unofficial and very casual survey of midtown New York restaurants during the last week indicates that more people are toting their leftovers home in doggy bags.

title: ELDERLY TAKING JOBS FOR SUMMER
description: HYANNIS, Mass., Aug. 10Elderly residents on Cape Cod are making solid inroads into the summer job market here, once mainly the domain of vacationing youths.

title: Miss Fougner Has Nuptials
description: MANHASSET, L.I., Aug 11 Miss Elizabeth Ann Fougner, daughter of Robert S. Fougner and the late Mrs. Joan Koppel Fougner, was married here at noon today, to Arthur Sherwood Hillhouse 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Hillhouse of Colts Neck, N.J.

title: Warfare Heightens Tensions at Mental Hospital in Cambodia
description: TAKHMAU, Cambodia August 11It seems peace ful in the compound. breeze rustles through many shade trees and rose vines. Cows graze in open field. A mother nurse her child on a bench.

title: Terrier Is Victor In Jersey
Gainesville 8
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla.  A slim, elegantly tailored grayhaired man ducks in and out of the F.B.I. offices in the Federal Building here, doing his best to keep out of sight.

title: 3 Accidents Kill 3 On State Thruway In Suffern Vicinity
description: SUFFERN, N. Y., Aug. 11Three persons were killed in three separate accidents on the Gov. Thomas E. Dewey Thruway near here early today, causing an approximately 20milelong bumper to bumper traffic tieup north to Newburgh, according to police.

title: Nancy White, a College Dean, Engaged to Peter H. Kurzman
description: KITTANNING, Pa., Aug. 11 The engagement of Miss Nancy Douglass White, dean of student affairs at Florida Atlantic University in Boca Raton, to Peter Hess Kurzman has been announced by W. and Mrs. David White, parents of the future bride. She and her fianc, who is a consultant in public and community relations with the New York City Charter Revision Commission, plan to married in New York on Sept. 29.

title: Amnesty for Nixon?
description: FIERY RUN, Va., Aug. 11At some point in the crazy story of these times, we are probably going to have to think about a general amnesty not only for the draft dodgers in the war but the truth dodgers in the White House.

title: Was This Lear Inspired by Watergate?
description: WHAT, King Lear again? said playwright friend on hearing of this assignment. Why not review it as if it were a new play?

title: Two Years of Controls How Much Longer?
description: WASHINGTON"There is nothing like administering controls, said Deputy Secretary of the Treasury William E. Simon the other day, to make you into a freemarket man.

title: Yanks Beaten on Reunion Day
Research Ship to Hant for Civil War Ironclad
description: BEAUFORT, N.C., Aug. 11 (UPI)Duke University has announced that its research vessel, Eastward, will begin a twoweek search Aug. 17 for the Monitor, a Civil War Ironclad that sank off the North Carolina coast in 1862.

title: Mary K. Hoperaft Is Bride of T. B. Carter
description: WARWICK, R. L, Aug. 11  In St. Peter's Roman Catholic Church here this afternoon Miss Mary Kathryn Hoperaft, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Taylor Hoperaft of Edgewood, was married to Thomas Benedict Carter, son of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert Pratt Carter of Englewood, N. J. The Rev. Walter Heath performed the ceremony.

title: BQLI Bulletin Board
description: Bay ShoreThe oils and watercolors of Mrs. May Frederick. Also an international collection of dolls, Mondays through Fridays, 10:30 A.M. to 5:30 P.M. and 7 to 9 P.M. and Wednesdays, 1 to 5:30 P.M. and to 9 P.M., public library, 1 South Country Road.

title: Peter Douglas, Law Student, Marries Patricia A. McClave
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J., Aug. 11  St. Peter's Episcopal Church was the setting here this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Patricia Adams McClave, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Wilkes McClave 2d of New Vernon, to Peter Roderick Douglas. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. John W. Douglas of Chevy Chase, Md. The Rev. Hughes Garvin performed the ceremony.

title: Desert Vixen Wins $57,700 Alabama by 8 Lengths
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 11  Desert Vixen stamped herself as the Secretariat of her sex today. Opposing eight rivals in the $57,700 Alabama, the Floridabred star owned by Harry Mangurian romped to an eightlength success in the 1100BEmile test for 3yearold fillies.

title: Lower Court Ruling Reversed and Curb On Pollatant Upheld
description: DENVER, Aug. 11  The United States Court of Appeals for the 10th Circuit this week overturned a United States District Court ruling that had stopped enforcement of strict controls of sulphur oxide emissions from the Anaconda Company's giant smelter stack at Anaconda, Mont.

title: ADVERTISING POINT OF VIEW
description: A packaging potpourri for light summer reading:

title: Island's Political Elite Flock to a Clambake
description: GREENPORT, L I.Judging by their clothes and their. cars, it wasn't their kind of place.

title: The Senate Sues
description: WASHINGTON  The Republican political team that won national leadership with promises to restore law and order found itself last week involved with the law to an almost unprecedented degree, at a consequent cost to order in their party, the Government and the nation.

title: Dance You Can Dance On Roofs, Too
description: DANCING does not simply inhabit space, but carves and molds it and erasing bridges, islands, continents of air. Yet the place where dance occurs is important too, since it imposes boundaries both on the dancing and on how we look at it. (Do we expect anything relating to the stage action to happen in the aisles of one of those velvetswathed opera houses? No. And if it did we'd shush it and glare at it and tell it to mind its manners.)

title: U.S. Aide Joins U.N. Group
description: James F. Leonard, a United; States disarmament expert, is leaving the State Department to join the United Nations Association of the United States, of America as vice president, for policy studies. The 53yearold Foreign Service officer had been assistant director of the Arms Control and Disarmament Agency in Washington.

title: CANDIDATE FIGHTS REMAPPING PLANS
description: Assemblyman Albert H. Blumenthal, Liberal party candidate for Mayor, urged Mayor Lindsay yesterday to veto the City Council's latest reapportionment plan.

title: Outsiders Disrupt Life in the Village
description: An influx of outsiders, many apparently narcotics addicts, has been flooding into Greenwich Village this summer, disrupting an area that still remains both a magnet for crowds of tourists and a desirable residential neighborhood.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: The Beaux Arts apartment buildings on the East Side have been purchased by a group headed by Daniel Brodsky for $8.1million.

title: 2 SUSPICIOUS FIRES ARE UNDER STUDY
description: Fire Marshal Edwin H. Sheppard said this week he was investigating two suspicious fires in the Bronx  fires that have been linked to a long feud between two factions of the Bronx antipoverty program.

title: College Freshmen Alerted on Grants
description: TRENTON (UPI)  The Federal Government has made a $250 grant available to each new student entering college this fall, but Ralph A. Dungan, the state's Chancellor of Higher Education, fears that freshmen are unaware of the program.

title: Some of the Best People Are Afraid of Flying
description: JOAN CRAWFORD (who has capitalized on her fear of flying by making a TV commercial about it) isn't the only one who flies scared. There's me, for instance. And research reveals that Joan and I have lots of company. By some estimates, there are 25 million of us, including a remarkably long list of celebrities, executives, politicians and other notables who don't like to fly. If ycu pray at the boarding gate, you are in good company.

title: RYAN IDENTIFIES HIJACKING TARGET
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 11 Defense Minister Moshe Dayan said tonight in an unscheduled television interview that the aim of last night's diversion of a Lebanese airliner had been to seize Dr. George Habash, the head of the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine.

title: Cocaine Found in London
description: LONDON, Aug. 11 (Reuters) The police said today that they had found more than $250,000 worth of cocaine in an apartment in the fashionable Chelsea district. There were more than seven and quarter pounds of cocaine, the police said, adding that it had been brought here from Brazil through West Germany.

title: 2D CAVEDI FEARED AT FALLEN HOTEL
description: A fire official voiced con. cern yesterday about a further collapse at the old Broadway Central Hotel as the search for the bodies of two persons who have not been accounted for continued.

title: The Watergate Testimony So Far: Questions Remain on Eight Major Issues
description: In 37 days of nationally televised hearings and 7,573 pages of testimony, the opening phase of the Senate's Watergate investigation produced a huge outpouring of evidence, assertion and insight.

title: STATE TO ACQUIRE 3,000ACRE MARSH
description: WESTBROOKVILLE, N.Y., Aug. 11The states Department of Environmental Conservation has decided to acquire and develop most of the 3,000acre Basherkill freshwater marsh in Sullivan County as a state nature preserve and wildlife refuge.

title: The Babe Ruth I Knew
description: In all my more than 50 years in major league baseball (41 as writer for The New York Times), there never was nor can there ever be a more faidinating characterthan the one and only George Herman Ruth, The Babe. Fascinating and fantastic, he truly was in a class by himself. And this applies to activities on and off the ball field.

title: Wendy Smith Sets Nuptials
description: Miss Wendy Johnson Smith and Christopher Thomas Born plan to be married Sept. 22. Their engagement has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. John J. Smith of New York, parents of the prospective bride.

title: Jets Victors, 3414, On 49er Turnovers
description: TAMPA, Fla., Aug. 11 Harassed by reporters about the progress of the salary negotiations with his two holdout running backs, Coach Weeb Ewbank said last week that he could win without them. Tonight his New York Jets proved it by routing the San Francisco 49ers, 3414.

title: The Viewing From Britain
description: A surprising fact about watching the telly in Britain is that one doesn't feel insulated in a media ghetto separate from the world of books. It may be a matter of a few ells or a couple of cubits but somehow the social distance between the two media does not seem as large as does on American television. In Britain the two worlds are at least on speaking terms. Authors are actually considered people worth showing in their own right, rather than occasional intruders who are stiffly ushered on and off to plug their books. What is more, attention is paid to great authors of the past, while their works are dramatized with the reverent fidelity of people who care about their literary past. (That may be because Britons think a lot about the past these days, but let that pass.)

title: Tokyo Protest Closes Plants
description: TOKYO. Aug. 11 (Reuters)Three chemical factories accused of poisoning fishing grounds in Tokyo Bay with mercury waste were forced to suspend operations today as hundreds of angry fishermen, staged a land and sea blockade for the fourth day.

title: Ana R. Loud Is Remarried
description: CENTER CONWAY, N.H., Aug. 11  Mrs. Ana Roigt Loud and Mark ap Catesby Jones, both of New York, were married here today in a civil ceremony at the home of Howard Crow Dickinson, a friend.

title: Mrs. Manello Has Child
description: A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Seymour Manello of Flushing, Queens, on July 26 at the New York University Medical Center. The child has been named Daniell Leah.

title: BAY TRANSIT SERVICE TESTS OAKLAND RUN
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 11The first test run of Bay Area Rapid Transit (BART) train cars from Oakland through an underwater tube to a station in this city's financial district was made successfully yesterday.

title: Week of Harmony In Campus Setting
description: NEW BRUNSWICKTwo hundred youngsters and 70 adults spent a week on the Douglas College campus earlier this month.

title: WOMEN OFFICERS TESTED ON PATROL
description: Women police officers are patrolling on foot in four boroughs of the city and the experiment is so successful that the Police Department has decided to assign more women to pounding a beat.

title: Army Officer Marries Rosemary D. McPeak
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Aug. 11Miss Rosemary D. McPeak, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harry D. McPeak of Mount Vernon, was married here at noon to Lieut. John A. Bonin, U.S.A., son of Mr. and Mrs. Alvin A. Bonin of Bellaire, Tex. The Rev. Dennis B. Sughrue performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass in the uptial mass in the Roman Catholic Chapel of the Most Holy Trinity at the United States Military Academy.

title: POVERTY GRANTS TO AID JEWS HERE
description: Federal grants totaling almost $500,000 for programs for the Jewish poor in New York were announced last week.

title: Illinois Gasoline Dealers Plan Price Curb Protest
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 11 (UPI)Directors of the Illinois Gasoline Dealers Association voted today to stage a threeday shutdown of their stations, perhaps to be followed by a weeklong lockout, an association official said.

title: Paterson To Ballot On Revising Government
description: PATERSONThe Paterson Charter Study Commission recommended last week that this city, the third largest in the state, adopt a nonpartisan MayorCouncil form of government.

title: Dunking Invitation: Racing Fitted Dinghies
description: ST. GEORGE, Bermuda, Aug. 11It has been called the toughest sail racing in the world, an invitation to dunking. After all, who would believe that a narrow 14foot boat could carry up to 1,200 square feet of sail and a 30foot mast and stay upright?

title: GUIDELINES NO BAR TO STERILIZATION
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11 (AP)  Until better policing methods are found, forced sterilization of persons receiving medical care under Federal programs will probably continue despite tough guidelines, a Government health official says.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: Richard O. Simpson knows firsthand the potential for tragedy in ordinary household items  like candyflavored aspirin, for example. Two of his children had to have their stomachs pumped after devouring a quantity of the tasty pills while playing doctor. This incident occurred some 20 years ago, long before recent Government safety codes mandated childresistant closures.

title: The Faces Of Yugodatia
description: With its sparkling, 500milelong Dalmatian Coast, its offshore islands, its soaring mountains and such cosmopolitan resorts as Split and the ancient walled city of Dubrovnik, Yugoslavia has been called vacationer's paradise. The soul of the country, however, is best expressed in the faces of the inhabitants. Here, young and old, are the Yugoslays, a people regarded by many tourists as the most hospitable in Europe.

title: Bringing down the Red Baron
description: It's a humbled Red Baron you see in the ads these days, peddling package tours with the usual Volkswagenandmetaphysicalguesthouse in suburban Westphalia. Last February, Lufthansa tried a bolder maneuverproposing a major cut in excursion faresonly to be shot down by the Civil Aeronautics Board, which has the authority to review fares on all flights originating in the United States. Uneconomic, said the board, meaning that didn't think the airlines could earn a comfortable profit if they had to meet Lufthansa's lower fares. And that's the end of the matterat least until next winter, when the international carriers once more go through the annual farecut follies, unique form of burlesque in which the strippers end up wearing all of their own clothes and of the audience's.

title: Peace Units Shift Goals
description: TEANECKThe last United States groundcombat troops left Indochina six months ago, and the American bombing of Cambodia is scheduled to end on Wednesday. But the Bergen County Peace Center toils on.

title: Miss Willard Has. Nuptials
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Aug. 11 Miss Laura Rogers Willard and Thomas Glenn Ratcliff, graduates of Ithaca College, were married here this afternoon.

title: Parisians Will Pay Double To Park Cars in October
description: PARIS, Aug. 11 (UPI)Come October, Parisians will be paying double to park their cars on the street, if they can find a space.

title: YOUTH PANEL ASKS WIDER LEARNING
description: A year of studying American youth and the way they grow up in today's society has led special Presidential panel to the conclusion that young people ought to have more interaction with adults, should be given greater chances to work and learn outside the school, and should assume more responsibility for themselves and others.

title: Army Intelligence
description: BONNI believe that military intelligence is out of control here in Germany and that somebody has got to stop them. So saying, a young American enlisted man, Specialist John M. McDougal, of the 527th Military Intelligence Battalion in Kaiserslautern revealed the details of a whole range of American Army intelligence activitiesdirected not against the enemy to the East but within, against the Army's own dissidents and troublemakers.

title: Susan Baker Wed To James R. Hill
description: EAST ORANGE, N. J., Aug. 11Miss Susan Dale Baker and James Robert Hill were married here this afternoon in the Arlington Avenue Presbyterian Church by the Rev. K. Blaine Cragg, the minister.

title: Buffalo Meat for Sale
description: LYNNWOOD, Wash., Aug. 11 (UPI)  Buffalo is selling like beefsteak in Lynnwood. A sample of prices for buffalo meat on display shows that rib steak is selling for $1.89 a pound, short ribs for 98, stew meat for $1.49, hamburger for $1.09, round steak for $1.89 and chuck steak for $1.39.

title: Chilean Police Try to Seize Striking Truckers Vehicles
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 11 (Reuters)  Squads of armed Chilean police fired tear gas to disperse striking truck owners during an attempt to requisition their vehicles last night.

title: Cosmos Win Last Game And Qualify for Playoffs
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Aug. 11The New York Cosmos gained the wildcard playoff spot in the North American Soccer League with a 43 victory over the Dallas Tornado at Hofstra Stadium tonight before 7,250 fans.

title: Lauren M. Sweatt Wed to Lieutenant
description: Miss Lauren Marie Sweatt, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert W. Sweatt of New City, N. Y., was married in St. Patrick's Cathedral here yesterday morning to Lieut. William Joseph Kubida, U. S. A. F. The bridegroom, who is stationed at Griffith Air Force Base in Rome, N. Y., is the son of Mr. and Mrs. William Kubida of WinstonSalem, N. C., formerly of Maplewood, N. J.

title: Saratoga Race Charts
U.S. Cancels JobTraining Pacts Here
description: The Federal Government has canceled more than $6million in manpower training contracts held by business concerns in New York and New Jersey because, it said, the firms were failing to provide disadvantaged workers with the onthejob instruction that would enable them to get and hold semiskilled and skilled Jobs.

title: Miss Colleen T. Cahill Marries
description: STODDARD, N. H., Aug. 11 Miss Colleen Townsend Cahill, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. George F. Cahill Jr. of Needham, Mass., was married here this afternoon to Thomas P. Remley, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur P. Remley of Neenah, Wis. The Rev. Edward W. Meury performed the ceremony in the Stoddard Congregational Church.

title: Records Show Engineering Consultant Employes Gave $18,250 for Agnew Drive for Governor in 1966
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 11Records subpoenaed yesterday by Federal investigators show that employes of nine Maryland consulting engineering companies contributed $18,250 to Spiro T. Agnew during his 1966 campaign for Governor of Maryland.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
JeremyA Big tittle Movie
description: LAST year I saw a wonderful documentary on the emotionpacked subject of birth and deith. The film was unusually sensitive to nuance: an unspoken thought, a spoken thought, a gesture, facial expressions. Objects  hospital beds, trays of food, medical machines (the stilllife of a still life)filled the screen the way they filled the lives that depended on them. We the viewers felt a sense of intimacy, though the camera did its best not to invade privacy, or to presume upon relationships that had sprung up naturally during the filming.

title: Charles M. Daniels, Won Olympic Swimming Medals
description: MONTEREY, Calif., Aug. 11 (AP)Charles M. Daniels, former national swimming champion and holder of four Olympic gold medals, died Thursday at his home in nearby Carmel Valley. He was 88 years old.

title: Paperbacks Recommended New Titles
description: THE BREAST, by Philip Roth. (Bantam, $1.25.) Prof. David Alan Kepesh turns into an enormous female breasta literary trick... terrific for a thing of its kind.

title: The Big Man Who Wasn't There Casts Shadow Over Stadium
Abplanalp Discusses San Clemente Deal
description: WALKER'S CAY, Bahamas, Aug. 11Robert H. Abplanalp, the New York Industrialist who helped President Nixon buy his San Clemente home, says he was recruited for that deal by Herbert W. Kalmbach, Mr. Nixon's personal attorney at the time.

title: Mrs. Bazin Is Married
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Aug. 11  Mrs. Christine Ann Greenlee Bazin, daughter of Dr. Ralph MacMartin Greenlee, a surgeon, and Mrs. Greenlee, was married here this afternoon to David M. McDermott, son of Mr. and Mrs. Vincent Thomas McDermitt of Uniondale, L. I, The Rev. Dr. Charles L. Copenhaver of the Reformed Church performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents. The couple, whose previous marriages ended in divorce, work for Spring Mills in New York. The bride is advertising and salespromotion manager of the consumerproducts division. Her husband is a products

title: Police Help Cut Building Costs
description: PEAPACKGLADSTONE By undertaking a project that is considered as exemplary as it is extraordinary, the local Police Department is doubling the size of its headquarters at a cost of only few hundred dollars to the borough's taxpayars.

title: Miss McGuirk Wed
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Aug. 11Miss Cheryl Ann McGuirk, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George Joseph McGuirk, was married here today in St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church, to William Mien Haverinen, son of Mr. and Mrs. Andrew Haverinen of South Paris, Me. The Rev. William Boldt performed the ceremony.

title: Jordan in New Post
description: HATTIESBURG, Miss. (UPI) A former Clemson University player and coach, Ronald P. (Whitey) Jordan, has been named offensive line coach at the University of Southern Mississippi.

title: Representatives Asked to Tour L.I.
description: WESTBURY, L.I.  The Long Island Association of Commerce and Industry and Representative Angelo Roncallo announced last week that invitations had been sent to all 60 freshmen Representatives in Washington to a getacquaintedwithLong Island tour next month.

title: IRVING BLUM, HEADED REALTY, RACE FIRMS
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 11Irving Blum, chairman of Blum's, Inc., a real estate, finance and investment firm, and a leader in charitable activities, died today at the age of 58.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Why Won't They Let Haskell and Stella Be Directors?
description: HOLLYWOOD IN THE green California morning, the cameras are rolled into position. At a signal from the director, 200 actors pour over the top of the hill. Plunging and panting, they converge on a bronze Plymouth Satelite.

title: AFRICAN DROUGHT SETS A TRIBE FREE
description: DORI, Upper Volta, Aug. 11 (Reuters)  Tribes in West Central Africa who have been Virtual slaves for countless generations are now breaking away from their masters as the current drought and food shortage shatter the traditiona mosaic of African society.

title: U.S. &
description: WASHINGTON  The time has come for us to deal America a strong slap on its cool, arrogant face, cried Col. Muammar elQaddafi, the fiery Libyan leader, before a crowd in Tripoli two months ago as he announced the expropriation of the Americanowned Nelson Bunker Hunt Oil Company, producer of about one tenth of Libya's oil output.

title: INCOME NEEDS GIVEN FOR OLDER COUPLES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11 (UPI) A retired couple living in the city could maintain a moderate standard of living on an annual income of $5,195 if they limited their luxuries and stuck to necessities, according to Government statistics.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: SEVERAL MAJOR BANKS have raised their prime rate to 9 per cent.... Canadian banks are moving their prime rate from 7 per cent to 8 per cent.... The Netherlands central bank has raised its bank rate from 6 per cent to 6 per cent.

title: Thunderbolt From the Early Days
description: BALTIMORE  Americans have always been ready to listen to the worst about candidates for the Presidency, and over the years they have heard it: Men who sought the White House have been accused of everything from fathering children illegitimately to closet Marxism. But the men who achieve the White House are rewarded with a national tolerance, an uncritical will to believe and approve them that is almost suggestive of royalty.

title: Nancy Bittles Married To John Lea Walcott
description: WYCKOFF, N. J., Aug. 11 Miss Nancy Bittles, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William J. Bittles Jr. of Houston, formerly of Wyckoff, became the bride this afternoon of John Lea Walcott, son of Mr. and Mrs. Henry R. Walcott of Wyckoff and Cotuit, Mass.

title: Israel to Be Saluted at 5Day Fair in Deal Park
description: DEAL PARK  Authentic Israeli art, merchandise, entertainment and food will be among the attractions at a fair here honoring Israel's 25th anniversary.

title: Quarry and Woody To Fight on Aug. 31
description: Jerry Quarry will oppose James J. Woody in a 10round heavyweight bout on Aug. 31 on closed circuit television. The fight will be a 10:30 P.M. prelude to the heavyweight title bout between George Foreman, the world champion, and Jose (King) Roman of Puerto Rico, scheduled to start at 11:30.

title: New Law May Aid Local Services
description: TRENTON  Broad, new powers aimed at helping the state's hundreds of local governmental units to upgrade their services became effective last week, but the law's architects believe that many officials still must be sold on the idea.

title: Barbara Liebmann Plans Nuptials
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Aug. 11  The engagement of Miss Barbara Mary Liebmann, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William B. Liebmann of Westport, to Dennis Kent Lynn, son of Mrs. George F. Lynn of Oneonta, N. Y., has been announced by the future bride's parents.

title: Myron Boyce Weds Elizabeth A. Stanton,
description: Miss Elizabeth Anne Stanton was married here yesterday afternoon to Myron Boyce of New York, president of the ByronBoyce Company, a New York real estate company. The Rev. Donald Ostroth performed the ceremony at the Marble Collegiate Church.

title: Poetry with and without people
description: Gregory Ores first book of poems, Burning the Empty Nests, has the abstract beauty of aerial photography. Everything is seen as if from a distance: silhouettes of experience, contours of feeling. The landscape is almost bare of people; the eventful social world carries on its business and intimacies somewhere beyond the horizon. The poet, alone, gazes at empty beds, rooms, streets and fields; the birds have fled their nests. Only an occasional figure steps forward, as from a hallucination, to menace him with death or loss of identity. The atmosphere is one of cryptic intimations and emotional claustrophobia. As in a nightmare, a black knot is tied around his throat, the earth wants to swallow you, a flock of sparrows is eating your footprints. Even the face of the woman he loves is an unknowable mask.

title: The Cornerstone Ceremony Is in Decline
description: They are structurally superfluous and it is becoming increasingly difficult to figure out where to put them, but cornerstones are surviving as a construction tradition. The cornerstonelaying ceremony. on the other hand, is in decline.

title: HOUSING AID PLAN TIED TO WELFARE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11The Nixon Administration is considering a dramatic proposal to provide subsidized housing for America's poor that would tie housing to basic welfare reform, according to sources close to the Department of Housing and Urban Development.

title: That's a Junk Anchored in the Sound, Believe It or Not
description: When Mrs. Dorothy Ennis was a girl, she often sailed on an authentic Chinese junk that belonged to Robert ('Believe It Or Not') Ripley, who was a friend of the family. And I've been after one ever since, said Mrs. Ennis aboard her 36foot junk, The Seadragon, anchored in Long Island Sound at Larchmont Yacht Club. Built in Hong Kong, the solid teakwood junk is complete with foursided mainsail and a little sampan tethered to its aft. Mrs. Ennis purchased the craft last fall for $17,500.

title: Stranded, abandoned and unloved; The author of these reviews has been tracking the young for a generation as a writer, teacher and mother of a 14yearold.;Snow Bound; By Harry Mazer. 146 pp. New York: Delacorte Press. $4.95. (Ages 10 to 14)
description: A more mismatched twosome would be hard to imagine. Tony, 15, is the spoiled, handsome son (there are three sisters) of workingclass Americans caught in the mindless upwardmobility spiral. Following an argument Tony borrows his mother's car and, on impulse, heads north in a blizzard to visit a relative. Cindy, slightly older, is the motherless only child of a physician father, too busy and detached to take note of her emergent womanhood. Bookish, sharp in her way, Cindy has trouble relating to others. When the bus she is taking home from her grandmother's is delayed by the storm, Cindy (also on impulse) hitches a ride with Tony.

title: Don't tr to kid them
Heartworm Worries Local Fanciers
description: Heartworm, a dreaded word in the lexicon of the Gulf Coast and Southern fancier, is appearing with greater frequency in the metropolitan area. This is the disease in which parasites lodge in a dog's heart. If untreated, they may cause death. Veterinarians and animal hospitals in our area are receiving an increasing creasing number of calls from worried owners, said Dr. Frederick B. Tierney, president of the Veterinary Medical Association of New York City. For over 20 years, heartworm has been recognized as a serious problem in the South. Although in some sections of the East it has reached epidemic proportions, here it appears to be endemic.

title: WALL STREET
description: With wheat selling at record $4plus a bushel and the price of bread up 1 to 4 cents a loaf, it's no wonder the consumer is reeling and worrying.

title: Author's Query
description: I am compiling a book for insomniacs and should be very glad to hear from any of your readers who have discovered or developed ways of getting themselves to sleep or, if sleep is impossible, to entertain themselves during the hours of the night. I would appreciate suggestions as to suitably soothing or distracting stories, poems, puzzles, braingames and their like. Secondly, I am eager to collect together all manner of unusual methods for inducing sleepmental tricks, autohypnotic diagrams, even physical exercises. And, thirdly, if readers have good anecdotes about insomniac experiences, I should love hear about those

title: The World
description: SANTIAGO  Once again, Chile's Marxist President Salvador Allende Gossens has skirted the brink and conic back from it.

title: Remedial Clinic Faces Cuts
description: The Developmental Clinic for Growing Children, a remedial reading service for the children of the Fort Greene section of Brooklyn, is facing budget cuts that will seriously affect an already shorthanded staff.

title: Journalism Appointment
description: EDWARDSVILLE, Ill., Aug. 11 (AP)The Southern Illinois University board of trustees approved yesterday a oneyear appointment of Bryce Rucker as director of the school of journalism at Carbondale. A permanent director is being sought.

title: Southampton Curbs Local Shellfishing
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L.I. Clam diggers who are not residents or taxpayers of Southampton will no longer be able to harvest shellfish from town waters.

title: MINISTER DOUBTS DRIVE BY CHURCH
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Aug. 11A world pentecostal leader discounted today a prediction by a pentecostal evangelist that the Roman Catholic Church would crack down on Catholic charismatics, or neopentecostals.

title: More Illegal Drug Residues Found in Meat and Poultry
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11 (UPI) Illegal drug residues were found in 2.7 per cent of the meat and poultry product samples tested in a nationwide Agriculture Department program in the second quarter of this year. The findings compared with a 1,9 per cent violation rate in the first quarter, officials disclosed in a statement today.

title: Lewisohn Helps Badillo Collect Petitions of New Reform Party
description: City Finance Administrator Richard Lewisohn, the Republican candidate for Controller, has joined with Representative Hermrn Badillo, a Democrat, in collecting.nominating petitions threeparty support  Republiparty.

title: Questions
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11  This weekend, President Nixon is walking the secluded fields and woods of Camp David trying to put together a defensible account of his own role during the months of the Watergate coverup. If it is to be worth delivering, this account must be more persuasive than his news conference of last August 29, his televised speech of April 30 or his lengthy statement of May 22.

title: What happens to women who struggle, what happens to those who don't
description: At the very beginning and the very end of this rambling novel, Marge Piercy powerfully conveys that particular quality of lost identity and desperation which, once recognized as common experience, has sparked the rage and solidarity of the women's liberation movement and created the concept of women's consciousness. The novel spans the 1960's in the lives of two women: Beth, the provincial workingclass girl who discovers that the ideal marriage she's always dreamed of is a living hell and gathers her strength to escape it; and Miriam, the brilliant, independent mathematician, who is caught, blinded and thoroughly trappedat least for the moment by a middleclass version of the same nightmare.

title: TOLERANCE ON SEX IS FOUND GROWING
South Korean Teams Head For Games in Soviet Union
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 11A delegation of 38 South Koreans left here today for Moscow to participate in the 1973 Universiad, or world university games, to be held in the Soviet capital from Tuesday through Aug. 25.

title: West African Famine ZoneA Road in Niger Leads From a Breadbasket Area Into a Wasteland
description: ON THE ROAD TO AGADEZ, Niger (AP)Just ahead, the fabled mudbrick city of Agadez rises out of the wilderness at the edge of the Sahara.

title: Edith Post Gallatin Married To William Harrison Boone Jr.
description: MANHASSET, L.I, Aug. 11  Miss Edith Post Gallatin and William Harrison Boone Jr were married at noon today in Christ Episcopal Church here, by the Rev. Frank Johnston.

title: Recording
description: LEONTYNE PRICE: Puccini Heroines (RCA LSC 3337). Any dj vu aspects that this recital might conjure up are purely illusory: Price has only previously recorded two of these 11, mostly familiar, Puccini arias (Un. bel di and Vissi d'arte on her first recital album, RCA 2506 of 1961)in fact just three of the nine heroines represented here even figure in her active repertoire.

title: Beame Accuses Drug Unit Of Losing Local Control
description: Controller Abraham D. Beame charged yesterday that the city's Addiction Services Agency had virtually lost control of its 300 locally operated drug rehabilitation program, many of which, he said, had consequently become fonts of waste, inefficiency and possibly corruption.

title: A Soviet Oldster Hails Birth of 250 Millionth
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 11 (Reuters)A Caucasus Mountain dweller, who cihims to be 168 years old and the world's oldest man, has congratulated the Soviet Union I on the birth Thursday of its 250 millionth citizen, the weekly magazine Nedelya reported.

title: A Perth Amboy Teacher Seeks to Trace and Preserve a Mansion's Heritage
description: PERTH AMBOY  An archeological dig is under way behind a dilapidated Kearny Avenue mansion that was intended as the official residence of the Royal Governor of New Jersey and was the site of the famous confrontation between Benjamin Franklin and his son, William, over the colonists right to seek independence from England.

title: $185,000 Payment Voted For Erroneous Police Shot
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 11 (UPI)  The city council approved payment this week of $185,000 to a former Mexican official who was shot in error by policeman because a friend was holding a paper bag.

title: Power Is Cut in New Delhi
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 11 (AP)New Delhi's five electric power generating units broke down today, throwing the Indian capital into its third and most severe power crisis in four months.

title: The Nation
description: HOUSTONIt was a gruesome cachebones, hair, rotting flesh and skulls that police said were too small to belong to adults. By the weekend, they had filled 23 disaster poucheseach representing the remains of a missing teenage boy.

title: Food Costs
description: Tomorrow morning. the price freeze ends for nonfarm goods and services, and all predictions are for higher prices  although there were only guesses as to the extent of the increases that might be ahead for such things as TV sets, bicycles and shoes.

title: Parents Win Backing At SitIn In School
description: State and city officials expressed their support of the parents occupying Public School 208 in East Flatbush at a recent rally at the school.

title: Alice E. Williford Married in Bronxville
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Aug. 11Miss Alice Elizabeth Williford and Wendell Ford Dickerson Jr. were married here this afternoon by the Rev. Dr. Charles Copenhaver in the Reformed Church. The bride is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Oscar. Hutcherson Williford of Heritage, Conn., formerly of Bronxville. Mr. and Mrs. Dickerson of Port Washington, L. I., are the parents of the bridegroom.

title: Saratoga Comes to Life Again, But This Time With Problems
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Aug. 11It's like an elegant, Victorian movie set. Saratoga comes to life one month of each year, then gets put back into wraps for 11 months. With the exception of the usual births and deaths, marriages and divorces, its principal characters seldom change: Phippses, Vanderbilts, Whitneys and Sanfords. They own and race their own horses.

title: Vietcong Say 71 Protest Transfer to Communist Side
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, today that 71 former South Aug. 11The Vietcong Vietnam soldiers and Government officials who had been in jail were smuggled in among: civilian prisoners turned over to the Communists last month.

title: Letters
description: As an attorney who practices in Nassau County and who has spent over 20 years representing taxpayers in proceedings to review assessments upon real property, I must take issue with Horace Z. Kramer's Point of View article advocating assessment of real property by class [July 15]. It is unfortunately true that the property tax is a blind tax without eyes, heart, mercy or consideration. The question is, however, whether Mr. Kramer's suggestions will improve the deficiencies or exacerbate the problem.

title: At Juanita's, Three Square Meals Are Anything But Square
description: FETTERS SPRINGS, Calif.  Last year as I drove into Juanita's for lunch, a black ape about two feet tall hurried across the driveway into the rosebed, picked a blossom and ate it. In the lobby an aging White Wyandotte rooster dozed on its perch over the ancient hotel desk. Nearby, a halfbreed gamecock, magnificent with a red ruff and cascade of brown tail feathers, minced about on the back of an overstuffed divan, turning its head sharply from side to side as it gave me a bright, beady onceover. Now and then it flapped its wings and crowed.

title: 8 MEDICAL UNITS AGREE TO CHANGE
Hospital Is Battling For 38 More Beds
description: POINT PLEASANTPoint Pleasant Hospital and the state's Health Department are in the process of submitting new arguments in a continuing court battle that has prevented the hospital from making available 38 addition al beds.

title: 10HOUR SUICIDE TRY FAILS IN EAST RIVER
description: A 30yearold man who said he had been trying to drown himself by swimming in the East River for almost 10 hours was pulled from the water oy Coast Guard yesterday morning over his objections and then tried to jump back in when he was turned over to the police.

title: Some Names From the Early Days
description: In a little real estate office across from the Maryland state Capitol in Annapolis there hangs a photograph taken in 1970 of two hunters with shotguns and a pair of dead Canada geese.

title: National Young Democrats Vote to Censure President
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Aug. 11 (AP)The National Young Democrats voted today to formally censure President Nixon for what they called not cooperating with those investigating the Watergate scandal.

title: MONASTIC ORDER SPREAD BY YOUNG
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 11A new coeducational monastic orderindependent of any isting churchis being spread quietly across the nation cheery young people in black clerical garb.

title: Customs Men DutyFree
description: MANILA, Aug, 11 (AP)Fourteen custom officials who built their own clubhouse for gambling during office hours and for immorality have been dismissed, a Customs Bureau spokesman said this week. President Ferdinand E. Marcos ousted the 14, including a police captain and a port collector, after a supervisory group reported the extracurricular program at Davao City, 600 miles south of Manila on the island of Mindanao.

title: An Inquiring Capital Debates: What Is Falsification?
description: WASHINGTONThe question that haunted last week's new testimony about the secret 196970 American bombing of Cambodia had a deceptive simplicity: What constitutes falsification of reports?

title: Bronx Athlete Wins Awards
description: Thomas McLaughlin, a senior from the Bronx, has been named the recipient of the Oswald Behrend Award presented annually by the University of Massachusetts to a studentathlete whose achievements best exemplify the qualities of courage, desire, sportsmanship and citizenship. He was captain of the 197273 basketball team.

title: Birthplace of Sloppy Joe
description: SOUTH ORANGE  It's long way these days from Havana to this affluent community of 17,000, but the memory lingers on. For it was at the Town Hall Delicatessen, at 18 South Orange Avenue, that the giantsize sandwich known as a Sloppy Joe is said to have been born and that's where the Cuban connection comes in.

title: Jeffrey Kahn to Marry Deborah Waldt
description: SPRINGFIELD, N. J., Aug. 11Mr. and Mrs. Leonard Waldt have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Deborah Hermine Waldt, to Jeffrey Kahn, son of Mr. and Mrs. Stephen Kahn of Scarsdale, N.Y.

title: Libya Said to Take 51% of the Assets Of U.S. Oil Concern
description: CAIRO, Aug. 11 (Reuters)The Egyptian Middle East News Agency said tonight that the governing Libyan council had issued a decree nationalizing 51 per cent of the assets of the American oil concern Occidental Company of Libya.

title: Inta Vanagelis Wed to T. D. Adams
description: MELVILLE, L. I., Aug. 11 Miss Inta Vanagelis, a supervisor in the Children's Bureau of Nassau County, and Taggart D. Adams, an assistant United States attorney for the Southern District of New York, were married here today in the Latvian Lutheran Church by the Rev. Richard Zarins.

title: Body of Dr. George Wiley Recovered and Identified
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 11 (UPI) The body of Dr. George Wiley, the welfare rights leader, was recovered and identified today after a threeday search in the choppy waters of the Chesapeake Bay.

title: ALASKA LAND PLAN URGED ON MORTON
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11The first comprehensive plan for using 80 million acres the Federal Government still owns in Alaska was delivered to Secretary, of the Interior Rogers C. B. Morton this week by a special advisory commission.

title: GunLaw Umbrella Now Bars Antique
description: TRENTON  The State Police have embarked on a campaign to notify gunsmiths of a new interpretation of New Jersey's guncontrol law. The drive is designed to impede the flow of pistols to criminals.

title: Owner of Colorado Cattle Feedlot Tells His Side of BeefCrisisStory
description: GREELEY, Colo.  Normally there is little public interest in William H. Webster's business, which is sprawled over 220 acres east of the Rockies. Here he fattens yearling cattle for the market, a process more complicated than merely leading a steer to a plentiful trough and saying munch.

title: Watergate Memo Alters Carolina Suit
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Aug. 11 A disclosure in the Watergate investigations has transformed the complexion of class action lawsuit filed in late 1971 by 14 young dissenters who were excluded from a public gathering here at which President Nixon honored the Rev. Billy Graham, the evangelist.

title: Solutions to Last Week's Puzzles
description: P(ETER) DE VRIES: FOREVER PANTING  It's the same keg of nails any way you open it. Id isn't just another big word, either. Far from it. It's a good solid term for a solid fact.... I even have a name for my own id, whom I see as a rather hairy party inhabiting me as a lodger.

title: Special Trains Set For GiantJet Fans
description: Special express trains to the New York GiantsNew York Jets football game in the Yale Bowl, New Haven next Sunday will be run by Penn Central from Grand Central Terminal.

title: Big Jump in Drag Use Is Reported in Ulster
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug. 11 (Reuters)The number of known drug users in Northern Ireland has jumped to 8,000 from 480 in 1969 when the current violence broke out in the province, according to police figures.

title: The Lawyers
description: WASHINGTONTo anybody but a lawyer it might have sounded odd. There was the new president of the American Bar Association, male, white, middleaged and prosperous, the epitome of the A.B.A. member, acknowledging that there was an incompetent fringe of the legal profession that he wouldn't trust to do anythinga fringe, he said, of 20 to 25 per cent of the nation's.

title: After 37 Days on TV, a Choice of Alternate Theories
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11The hearings have stopped but the question lingers onwas the President involved?

title: Mystic Seaport Adds Spritsail and Bateau to Collection
description: MYSTIC, Conn., Aug. 11The Marine Historical Association here has come up,. with two more novel boats to add to its salty collection. sociation, Inc., at Mystic recently, William C. Ridgway

title: Wrestlers Trip To Poland Barred
description: WARSAW, Aug. 11 (AP)The International Wrestling Association has barred American wrestlers from touring Poland, Polish wrestling officials said today.

title: Reform Is Sought in Nassau Sentencing
description: MINEOLA, L. I.  The Nassau County court system has been studying methods of avoiding disparities in sentences of persons convicted of basically the same type of crime.

title: Guard Shot in 2d Holdup Of the Day Remains Critical
description: Frank Carty, the 64yearold guard who was shot by a holdup man at the First National City Bank in the Pan Am Building at 200 Park Avenue on Friday remained in critical condition at Bellevue Hospital yesterday.

title: 3Day Team's Problem Is Lack of Good Horses
description: The sun was beating down on the sprawling grounds of the United States Equestrian Team's training headquarters in Gladstone, N. J., the other day. The temperature was in the 90's.

title: Child to the Altschulers
description: WAYNE, N. J., Aug. 11A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs, Robert H. Altschuler on July 21 at the Chilton Memorial Hospital. The child has been named Karin Lee.

title: Storm Kills 4 Here
description: Two men were killed by lightning yesterday in Prospect Park in Brooklyn and a 16yearold boy was fatally hurt, apparently by another bolt, four miles away. In Jamaica Bay a priest drowned when a sailboat capsized in heavy winds during the sudden storm. Page 58.

title: ENTREMONT BUSY IN MOZART SERIES
description: Philippe Entremont was a busy man at the Mostly Mozart concerts in Philharmonic Hall Friday and Saturday nights. The French pianist took charge of three Mozart concertos that he played and conducted from the keyboarda feat he first performed here during this annual summer festival just two years ago.

title: Headliners
description: Declaring that he had been wooed by Governor Rockefeller, but not seduced, labor mediator Theodore W. Kheel, Who helped sink Governor Rockefeler's 1971 transportation bond issue, signed aboard Friday to support the 1973 version. The differencebesides an extra billiondollar price tag and subsidies to save present commuter and subway faresis that Mr. Rockefeller acceded to Mr. Kheel's longheld contention: that the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey should be responsible for planning, developing and coordinating transportation system in the metropolitan area.

title: Four Killed in a Flash Thunderstorm in Brooklyn
description: Two men standing under tree in Prospect Park during sudden electrical storm were killed by lightning yesterday and a 16yearold was apparently fatally struck by another bolt as he sought refuge elsewhere in Brooklyn. In Jamaica Bay, a 50yearold priest was drowned when high winds touched off by the storm capsized his sailboat.

title: Auto Union Is Threatening Big 3 To Get Voice in Work Conditions
description: DETROIT, Aug. 11The late Walter P. Reuther, who was president of the United Authmobile Workers, once characterized an auto assembly plant at General Motors as a glorified, goldplated sweat shop.

title: India's Air Travel Beset by Criticism
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 11 A plane crash two months ago has shaken the Indian Government, stirred calls for Cabinet resignations and placed a harsh spotlight on New Delhi's international airport.

title: What Does an Economist Get Paid for
description: The Joint Economic Committee of the Congress had some sharp bipartisan criticism for the President's Council of Economic Advisers the other day. Senator Jacob K. Davits accused the economists of leaving business in a state of great uncertaintyyour policy seems to be one of stopgo confusion.

title: U.S. Soccer Improving Its International Image
description: Victories for the United States national soccer team have been as rare as snow in Miami, but after last week's triumph over Canada, the Americans hope to post another victory today when they meet Poland at New Britain, Conn., at P.M., in an exhibition game.

title: A.B.C. Says Paar Will End LateNight Show in Fall
description: The American Broadcasting Company has confirmed that Jack Parr will close his oneweekamonth latenight talk show after Nov. 16.

title: Numismatics Bid for Ike Dollar Windfall Fails
description: LOGIC, foresight, common sense and, not unexpectedly, an outpouring of letters from constituents carried the day in the House of Representatives just before Congress began its August recess. The House voted 230 to 183 against a bill that would have given Eisenhower College in Seneca Falls, N.Y., $1 from the $10 price of each proof. Eisenhower dollar coin already sold and to be sold. The immediate windfall to the college would have been about $6.5million, with the prospect of as much as $20million more over the next several years

title: 5 G.O.P. Senators Urge Nixon to Sign Wage Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11 (AP) 2Five liberal Republican Senators have urged President Nixon in a letter, to sign the minimum wage bill as a move to help lowpaid workers hard hit by inflation.

title: Sweden Captures Lead at Senior Net
description: Torsten Johansson and Sven Davidson led Sweden to a 20 lead over India in the quarterfinals of the international senior team tennis competition for the Stevens Cup yesterday at the Town Tennis Club in Manhattan.

title: The Senate Rests
description: WASHINGTONIt consumed 37 days spread over three months. It supplanted 181 hours of television soap operas and quiz shows. It crushed personal reputations among the 34 witnesses and carved national images for the seven Senators. It altered the balance of power between Capitol Hill and the White House. It exposed hidden recesses of the Central Intelligence Agency and the Federal Bureau of Investigation. It produced lists of Presidential enemies and plans to bug and burglarize American citizens.

title: Ravenhaired, deeply tanned and radiant
description: She dropped to the sand, and he took her in his arms. When their lips met it was everything she knew it would be. And when he took her, she knew it had been the moment she had waited for all her life. His caress was gentle yet firm. She reached out for him and held him close... closer.. until they were united like the sand that joins the wave that draws it back into the sea.

title: Photography.
Quality of Meat Declines; Some Cuts in Short Supply
description: Beef, pork and lamb are still readily available in stores; around the country. There may be shortages of particular cuts,, or shortages in particular stores on particular days, but there is no overall meat shortage, al survey by The New York Times shows.

title: 94 Black Students Jailed 6 Months in South Africa
description: JOHANNESBURG, South At. ries, Aug. 11Ninetyfour black students have been jailed fox sizx months following a disturbance at a training college three months ago.

title: How to Manipulate a Musician Or Even a Politician Music
description: NEARLY everybody in the country is tape conscious these days, thanks to an invention that was developed in Germany in the early 1940's. Almost immediately, it was realized that the tape machine was versatile tool. With it any sound could instantly be recorded, played back, erased, dubbed in, manipulated, even falsified if one's inclinations ran in that direction. Those early machines, incidentally, were not necessarily tape machines. There were experiments with spools of wire, and some of those hit the market. But wire proved nowhere near as versatile as tape. Splicing was difficult. And often there were backlashes, resulting in tangles of wire that you wouldn't believe.

title: The Aerosol World of Robert Abplanalp
description: A banana split awaits the crowning touch. One squirt of the aerosol can and out comes whipped cream.

title: Delta Queen Cruises On, Saved Again by Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11The Delta Queen, the last remaining overnight riverboat in the United States, will continue to churn the waters of the Mississippi River for five more years as a result of her fourth Congressional reprieve from safety laws since 1966.

title: Logue Forecasts 1973 Slowdown In U.D.C. Pace
description: On a clear day the view from the 46thfloor offices of the state Urban Development Corporation is breathtaking. Tithe north Central Park is a shining lake of green surrounded by the elegance of Fifth Avenue and Central Park West. To the east is the panorama of Manhattan and Queens.

title: Home improvement
description: SAGGING floors in a private home are, unfortunately, a fairly common problem whose severity can vary from that of merely a minor nuisance to an indication of a serious defect that should be corrected as soon as possible. In most cases the trouble is due to warping or sagging or one or more main floor beams, or the addition of very heavy loads not originally planned forsuch as a large piano, heavily loaded freezer, extra refrigerator or a new fireplace.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Out of Failure Comes a Happy Ending (of Sorts)
description: The coop committee never succeeded in converting the building. In fact, it never held another tenant meeting. Not after what happened that first night.

title: Rams Can't Find Place On Roster for Sixkiller
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 11 (UPI)Sonny Sixkiller, the Indian quarterback who starred at the University of Washington but was passed over in the college draft because of his size, was released today by the Los Angeles Rams. Sixkiller is 5 feet 11 inches tall and weighs 190 pounds.

title: Stamps
description: WITH what's been happening to the dollar and inflation, this year it has been a lot more feasible  if not as much fun  to go abroad via stamps.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: BOSTON, Aug. 11 (AP)Reggie Smith, Boston's limping slugger, received a substantial fine and was benched today, less than 24 hours after having walked out on the Red Sox amid fan booing during a game with the California Angels.

title: New & Novel
description: A black baseball team barnstorming in the 1930's had at least one problem in common with its white counterparts: the cupidity of club owners. And it had one problem all its own: racism. How Bingo Long's peregrinating troupe faces up to these twin hazards is the nub of a captivating novel that moves in the same orbit as Robert Deane Pharr's memorable The Book of Numbers. A prodigious catcher and longball hitter, Bingo Long forms his runaway team to escape the thrall of their owner, Sallie Potter, a Louisville tavern owner who fires players when they are injured.

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:
description: Tickets matching the number win $2,500. Tickets, with the five numbers in reverse win $225. Tickets with the first or last four numbers in order win $225. Tickets with the first, middle or lest three numbers In sequence win $25. Tickets with all five numbers scrambled win 325. Tickets matching the first and second digits, the second and third, the third and fourth or the fourth and fifth win $2.50.

title: Modern Operas? You Write Em, We'll Produce Em
description: IF ever I had the time for weaving fantasies of another life, I would still do what I am doing, but at another time and place. I would be preparing a new opera while all the world waited breathlessly for the tunes"; I might even be devising means to shield the best of them from premature leakage, and there would be no doubt whatever that I was ushering in a masterpiece. We all know that there actually was such a time and place not too long ago and perhaps there will be again, but for some time now, the search for and production of modern opera has been a kind of crusade producing primarily paranoia.

title: Presbyterians Abroad Sought For Voluntary Evangelism Role.
description: FULLERTON, Calif., Aug. 11 In the wake of a general decline in support of missions by the major Protestant denominations, a new United Presbyterian Church organization is charting a novel approach to missionary operations by organizing American Christians overseas for voluntary religious work.

title: Sunday Observer
description: What an exquisite 20thcentury horror to find yourself caught in the net of some noble cause that needs an innocent victim.

title: Sex and Marriage in Utopian Communities
description: Scholarship, not unlike the fashion industry, is subject to sudden shifts in taste. Ten years ago most historians viewed the abolitionists as misguided fanatics; now they are seen as candidates for sainthood. Where our foreign policy was once regarded as en extension of American benevolence, it is now widely considered a cover for corporate profit. Where consensus had long been the operative term for describing the process of domestic adjustment, conflict now seems to many the more accurate description. Shifts in judgment are paralleled by shifts in emphasis: different generations of historians have variously located the essence of the American experience in the frontier, the melting pot, the sense of divine mission, material abundance, class antagonism (or its lack), racial and sectional tensions, individualism

title: Son for the Kartens
description: A son was born to Dr. and Mrs. Irving Karten on July 20 in the University Hospital. Mrs. Karten, a speech pathologist, is the former Miss Frances Turner of New York. The child, the couple's third, is named Elan Yeshayahu. Her. father Is an assistant professor of clinical medicine at the New York University School of Medicine.

title: Chinese Landscape Paintings Come to Life on a Barge Trip Down the Li River
description: KWEILIN, China  It is not by chance that many of China's greatest painters devoted themselves to river landscapes, for China is a land with rivers of extraordinary beauty.

title: State Joins Consumers In Battling A Budget
description: TRENTON  The state's Budget Director has begun a series of special meetings with all state departments in an effort to devise a strategy to cope with soaring prices for virtually all equipment, material, supplies and services required to operate the vast bureaucracy.

title: Arab Terrorists
description: JERUSALEMThe remark was prophetic.

title: BROOKLYN MAN, 71, BEATEN BY 2 YOUTHS
description: A 71yearold man was severely beaten and his 56yearold sister assaulted when they were awakened early yesterday, in their Brooklyn apartment by two youths who escaped with an undetermined amount of money and valuables.

title: Music Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Ellen Bowman Is Bride of Dennis Perman
description: CHEVY CHASE, Md., Aug. 11In All Saints Episcopal Church here this evening, Miss Ellen Hempstone Bowman, daughter of Col. John Webster Bowman, U.S.M.C., retired, and Mrs. Bowman of Washington, was married to Dennis Paul Perman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin E. Perman of Lodi, N. J. The Rev. George C. Estes performed the ceremony, assisted by the Rev. Richard A. Miller.

title: Katydid
description: Many old beliefs die hard, even in the face of reason. The groundhog, which sleeps away the entire winter, supposed to know when winter will end. And the katydid, which spends well over half the year in the egg, supposed to know when frost will come.

title: Fruitlands: Memorial to Transcendentalism
description: HARVARD, Mass.The prize in the assembly of antiquities here at the Fruitlands estate is an ochrered farmhouse dating from around 1740. Its square and plain proportions are typical of the period in which it was built. There are four rooms down and four up, and sleeping space in the attic. Yet this is no ordinary Massachusetts farmhouse.

title: Do women have distinctive subjects, roles and styles?
description: We have lately had two or three new anthologies of poetry by women and they provoke two reactions, either an irritable rejection or a lurking curiosity. Lately, though, I think there has come, with heightened separatist consciousness, a change: some women want to sound different, to find styles not invented by male society. Otherslike Diane Wakoski have refused to be included in allwomen anthologies; would the dead have agreed? Would Edna St. Vincent Millay join the sorority? Would Dickinson? Would Wylie? Would Lowell? And not only the anthologies, but the increasing number of books by women poets, force us to the question: Do women have distinctive subjects, or distinctive roles visavis traditional subjects, or distinctive styles?

title: SPECIAL CLASSES AID SLUM PUPILS
description: Fourteenyearold Margaret can't read. Aaron reads at level three years below the norm for his age group. Ye both of these highschool sophomores are enrolled in special classes at Columbia University

title: Peru to Fight Pack Labor
description: LIMA, Peru, Aug 11 (UPI)Labor Minister Pedro Sala has said he will try to end a mountain custom of using humans as pack animals. The custom persists chiefly because it is cheaper to use humans  often Indians  than mules.

title: Peach Basketry On Wane in State
description: CALIFONThe next time you're out buying some fresh fruits or vegetables at a farm stand, you might take a close look at the display of wooden baskets. They are fast becoming an endangered species.

title: Atlantic City: For Some, a Boardwalk
description: ATLANTIC CITY  For four decades, children have been flocking to Atlantic City in July and August to show off their talents at the Steel Pier's Children's Theater. And they still come  at the rate of more than 300 a week  to dance, sing, twirl batons, play instruments or display their comedy talents in the pier's 1,700 seat theater.

title: All Out for Aretha
description: ARETHA FRANKLIN'S singing, an art, speaks, directly to the people she comes from: Americans  mostly Black, LeRoi Jones's Blues People, shuffling in spaceage dance halls knee to knee with superstrivers and the postal aristocracy. Gangsters, Militants. Bourgeois inheritors of The Dream. All Black Americana can get to Aretha Franklin because she knows so many ways to get to them.

title: Bridge
Why a Commonwealth?
description: For an association that seemed headed for the rocks two years ago, the Commonwealth of Nations has emerged from its conference in Canada in robust health. The Ottawa sessions were spared the acrimony that scarred the 1971 conference in Singapore, when African and Asian members threatened to break with Britain it it resumed arms sales to South Africa.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: IN the estimation of Allen (Death Sentence McKee for the Movies? July 22) all of us who applaud the recent decision of the U.S. Supreme Court to place f the control of pornographic movies in the hands of local authorities are tasteless ignoramuses. This is quite evident from his snide references to us as Biblebelt crusaders, spinsterbrained moralists and delta demagogues bent upon the destruction of what he calls the motion picture industry's fresh art.

title: Late Listings for Today's TV
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2.

title: National Endowment Puts Government Into Role of Major Patron of the Arts
description: When the National Endowment for the Arts began in 1965, Representative Gerald R. Ford was one of many conservative Congressmen who opposed it. Now he is one of the Endowment's most ardent supporters, and one of the reasons; for his conversion was Alexander Calder.

title: Miss Jane Gordon Claytor Is Bride
description: ROANOKE, Va., Aug. 11Miss Jane Gordon Claytor, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Buckner Claytor of Roanoke, was married here this afternoon to Samuel Johnson Webster, son of Mrs. Russell Davies Webster of Columbus, Ohio, and the late Mr. Webster.

title: This Crunch Is Different
description: The nation's economy is supposed to be guided by Government taxing and spending, Federal Reserve control over money and credit and Phase 4 controls. But fiscal policy works slowly, if at all, and controls seem ineffective and confusing, so monetary policy is left to handle the job.

title: NEWARK UNVEILS RENEWAL PROJECT
description: NEWARK, Aug. 11 (AP)A 20year, $2.5billion project to revitalize the city was unveiled last week by Robert Notte, executive director of the Newark Housing Authority.

title: Giants&
