description: MANILA, Aug. 13  President Ferdinand E. Marcos appealed again today to Philippine Moslems to cooperate with the Government, pledging to use his martiallaw powers to develop their homelands in Mindanao.

title: NURSES WIN, LOSE IN SEX BIAS CASE
description: JERSEY CITY, Aug. 13Two Registered Nurses who filed charges of sex discrimination when they were transferred from the ambulance squad to in hospital service at the Jersey City Medical Center last, year apparently have won a point and lost $3,000 a year.

title: People in Sports: Aussies Call On Laver
description: For the first time since 1962, Rod Laver will represent Australia in Davis Cup competition this year. The fourtime Wimbledon champion notified Neale Fraser by telephone rrom his home in California that he hoped to go to Melbourne for the semifinal round against Czechoslovakia in November.

title: GUNMAN IS INJURED IN AN ULSTER CLASH
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug. 13 (UPI)Gunmen and soldiers exchanged fire in two separate incidents in Belfast early today, the army said. In Londonderry an army patrol asserted that it had fired on and hit a gunman near the Roman Catholic Creggan district.

title: Household Income Rose 7.4% in 72, U.S. Says
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 (AP)Median household income in the United States rose to $9,700 last year, an increase of about 7.4 per cent from that of the previous year, the Commerce Department said today.

title: Agnew Back in Washington After Weekend in California
description: WASHINGTON, Aug, 13 (UPI:  Vice President Agnew re. turned from a long weekend it California today while his attorneys worked on his defense against allegations that he was involved in a kickback scheme while governor of Maryland.

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: Among the foods we are being warned against these days are sugar, salt, solid fats, proteins and carbohydrates. The heart people are down on yolks, and the cancer people are worried about egg whites. Now the latest under indictment are peanut oil and coffee.

description: The North American Soccer League semifinal playoffs begin tomorrow night with the New York Cosmos meeting the Dallas Tornado in Dallas and continue Saturday night in Philadelphia where the Atoms take on the Toronto Metros. Each playoff is onegame series.

title: Air Crash Kills 85
description: All 85 passengers and crew members aboard a Spanish airliner were killed yesterday when the Caravelle jet exploded and crashed just before landing at La Coruna, in northwestern Spain. Page 2,

title: Influx of Canadians Saves Season for Wildwoods
description: NORTH WILDWOOD, N. J., Aug. 13To anyone walking down Surf Avenue late at night,, the strains of La Seine or lin Certain Sourire swelling from the open door of the Club Quebec would indicate that the bistro boasts a chorus of French singers.

title: At First, No One Dreamed of a Castle
description: GREENWICH; Conn.  A man's home may be his castle. But how many castles feel like home?

title: LeadFree Gas Project
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 13 (UPI)  Fluor Engineers and Constructors, Inc., today started work on a $30million modifiication project for the Los Angeles refinery of the Union Oil Company of California to produce leadfree gasoline. The changes will not increase gasoline output.

title: People and Business
description: Carl O. Kamp, Jr., whose resignation as a member of the Federal Home Loan Bank Board becomes effective Wednesday, has been elected president of the regional Federal Home Loan Bank of Atlanta, succeeding John A. Fogarty, 65 years old, who is retiring at the end of this month.

title: Joe Nichols
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y. Aug. 13The atmosphere wound barn 24 this morning was calm and serene, and Secretariat was being walked around just like any other of the many thoroughbreds stabled in the area. Mrs. John (Penny) Tweedy, the major domo of the Meadow Stable's racing activities, was happy at the sight of the Triple Crown winner taking his morning walk without a sign indispostition.

title: The Tapes and History (cont.)
description: Charles L. Black Jr., the Luce Professor of Jurisprudence at Yale Law School, wrote an impassioned and perhaps unduly dogmatic column on the OpEd page Aug. 3 entitled, Mr. Nixon, the Tapes and Common Sense. Professor Black says that Mr. Nixon is everlastingly right in sitting on his tapes, that, if he lets anyone outside the executive branch hear them (Mr. Haldeman presumably excepted), the Presidency is doomed and that the President is therefore serving the cause of his successors for all time to come.

title: Cuite Bids Election Board Shift 2 Registration Days
description: The City Council's Majority Leader complained to the Board of Elections yesterday that two of the three days set aside for registration conflicted with Jewish holy days.

description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13Vice President Agnew's staff advisers here believe he will turn over his personal financial papers, as requested by Federal prosecutors, probably this week, Marsh Thompson, Mr. Agnew's press secretary, said today.

description: It now appears that the July market advance brought much needed relief for investors who had received repeated requests for additional cash tor their margin accounts during the unremitting bear market.

description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 13 (UPI)Final settlement of the nationwide gypsum wallboard case, the largest private price fixing antitrust case in history, was announced today, subject to court approval.

description: MONTREAL, Aug. 13The Canadian Government, moving against the steepest increases in the cost of living that this country has known since the Korean war, imposed temporary controls tonight on the export of beef and pork.

description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 13 (UPI)Joe L. Brown, general manager of the Pittsburgh Pirates, walked into a scheduled news conference at his office tonight just as two television lights blew out.

description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 (AP)  The Commodity Exchange Authority has charged the Louis Dreyfus Corporation, a wheat exporter, with willfully filing inaccurate reports during last year's massive wheat sale to the Soviet Union, the authority announced today.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
Grant for L.I. Park
description: ALBANY, N. Y., Aug. 13 (UPI)Lieut. Gov. Malcolm Wilson, acting for vacationing Governor Rockefeller, today announced approval of a Federal grantinaid of $1,125,000 to the Nassau County town of Oyster Bay toward acquisition of the 121acre Bruce Estate for use as a town park. The grant will be matched by town funds, Mr. Wilson said.

title: HARTFORD GRANTED COURT INJUNCTION
description: Huntington Hartford yesterday won a preliminary injunction in New York State Supreme Court to block financial transactions he claimed would strip him of his holdings in Paradise Island, a vacation resort in the Bahamas.

title: AGNEW NET WORTH SHOWS INCREASE
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 13The publicly reported wealth of Vice President Agnew has increased by $112,000 over the last seven years, according to statements issued by Mr. Agnew over the years.

title: EARL B. WILSON SR, OF SUGAR INDUSTRY
description: FRANKLIN, La., Aug. 13 (UPI) Earl B. Wilson Sr. who was called to Washington as a $1ayear man by President Franklin a Roosevelt to acquire and ration sugar, during World War II, died today at the age of 82.

title: Harlem Jeweler Is Slain During Holdup of His Shop
description: A 54yearold Harlem jeweler was fatally wounded by two armed young men during a holdup of his store shortly after 6 P.M. yesterday.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: A Fisherman Goes Inside
description: MARGAREE FORKS, Nova Scotia While fleeing the rainswollen St. Mary's River northeast to another Atlantic salmon stream, the Margaree, my spirits soared as a rift appeared in the heavy clouds. I drove to Margaree Harbor where, beside the sounding sea, I drank a toast to the end of the wet weather that had continued without end since my entrance into the province several days before.

title: Republican Holds. Up Key Nixon Appointment in Revival of LoyaltyRisk Issue
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13Operating in the protective shadow of the Watergate scandal and the Cambodian bombing dispute, a conservative Republican has succeeded in obstructing a key move in the Nixon Administration's foreign economic policy.

title: Jennifer Boyer Wed to A. W. Klein
description: PLAINFIELD, Vt., Aug. 13 Miss Jennifer Flagg Boyer and Anthony W. Klein were married here yesterday in the Plainfield Town Hail by Justice of the Peace Harold Townsend.

title: Boy Drowns in Lake Lenape
description: MAYS LANDING, Aug. 13 (AP)  An 8yearo1d Atlantic City boy drowned in Lake Lenape here yesterday the police reported. The boy, Alvin Rich, was boating with another youngster when he jumped into the water without a life preserver, the police said. The boys were taking part in the Lenape Park Day Camp for disadvantaged children.

title: Morgan, Stanley Interest In Texasgulf Bid Reported
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 13Morgan, Stanley & Co., the investment banking concern, was reported here today to have taken an interest in the outcome of the $290million Canadian tender offer to United States stockholders for 10 million shares of Texasgulf, Inc.

title: Pilot Who Conquered Disease Died as Observer on Boston Jet
description: BOSTON, Aug. 13Six years ago, the flying career of a bald and bouncy 45yearold Northeast Airlines captain, Joseph E. Burrell, was interrupted by illness. A chronic tremor in his left thumb was diagnosed as a symptom of Parkinson's disease. He was grounded and went on sick leave.

title: People in Sports: Aussies Call On Laver
description: For the first time since 1962, Rod Laver will represent Australia in Davis Cup competition this year. The fourtime Wimbledon champion notified Neale Fraser by telephone rrom his home in California that he hoped to go to Melbourne for the semifinal round against Czechoslovakia in November.

title: City Drug Officials Reject Beame lnefficiency Charge
description: The officials who run the drug programs administered by the city's Addiction Services Agency reacted angrily yesterday to charges of inefficiency and corruption made by Controller Abraham D. Beame.

title: Nicklaus and Weiskopf Will Rest on Their Laurels
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 13 (UPI) Jack Nicklaus, once again the king, and Tom Weiskopf, who figures the pressure may finally be off, plan to take it a little easy the rast of the year.

title: Baeza Rides Winner of Adirondack
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Aug. 13Talking Picture of the Elmendorf interests won the $29,375 Adirondack today before a crowd of 16,667.

title: What's in a Name? Wrong Man Seized On Robbery Charge
description: A robbery suspect was set free by a Criminal Court judge yesterday, a week after he was mistakenly arrested on a warrant issued for a man with an almost identical name who lived at the same address.

title: Nice Gang Shoots 3 in Brooklyn
Dismissal Asked in Haig Suit
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 (UPI) The Justice Department asked the Federal District Court today to dismiss a suit against President Nixon's chief of staff, Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr., who remained on the active Army payroll for two months while working at the White House. Irving Jaffe, Acting Assistant, Attorney General, said the suit) was moot because General Haig retired from the Army July 31. The taxpayers suit was brought by Alan B. Morrison, a representative of Ralph Nader's consumer organization.

title: Cornelius M. O'Shea Dies at 61; City's Chief Park Horticulturist
description: Cornelius M. O'Shea, chief horticulturist of the city's Department of Parks, died yesterday in La Guardia Hospital. He was 61 years old and lived at 46.10 61st Street, Woodside, Queens.

title: MAN FOUND SLAIN IN CENTRAL PARK
description: A 35yearold man was found shot to death in Central Park early yesterday. The police identified him as John Murray of 55 West 92d Street. They said. he was found near the bridle path on the west side of the, park not far from the 72d Street entrance.

title: FRANKLIN BANK SETS S.E.C. CONSENT ORDER
description: The Franklin National Bank has agreed to a consent order issued by the Securities Exchange Commission in a proceedings involving the Susquehanna Corporation, a spokesman for the bank said yesterday.

title: West Berlin Holds Up Return Of Girl to East Pending Plea
description: BERLIN, Aug. 13 (UPI)The prosecution said today that it would not carry out a court order to send a girl fugitive back to East Germany until the European Court of Justice had heard her appeal.

title: Nice Gang Shoots 3 in Brooklyn
description: A gang of youths who call themselves the Jollie Stompers and who have been praised by the police for their good behavior held up and shot two men early yesterday in the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn.

title: Abplanalp Says He Has Spent $1Million To Make His Island Secure for President
description: GRAND CAY, Bahamas, Aug. 13As his yacht Sea Lion 2 sliced through the emerald Bahamas waters, Robert H. Abplanalp glanced toward a precarious perch on stilts 25 feet above the deck, used as a highrise lookout chair for deepsea fishing.

title: AMEX PRICES OFF IN LIGHT TRADING
12 on City Payroll Accused of Fraud By Welfare Agency
description: The city's Department of Social Services will forward next week to the appropriate district attorneys for possible prosecution cases against at least 12 welfare recipients who hold Board of Education jobs.

title: F.D.A. Seeks Lists Of Items Containing Aerosol Chemical
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 (AP) The Food and Drug Administration ordered all drug companies today to submit lists of products containing Trichloroethane and proposed rigid restrictions on future use of the chemical, which has been linked to the deaths of 21 persons who inhaled it from aerosol cough remedies.

title: Police in Houston Explain Procedure on Runaways
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 13Police Chief Herman Short defended today department policies of handling runaway juveniles against criticism of some of the parents whose children are believed to have been victims in the mass killings here.

title: Shedding Pounds at the Plaza Will Cost $500 a Year
description: The letter from James H. Lavenson, president of the Plaza, begins: I'm 53 years old and fat. In addition, I'm in lousy shape physically.

title: ... and False Alarms
description: Not surprisingly, a somewhat similar problem has developed with respect to burglar alarms, now that an increasing number of these signal systems are being installed in private homes by securityminded families. False alarms have become a costly drain on police manpower.

title: Celebrities Enliven a 3Day Party, Salute to Israel
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 13Herod the Great would have loved it.

title: Giants Won't Experiment in This Preseason Game  They're Playing the Jets
description: Battle lines were drawn quickly for Sunday's, GiantsJets exhibition when Coach Alex Webster said yesterday that we'll go with No. 1 people.

title: Nixon Cruises on Potomac
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 (AP) President Nixon went for dinner cruise today aboard the Presidential yacht Sequoia, accompanied by the White House chief of staff, Alexander M. Haig Jr.

title: Five Get Life Terms in 1972 Virgin Island Slayings
description: CHRISTIANSTED, V.I., Aug. 13 (UPI)Five men were sentenced today to life imprisonment for the murders of eight persons last fall at a luxurious golf course here.

title: Bees Score at P.G.A., Too
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 13 (AP)Hornets, trees, golf balls and even caterpillars were among the course hazards for the people in the galleries at the Professional Golfers Association championship last week. About 200 embattled fans sought medical attention at the firstaid tent for a variety of reasons. Ncne was more bizarre than the Cleveand man who was chomped by furry, multilegged crawler he found on his neck. Hornet and bee stings were the biggest reason for first aid. although some of those were elated directly to the golfing. One 14yearold boys sat on a hornet when he hunkered down to get a better view of the green.

title: The Bitter End
description: More than four years after President Nixon was first elected on a promise to end the war in Indochina and nearly seven months after he proclaimed peace with honor, United States combat operations in the longest, most divisive war in the nation's history are scheduled to end tonightnot as a result of Presidential initiative but through a courageous mandate or Congress.

title: Blackout Interrupts Address by Allende
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 13 A power cut brought a total blackout here as President Salvador Allende Gossens was in the middle of a nationwide address on the country's political crisis.

title: GEORGE C. THAYER, POLITICAL WRITER
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 George C. Thayer, the author of numerous books and articles on political subjects, died today at Georgetown University Hospital here. He was 39 years old and lived here.

title: BEEF SLAUGHTER UP 15% IN A WEEK
description: An upturn in the nationwide slaughter of cattle appears to! have developed for the first time since a squeeze that began July 18, when President Nixon kept price ceilings on beef while removing them from all other foods.

title: RCA SCHOOL HERE PLANS TO CLOSE
description: RCA Institutes, an electronics school with 12,500 students that opened 64 years ago as the Marconi Institute, is schedI uled to close.

title: PRICES ARE RAISED ON CARS AND STEEL AS PHASE 4 OPENS
description: Higher prices were announced yesterday for automobile's and the steel used to manufacture a variety of consumer products as the Nixon Administration's 60day price freeze gave way to a more relaxed Phase 4.

title: Air Crash Kills 85
description: All 85 passengers and crew members aboard a Spanish airliner were killed yesterday when the Caravelle jet exploded and crashed just before landing at La Coruna, in northwestern Spain. Page 2.

title: Foe of Korean Chief, Abducted In Tokyo, Is Released in Seoul
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Tuesday, Aug. 14Kim Dae Jung, the former South Korean Opposition leader who was mysteriously abducted from a Tokyo hotel last Wednesday, was abruptly freed and returned to his home here last night in good health.

title: Missing in Boat Accident
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Aug. 13 (AP)Robert Millhouse, 48 years old, of Stamford was missing and presumed drowned after a boat capsized off Greenwich Point yesterday afternoon. The Greenwich police said Mr. Mil!house and three companions in a 14foot outboard boat were caught in a squall on Long Island Sound. The companions were rescued, and the boat was recovered.

title: Robert Kennedy's Son Among 6 Injured When Jeep Overturns
description: NANTUCKET, Mass., Aug. 13 David Kennedy, the 17yearold son of the late Senator Robert F. Kennedy, and five other young people were injured this afternoon when jeep driven by David's brother, Joseph, 21, overturned on highway six miles east of here.

title: Rogers in Effort To Revive SEATO As Peace Alliance
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 Secretary of State William P. Rogers plans to meet with envoys from the other Southeast Asia Treaty Organization members in New York next month to put stress on the nonmilitary aspects of the 19yearold organization as a way of keeping it alive, State Department officials said today.

title: President Signs Highway Bill With Provisions for Mass Transit Assistance
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13President Nixon signed today $23billion highway bill that permits for the first time share of the Federal Highway Trust Fund to be used by tin cities for mass transit.

title: 2 Top Badillo Supporters Switch Backing to Beame
description: Two of Representative. Herman Badillo's political inner circlethe small group that met at his apartment after he lost the Democratic mayoral runoff and discussed whether he should try again as an independentcame out publicly yesterday for the man who won the runoff, Controller Abraham D. Beame.

title: Business Being Sought
description: The Control Data Corporation announced last night that preliminary discussions had taken! place for it to manage and maintain, but not own, leased peripheral computer equipment, presently installed by the Memorex Corporation.

title: LEO STERN
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., Aug. 13Leo Stern, managing partner of Newburger Loeb & Co., investment bankers, when he retired in 1971, died today at his home.

title: BURGER AGAIN BARS SESSION ON BOMBING
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13 (AP) Chief Justice Warren E. Burger again denied today an application to call a special term of the Supreme Court to consider the constitutionality of United States bombing of Cambodia. It was his second such action in five days.

title: Mrs. Mary Abreu Is Married to Baron
description: STOCKBRIDGE, Mass., Aug. 13Mrs. Mary Sargent Ladd Abreu and Baron Bernard d'AnglejanChatillon, both of Paris, were married in the First Congreational Church here today. The Rev. Malcolm D. Kilborn performed the ceremony.

title: Business Briefs
description: The newsprint shortage tightened yesterday as the three mills of a large Canadian producer, the Price Company of St. Anne, Quebec, were struck by 1,800 workers.

title: Dr. John D. Corbit Dead; Philadelphia Gynecologist
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 13 Dr. John D. Corbit Jr., director of the obstetrics and gynecology division of Lankenau Hospital since 1964 and professor of gynecology at Jefferson Medical College, died Friday at the hospital. He was 63 years old and lived in Penn Valley.

title: Kraft Food Announces Temporary Allocations
description: GLENVIEW, Ill., Aug. 13 (AP)Kraft Foods, a subsidiary of Kraftco Corporation, announced today temporary allocation of cheese products to its retail food service and industrial customers. The allocations are based on a percentage of the customer's normal average weekly order and will re main in effect until further notice.

title: Pipe Bomb,10th of Year, Found At Brooklyn Construction Site
description: An unexploded pipe bomb, the 10th such device found at a construction site in the city this year, was discovered yesterday morning in Brooklyn.

title: WARNING TO HANOI GIVEN BY SAIGON
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 13 (Reuters)South Vietnam warned today that it would react if it considered itself threatened by North Vietnamese troops in Cambodia after the American bombing halt on Wednesday.

title: In Nest of Meter Maids, a Truck Driver Is Fair Game
description: If the wine runs short at the Mexican mission, guests can blame the uncorking of yet another campaign against parking violations that claimed the wine truck as an early victim.

title: A's to Regain Hunter
description: BOSTON, Aug. 13 (AP)Jim (Catfish) Hunter of the Oakland A's is expected to play late this week for the first time since the AllStar game, Manager Dick Williams said today.

title: Fever of City Rivalry Infects New Jet, Too
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Aug. 13 He had been a Jet only a few days when Richard Neal first heard about the game against the Giants, an annual crusade that will be staged next Sunday at New Haven.

title: A NUCLEAR PLANT BALKED IN JERSEY
description: LACEY TOWNSHIP, N.J., Aug. 13  Construction of the Jersey Central Power & Light Company's 1.14 million kilowatt atomicpowered generating station here was delayed when members of the local Planning Board tonight tabled the company's request for siteplan approval The planned $500million generating plant, for which ground was to have been broken Aug. 23, would be about 3,000 feet from Jersey Central's present smaller plant on Oyster Creek and Forked River.

title: Texas Toll of Boys Rises to 27 In Nation's Biggest Slaying Case
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 13They used to hang around Dean Corll's candy shop. They included friends, boys from school, neighborhood buddies, and later, runaway kids from other towns.

title: Swedish Trotter to Race at Roosevelt
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Aug. 13 (AP)Lime Rodney, a Swedish filly with a reputation as an exceptional sprinter, has been entered in the $150,000 Roosevelt International Trot, increasing the list of starters for the Aug. 25 race to five.

title: Wallace McGill, Produced The Bell Telephone Hour
description: FORD LAUDERDALE, Fla., Aug. 13Wallace Read McGill, former producer and director of the Bell Telephone Hour on radio, died yesterday at his home here. His age was 67.

title: HARRY A. PEARSC
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 13Harry A. Pearson, director of research for the Sonotone Corporation in Elmsford, and an expert on amplifiers and hearfi ing aids, died yesterday of cancer at White Plains Hospital. His age was 63 and he lived here.

title: The Theater In London
description: LONDONA year or so ago Trevor Nunn, the young artistic director of the Royal Shakespeare Company, conceived the idea of staging all of Shakespeare's Roman plays as a sequence, showing, if you like, the rise, decline and fall of the Roman Empire.

title: Protests Prompting A Restudy of Plans For Merritt Road
U.S. Loses Appendix At Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 13 (AP)The United States lost a top gymnast because of emergency surgery and finally managed to cut through Soviet red tape at the World University Games today.,

title: Confiscating Handguns
description: A prestigious national panel studying crime in the United States has made the most farreaching recommendation yet for reducing the heavy toll in murder and crime that results from the indiscriminate availability of handguns. The National Advisory Commission on Criminal Justice Standards and Goals, composed of present and former governors, police officials and judges, urges the outright confiscation of handguns now owned by private individuals.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A former cashier for the city's Offtrack Betting Corporation was accused of playing the horses on May 21the day he quitby punching himself $8,850 in O.T.B. tickets that covered all entries in the fifth, sixth, seventh, eighth and ninth races at Belmont Park. Kenneth Moseley, 29 years old, of 130 East 115th Street, was arraigned State Supreme Court on charges of larceny and possession of stolen propertynamely, the tickets he punched at the city betting office at 244 West 42d Street and cashed later for $12,000.

title: FRANK ZVERINA
description: Frank Zverina, a Czechoslovak writer and translator who was active in the Czech resistance during the Nazi occupation of his country, died Sunday at St, Barnabas Hospital, the Bronx. His age was 53.

title: Geraldine Rockefeller Dodge, Founder of Kennel Club, Dead
description: MADISON, N. J., Aug. 13 Mrs. Geraldine Rockefeller Dodge, last surviving child of the financier William Rockefeller and the widow of Marcellus Hartley Dodge chairman of the Remington Arms Com, pony, died today at her home, Giralda Farms. She was 91 years old.

title: Collins &
description: The Collins & Day Group, Inc., the leading dealer in commodity options, is negotiating to sell its nationwide operation, according to industry sources. The name of the prospective buyer could not be ascertained yesterday.

title: White Homers Twice and Medich Tops Angels, 60, for Yanks
ECOLOGY BECOMES A CAMPAIGN ISSUE
description: TRENTON, Aug. 13In their first confrontation in the New Jersey campaign for Governor, Representative Charles W. Sandman Jr. and former Superior Court Judge Brendan T. Byrne disagreed today on applying environmental protection to highway construction projects.

title: 25 C.B.S. Affiliates Won't Show Maude Episodes on Abortion
description: More than 25 C.B.S. affiliate stations have declined to carry reruns of two episodes of Maude dealing with abortion, the first of which is scheduled on the Columbia Broadcasting System television network tonight.

title: Here Is Some Advice On AirShipping Pets
description: The Humane Society of the United States advises against shipping pets by airplane because of the chance of injury or death. However, if a pet must be shipped, the society offers a number of recommendations. Among them are the following:

title: Advertising: Dr. Brothers on TV
description: After growing for three years as a sales promotion agency, Halpern/McDevitt, Inc., took the plunge about a year ago and moved head on into advertising.

title: AIRLINES'
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13The Aviation Consumer Action Project asked the Civil Aeronautics Board today to formulate reasonable rules to make the airlines more responsive to passengers baggage problems.

title: Chrysler Walkout Ends; Union Vows Strike Vote
description: DETROIT, Aug. 13 (UPI) The Chrysler Corporation's forge plant here resumed production of essential parts today as workers ended a wildcat srike over allegedly unsafe working conditions.

title: Canadians Save Jersey Resorts
description: NORTH WILDWOOD, N. J., Aug. 13To anyone walking down Surf Avenue late at night, the strains of La Seine or Un Certain Sourire swelling from the open door of the Club Quebec would indicate that the bistro boasted a chorus of French singers.

title: CAMBODIA LOSES TOWN AT JUNCTION ABOVE ITS CAPITAL
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Aug. 13Despite an overall lull in fighting in Cambodia today, military sources reported the loss of an important market town 48 miles northeast of here. American planes continued heavy attacks all around Phnom Penh with two days remaining until the scheduled cutoff of the bombing.

title: Basketball Stars Honor An Old Friend Tonight
description: Maurice Stokes has been dead for three years, but pro basketball players, old and new, won't let his memory fade. His fight for life is being recalled in the film, Maurie, and tonight the annual charity game that bears his name at Kutsher's Country Club in Monticello, N. Y.

title: Final Gospel Program Intensifies 73 Soul Series
description: Gospel as a musical art form and gospel as an expression of religious faith were both stirringly presented Sunday in the final gospel program in the Soul at the Center 73 series at Lincoln Center.

title: Tomatoes Coming In a Bit Late but Reasonably Priced
description: CAMDEN, N. J., Aug. 13Trucks carrying the first tomato shipments of the season are unloading tons of the vegetables at the Campbell Soup Company, here, and though the harvest is late, the price is not paring.

title: Blunder in the Sky
description: Israel's strategists have blundered into a dangerous escalation of their longstanding underground war with the Palestinian extremists. Last week's temporary seizure of a commercial passenger plane outside Beirut was as foolish as it was illegal. The precedent it set could come back to haunt the Israelis in their longstanding insistence on the inviolability of civil aviation, an insistence in which they have been joined by the United States and, even on occasion, by the Soviet Union.

title: Foe of Korean Chief, Abducted In Tokyo, Is Released in Seoul
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Tuesday, Aug. 14Kim Dae Jung, the former South Korean Opposition leader who was mysteriously abducted from a Tokyo hotel last Wednesday, was abruptly freed and returned to his home here last night in good health.

title: Roundup: Tempers Flare But the Pirates Cool It
description: Despite reports of a blazing argument between Manager Bill Virdon and Richie Hebner, the third baseman, and the hair curlers of Dock Ellis, The Pittsburgh Pirates are making a steady run at the flag in the National League's Eastern Division.

title: Nuclear Geneiating Plant Delayed by Planning Board
description: LACEY TOWNSHIP, N.J., Aug. 13Construction of the Jersey Central Power & Light Company's 1.14 million watt atomicpOwered generating station here was delayed when members of the local Planning Board tonight tabled the company's request for siteplan approval. The planned $500million generating. plant, for which ground was to have been broken Aug. 23 would be about 3,000 feet from Jersey Central's present smaller plant on Oyster Creek and Forked River.

title: Military Under Fire
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13This country's professional military men are going through a hard time. The Senate Armed Services Committee has shown that the Air Force secretly bombed Laos and Cambodia when both were (neutral countries. Similarly, the Marines crossed the border into Laos in early 1969 and engaged in secret, heavy fighting there.

title: Bohack Sells 7 Units
description: The Bohack Corporation has eft Manhattan, the Bronx and Westchester with the sale of ;even supermarkets of which )rivately owned Sloan Supernarket Stores took possession last Saturday night.

title: About the Mets:
description: The last time the Mets played in San Diego, they got shut out twice before winning a 9.2 game. Nevertheless, their wonlost record in San Diego is 18.9, and it the only place in the United States where they have winning record (they are 2219 at Montreal)... Teddy Martinez, who injured his heel Saturday in San Francisco, is on a daytoday status, giving Brian Ostrosser a chance to start at shortstop. When a hitter is used for Ostrosser, Wayne Garrett moves over from third.... Bud Harrelson, his cracked breastbone still healing, is with the team, but it will be sometime before he can play... John Milner, the most impressive young slugger the Mets have ever had, has some thoughtprovoking relationships buried among his statistics. His 75 hits have driven in 58 runs and his 20 home runs (twice as many as any other Met) have come in only 310 at bats, the sort of pace usually followed by 40homer men.... As for Garrett, his 242 average doesn't reflect his value, because his 51 walks give him an onbase average of 339, As a comparison, Felix Milian, who hitting.289, has had only 19 walks for an onbase average of 317.

title: Nicklaus and Weiskopf Will Rest on Their Laurels
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 13 (UPI) Jack Nicklaus, once. again the king, and Tom Weiskopf, who figures the pressure may finally be off, plan to take it a little easy the rast of the year.

title: Books of The Times
description: James Morris is an insomniac who solved the problem of what to do in the wee hours of the morning by building himself powerful radio receiver and tuning in to Fundamentalist preachers, mostly from the right wing. He got hookedfascinated by their ideas, their world views, their infighting and, most of all, their obvious public appeal and financial success. The Preachers is his acommt of the voices that filled his earlymorning world. It is an act of love by a gourmet of the religious right.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: CLIFTON, Aug. 13The game started four years ago with an anonymous phone call to Dick Vitale, who recently was appointed head basketball coach at the University Detroit.

title: Black Doctors Urged to Take A More Active Role in Politics
description: The National Medical Association, the professional organization representing the nation's 6,000 black doctors, must take a more active role in national politics if current gains made in health services for the poor are to be maintained, a Government official said yesterday.

title: Hospital Burial Scheme Traced to 1967
description: SECAUCUS, Aug. 13  Six years ago, John Stanton, patient number 1142 at Meadow View Hospital, the Hudson County mental institution on County Road here, died a natural death.

title: Business Inventories Climb
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 13Total business inventories rose by $2.6billion in June, the largest monthly increase on record, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: All 85 Aboard Spanish Jet Die in Crash
description: LA CORUNA, Spain, Aug. 13 (Reuters)A Spanish Caravelle airliner exploded and crashed near this northwestern port today and airline officials said that all 79 passengers and six crew members aboard had been killed.

title: 5,000 Gas Stations to Close
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 14 (AP) More than 5,000 service stations in Pennsylvania are expected to shut down for the threeday Labor Day weekend to protest Phase 4 economic regulations, Thomas J. Anderson, executive director of the Pennsylvania Service Station Dealers Association says. The dealers say the rules for the petroleum industry leave them in a pinch.

title: HALLECK'S WIFE, 71, DROWNS IN MONTANA
description: WEST YELLOWSTONE, Mont., Aug. 14 (UPI)Mrs. Charles A. Halleck, wife of the former House Republican leader, drowned yesterday when she fell from a boat into the Madison River while fishing with her husband.

title: BREITEL BACKED BY BLUMENTHAL
description: Charles D. Breitel, associate judge of the state Curt of Ap peals and RepublicanLibera candidate for chief judge, was endorsed yesterday by Assemblyman Albert H. Blumenthal a Democrat running for Mayor on the Liberal line.

title: Korean Says His Abductors Planned Carefully and Acted Skillfully
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 14Kim Dae Jung, the South Korea Opposition leader who disappeared suddenly in Tokyo six days ago, said tonight his abduction had all the marks of careful planning, skilled execution and close monitoring by those in charge.

title: Censoring Maude
description: A spokesman for the Catholic Communications Foundation has called the decision of the Columbia Broadcasting System to rerun two episodes of the situation comedy Maude dealing with abortion a willful insult to the American televiewer.

title: Mick Jagger and Stones Star in Telecast Sept. 29
description: Mick Jagger and the Rolling Stones, last seen on American television more than seven years ago, will star in the premiere telecast of a new series, Don Kirchner's Rock Concert. The program, which has been sold in syndication to 47 stations so far, will he seen here Sept. 29 on WNEWTV at 11:30 P.M.

title: Nader Asserts Nuclear Industry Forces Public to Accept Plants
description: PHILADELPHIA. Aug. 14Ralph Nader accused the nation's nuclear industry today of taking advantage of the current energy crisis to force the public to accept the use of nuclear power plants.

title: New Polyester Fiber Plant Is Scheduled by du Pont
description: A polyester fiber plant with an initial capacity of 250 million pounds will be erected near Charleston, S. C., E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co., Inc., announced yesterday. The plant, which will produce both filament and staple polyester fiber, is scheduled for completion in late 1975.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: PLYMOUTH, England, Aug. 14 (AP)Two Big American yachts slipped away from nearly 300 challengers in the Fastnet race today and appeared to have the ocean classic between them as they neared the finish. The 61foot Sorcery, ineligible to win the Admiral's Cup because she one foot over the specifications, was sighted passing Wolf Rock, 65 miles from the finish. She is owned by Jim French Baldwin of Locust Valley, L. I.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: BURBANK, Calif., Aug. 14 (UPI)Lockheed missiles and Space Company today obtained $113.4million in new Navy contracts, including one of $111.5million for work on the Poseidon submarine launched ballistic missile.

title: LYNCH MAY QUIT IN IRISH INCIDENT;Weighs Exit as Party Head After Memory Lapse
description: DUBLIN, Aug. 14 (Reuters) The former Prime Minister of Ireland, John Lynch, said today that he was considering quitting as leader of the Opposition party because of al lapse of memory about British spy operations in the republic.

title: Allende Cabinet Orders Strong Steps To Curb Violence and End Truck Strike
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 14President Salvador Allende Gossens new civilmilitary Government ordered strong measures today to curb the wave of terrorism in Chile.

title: Discontent With Common Market Rising in Britain
description: LONDON, Aug. 19As Prime Minister Heath races his yacht off the English coast, new winds of anxiety are stirring Britain because of an issue that just won't go awaythe Common Market.

title: POLICE TO WIDEN VILLAGE PATROL
description: City officials announced yesterday that additional police officers would be stationed in Greenwich Village bececause of the knife slaying of a young woman in the area last week and complaints by residents that an influx of outsiders wasp disrupting the neighborhood.

title: 250 Young Radicals Rally Against Indochina Policy
description: About 250 young people from a variety of radical political groups demonstrated last night on 34th Street between Eighth and Ninth Avenues against American policies in Indochina.

title: SUPPORT PLEDGED
description: WASHINGTON, Wednesday, Aug. 15American bombing in Cambodia officially ended last midnight with the Nixon Administration still pledging to do everything possible within the law to support the Government of President Lon Nol.

title: HELEN TESCHEMACHER
description: NORTH PLAINFIELD, N. J., Aug. 14Helen Teschemacher, who was a teacher in the old city of Brooklyn before its consolidation as part of New York City, died at the age of 99 in the Villa Maria Nursing Home.

title: A Sad Case Of a KissAnd Teller
description: A Brooklyn grand jury decided yesterday that the marraige of John Ryall and Leslie Chernak was not made by angels but was conceived in a Long Island apartment and financed by a holdup of the bank where Leslie's sister worked as a teller.

title: REGINALD P. VINCENT
description: SUMMIT, N. J., Aug. 14Reginald Palmer Vincent, a vice president of the First National City Bank, who retired four years ago after 40 years of service, died at the Mary Fletcher Hospital, Burlington, Vt., where he was taken from his summer home in Glen Burnie, N. Y. His age was 69.

title: Cyprus Is Awaiting Reaction Of Rebel Leader to Setbacks
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Aug. 10After two years of fitful guerrilla actions and political intrigue, Archbishop Makarios, the President of Cyprus, has backed his most dangerous opponent into a corner.

title: Huge Tent Rises in Bronx
description: A tent about the size of a football field has been erected at the foot of the 145th Street bridge in the. Bronx for a 24 day, series of evangelical services that begin Friday night, with the Rev, W. R. Schamback residing.

title: People in Sports: Unitas Hits Back At Colts, Sues for Breach of Contract
Records: Engaging Elf
description: Since Ruby Braff, that engaging elf from Boston, came to New York with his cornet almost 20 years ago, he has led an essentially underground existence despite consistent critical acclaim for his warmtoned, melodic and imaginatively swinging playing. But there are indications that 1973 may be Ruby's year of emergence.

title: BREITEL BACKED BY BLUMENTHAI
description: Charles D. Breitel, associate judge of the state Curt of Appeals and RepublicanLiberal candidate for chief judge, was endorsed yesterday by Assem. blyman Albert H. Blumenthal, a Democrat running for Mayor on the Liberal line.

title: Mosbacher Wets Feet As Racing's Helmsman
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Aug. 14Emil Mosbacher Jr. made his first apperance at race track today since he became chairman of the State Racing and Wagering Board. Under the guidance of Chairman Joseph Gimma of the State Racing Commission and accompanied by his Racing and Wagering Board colleagues, Joseph Boyd and Eugene Keogh, Mosbacher said the visit represented a chance for us to educate ourselves.

title: Training School Told to Stop Its Overoptimistic Claims
description: The Paralegal Institute, a training school for lawyers assistants at 132 Nassau Street, has been ordered in State Supreme Court to stop its overoptimistic statements about the state of the job market for paralegal assistants and to stop offering guarantees of jobs and starting salaries.

title: Records: Engaging Elf
description: Since Ruby Braff, that engaging elf from Boston, came to New York with his cornet almost 20 years ago, he has led an essentially underground existence despite consistent critical acclaim for his warmtoned, melodic and imaginatively swinging playing. But there are indications that 1973 may be Ruby's year of emergence.

title: Theater: Notes on Nudes
description: LONDON  Quite recently I was asked about nudity on Broadway. I replied firmly that there was no nudity current on Broadway, and it was only later that I remembered David Storey's The Changing Room. Now whether this was because in a male chauvinist way I only counted female nudity, or whether male nudity in a locker room setting seemed so inescapable to me that I did not really notice it, I am not sure. However, everyone must notice the new nude look of the London theater.

title: Israel Sentences and Frees 2 in Jewish Defense League
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 14 (UPI)  A district court judge yesterday sentenced two members of the militant Jewish Defense League to four months in jail for their role in arson at a Christian mission on the Mount of Olives in February.

title: ShortTerm Rates Climb; Treasury Bills Set Pace,
COMMODITIES UP BY LIMITS AGAIN
description: The exporters once again elbowed the flour millers out of the grain trading pits yesterday on the Midwest commodity exchanges.

title: Tides of Change Alter the Look of Tar Beach
description: They used to call it tar beach, the New York root that was the poor man's summer resort: a statuscut above the fire escape for sunnning or a touch of breeze or romance on a sweltering night.

title: Mixed Drug Scene
description: In the span of less than a week, New Yorkers have been handed two sharply conflicting reports on the progress of local efforts to combat drug abuse. One is rosy, the other grim. One papers over all shortcomings with a recital of reassuring statistics; the second punches through the figures to reveal an alltoothin and sometimes shoddy performance.

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. California Angels, at Yankee Stadium, River Avenue and 161st Street, the Bronx, P.M.

title: Advertising: Ms. Branching Out
description: The women at Ms. magazine, pleased with its progress in the year since regular monthly publication began, have been gradually diversifying into related activities in the communications field. And now they're getting ready for a really big one.

title: President Again Endorses Sonnenfeldt for Treasury
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 (UPI)  President Nixon has the greatest respect for Helmut Sonnenfeldt and hopes he will be confirmed as Treasury Under Secretary, the White House said today.

title: Educational TV Underutilized, A State Watchdog Panel Finds
description: ALBANY, Aug. 14 (AP)A watchdog commission said today that educational television in New York State was underutilized, poorly coordinated, and, in some ways, a victim of its own potential.

title: 60 Raid Foes Arrested at White House
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14On the final day of United States bombing in Cambodia, 60 personsincluding the antiwaractivists the Rev. Daniel J. Berrigan and his brother Jeromewere arrested today as they knelt and prayed at the WhiteHouse in a protest against the raids.

title: 55 STEERS BOUGHT BY CITY FOR BEEF
description: The city yesterday bought 55 steers, its first purchase of cattle for customslaughter since World War IL The steers are expected to yield 34,367 pounds of beef for the municipal hospitals.

title: 7 Hurt, 2 Missing In Lodi Explosion At Chemical Plant
DEMOCRATS TO HOLD A 7HOUR TELETHON
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 14 (America Goes Public will be the theme of a sevenhour na tional telethon Sept. 15 designed to wipe out the Demo cratic party's $3million debt (left over from the 1968 Presidential campaign.

title: Turner's Lawyer Assails Resuming Of Hearings Here
description: An attorney for Glenn W. Turner's Koscot Interplanetary, Inc., a cosmetics company, assailed as a travesty the resumption yesterday of a hearing here on a Federal Trade Commission complaint charging Mr. Turner, Koscot and others with misleading and deceptive business practices.

title: 13th Navy Man Found Guilty Of Disobedience Off Vietnam
description: Manila, Aug. 14 (UPI)The 13th crew member of a United States navy vessel charged with disobeying orders while minesweeping off North Vietnam in March was found guilty as charged today and was sentenced to 75 days confinement at hard labor, Navy officials re ported.

title: CATS WITH CANCER FOUND INFECTIOUS
description: Cats living in the same household with another cat suffering from a lymph cancer caused by the feline leukemia virus run a large risk of being infected and developing cancer, researchers here and in Boston have reported.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Thieves at Cornell University in Ithaca, N. Y., stole rifles, 11 handguns, three telescopic sights, five bayonets and a grenade launcher from two R.O.T.C. storage areas the campus.

title: Notes on People
description: The office of Frank S. Hogan, the Manhattan District Attorney, said he was in good condtion at St. Luke's Hospital, where he was admitted Friday night after complaining of fainting spells. A spokesman for Mr. Hogan said the 71yearold prosec !tor was hospitalized for a series of tests and that the tests are incomplete, but he has been out of bed. The spokesman said Mr. Hogan would stay in the hospital for several more days. He is expected to win a ninth fouryear term as District Attorney in November.

title: Dollar Value Climbs
description: The value of the dollar jumped to its highest level in six weeks in Europe yesterday. The price of gold fell $7 an ounce to $95, its lowest level in three months. Prices on the New York Stock Exchange dropped sharply for the third day. Page 47.

title: Westchester Doctor Indicted for Selling Drug Prescriptions
description: The Westchester County sheriff's office yesterday reported the indictment and arrest of a New Rochelle physician accused of having sold prescriptions for dangerotis drugs, such as barbiturates, at $15 apiece without examining the patients, who turned out to he undercover agents.

title: Books of The Times
description: A friend of mine dislikes swimming on beaches where there are lifeguards. I reserve the right, he says, to drown myself if I choose. Janis Joplin chose to drown herself in Southern Comfort and in drugs, and to me it seems somehow disproportionate that we should be expected to interest ourselves in 333 pages chronicling this process. Miss Joplin seemed, or looked, or sounded, better or worse. She was on or off either speed or heroin. She had cut down or increased her drinking. Her frame of mind was optimistic or pessimistic. Of her acquaintances 14 knew that she was using in the months just before her death and 22 did not. This is the general tenor of Buried Alive: The Biography of Janis Joplin.

title: FETAL HEARTBEAT SUBJECT OF STUDY
description: A Los Angeles doctor has reported finding a high rate of irregular fetal heartbeat during the labor of poor mothers who appeared healthy. The rate of such fetal distress was almost as high as that for mothers whose medical hiStories indicated a high risk of complication in pregnancy.

title: JUDGE IS ACQUITTED OF BRIBERY CHARGE
description: MIAMI, Aug. 14  Dade County Circuit Judge Jack Turner was acquitted here to day of a bribery charge by a jury that had deliberated less than one hour.

title: FAMILIES WELCOME FORT WORTH FIVE
description: The Fort Worth Five returned to New York yesterday after being released for the second time from a Texas jail where they were being held for refusing to tell a grand jury about an alleged gun deal with the Irish Republican Army.

title: MORE PRICE RISES SET BY COMPANIES ON KEY PRODUCTS
description: The trickle of price increasee that began Monday when the Nixon Administration's price freeze gave way to Phase swelled to a steady stream yesterday.

title: Mrs. Oliver Gains in. U.S. Amateur Golf
Economy in Precarious Times
description: These are precarious times for the American economy. A boom is in its final stages. Interest rates are soaring. Commodity prices are skyrocketing. The stock market is depressed.

title: Mr. Agnew Cooperates
description: Vice President Agnew has made precisely the right decision in agreeing to cooperate fully in the investigation which Federal prosecutors are conducting into allegations of political corruption in Maryland during his term as Governor.

title: CREDITORS OF ROLLS TO GET $66MILLION
description: LONDON, Aug. 14 (Reuters) Unsecured creditors and worker shareholders of the RollsRoyce Company, which encountered financial difficulties in 1971 and left shareholders and creditors little hope of recouping their money, will receive payments totaling more than $66million, it was announced today.

title: Gunfire From a Car Injures Three Men On Bronx Sidewalk,
description: Three men standing on Bronx sidewalk were injured by shots fired from a passing car last night, according to the police, who said the vehicle roared away after the shooting.

title: Roundup: A's Stop Cepeda and Beat Red Sox, 10
description: The Boston Red Sox are fading fast in the American League's Eastern Division race, and part of the trouble lies with Carlton Fisk, the AllStar catcher, who has been fighting a batting slump.

title: Officials Plan for Use of Highway Funds
description: Transportation officials in the metropolitan area began, detailed planning yesterday for using the funds in the $23bi1lion federal highwaymass transit bill and said the money would buy new highways new buses and some new masstransit facilities.

title: The 25th Amendment
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14This city has been living on surprises for so long that it has a had case of the jitters. What was unthinkable a few days ago is in this morning's headlines, and Vice President Agnew is only the latest object of this prevailing pessimism.

title: Two Filipino Courts to Try 10 Accused of Plot to Murder Marcos
description: MANILA, Aug. 14Two military tribunals have been assigned to try 10 persons, including prominent Filipinos and three Americans, on charges of attempting to kill Presiident Ferdinand E. Marcos, informed sources said today.

title: Outrageous Exploitation
description: BURLINGTON, Vt.The Watergate affair has been outrageously exploited by both the American press and the Congress. It all adds up to a vicious political stunt, an antiNixon vendetta which is utterly appalling in its depth of hatred and recrimination.

title: Jet Defense Is Typified By Elliott
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Aug. 14  John Elliott,.the Jets defensive taclile, took a business trip from his home in Warren, Tex., to New York during the offseason, visited about three shops and sorebody recognized him in two.

title: ATTICA GROUP SEEKS DATA ON JURY SETUP
description: BUFFALO, Aug. 14 (AP)The juryselection process in Erie County has been challenged by an organization representing some prisoners accused of having committed crimes during the Attica prison riot.

title: Nixon s Mood Stirs Anxiety
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14A White House official who recently saw President Nixon expressed concern the other da) that Mr. Nixon seemed to be committed to a hardline defense of his Administration in the Watergate scandals.

title: Cruise Ship Runs Aground For Second Time in Month
description: ST. THOMAS, Virgin Islands, Aug. 14, (Reuters)The British cruise ship Canberra, which ran aground last month off Granada, West Indies, ran aground here tonight.

title: Nixon's Popularity in Gallup Poll Declines to 31%, the Lowest Point for an American President in 20 Years
description: As the nation waited for President Nixon's latest statement on the Watergate scandal, the Gallup Poll reported yesterday that his popularity had plummeted to the lowest point for any American President in 20 years.

title: 3 HELD IN TIER FROM HOTELS HERE
description: More than $200,000 worth of stolen goods, checks am jewelry were confiscated late Monday by the police as the arrested three persons the said were in part responsible for a number of hotel burglar ies in recent weeks.

title: Bombs Hardly Hurt Reds, A Reported Defector Says
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Aug. 14 (UPI)A soldier identified as a rebel who defected to the Cambodian Government side said today that six months of intense American bombings in Cambodia has inflicted little damage on insurgent troops.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Sargent. 41. Is Named Dean Of Suffolk's Law School
description: Prof. David J. Sargent of Medford, Mass., has been named dean of the Suffolk University School of Law in Boston. The appointment of the 41yearold faculty member was announced by President Thomas Fulham.

title: Merger Seen No Closer
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y. Aug. 14Walter Kennedy placed a damper today on the possibility of a merger between the National and American Basketball Associations. The N.B.A. commissioner, at a news conference before the annual Maurice Stokes memorial basketball game at Kutsher's Country Club, said, The stumbling block remains the option clause. Our owners feel the option clause is must for the future of the N.B.A. They felt that way two years ago when we joined the A.B.A. in asking Congress for permission to merge. Nothing that has reached the commissioner's office indicates their position has changed.

title: NIXON WILL SPEAK TO NATION TONIGHT
6 BROOKLYN YOUTHS SEIZED IN GANG FIGHT
description: Six youths were arrested in the Williamsburg section of Brooklyn yesterday afternoon when neighbors called in the police to break up a rumble involving about 75 members of four youth gangs, all described as troublesome, the Brooklyn police said. No injuries were reported.

title: BEAME URGES A RISE IN GUNPERMIT FEES
description: Controller Abraham D Beame called yesterday for graduated scale of fees for ap plicants for more than one long gun and a tightening o the fiscal practices of the city' Firearms Control Board, which issues longgun permits.

title: Car Sales Up 3.1% In Aug. 110 Period; Chrysler Off 14.2%
description: DETROIT, Aug. 14 Americans are continuing to buy new cars in record numbers.

title: OTB Weighing Legal Version of the Numbers Game
description: Televised harness races whose numbersgame format could produce cheering such as C'mon 50.6 are being considered by the Offtrack Betting Corporation.

title: Mrs. Wenk Married to Robb M. DeGraff
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Aug. 14  Mrs. Patricia McCullough Wenk of Darien was married here this evening to Robb M. DeGraff, an advertising manager with E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co. in Wilmington, Del.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: The Whitney Museum of American Art will increase its admission fee on weekends, and holidays from $1 to $1.50, beginning Sept. 1. Like the Museum of Modern Art, which plans this week to raise its fee to $2, an increase of 25c, the Whitney's operating budget has been subject to increasing deficits.

title: Safety Law on 74 Cars Goes Into Effect Today
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 (AP)A Federal law requiring all 1974 model cars to be equipped with air bags or with devices that keep the car from starting unless the seat belts are fastened goes into effect tomorrow.

title: Peekskill Gets Grant
description: State Housing Commissioner Lee Goodwin has approved a $278,483 grant for two neighborhood improvement projects in the City of Peekskill. She said the money would be used for the rehabilitation of housing, new sidewalks, curbs and street lights, tree planting and landscaping, and new park facilities.

title: Teacher's Request For Pistol Permit Leads to an Arrest
description: A 28yearold high school teacher who applied for a pistol permit and invited license bureau policemen into his apartment to discuss his application ended up in the 24th Precinct station house yesterday afternoon, booked on several charges of violating local gun laws.

title: Nettles's Homer Helps Yanks to 72 Triumph
SALMONELLA DRIVE IS URGED BY ED.A.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14An intensive public education campaign to reduce the estimated total of two million cases of salmonella poisoning a year was recommended today by officials of the Department of Agriculture and the Food and Drug Administration.

title: Aluminum Pact Expected to Produce 4Year Peace
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 14The United Steelworkers of America and the nation's three largest aluminum producers today reached a landmark agreement that is expected to forestall feast and famine cycles of production and assure labor peace until the summer of 1977.

title: 7 Hurt, 2 Missing In Lodi Explosion At Chemical Plant
description: LODI, N. J., Aug. 14Seven men were. injured and at least two others were missing after an explosion rocked a chemical plant near busy Route 46 here today. Five of the in jured were in critical condition at Hackensack Hospital last night, but all were expected to live.

title: Bridge: Interference With the Bidding By Opponents Can Aid Enemy
CAPITAL AREA HIT
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Wednesday, Aug. 15  Amerdean warplanes carried out intense bombing yesterday around this beleaguered capital in the last hours before the official end of more than a decade of United States combat involvement in Southeast Asia.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: PLYMOUTH, England, Aug. 14 (AP)Two Big American yachts slipped away from nearly 300 challengers in the Fastnet race today and appeared to have the ocean classic between them as they neared the finish. The 61foot Sorcery, ineligible to win the Admiral's Cup because she one foot over the specifications, was sighted passing Wolf Rock, 65 miles from the finish. She is owned by Jim French Baldwin of Locust Valley, L. I.

title: U.S. EMPLOYES DROP BY 40,822 IN YEAR
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 (UPI)The number of persons on the federal payroll, both civilian and military, dropped 40,822 during the fiscal year ending last June 30, a Congressional report said today.

title: Equity Financing
description: A special offering of 241,700 shares of Coleman Company common at 19 per share was continued yesterday by Bear Sterns & Co. The company's stock closed at 18, down 1 on the American Stock Exchange.

title: CAPITAL AREA HIT
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Wednesday, Aug. 15  American warplanes carried out intense bombing yesterday around this beleaguered capital in the last hours before the official end of more than a decade of United States combat involvement in Southeast Asia.

title: People and Business
description: Charles H. Townes, a professor of physics at the University of California at Berkeley, who won the Nobel Prize in 1964, was named yesterday to the board of directors of the General Motors Corporation.

title: Mean Guy Thieves Get Central Park's Ugly Duck
description: Hans Christian Andersen's Ugly Duckling, one of themost popular statues in Central Park, was stolen from its granite base last week, andan intensive search by detectives and Parks Department personnel has so far failed to find it.

title: MARKET SLUMPS FOR THIRD SESSION; Disappointing Profit Results of Procter & Gamble Seen as Factor in the Drop; DOW INDEX IS OFF 12.49; Response Early in Session to Higher Discount Rate Puts Pressure on Trading; STOCKS DECLINE FOR THIRD SESSION; Continued From Page 47
description: Rising interest rates combined with disappointing profit results for Procter & Gamblea favorite Wall Street glamour issue  to send the stock market yesterday to its third big successive decline.

title: State Court Upsets Civil Obscenity Law
description: The state's civil statute on obscenity was ruled unconstitutional yesterday by Justice Abraham J. Gellinoff of the State Supreme Court in Manhattan.

title: Nearby Residents Assail Lodi Chemical Plants
description: LODI, N. J., Aug. 14Residents of the small homes that circle the Washine Division chemical plant, where seven workmen were injured in morning explosion, expressed fear, anger and frustration today.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Thieves at Cornell University in Ithaca, N. Y., stole rifles, 11 handguns, three telescopic sights, five bayonets and a grenade launcher from two R.O.T.C. storage areas the campus.

title: Labor Leader to Be Named To Oppose Peron in Election
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 14 (Reuters)  The labor leader, Agustin Tosco, will be nominated to oppose Gen. Juan Perim in Argentina's presidential elections on Sept. 23, it was announced here today.

title: Two Holidays Proclaimed
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 (AP) President Nixon signed proclamations today designating Oct. 8 as Columbus Day and Oct. 11 General Pulaski's Memorial Day. Both proclamations were requested by Congress.

title: Albert van Sand Is Dead at 92; Edited DanishLanguage Weekly
description: Albert van Sand, who was editor of the Danish weekly newspaper Nordlyset (Northern Light), from 1920 until he retired in 1953, died yesterday in Waterbury, Conn., Hospital. He was 92 years old and lived at 137 East 38th Street and in Southbury, Conn.

title: Turbaned Motorcyclist Given a Fine in Britain
description: LONDON, Aug. 14A Sikh was fined $35 today for refusing, on account of his religion, to wear a crash helmet while motorcycling.

title: Nixon Asks All Steps in Agnew Case
WELFARE RULES BEING TIGHTENED
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 (AP) Secret state investigations of welfare applicants and recipients, which were abolished in the nineteensixties, were reestablished today by a new set of Federal regulations.

title: Mayer Wins By 61, 63 At Merion
description: HAVERFORD, Pa., Aug. 14 Topseeded Alex Mayer, arriving at 2 A.M. on a 24hour flight from Lebanon, began his quest for the Pennsylvania grass tennis championship with 61 63 victory over Tom Kriess of Los Angeles today at the Merion Cricket Club.

title: Mrs. Court Likes Her Chances for Open
description: Sparked by her victory Sunday over Mrs. Billie Jean King, the Wimbledon champion, Mrs. Margaret Court is eager for the United States Open tennis championships at Forest Hills.

title: POLICE IN 2 CITIES ACCUSED OF BIAS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14The Justice Department, in two separate lawsuits filed today, charged the police departments of Chicago and Buffalo with discriminating in employment against blacks, Spanishsurnamed personi:, and women.

title: Atlantic Divers View Volcanic Activity
description: PARIS, Aug. 14Three dives have been made into the midAtlantic canyon where the world's surface is being torn apart and born anew. For the first time human eyes have gazed directly on the evidence for this process beneath the sea.

title: Confusion in Cambodia
The Bellhop Picks Up Tips From Auerbach
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., Aug. 14A year made a big difference in the uniform and the reception Phil Hankinson received today at Kutsher's Country Club. Last August the 6foot7inch University of Pennsylvania star was bellhop checking in the likes of Cazzie Russell and Rick Barry of the Golden State Warriors. Spencer Haywood of the Seattle SuperSonics and Red Auerbach, president and general manager of the Boston Celtics.

title: Wreckage of Bomber Foundin Coast Ravine
description: BIG SUR, Calif., Aug. 14 (AP)Two youths hiking in a steep ravine found the wreckage of a B25 bomber that the authorities say may have crashed there 30 years ago.

title: POLICE TO WIDEN VILLAGE PATROL
description: City officials announced yesterday that additional police officers would be stationed in Greenwich Village bececause of the knife slaying of a young woman in the area last week I and complaints by residents that an influx of outsiders was disrupting the neighborhood.

title: Agnew Offers to Answer Any Questions in Inquiry
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 14Vice President Agnew offered today to answer questions personally and open his records to the United States Attorney here who is investigating allegations of extortion, bribery, tax fraud and conspiracy that allegedly took place when Mr. Agnew was Governor of Maryland.

title: Agnew Offers to Answer Any Questions in Inquiry
ROYAL INNS SLATED TO REPAY $500,000
description: SAN DIEGO, Aug. 14 (AP)Financially troubled Royal Inns of America, Inc., will start paying its debts at the end of this month, ending fivemonth moratorium, it was announced today.

title: About the Yankees:
description: After the Yankees play California this afternoon, they'll begin their final visit to Western Division cities. The twoweek trip will take them to Dallas, Kansas City, Oakland and Anaheim. They'll return home Aug. 31, at which point they'll have 30 games remaining, all against Eastern clubs.... Every fan who attends the last game, against Detroit Sept. 30, will receive a 32minute record titled Sounds of Yankee Stadium, produced by Fleetwood Record Company and narrated by Mel Allen. The record will feature great moments in Yankee Stadium history.... Bobby Murcer was named most popular Yankee by the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association. He'll probably get a speeding ticket on the way home, someone cracked.... The Yankees were still shaking their heads in wonder over the appearance of Alice Cooper, the rock n roll star, who received a specially made bat from the Louisville Slugger people at the Stadium Monday night. Why don't you give him a try? You never can tell what'll turn a club around, an observer said to Manager Ralph Houk. That won't, said the manager, staring at Alice, who was dressed in sneakers (without socks), tattered short shorts, no shirt, a windbreaker with the Yankee emblem and long scraggly hair.

title: Head of Cycle Gang Is Accused Of Possessing Bomb and Pistol
description: The president of a New York chapter of a motorcycle gang was arrested last night in Brooklyn after the police said they had discovered a grenadelike explosive device, a revolver and about 80 rounds of ammunition in the car he was driving.

title: NARCOTICS THEFT REPORTED SOLVED
description: Maurice H. Nadjari, the special state prosecutor, said yesterday that authorities investigating the theft of more than $70million worth of narcotics from Police Department custody now know exactly how it was done and who did it but had not yet gathered enough evidence for arrests.

title: State Court Upsets Civil Obscenity Law
NARCOTICS THEFT REPORTED SOLVED
description: Maurice H. Nadjari, the special state prosecutor, said yesterday that authorities in vestigating the theft of more than $70million worth of narcotics from Police Department custody now know exactly how it was done and who did it but had not yet gathered enough evidence for arrests.

title: Gas Worries Said to Cut Visits to National Parks
description: Visits to most of the country's major national parks have declined this summer, in what park officials see as the first strong evidence that many Americans have changed their 1973 vacation plans because of threats of a gasoline shortage.

title: Reputed Mafia Figure Gets 10Month Term in Nassau
description: MINEOLA, LI., Aug. 14 (UPI) Michael Sabella, a 62yearold reputed captain in the Mafia crime family formerly headed by Joseph Bonnano, was sentenced today to a 10month term in the Nassau County jail for criminal contempt of grand jury.

title: Court Bars Perez Jimenez From Venezuela Elections
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Aug. 14 (Reuters)The Venezuelan Supreme Court today banned a former President, Marcos Perez Jimenez, who ruled from 1948 to 1958, from seeking the presidency again in elections here this December, a court spokesman said.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
Food Fair Is Target of F.T.C. Complaint
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 (AP) The Federal Trade Commission issued a complaint today against the nation's fourthlargest retail food chain, alleging it had imposed anticompetitive agreements on tenants of the 48 shopping centers controlled, by its subsidiary.

title: SUPPORT PLEDGED
description: WASHINGTON, Wednesday, Aug. 15American bombing in Cambodia officially ended last midnight with the Nixon Administration still pledging to do everything possible within the law to support the Government of President Lon Nol.

title: Decision Is Reversed
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 The Federal Reserve Board approved today the acquisition of G.A.C. Finance, Inc. of Allentown, Pa., by the Bank America Corporation, holding company parent of the Bank of America, largely in order to avoid the collapse of the acquired company.

title: Christmas at White House To Feature a Live Tree
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 (AP) Ecologyminded families who have switched from cut to live Christmas trees will be joined by the White House this year.

title: 2 Winners Caught by Surprise
description: Dick Brooks cried so hard he couldn't see the checkered flag. Wally Dallenbach didn't even know he had won.

title: When Severe Illness Plays Havoc With Family Life
description: A catastrophic illness can reduce a middleincome family to poverty in less than two years, according to a study released today by Cancer Care, Inc., and the National Cancer Foundation, Inc.

title: Two L.I. Children Drown In Backyard Swim Pools
description: RIVERHEAD, L.I., Aug. 14 (UPI)Two children drowned in backyard swimming pools in separate incidents, in Suffolk County today.

title: False Conflict
description: When the members of the Constitutional Convention of 1787 created this country's structure of government, they did not divide it into separate, watertight compartments. The power of governing was shared among the executive, legislative and judicial branches  each of them checking, balancing and restraining the other two.

title: 2 Virgin Islands. Jurors Charge Pressure For Slayings Verdict
description: CHRISTIANSTED, V. I., Aug. 14Two members of the jury that convicted five young blacks yesterday of eight killings at a luxurious golf club here last fall said today in notarized statements that they had been pressured into reaching the guilty verdict.

title: Rapist on Probation Held in Slaying of Jersey Girl
People Mystified as Direct U.S. RoleEnds at a Time of Military Adversity
description: As the orders went out to stop the American bombing of Cambodia, the end of direct United States military involvement therelike the beginning was wrapped in controversy and confusion.

title: Mrs. Court Likes Her Chances for Open Mayer Wins
description: Sparked by her victory Sunday over Mrs. Billie Jean King, the Wimbledon champion, Mrs. Margaret Court is eager for the United States Open tennis championships at Forest Hills.

title: Policeman on Trial for Selling Marijuana
description: Two tape recordings of conversations between a suspended policeman accused of selling $35 worth of marijuana and the undercover police officer who allegedly bought the marijuana were played in court yesterday.

title: Dealers Disagree on Significance of Increase
description: LONDON, Aug. 14 (AP)The American dollar jumped to sixweek peak today. Gold fell $7 an ounce to a threemonth low.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Lady Reading Dies at 78; Women's Equality Leader
description: LONDON, Aug. 14  Eva, Dowager Marchioness of Reading, president of the British Section of the World Jewish Congress and a member of its World Executive, died today at her home at Thakenham, Sussex. Her age was 78.

title: Goings On in the Barnyard
description: When The Times asked me to report on what's being said in my barnyard about Watergate, I immediately sought an audience with the goose. She is sore at me at the moment but is always willing to talk.

title: 3 HELD IN THEFTS FROM HOTELS HERF
description: More than $200,000 worth of stolen goods, checks and jewelry were confiscated late Monday by the police as they arrested three persons they said were in part responsible for a number of hotel burglaries in recent weeks.

title: Nixon Likely to Stay, British Odds Indicate
description: LONDON, Aug. 14 (UPI)The British bookmaking concern of Ladbrokes and Company, Ltd., began offering today what it described as fairly strong odds that President Nixon would survive the Watergate scandal.

title: Living and Working Together: Little Room for Marital Stress
description: Married couples who not only live together, but work together too, seem to be on the increase as more women become involved in careers. Obviously, being together almost constantly raises some special questions. How, for example, do the couples decide who does what at work? And, since they both work, who does what at home? Do they feel competitive? Do they ever need to get away from one another?

title: Wretched Tapes (cont.)
description: NEW HAVENThe question about those wretched Presidential tapes is not whether the President requires a large measure of privacy of consultation and decision making if he is to function effectively. Of course he does, no less than do judges, or Congressional committees, or individual Senators and Congressmen. The Constitution does not say so in precise terms, but the constitutional reason of the thing does say so.

title: U. S. Calls Abduction of South Korean Deplorable
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14A State Department spokesman called the kidnapping of Kim Dae Jung a deplorable inci dent today and voiced hope that authorities in South Korea would find and punish those responsible for the abduction of the Opposition political leader.

title: 750 Pounds of Frozen Fish Burned After Trailer Fire
description: SOUTHBURY, Conn., Aug. 14 (AP)At least 750 pounds of frozen fish were destroyed when the brakes of a tractortrailer caught fire on Interstate 84, the state police reported.

title: BOARD IN NEWBURGH REJECTS BUSING PLAN
description: NEWBURGH, N. Y. Aug. 15 (AP)The Newburgh Y., Board of Education voted unanimously tonight to reject a schoolintegration proposal by the State Education Commissioner, Ewald B. Nyquist.

title: Gas Discovery Is Cited
description: The Continental Oil Company and the National Coal Board, Ltd., yesterday announced the discovery of commercial quantities of gas in their well 49/124 drilled in the British. North Sea within the area which has been dedicated under the terms of the Viking Field.

title: Israel's Interception of Airliner Is Deplored by U.S. at the U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Aug. 14The United States warned Israel today in the Security Council that while national and international efforts to control terrorism must go forward, they must do so within and not outside the law.

title: A Visit to 3 European Music Festivals
description: SALZBURG, Austria, Aug. 14  Every town in Europe seems to he host to a music festival these days, and the reasons are clearly as touristic as they are artistic. But a visit this summer to the big three Central European festivals suggests that they, too, are not immune from problems of creeping commercialization and declining artistic standards.

title: U.S. Newsprint Supply Is Getting Tighter
description: The supply of newsprint for newspapers in the United States is currently tight and likely to become more so, according to industry and newspaper sources.

title: Migrants File Protest
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Aug. 14 (AP)About 1,000 migrant workers in Western Massachusetts have signed a letter to the Puerto Rican government. protesting poor working conditions. The letter also criticized negotiating procedures by the Puerto Rican Department of Labor, which handles contracts for the workers with shade tobacco growers, according to the director of the New England Farm Workers Council, Marcel M. Ringawa.

title: 4 Americans Among Dead In Spanish Air Disaster
description: MADRID, Aug. 14 (UPI)Four, possibly five Americans died in the crash of a Spanish Aviaco Caravelle jet near Lal Coruna yesterday that took a total of 86 lives, the United. States Embassy said yesterday.
