title: A.F.L.C.I.O. Parley Oct. 18
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 (AP) The American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations today set Oct. 18 for the start of its 10th Constitutional Convention, which will be held at the Americana Hotel in Bal Harbour, Fla. The convention will remain in session from day to day until the business of the convention shall have been completed, the announcement said.

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. California Angels, at Yankee Stadium. River Avenue and 16Ist Street, the Bronx, P.M.

title: DR. LAURA A. KOLK
description: GLEN COVE, L.I., Aug. 14Dr. Laura A. Kolk, who retired in 1961 as associate professor of biology after teaching at Brooklyn College since its founding in 1930, died Saturday in Community Hospital. She was 82.years old and lived on Hendrick Avenue.

title: BANKRUPTCY STEP AT COLLINS &
description: The leading dealers in commodity options, Collins & Day Group, Inc., sought protection from creditors yesterday by filing under Chapter XI of the Federal Bankruptcy Act in United States District Court here.

title: Dollar Value Climbs
description: The value of the dollar jumped to its highest level in six weeks in Europe yesterday. The price of gold fell $7 an ounce to $95, its lowest level in three months. Prices on the New York Stock Exchange dropped sharply for the third day. Page 47.

title: COOP CITY WEIGHS REPAIR OF CRACKS
description: Officials of Coop City, the massive cooperative apartment development in the Bronx, are seeking to determine who should bear the $600,000 cost of repairing large cracks that developed in the walls of 400 apartments before the statesupervised project was completed last year.

title: Samuel L. Rosenberry, 70, Authority on Securities Law
description: CHATHAM, Mass., Aug. 14 Samuel Landfair Rosenberry, a senior partner in the law firm of Milbank, Tweed, Hadley & McCloy, died here of cancer yesterday at his summer home. His age was 70 and lived at 135 East 71st Street, New York.

title: Police Seek Aid to Identify Youth Slain in a Stairwell
description: The detectives of the Fourth Homicide and Assault Squad are seeking to identify a young man, possibly black or Hispanic. who was found slain on a secondfloor landing of stairwell at 1550 York Avenue, near 81st Street. last week.

title: Commander of Key City That Fell Is Arrested
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Aug. 14 (UPI) Cambodian commander of a key road junction city that fell to insurgent troops two days ago has been arrested and jailed, the high command said today.

title: PRICES ON AMEX CONTINUE TO DROP
Red Smith
description: It was the middle of August, 22 years ago, when the New York Giants, trailing the Brooklyn Dodgers by 13 games, began the devouring rush that brought these tribal enemies to the season's end in a dead heat and set up the playoff that Bobby Thomson won with a home run bigger than any of Babe Ruth's 714, bigger even than Henry Aaron's 715th will be to anybody except Henry. The Little Miracle of Coogan's Bluff it was called by the cartoonist Willard Mullin, for that race was even harder to believe than the one the Miracle Braves had made in 1914. That Boston team had to make up 14 games but had much longer to do it, starting from last place on July 4. After the holiday the threeman pitching staff of Dick Rudolph, Lefty Tyler and Bill James got hot that by midAuguston the 17th to be exactthe Braves were only three games behind the Giants.

title: RIZZO IS BAFFLED AT LIE TEST RESULT
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 14 (Reuters)  Mayor Frank L. Rizzo reported today he was baffled at learning he had failed a lie detector test on local political dispute.

title: Teacher's Request For Pistol Permit Leads to an Arrest
description: A 28yearold high school teacher who applied for a pistol permit and invited license bureau policemen into his apartment to discuss his application ended up in the 24th Precinct station house yesterday afternoon, booked on several charges of violating local gun laws.

title: ETTA REHAHN
description: YONKERS, Aug. 14  Mrs. Etta Rehahn Polchinski, who had sung in opera as a soloist with the Metropolitan Opera Company and over radio station WOR in New York, died today at her home, 39 Cypress Street, Her age was 78. She was the widow of Edward P. Polchinski, operator of a monument and cemetery works at Hawthorne.

title: CHRYSLER PLANT SHUT IN ASSAULT Security Men Are Attacked After Worker's SitIn
description: DETROIT, Aug. 14A Chrysler automobile stamping plant was shut down here today after two plant security men were assaulted when a discharged employe closed a framing department by sitting on an assembly line. A number of workers remained in the closed plant.

title: Trial of Gainesville Eight Put Off by Juror's Illness
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Aug. 14 (UPI)The conspiracy trial of the Gainesville Eight, now in its third week, was delayed today when a juror became ill.

title: U.S. Aide of Exiled Bishop Is Deported by South Africa
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Aug. 14The South African Government today deported the American secretary of an Anglican bishop it had previously exiled.

title: EFFICIENCY URGED IN USE OF PONE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14Conservation is the key to meeting the country's surging demand for energy while protecting the environment, according to a report released to day by the Council on Environ. mental Quality.

title: 359 U.F.W. PICKETERS RELEASED FROM JAIL
description: FRESNO, Calif., Aug. 14Dorothy Day, the New York Roman Catholic radical leader, and 358 other supporters and members of the United Farm Workers union were released last night from the Fresno County jail, where they had been held for up to two weeks for violating court orders restricting picketing activities.

title: Giants King Rat Is Ready to Run With the Pack
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, N.J., Aug 14The New York Giants Rat Pack will begin nibbling in earnest for the first time Sunday against the Jets, and Ron Johnson, the king rat, is hungry.

title: Attorney Denies Magruder Will Plead Guilty Tomorrow
description: Jeb Stuart Magruder, former deputy director of President Nixon's 1972 campaign committee, will plead guilty tomorrow to one count of conspiracy to obstruct justice for his involvement in the Watergate scandal, C.B.S. News reported last night.

title: 2 Youths Indicted in Texas Killings
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 14 (UPI) Elmer Wayne Henley and David Owen Brooks, who confessed they had participated in a homosexual's sextorture slayings of 27 boys, were indicted for murder today by a Harris County grand jury.

title: POLICE STUDYING KENNEDY FE
description: NANTUCKET, Mass., Aug. The police on this resor island said today they wer continuing their investigatioi of an accident yesterday which an auto driven by Jo seph P. Kennedy 3d overturneon a country road, injuring hi. younger brother David anc five young women.

title: MORE PRICE RISES SET BY COMPANIES ON KEY PRODUCTS
description: The trickle of price increases that began Monday when the Nixon Administration's price freeze gave way to Phase 4 swelled to a steady stream yesterday.

title: Mean Guy Thieves Get Central Park's Ugly Duck
description: Hans Christian Andersen's Ugly Duckling, one of the most popular statues in Central Park, was stolen from its granite base last week, and an intensive search by detectives and Parks Department personnel has so far failed to find it.

title: FRED GIPSON DIES; POPULAR AUTHOR
description: MASON, Tex., Aug. 14 (AP) Fred Gipson, the author of HoundDog Man, Old Yeller and other adventure stories written for both children and adults, died this morning at his ranch home near here. He was 65 years old.

title: BOY, 5, AND MAN, 53, ARE KILLED BY CART
description: MOUNT VERNON, N. Y., Aug. 14A 5yearold boy and a middleaged man were killed here this morning when a car driven by a man on his way to court to answer a drunken driver charge mounted the curb at a busy intersection and smashed into a group of pedestrians.

title: Procter &
BISHOP MINIHAN OF BOSTON IS DEAD
description: BOSTON, Aug. 14Auxiliary Bishop Jeremiah F. Minihan of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Boston died today while on vacation in Dublin. His age was 70.

title: John Broderick, Ad Executive With FrankLaw, Is Dead at 69
description: SUN CITY, Ariz., Aug. 14John P. Broderick, a retired New York financial public relations consultant and executive, died yesterday at his home here.

title: IRAN IS ACCEPTED FOR TRUCE BODY
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 (AP) Iran has been accepted as a member of the International Commission of Control and Supervision in Vietnam, the Iranian Ambassador, Ardeshir Zahedi, said today.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 (Reuters)Earnings and the rate of return for the 65 major United States railroads impioved in both the second quarter of this year and for the year that ended June 30, according to a report issued today by the Interstate Commerce Commission.

title: Rapist on Probation Held in Slaying of Jersey Girl
description: FLEMINGTON, N. J., Aug 14 A suspect who the police said was on probation after serving a term for rape was charged today with murdering a 17yearold girl near her family's wooded, rural home in East Amwell.

title: 2 Mozartean Temptations
description: In performing Mozart, two opposing temptations must. be resisted. On one hand, whether early or late, his music must not he romanticized and poured into the 19thcentury expressive mold; on the other, it must not he trivialized by overemphasizing the rococo aspects that underlie so much of his work.

title: Mayer Wins By 61, 63 At Merion
NORWAY EXPELS AN ISRAELI AIDE
description: OSLO, Norway, Aug. 14 (AP) The Norwegian Government today expelled an Israeli Embassy security officer accused of hiding two Israeli fugitives wanted in the slaying of a Moroccan.

title: Kenneth G. Southard Dies; Advertising Executive, 36
description: Kenneth G. Southard, a vice president of Kenyon & Eckhardt Inc., New York advertising agency, died Sunday at Lenox Hospital after a brief illness. He was 36 years old and lived in Port Washington, L. I.

title: Multinational Units Absolved of Major Blame in Drain
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14Large United States corporations were not the main culprits in the massive attack on the dollar in the world's currency markets in the first three months of this year, the Treasury has concluded on the basis of new figures.

title: DR. SIDNEY SMEDRESMAN
description: Dr. Sidney Smedresman, a physician who had also been a supervising school physician for 20 years, died Saturday, apparently of a heart attack, at his home, 14743 77th Road, Kew Garden Hills, Queens. He was 62 years old.

title: Israel's Interception of Airliner Is Deplored by U.S. at the U.N.
GEN. S. G. POPLAVSKY SOVIET COMMANDER
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 14  Gen. Stanislav G. Poplaysky, Soviet commander of Polish grounds forces after World War II, is dead here at the age of 71.

title: Equity to Sell Unit
description: The Liberty Savings and Loan Association, a subsidiary of the scandalridden Equity Funding Corporation of America, announced yesterday that Equity Funding has agreed to sell Liberty to the Coast Federal Savings and Loan Association for $12.6million in cash. Liberty said the agreement to purchase its assets and assume its Iiabilities is subject to approval by the Federal Home Loan Bank and the California Savings and Loan Commissioner.

title: SUIT FOR $2MILLION ACCUSES THE TIMES
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 14A damage suit of more than $2million has been filed in United States District Court in Tampa, Ha., against The New York Times by ComCorp, Clevelandbased publishers of the Polk Shopper's Shopping News, Lakeland, Fla.

title: Two Perons or One?
description: Juan Peron's acceptance of his party's nomination for President of Argentina was hardly in doubt. What has surprised many Argentines and shocked thousands of Mr. Perdn's loyal supporters is his announced decision to go into the election next month with his third wife as his vicepresiilential running mate.

title: Rescue Craft Set, but Skylab 2 Gets Green Light
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 14 (AP)Space officials said today that the Skylab 2 crew would be permitted to complete their record 59day space mission. A rescue craft, if needed, will not be launched before Sept. 25.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: The Whitney Museum of American Art will increase its admission fee on weekends, and holidays from $1 to $1.50, beginning Sept. 1. Like the Museum of Modern Art, which plans this week to raise its fee to $2, an increase of 25c, the Whitney's operating budget has been subject to increasing deficits.

title: 28 Food Outlets Cited as Health Code Violators
French Police Seize a Watch Factory That Was Run by Its Striking Workers
description: PARIS, Aug. 14The national police seized a watch factory from striking workers to day, provoking a test of strength that could lead to labor turmoil across France.

title: CARLYLE BLACK, 86, LED AMERICAN CAN
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn. Aug, 15Carlyle H. Black, who retired in 1952 as chairman of the American Can Company, died yesterday in a Stamford nursing home. He was 86 years old and lived at 84 Ferris Hill Road.

title: Mrs. Trudeau Slowly Moves Into the Spotlight
description: OTTAWA  The parties parades and airport ceremonies surrounding the Commonwealth conference and two visits by Queen Elizabeth this summer have given the Canadian public and Mrs. Pierre Elliott Trudeau their first real chance to get to know each other, and the public, at least, seems delighted.

title: JAMES L, HARRISON
description: James L. Harrison, a retired vice president of the First National City Bank, died on Tuesday in Martha's Vineyard, Mass. He was 77 years old and lived at 1075 Park Avenue.

title: Israeli Forces Say North Koreans Pilot Some Egyptian Jets
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 15 (AP)The Israeli military command said today that 10 to 20 pilots from North Korea were flying Jet fighters for the Egyptian Air Force.

title: HAYFEVER SEASON LOOKING BAD HERE
description: Allergists are forecasting bad season for hayfever suf ferers because wet weather ha: spurred the growth of rag. weed, the plant that produce: the most irritating pollen.

title: Too Many High Officers In Military. Mondale Says
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 (CPI)  Senator Walter F. Mondale, Democrat of Minnesota, said tolay that the military was so topheavy with highranking officers that its grade structure was shaped like a balloon rather than a pyramid.

title: Franc's Rise Costs a Shoe Town Lobs
description: ROMANS, France, Aug. 9 The international monetary crisis has struck this shoemanufacturing town in the Rhone Valley, with a working population of 10,000 suddenly facing 1400 fewer jobs.

title: Richardson Briefed Agnew on Evidence
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15Attorney General Elliot L. Richardson met with Vice President Agnew early this month and outlined the substance of the evidence gathered by Federal prosecutors in Baltimore against the Vice President.

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesteday was:
Books of The Times
description: With some bitterness, a lawyer acquaintance vehemently expounded recently on the evils of smallclaims courts: how lawyer cannot win a case; how it is all stacked in favor of rascally plaintiffs. The lawyer's animosity was understandable, for smallclaims courtsif they are properly runare designed to make it easy for the individual to bring suit without expense and without a lawyer. They are informal courts or, as the lawyer put it, they often pay little attention to the law. Douglas Matthews, the author of Sue the B*st*rds: The Victim's Handbook, puts it in another light when he discusses a smallclaims court judge who felt that ignoring the etter of the law was perfectly just in order to fulfill its basic and wasn't atraid to take a reasonable guess about the facts of the case.

title: Partygoers Gather for Evening With the Enemies
description: The moment the White House enemies list surfaced, it was inevitable that somebody would attempt to bring them together to celebrate/deplore their newly acquired status while also raising money for a cause and promoting something. Such are the ways of enterprising New Yorkers.

title: Personal Finance: Upgrading Savings
description: As if it were not confusing enough to he faced with the infinite variety of interest rates that savings banks are offering now, depositors are also finding themselves in a state of confusion over the penalties for premature withdrawals on savings certificates.

title: Stroessner Starts 5th Term
description: ASUNCION, Paraguay, Aug. 15 (AP)  Gen. Alfredo Stroessner was inaugurated as President of this South American country today for the fifth time. He has been in office 19 years, and his current term ends in 1978.

title: Girl Wounded by Terrorists In Athens Airport Attack Dies
description: MILWAUKEE, Aug. 15 (AP) Laura Kay Haack, a 16yearold Milwaukee girl injured in the Aug. 5 terrorist attack at the Athens airport, died today, her family reported.

title: U.N. Condemns Israel for Forcing Down Arab Plane
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 15The Security Council voted unanimously this afternoon to condemn Israel for intercepting a Lebanese commercial airliner last week and forcing the plane to land in Israel.

title: U.S. AIMS TO SPUR SEABED PROJECTS
description: GENEVA, Aug. 11The United States has proposed an international law that would protect underwater oil and mining investments from the kind of contract breaking that Arab producing countries have recently been inflicting on American companies.

title: BTREITE NOT YET HOUSEHOLD WORD
description: ALBANY, Aug. 15  We love you judge... oh, yes we do... we love you, judge, a group of boys and girls chanted today at a rally in Siena College for Charles D. Breitel, the RepublicanLiberal candidate for Chief Judge of the Court of Appeals.

title: SUIT ON GAS LEAKS SEEKS $1.2MILLION
description: LANSING, Mich., Aug. 15The state of Michigan sued an oil company and a driller today for $1,265,000 in damages it attributed to natural gas eruptions that forced the evacuation of the northern Michigan hamlet of Williamsburg in April and undermined buildings there.

title: People and Business
description: Bernard Cornfield was remanded in custody again yesterday in Geneva pending trial on charges of fraud, criminal mismanagement of public money and abetting speculation in connection with the mutualfund empire, Investors Overseas Services, he once headed.

title: Man, 64, Is Beaten to Death in His Queens Home
description: A 64yearold man who the police said, had a minor record of bookmaking arrests was beaten to death in the kitchen of his home in Maspeth, Queens, early yesterday morning.

title: BREZHNEV CONCEDES NO GAIN WITH CHINA
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 15Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist party leader, said today that Moscow had made no progress toward improving relations with China.

title: Error Helps Defeat Yanks, 31
description: Champing on the stub of a cigar and mulling over another loss, Ralph Houk, the Yankees manager, said yesterday: We haven't played good defensive ball. Our defense just hasn't been up to par for the last three of four weeks.

title: Mitsui Sets U.S. Deal
description: The American Metal Climax, Inc., and Mitsui & Co., Ltd., the Japanese trading company, announced yesterday an agreement in principle for Mitsui to acquire 50 per cent: interest in Amax's aluminum business for $125million. It would he the first major. purchase by Japanese interests of a stake in a large American company. Page 51.

title: Advertising: New Diet Rite Tack
description: The new advertising for the new Sugar Free Diet Rite Cola started this weekbut the company that makes the soft drink hopes it will be an old story.

title: Cox, Fillol Are Beaten At U.S. Net
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug. 15 (UPI)  Two seeded players, Mark Cox and Jaime Fillol, were eliminated in the $90,000 United States claycourt tennis championship today.

title: Hypocrisy and Hope
description: The unanimity with which the United Nations Security Council condemned Israel yesterday for skyjacking an Iraqbound passenger plane was a justified and measured response by the international community to a misguided act of illegality in the skies.

title: Iberia Will Buy U.S. Jets With Loans From Eximbank
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 (Reuters)The Spanish airline Iberia will spend $146.10 million on new airliners with the aid of loans from the United States ExportImport Bank and private sources. Eximbank announced today.

title: Air Force Lists Crew Of Final B52 Mission
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 (AP)  The Air Force made public today the names of the men who flew the last B52 mission over Cambodia, from Andersen Air Force Base on Guam, where the plane is on temporary duty from Blytheville Air Force Base in Arkansas.

title: In Dubious Battle
description: Before he became President, Richard Nixon described in Six Crises the struggle through which he puts himself in times of stress. At critical moments before and since, he has inadvertently given more revealing public glimpses of his private emotions. What is it that he has revealed?

title: New Jersey Sports
description: ELIZABETHMickey Walker, the Toy Bulldog who won the world welterweight boxing championship a half century ago, was 72 years old July 13, but he would like forget that. Walker had such a colorful career as welterweight and later middleweight champion that little can equal the thrills of the past.

title: Sniping Suspect Arrested
description: MIAMI, Aug. 15  A sniper fired on a policeman and two police cars today and was later arrested in a downtown Miami hotel, the police said. No injuries were reported. The police charged the suspect, Ramon Ramos, 45 years old, with five counts of assault with intent to commit murder.

title: Reception Is Hostile To Israel
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 15 (AP)Soviet fans derisively whistled the Israeli team all around huge Lenin Stadium tonight during opening ceremonies for the seventh World University Games.

title: MILITARY TRYING TO PLACATE CHILE
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 15Chile's armed forces have discreetly assumed the delicate mission of attempting to restore order to this troubled country, with the general approval of the ruling leftwing Popular Unity coalition and the main conservative Opposition.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: A Toast to the Lordly and Elusive Salmon
description: MARGAREE FORKS, Nova ScotiaWe fished the better salmon pools on the lower reaches of the Margaree River on Cape Breton Island with great diligence, but no fish took.

title: Political Suit, Daley Says
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 15 (UPI)Mayor Richard J. Daley today dismissed a Federal charge of discrimination against the Chicago police department as political suit. The Justice Department yesterday accused the Chicago police of discrimination in the hiring of blacks, Latins and women.

title: Judges Want an Outsider To Handle Agnew Inquiry
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 15 The chief judge of the United States District Court here, Edward S. Northrop, asked today that a judge from outside the district encompassing Maryland be appointed to handle all matters that irrvolve the investigation of Vice President Agnew so that nobody can say there's been any coverup, or something personal one way or another.

title: POLICE UNIT CUT SCORED BY BEANIE
description: Controller Abraham D. Beanie, Democratic candidate for Mayor, charged yesterday there would be 8,000 fewer arrests of drug pushers, muggers, rapists, child abusers and other offenders in the next year because of a reduction in the size of the police warrant squad.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 (AP)The Southland Corporation has agreed not to choose product lines offered in its 7Eleven convenience stores on the basis of how much suppliers buy from Southland's other subsidiaries, the Federal Trade Commission announced today. The F.T.C. had issued a complaint last year alleging that Southland had indulged in reciprocal dealing, the business equivalent you scratch my back and I'll scratch yours.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: HISTORY One way to give children two quick glimpses of American history, which might delight them and possibly confuse them a little, is to take them to the performance of Theodore Thunder and the Greedy Grabber by the Theater in a Trunk troupe (GR 77455). It will be held this morning at 11 A.M. next door to the Hamilton Grange, a historical landmark, in St. Luke's Episcopal Church, Convent Avenue and West 141st Street, Manhattan.

title: Gifted Grade Schoolers To Get Special Instruction
description: The city school system will get its first program for teaching gifted elementary school children this fall, following a vote to set up the program by the central Board of Education last night.

title: Koch Home Burglarized As He Talks With Police
description: While Representatives Edward I. Koch was meeting with the police yesterday to discuss the problems of increased crime in Greenwich Village, thieves were ransacking his apartment in Washington. The Manhattan Democrat's neighbors reported that a television set and some clothing had probably been stolen.

title: J. P. Stevens is Sued by Union For Allegedly Bugging Officers
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., Aug. 15 The Textile Workers Union of America, the Industrial Union Department of the A.F.L.C.I.O. and 19 individuals filed a suit in United States District Court here today against J. P. Stevens & Co. seeking over $71million in damages arising from alleged electronic surveillance of union officials and other persons over a threemonth period.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: A July 29 editorial complains that the Highway Trust Fund compromise reached by the HouseSenate conferees is a major victory for the highway lobby.

title: Baseball Talks Hit Roadblocl.
description: MILWAUKEE, Aug. 15 (AP) American League officials. apparently planning lastminute strategy in an effort to win approval of interleagur play, recessed tonight until tomorrow.

title: A.C.L.U. Demands End To Agnew Inquiry Leaks
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 The American Civil Liberties Union has called upon Attorney General Elliot L. Richardson to stop leaks of information to the press concerning the investigation of Vice President Agnew.

title: Effect of Bombing: It Helped, but Peace Is Still Elusive
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Aug. 15Military experts here agree that the bombing of Cambodiahalf a million tons in four and a half yearswas the only thing that kept the Government of President Lon Nol from falling, and that it slowed the impetus of the enemy offensive and prevented the insurgent forces from massing in large enough numbers to take Phnom Penh. In short, their view is that the bomb ing gave the badly disorganized Government forces some breathing time. But Western military attaches also point out that it was the sheer massiveness  not necessarily the effectivenessof the bombing that kept the enemy's hands off the capital. Whether it crippled the enemy's ability to take the country in the near future is quite a different question.

title: BLIND CHESS PLAYER MISSES A BIG UPSET
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 15 (AP)The fourthseeded chess player in the United States Open chess championship was almost upset early today by a blind chess player officially rated far below him.

title: Village Residents Press for a Crime Cleanup
description: Democratic politicians in Greenwich Village met with police officials yesterday, and Republican politicians in the area led a demonstration of 150 residents last nightall in the cause of cleansing the neighborhood of disruptive outsiders, many of them reportedly narcotics addicts.

title: U.S. Plans to Fight Orders for Papers On Pricing of Milk
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 (UPI) The Justice Department told a Federal judge today that it intended to appeal his order to turn over several Presidential documents on a controversial milkprice support increase for which the White House has claimed executive privilege.

title: Prices of Stocks Rebound In Mixed Trading Pattern
SALES HELD ILLEGAL ON WHISKY RECEIPTS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 (teuters)A Federal judge for the Eastern District of Virginia ruled today that HaffendenRimar International, Inc.., of Alexandria, Va., was violating securities laws in the sale of Scotch whisky as an investment. The case was brought by the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Cosmos Eliminated on Rote's Goal
description: IRVING, Tex., Aug. 15Kyle Rote Jr.'s goal in the 17th minute gave the Dallas Tornado a 10 victory over the New York Cosmos tonight in the North American Soccer League's semifinal playoff. The game was played at Texas Stadium before 9,009 fans.

title: Lodi Officials Propose Ban on Chemical Manufacturing Plants
description: LODI, Aug. 15Borough officials said today they planned to prevent any further manufacturing in a chemical plant where seven persons were injured in an explosion and fire yesterday.

title: Old Story, New Words
description: President Nixon left the Watergate crisis about where it was before he spoke. He rejected both the advice of those who urged him to mount a counteroffensive against the Senate investigating committee and those who urged him to confess error and seek reconciliation. In short, he redefined the conflict in different words, but he didn't remove it or even change it. His main theme was that he didn't know about the Watergate burglary or the coverup, and that nobody except John W. Dean 3d had suggested that he did. So, he said, now that all these charges have been argued over television for weeks, let's all get on together to more important things.

title: Rosburg Dropped From Tour For Comments About Casper
description: SUTTON, Mass., Aug. 15 Bob Rosburg, a member of the Tournambnt Players Division Policy Board of the Professional Golfers Association, the unit that directs and conducts the $8.2million tour, has been suspended for conduct unbecoming a professional golfer. Unless Rosburg appeals, the suspension will keep him out of the next three tournaments, staring with the $200,000 U.S.I. event this week.

title: Favored Az Igazi Takes Sanford by Two Lengths
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 15  Az Igazi scored the expected victory in the Sanford Stakes today, taking the 60th running of the event by two lengths. The winner, owned by Joseph Straus and trained by Homer Pardue, came into favoritism by elimination.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Would you like your goldfish or your favorite plant in bed with you? Just ask Bennett Janssen to design a bed for you. Mr. Janssen, who builds as well as designs furniture, recently made a bed for a client that incorporates a goldfish tank at the foot of the bed, with a miniature fig tree in the headboard.

title: Bishop Alvin A. Childs Dies; Former Mayor of Harlem, 64
description: Bishop Alvin A. Childs, pastor and founder of the Faith Temple Church of God in Christ at 1763 Amsterdam Avenue, and a former mayor of Harlem, died Saturday, apparently of heart attack, at his summer home in Oak Bluffs, Martha's Vineyard, Mass. He was 64 years old.

title: SOVIET OUTPUT UP 7.3% IN 7 MONTHS
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 15 (AP) The Soviet Union's gross industrial production is running ahead of planned goals, but the weaknesses that sent the Russians seeking American eco nomic aid remain glaringly per estent.

title: SLINGSHOT SHOWN TO FLORIDA JURY
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Aug. 15 A wristrocket slingshot made its first appearance today in the trial of seven antiwar veterans and a supporter charged with plotting to disrupt the Republican National Convention at Miami Beach last year.

title: FUTURES PRICES DECLINE BY LIMIT
description: Prices on the key commodities markets broke sharply yes terday after weeks of recordshattering advances on the huge Midwestern exchanges.

title: Abernathy Agrees to Stay as S.C.L.C.President
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug. 15 (UPI)The Rev. Ralph David, Abernathy agreed today to, !stay on as president of the Southern Christian Leadership, Conferetice after the board of directors rejected his resignation.

title: One Killed and 35 Injured In Belfast by Bomb in Car
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug. 15 (UPI)A bomb in a car demolished a bar filled with patrons celebrating a Roman Catholic holy day tonight. The British Army said that the blast killed one person and injured 35 more.

title: MAGRUDER IS SAID TO PASS LIE TEST
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15Jeb Stuart Magruder, the only Watergare insider so far to testify directly that former Attorney General John N. Mitchell approved the bugging and breakin plot in advance, was given a liedetector test by the prosecution and passed, according to reliable sources.

title: Stage: Odets in Full Cry
Laotian Talks Deadlocked; Clashes Break Out in South
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Aug. 15 (UPI)  Peace talks between Laotian Government officials and the proCommunist Pathet Lao were deadlocked today and Government sources said fighting had broken out in southern Laos.

title: White House Statement
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15Following is the text of a White House statement on Cambodia that was read at a news conference today by Gerald L. Warren, deputy press secretary:

title: Gasoline Supplies Improve
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 (Reuters)A further slight improvement in gasoline supplies for the sixth consecutive week was reported today by the American Automobile Association. I said a survey this week of 3 892 independent and brandname stations in continental United States and Hawaii showed that 54 per cent were operating normally against 53 per cent last week.

title: Reparations Are Asked for Men Who Survived Study on Syphilis
description: A study committee of the National Medical Association has recommended that the Government make reparations to the survivors of a 40yearold Federal study on 430 black Alabama men that sought to gauge the longterm efffects of syphilis upon the body.

title: U.S. ACTS TO CURB 2 TRANQUILIZERS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15The Federal Government moved today to impose tighter controls over Valium and Librium, widely prescribed tranquilizers that have been taken by over 20 million Americans.

title: 30HOUR PROTEST IN CAR PLANT ENDS
description: DETROIT, Aug. 15A 30hour sitin by workers at a Chrysler automobile stamping plant here ended today when the police arrested two of the protesters on charges of assaulting two plant security men.

title: Joseph Durso
description: Nolan Ryan drifted through the door of the visitors locker room in Yankee Stadium, hung his lightweight blazer on a hook in the wooden stalllocker, reached for the gray California Angels baseball suit and said: Don't ask me what's the problem. I've only beaten the Yankees onceout in California. But here, there's something about the mound that I don't likeI've never felt comfortable pitching from it, Next year, though, I'll be working back in my own park in New York: Shea. My own mound. It's been almost two years since Nolan Ryan pitched from the mound in Shea Stadium. Two years since the Mets traded him to the American League in their continuing search for a third baseman, the phantom of their infield for 12 seasons. And in those two years, he has become the strikeout king of the major leagues329 last season, 275 so far this seasonand he already has pitched nohitters against Kansas City and Detroit this summer, with maybe 11 starts to go.

title: Walther Out of Hospital
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Aug. 15 (UPI)  David (Salty) Walther, severely burned in a crash during the Indianapolis 500mile race, was discharged today from the University of Michigan Hospital in good condition. Walther, 25 years old, had been in the hospital's burn center since June.

title: Sophie's Regulars
description: Dawn: serene like a New England summer morning. The men began arriving at 5:30, forming conversational circles of two's and three's in front of the employment agency at Bowery and Rivington Street. Like sharpshooters, they watched the early morning traffic and other jobseekers. They talked of other restaurants, hotels, and of who was working where, and who had been asked to return for another day's or night's work. Now and then, men changed circles. Stationary, I watched as two men went over and leaned against an abandoned car (the burnt body was a symbol of ghetto sport. The unwritten rules of the game were in centerfield; the ball was out of the park. Exactly between the Avenues of Rage and Frustration.).

title: Judge Refuses Defense Plea for Delay in MitchellStans Trial
description: Federal Judge Lee P. Gagliardi said yesterday that the trial of former Attorney General John N. Mitchell and! former Commerce Secretary] Maurice H. Stans would start on Sept. 11.

title: Dramatic Gain Indicated In U.S. Payments Balance
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 Partly because of the new system of floating currency exchange rates and partly because of some real improvement, two measures of the United States balance of international payments showed dramatic improvement in the second quarter of this year, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Text of the Resolution Adopted by U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 15Following is the text of the resolution adopted today by the United Nations Security Council condemning Israel for her action in forcing down a Lebanese airliner Friday:

title: Johnson Reported to Have Used F.B.I. to Spy on the Democrats
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 15 (UPI) President Lyndon B. Johnson sent F.B.I. agents to the 1964 Democratic national convention to conduct a political spying operation against members of his own party, The Chicago Tribune reported today.

title: Personal Income Climbed By $7.3Billion in Month
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 (AP) The Government reported today a substantial increase in personal income during July, although there was a much slower growth rate in factory payrolls than in June.

title: MORTGAGE RATES RAISED TO 8% HERE
description: Several major New York: banks yesterday raised the in terest rate they charge on residential mortgages to 8 per cent. a new ceiling permitted by the State Banking Board last week

title: AGNEW URGES U.S. TO SUPPORT NIXON
description: DENVER, Aug. 15Vice President Agnew called on Americans tonight to support President Nixon in carrying on his job.

title: Fannin Announces He Will Plead Guilty To Drunken Driving
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Aug. 15 (AP) Senator Paul J. Fannin, Republican of Arizona, said today that he would plead guilty to charge of driving while intoxicated and had volunteered to appear before a grand jury investigating the case.

title: Engineers Unit to Check on Kickbacks
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 15The Maryland Society of Professional Engineers today named a committee to investigate reports of kickbacks by engineers to Maryland politicians, and the chairman of the committee said that a preliminary check indicated that apparently there is something in here.

title: Notes on People
description: The way Lieut. Gov. Lester G. Maddox of Georgia described some of the country's problems seemed simple enough. At a convention of food executives in Atlanta, Mr. Maddox said, in part: When the most productive nation in the world reaches the point where its economy is so out of control that traditional abundance becomes scandalous scarcity, then think it's a disgrace equal to Watergate.... The Communists got our grain, the Administration got credit for the deal, the speculators got the profit, and the rest of us got the bill.

title: Text of Nixon's Statement on Watergate Scandal as Issued by the White House
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15Following is the text of President Nixon's statement on the Watergate scandal as issued by the White House tonight just before the President began speaking to the nation:

title: U.S. Detects Soviet Blast
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 (AP)  Seismic signals believed to stem from a Soviet underground nuclear explosion were picked up in the United States last night, the Atomic Energy Commission said today. The signals originated from the southern part of the Soviet Union near the city of Tashkent.

title: PRESIDENT TO HOLD A NEWS CONFERENCE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15(UPI)  President Nixon plans to hold a news conference at San Clemente, Calif., after he goes there next week, the White House said today.

title: Mitsui Sets U.S. Deal
description: The American Metal Climax, Inc., and Mitsui & Co., Ltd., the Japanese trading company, announced yesterday an agreement in principle for Mitsui to acquire 50 per cent interest in Amax's aluminum business for $125million. It would he the first major purchase by Japanese interests of a stake in a large American company. Page 51.

title: Mrs. Nixon Says Talk Was From the Heart
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 (UPI)Mrs. Richard M. Nixon said today that the President in his Watergate address spoke from the heart and it went to the hearts of the American people.

title: Conservatives Pick Galvin For City Council President
description: Thomas F. Galvin, the Republican candidate for City Council President, was assured yesterday of a second line on the ballot when the Conservative party also named him as its candidate.

title: At Knopf, Avid Reader Rises to Top
description: The pleasures of a West Side boyhood that Robert Gottlieb remembers most fondly are not the movies at the Thalia, not the snowball fights outside the Ethical Culture School, and not even the exotic weeks at summer camp.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: PLYMOUTH, England, Aug. 15 (AP)The Brazilian yacht Saga overhauled the top United States challenger, Charisma, and was the first Admiral's Cup contender across the finish line today in the 605mile Fastnet ocean race. Saga made up an estimated 20 miles during the night overtake Charisma. The American yacht was badly becalmed on the final approaches to Plymouth Harbor.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 (Reuters)  The Western Electric Company has received a $163.8million contract modification for continuation of research and development into the safeguard ballistic missile system, the Defense Department announced today.

title: ExJersey Senator Is Indicted On Bribe and Perjury Charges
description: TRENTON, Aug. 15  Former Senator James M. Turner, Republican of Gloucester, was indicted today by the statewide grand jury on charges of having accepted a bribe to try to arrange an early parole for a convicted bookmaker.

title: That Watergate Senator Down Home in Carolina
description: MORGANTON, N.C., Aug. 15Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr., by all odds the bestknown United States Senator in the nation, came home a few days ago to his home town of 76 years in the quiet green foothills where the Blue Ridge Mountains roll serenely into Appalachia.

title: QUARLES NOMINATED TO A TOP E.P.A. POST
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 (AP) President Nixon accepted today the resignation of Robert W. Fri as deputy administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency and said he would nominate John R. Quarles Jr. to succeed him.

title: Baker Says He and Nixon Are as Friendly as Ever
description: NASHVILLE, Tenn., Aug. 15 (UPI)Senator Howard Baker, vice chairman of the Senate Watergate committee, denied today that there had been any breach in his relationship with President Nixon.

title: Weinberger Will Hold Meetings on Runaways
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 (UPI)Noting that many of the victims of the Houston mass murders were runaway boys, Caspar W. Weinberger, Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, says he plans a series of meetings with juvenile authorities from around the country on the problem of runaways. Mr, Weinberger said yesterday that there may be 600,000 to one million runaway children in the United States but that police figures were inadequate.

title: Plainclothes Officer Wounded in Car in Brooklyn
description: A plainclothes policeman was shot in the leg while riding in an unmarked car in Brooklyn last night. A search of the area failed to turn up his assailant.

title: NEGROES IN NEW ARK ASSAIL TRASH PICKUP
description: NEWARK, Aug. 15 Helmeted policemen tussled briefly with 200 demonstrators here today who attempted to deposit bagged trash on the City Hall steps to protest allegedly inadequate clean up efforts in the city's mostly black Central Ward.

title: NEWMAN PERFORMS METRONOMIC BACH
Met's Win on Seaver's 2Hitter
description: SAN DIEGO, Calif., Aug. 15Backed by Jerry Grote's grand slam and solo homers by Wayne Garrett and Cleon Jones, Tom Seaver cruised to his 15th victory tonight. Seaver's most dangerous No ill effects resulted from the fifthinning crackup, which preceded one of the two infield hits Seaver allowed as the New York Mets concluded their California trip with a 70 victory over the San Diego Padres. They headed home for New York, via allnight charter, with a 35 wonlost record for the tour and, miraculously, with only six more defeats on their record than the divisionleading. St. Louis Cardinals.

title: Judge Backs Kennedy, Rejecting Medical Bill Veto
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15A Federal District Court Judge today invalidated President Nixon's pocket veto of a $225million medicaleducation bill. The decision upheld the argument of Senator Edward M. Kennedy, a cosponsor of the bill, the plaintiff In the suit and the attorney who argued it.

title: Connecticut Motorists Ask Not for Whom the Belles Toll
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Aug. 15The concrete is hot, the automobile fumes are suffoeating, the work is repetitious, and the customer: sometimes get fresh.

title: Amex Seat Price Drops
description: A membership on the American Stock Exchange was sold yesterday for $40,000, down $2,000 from the previous sale on July 26.

title: A Donor Will Replace Stolen Ugly Duckling
description: Dorothy Strelsin, whose Fifth Avenue apartment overlooks the Hans Christian Andersen statue in Central Park, yesterday offered to donate to the city enough money to replace the statue of the Ugly Duckling that was stolen last week.

title: Suspended Miami Mayor Cleared in Bribery Case
description: MIAMI, Aug. 15 (AP)The suspended Mayor of Miami, David Kennedy, and two other persons were cleared of briberyconspiracy charges today by a Circuit Court judge.

title: U.S. ACTS TO CURB 2 TRANQUILIZERS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15The Federal Government moved today to impose tighter controls over Valium and Librium, widely prescribed tranquilizers that have been taken by over 20 million Americans.

title: Dollar's Gain Resumes; Gold Recoups a $5 Loss
description: LONDON, Aug. 15 (AP)The United States dollar paused briefly in its recovery today before resuming the rise that has already taken it to a twomonth peak.

title: The Bombing Ended, Cambodia Looks for a Lull in the Fighting
description: PHNOM PENH,. Cambodia, Aug. 15United States combat involvement in Indochina ended today with Phnom Penh still ringed with columns of smoke from the last air strikes.

title: NIXON ASKS WATERGATE BE LEFT TO COURTS AND NATION GET ON WITH URGENT BUSINESS DENIES ANY PART IN BREAKIN OR COVERUP
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15President Nixon said tonight the time has come to turn Watergate over to the courts and for the rest of us to get on with the urgent business of our nation.

title: Nixon Was More Specific Last May Than He Was in Address Last Night
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15While President Nixon gave the nation a general denial tonight to charges of personal involve ment in any aspect of the Watergate scandal, he declined to discuss the issues in any detail.

title: NIXON SEES PERIL TO PEACE IN HALT IN CAMBODIA RAIDS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15President Nixon marked the end of the American bombing in Cambodia with a new denunciation of Congress today for forcing the cutoffan act that he said undermines the prospects for world peaceand with new warning to North Vietnam not to take military advantage of the cessation.

title: BLACK FEMINISTS FORM GROUP HERE;National Body Hopes to End Mythsand Intimidation
description: Saying that they were aware of the enormous pressure on black women not to join the women'sliberation movement a group of black women an nounced yesterday the formation of the National Black Feminist Organization.

title: INA CORP. REFUSES DIVIDEND REQUEST
description: The INA Corporation, a Philadelphiabased holding company active in insurance and related fields, said yesterday it had refused a Government request, to reduce its fourthquarters dividend to conform to Federal guidelines.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Waterfront Commission charged yesterday that watchmen hired from a private security agency to guard cargoes in the New York Harbor had conspired with their employer to over bill 15 pier companies and shipping lines of at least $63,000 in 1971. The watchmen were ordered to appear at a commission hearing on Sept. 5 to answer the charges.

title: Chess: Portisch Solidifies His Grasp On First Place in Interzonal
Air Bags or Belt Devices To Be Installed on 74 Cars
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 (AP)  Automobile manufacturers will he required to equip 1974 models with air bags or devices that prevent them from starting unless seat belts are fastened.

title: H. E. GREEN, HEADED LONE STAR CEMENT
description: Harry E. Green, formerly board chairman and president of Lone Star Industries, Inc., of Greenwich, Conn., died on Tuesday on a visit to Virginia Beach. He was 66 years old and lived in New Orleans.

title: Baseball Talks Hit Roadblock
description: MILWAUKEE. Aug. 15 (AP) American League officials, apparently planning lastminute strategy in an effort to win approval of interleague play, recessed tonight until tomorrow.

title: Police Here Urged To Cease Arrests For Pornography
description: The city's Corporation Counsel, Norman Redlich, advised the Police Department yesterday not to make any pornography arrests and not to serve any summonses in Manhattan under the state's criminal obscenity statute.

title: PRICES OF BONDS SHOW SHARP RISE
With 20,000 Runaways in City, Police Are Confident That Chances for a Mass Tragedy Are Slight
description: There are 20,000 teenage runaways in New York City at any given time, but apprehending them is difficult because of state law and police procedure.

title: Webster Makes It Firm: Snead Will Start Sunday
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, N.J., Aug. 15Norman Snead will start at quarterback for the New York Giants Sunday against Joe Namath and the Jets at Yale Bowl.

title: About the Giants:
description: Joe Narnath may have said some terrible things about the Giants last year. But most members of the defensive unit, while waiting for the Jets quarterback to pop off before Sunday's game, are offering nothing but superlatives on what they've seen so far this season. Willie Williams, right cornerback: I think Joe's, much better this year. We looked at the films and it's unbelievable the way he zipped through teeth of the zone one time. Jack Gregory, defensive end: He looks more agile than he's ever been. Maybe it's because he's been injuryfree so far. There's no doubt he's the best in the game today. I think he's the best of all time.. Continued swelling in the left knee leaves Clifton Davis, the rookie fullback, questionable for Sunday's game.... Injuries in the Boston game to Willie Young (twisted knee), Bob Hyland (sprained ankle) and Joe Orduna (sprained ankle) also will leave their status in doubt until later in the week.

title: Husband's Consent Ruled Not Needed for Abortion
description: MIAMI, Aug. 15 (AP)A threejudge Federal court has ruled that a woman does not need her husband's or parents consent to obtain a legal abortion in the first three months of pregnancy.

title: 2 U.S. STEEL UNITS SUED ON POLLUTION
description: HAMMOND, Ind. Aug. 15 (UPI)The Environmental Protection Agency filed a suit today under the national Clean Air Act against two United States Steel Corporation facilitise in Gary, Ind.

title: The Lost Montagnards
description: One day early in June 1972, people in central Saigon on their way home to lunch were startled by the sight of a large group of half naked, darkskinned men, women and children fending their way through the tangle of motorcycles, pedicabs and cars. They were montagnards of the Stieng tribe located along the Cambodian border. For five days they had walked seventy miles from the vicinity of An Loc over the fields, avoiding embattled Route 13, to the capital city. Tired and without money, but clutching their machetes (essential in the jungles of the highlands as well as in the jungle of Saigon), they were on their way to the Ministry of Ethnic Minorities to seek help, which they immediately received.

title: Lincoln Collection Center Will Be Built in Tennessee
description: HARROGATE, Tenn., Aug. 15 (UPI)A center to house memorabilia of Abraham Lincoln will be built on the campus of Lincoln Memorial University for $1million.

title: Briefson the Arts
description: Alfred A. Knopf announced yesterday that it had added to its fall publishing list Ten Years After Ivan Denisovich, Zhores A. Medvedev's revealing story of Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn's struggle to publish his work in the Soviet Union. The hook by Mr. Medvedev, a noted Soviet geneticist and friend of Solzhenitsyn's who was recently deprived of Soviet citizenship for his own dissident. writings, is scheduled for a December release. It is said to he the first biographical study of the Nobel Prizewinning novelist by one of his own countrymen.

title: Court Backs Housing Loans
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 (AP)The United States Circuit Court of Appeals here rejected today a Government request for a stay of a lower court's order fOr resumption of a lowinterest rural housing program that was halted in January when funds for it were impounded by President Nixon.

title: NIXON SEES PERIL TO PEACE IN HALT IN CAMBODIA RAIDS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15President Nixon marked the end of the American bombing in Cambodia with a new denunciation of Congress today for forcing the cutoffan act that he said undermines the prospects for world peaceand with a new warning to North Vietnam not to take military advantage of the cessation.

title: AMEX UNCHANGED AS VOLUME SLOWS
Mitsui in $125Million Bid For 50% in Unit of Amax
description: The first major purchase by Japanese interests of a stake in a large American company was announced yesterday when American Metal Climax, Inc., and Mitsui & Co., Ltd., disclosed an agreement in principle for the Japanese trading company to acquire a 50 per (cent participation in Amax's aluminum business for $125million. Mitsui is a major Japanese trading company with considerable investments in mining, manufacturing, financial and other enterprises.

title: The President Replies
description: After nearly three months of silence, President Nixon has responded to the damaging if inconclusive testimony before the Senate committee on Watergate. Although we reserve until tomorrow a detailed assessment of the President's talk and the related statement issued by the White House, the speech in its broad outline was disappointing.

title: TURNER IS INDICTED ON BRIBE CHARGES
description: TRENTON, Aug. 15  Former Senator James M. Turner, Republican of Gloucester, was indicted today by the statewide grand jury on charges of having accepted a bribe to try to arrange an early parole for a convicted bookmaker.

title: Restaurant Food: Frozen, Cooked, Then Refrozen and Recooked
description: When Mr. and Mrs. America step out to dine by candlelight,, the chances are growing that they will eat the same sort of thing they left at home: TV dinners. The quality will be the same, but the price will be considerably higher.

title: Pitiless Giant
description: Before Congress finally called a halt this week, the United States dropped 7.4 million tons of bombs on Indochina over a nineyear period, more than three times the amount of explosives dropped by American planes during World War II. A halfmillion tons thundered down on the peaceful countryside of Cambodia, devastating a nation of peasants whose overwhelming desire was to be left alone and in peace.

title: State Park Comes to Bronx Riverside
description: Either get right or get out the choice is yours. Richard Oritz yelled at two youngsters trying to push each other into the pool at the first state park in New York City.

title: 2 Union Officials Indicted On Bribery Charge Here
description: Two union officials were indicted yesterday in Federal Court and charged with demanding a $500 payoff from contractor working on the site of the old Hotel New Yorker at 34th Street and Eighth Avenue.

title: India Marks Her 26th Year of independence in a Mood of Gloom
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 15India celebrated 26 years of independence today in a mood of gloom and melancholy.

title: Previous Statements by President on Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 (AP)Following are previous statements by President Nixon on the Watergate case, excerpted from news conferences and statements issued by the Whit Houses

title: Bridge: Mishearing of Opponent's Bid Turns Into Stroke of Fortune
Double is In, Quinella Out at Roosevelt
description: Alive or dead in the daily double, harnessracing fans apparently would rather take their chances on that form of wager than on a pair of quinellas.

title: No Champagne or Cheers as Last Plane Comes In From Cambodia;
description: KORAT, Thailand, Aug. 15The last United States fighterbomber to strike in Cambodia touched down here at 11:32 this morning.

title: Sports Today
description: HARNESS RACING

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A group of gun dealers, clubs and collectors filed suit to block the state police from enforcing a new interpretation of law making antique firearms subject to New Jersey's gun control laws.

title: City Has Begun a MitchellLama Inquiry
description: Investigation Commissioner Nicholas Scoppetta disclosed yesterday that his department was looking into possible misuse of city money in a major city housing program  the MitchellLama program for the construction of middleincome housing.

title: Seven Are Indicted In Muslim Slayings At Home in Capital
description: The killings took place at $78,000 home donated by Kareem Abdul Jabbar, the professional basketball star.

title: Complaint on Mail Brings Flood of Abuse
description: Joseph F. Rizzo isor was, he saysa man concerned with the public welfare in general and with the quality of mail delivery in particular.

title: CoverUp
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15I thought you might he interested in knowing was the bland way that the late F.B.I'Director, J. Edgar Hoover, began his notes to Presidents, as he transmitted information about public figures that might be potentially embarrassing.

title: Debt to Brokers Is Cut
description: Dept of customers to brokerage houses belonging to the New York Stock Exchange fell $170million last month to $6.01billion. The reduction was partly by margin calls, exchange officials said. The number of margin accounts dropped by 15,000 to 690,000.

title: Ford Sights Sales Gains
description: DETROIT, Aug. 15 (UPI)  The Ford Motor Company executives today reported higher sales and predicted a continued demand for new cars after 1974 models are introduced in September.

title: Eagles Eye Hornsby as Linebacker
description: With the training camp season half completed and the games that count beginning in a month, position vacancies and surpluses are well established among the 26 pro teams. A glaring weakness at middle linebacker for the Philadelphia Eagles has brought the Giants into an advantageous trade position. The Eagles want New York's Ron Hornsby to play the position rather than Ron Porter or Rick Absher, and their coach, Mike McCormack, has made an offer. Hornsby is surplus for the Giants behind Jim Files.

title: FEDERAL AID SOUGHT FOR PATH EXTENSION
description: The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey initiated action yesterday to obtain a Federal grant of $147million to cover twothirds of the cost of extending PATH rail transit service from Newark's Pennsylvania Station to Newark International Airport and from there to Elizabeth, Roselle Park. Cran ford, Westfield and Plainfield, N.J. A letter of intent, the required first step, was filed with the Tristate Regional Planning Commission.

title: MailTruck Crackdown Set
description: Police Commissioner Donald F, Cawley ordered all members of the force yesterday to warn drivers of United States mail trucks about parking illegally in the city. The warning period end Aug. 31. After then, the order said, summonses will be served.

title: French Output Off in June
description: PARIS, Aug. 15 (Reuters)The French industrial output index declined in June to 196 (1962 equals 100) from the record 199 in May, the National Statistical Institute said today.

title: Police Slay a Gunman in Shootout on East Side
description: Plainclothes members of the police anticrime patrol shot and killed a man yesterday after he opened fire on the two officers who had followed him into a secondfloor beauty, salon on a usually sedate East Side street.

title: 31 Food Spots Here Listed as Violators Of City Health Code
description: The Health Department has listed 31 more restaurants and food stores where its inspectors have found violations of the Health Code upon a second inspection. If warned that failtire to correct such conditions could result in closing orders when a final inspection is made later this month.

title: Two Nixon Writers, One Thoughtful And One Tough, Worked on Speech
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15Raymond K. Price Jr.'s fascination with words became clear at the age of seven years when he acquired a copying machine and published a weekly neighborhood paper in Setauket, Long Island. Its peak circulation was 80.

title: 7 IN POLICE LINKED WITH DRUG THEFTS
description: Seven New York City policemen holding ranks up to captain are suspected of having conspired with organized crime figures to steal more than $70million worth. of confiscated narcotics from police custody, lawenforcement officials said yesterday.

title: Cost of Feeding Family of 4 Here Increases 3.9% in Just One Week
MORE PRESSURE CITED ON VERDICT
description: CHRISTIANSTED, St. Croix, V.I., Aug. 15A third member of the jury that convicted five young blacks of eight slayings at a fashionable golf club here last September said today that she had been pressured into delivering a guilty verdict.

title: The Sonnenfeldt Case
description: The dramatic improvement the Nixon Administration has effected in relations with Moscow and Peking remains an achievement undimmed even by Watergate. The public spotlight has justifiably been on the President and Henry Kissinger as chief architects of this new design in American foreign policy, but just off center stage has been another key figure, Helmut Sonnenfeldt, Mr. Kissinger's principal deputy.

title: Roundup: Evans Catches Stargell on 34th Homer
Tannen's Way: Beat Virus, Then Giants
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Aug. 15If Steve Tannen could sit down right now and put his priorities in order, they would probably be a) kill the bug, b) defeat the Giants, c) stay away from injury and d) cure the drought.

title: Transcript of President's Speech to the Nation in Answer to Watergate Charges
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15Following is a transcript of President Nixon's address on the Watergate scandal as recorded by The New York Times: Good evening.

title: U.S. Pacific Command Reports Halt in Raids
description: HONOLULU, Aug. 15 (UPI)  America's Pacific command acknowledged late yesterday the end of its Cambodian bombing after more than six months of aroundtheclock strikes.

title: People in Sports: A Surprise for Carew
description: It was just a routine hit to left field, so Rod Carew was puzzled when the 15,000 fans began to stand up and cheer. I didn't realize it was my 1,000th, said the Twins second baseman yesterday, following his team's 121 victory over the Detroit Tigers Tuesday night. At first I couldn't figure out why everybody was standing. Then I heard something on the public address and I looked at the scoreboard.

title: Basketball Helps Shore Businesses
description: BELMAR, Aug. 15The oddsmakers are rating Larson Ford's and Jerry Lynch's as pretty much an evenmoney bet when they meet tomorrow night, weather permitting, in the final playoff game of the summer basketball league here.

title: Arguments Are Postponed In Vesco Yacht Seizure
description: A Federal judge has postponed arguments on whether the International Controls Corporation can seize Robert L. Vesco's yacht.

title: Political Suit, Daley Says
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 15 (UPI)Mayor Richard J. Daley today dismissed a Federal charge of discrimination against the Chicago police department as political suit. The Justice Department yesterday accused the Chicago police of discrimination in the hiring of blacks, Latins and women.

title: Cambodian Rebels Call the End of Bombing a Victory for Them
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 15Cambodian insurgents said today in a Frenchlanguage broadcast from Cambodia that the halt in the American bombing represented a great victory for their side. The broadcast said that the insurgents would fight on until the complete overthrow of the Lon Nol Government and the total and unconditional end of all acts of aggression by the American imperialists and their foreign valets, together with the total withdrawal of their forces and military personnel from Cambodia.

title: Julia Child Takes a Break From French Chef Series
description: Julia Child's French Chef series on stations of the Public Broadcasting Service will consist entirely of reruns this season, according to a spokesman for WGBH, the Boston station that produces the show for P. B. S.

title: Veterans in Japan Ask Official Status For Shrine to Fallen
description: TOKYO, Aug. 15Controversy over Japan's martial tradition erupted today during observance of the 28th anniversary of the end of World War II

title: BostonArea Drug Raids
description: BOSTON, Aug. 15 (AP) State and local policemen conducted a series of drug raids in the Boston area today and arrested 20 persons, including three women. They raided four homes, two in Revere and two in Chelsea.

title: Norton Simon Profits Break Records
Police Exhibition Slated
description: An exhibition policetraining program, the second of a fivepart series that began last Thursday, will be held today from 11 A.M. to 1 P.M. on the mall of the new Police Headquarters building, Police Plaza in lower Manhattan. The mall will be open to the public and several exhibitions and demonstrations will be held.

title: Seoul Trade Talks to Open
description: SEOUL, Aug. 15 (UPI)The united States and South Korea will open a threeday meeting In Seoul Thursday to discuss view export quotas for Korea's wool and manmade textiles to the United States for the period Oc. 1Sept. 31 next year. Kim ChungTae Assistant Foreign Minister for Economic Affairs, will head a sixmember Korean delegation.

title: FoodStamp Applications Are Rising With the Prices
description: The practice of cutting down on some food items and cutting out others has worked for many families, but the continuing surge in food prices is apparently forcing a growing number of working people to turn to food stamps.

title: Away From Strikes
description: The United Steelworkers of America, biggest union the A.F.L.C.I.O., is continuing to move forward imaginatively in devising plans for resolving industrial disputes through reason rather than strikes.

title: Stage: London Comedy
description: LONDONWhat has happened to comedy in London? you may ask. Nothing has happened to comedy in London.

title: Blumenthal Ads to Mark Tactical Shift
description: Assemblyman Albert H. Blu menthal of Manhattan, the Liberal candidate for Mayor, will begin a modest radio and news paper advertising campaign next week that will herald a shift from Mr. Blumenthal's strategy in the Democratic mayoral mary.

title: Two Experimenters Die In Picatinny Explosion
description: ROCKAWAY TOWNSHIP, Aug. 15Two technicians conducting an experiment at Picatinny Arsenal died this afternoon after an explosion at the Feltman Research Laboratory. It was the third fatal blast at the arsenal this year.

title: 2 Experimenters Killed in Explosion At Jersey Arsenal
description: ROCKAWAY TOWNSHIP, Aug. 15Two technicians conducting an experiment at Picatinny Arsenal died this afternoon after an explosion at the Feltman Research Laboratory. It was the third fatal blast at the arsenal this year.

title: Dramatic Gain Indicated In U.S.Payments Balance
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 Partly because of the new system of floating currency exchange rates and partly because of some real improvement, two measures of the United States balance of international payments showed dramatic improvement in the second quarter of this year, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: G.O.P. Loser in Texas Blames Watergate Case
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Aug. 15 A veteran Republican campaigner, defeated yesterday in a special state Senate election laid the blame on the Watergate scandal.

title: Railroad to Offer Shares
description: The Chicago & North Western Transportation Company yesterday filed plans with the Interstate Commerce Commission for a proposed offering of 500,000 shares of additional stocks, to be outstanding following a 60for1 planned split of the present stock. The split will increase the number of shares outstanding to 4,369,500.

title: Canadian Dumping Held Not Harmful
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 The Tariff Commission ruled unanimously today that imports of aluminum ingot from Canada, though sold at less than fair value, are not injuring the domestic aluminum industry.

title: Basketball Transactions
description: HOUSTONSigned George Johnson, center, and Fred Devaughan, forward, to 197314 contracts.

title: Reaction to Nixon Speech: Less in It Than Expected
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15President Nixon's supporters felt that he did not need to make a new personal defense on Watergate. His critics reacted angrily because he offered none. Both sides, in commenting on Mr. Nixon's television address this evening, said the President had added little to the Watergate discussionmuch less than almost everybody had expected.

title: DR, DOROTHY DE VAN
description: Dr. Dorothy Stepat De Van, who spent 35 years on the Hunter College teaching staff and was chairman of the department of home economics from 1965 to 1968, died Monday at her home, 4960 Broadway. She was 57 years old.

title: Police Team Engineers Caper in Cops and Robbers
MRS. OTTO N. MILLER
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 15Mrs. Alberta Hogue Miller, the wife of Otto N. Miller, board chairman of the Standard Oil Company of California, died last evening at her home here. She was 62 years old,

title: The winning New Jersey, daily lottery number yesterday was:
description: Tickets matching the number win $2503. Tickets, with the five numbers reverse win $225. Tickets with the first or last four numbers in order win $225. Tickets with the first, middle or last three numbers In sequence win $25. Tickets with all five numbers scrambled Win $25. Tickets matching the first and second digits, the second and third, the third end fourth or the fourth and fifth win $2.50.

title: Silence Follows Women Amateurs
Brambilla Is Victor
description: ENNA, Sicily, Aug. 15 (AP)  Vittorio Brambilla drove his AbarthOsella to victory today in the City of Enna Cup, the fifth event in.the European automakers championship for 2,000c.c. cars. He covered 180 miles at an average speed of 121 miles an hour.

title: C.D.C. Offers Vow: No Ties to Noranda
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 15  The Canada Development Corporation, which has been charged with conspiring with Noranda Mines, Ltd., of Toronto to take.

title: Parents May Lose Deposit Paid to Closed Day Camps
description: The parents of 1,500 children, most of them working mothers, stand to lose a substantial part of the $200,000 in deposits they paid to cover daycamp fees Sunrise Day Camps, Ltd., East Islip, L. I., a law firm representing the camp disclosed yesterday.

title: Alleged Homosexual Ring Found In a Raid on Apartment in Dallas
description: DALLAS, Aug. 15  The police here said today that they had uncovered a nationwide homosexual procurement ring in a raid on an apartment on the city's near north side.

title: Old Story, New Words
description: President Nixon left the Watergate crisis about where it was before he spoke. He rejected both the advice of those who urged him to mount a counteroffensive against the Senate investigating committee and those who urged him to confess error and seek reconciliation, In short he redefined the conflict in different words, but he didn't remove it or even change it. His main theme was that he didn't know about the Watergate burglary or the coverup, and that nobody except John W. Dean 3d had suggested that he did. So, he said, now that all these charges have been argued over television for weeks, let's all get on together to more important things.

title: LEFKOWITZ ACCUSES A COAST PROMOTER
description: State Attorney General Louis; J. Lefkowitz yesterday charged that a California promoter Mined $1,000 from at least seven New York investors for seals on a proposed computerized commodities exchange that never opened.

title: Richardson Briefed Agnew on Evidence
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15Attorney General Elliot L. Richardson met with Vice President Agnew early this month and outlined the substance of the evidence gathered by Federal prosecutors in Baltimore against the Vice President.

title: Conservative Unit Seems In Doubt on Nixon's Role
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 Young Americans for Freedom, the young conservative group that generally finds the Republican party too far to the left, opened its annual convention here today with its members seemingly undecided about President Nixon's involvement in the Watergate case.
