description: Aug. 16, 1973 GENERAL ASSEMBLY Committee on Colonialism 10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M. ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COUNCIL Committee on Elimination of Racial Discrimination10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: Lawyer Asks Court Order For Secret Service Data
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Aug. 15 (UPI)A Charlotte lawyer today asked a United States District Court to force James Riley, the chief of the United States Secret Service, to enter a deposition and turn over any tapes or documents related to a Presidential visit here in 1971.

title: BOARD IN NEWBURGH. REJECTS BUSING PLAN
description: NEWBURGH, N. Y., Aug. 15 (AP)The Newburgh City Board of Education voted unanimously tonight to reject a schoolintegration proposal by the State Education Commissioner, Ewald B. Nyquist.

title: U.N. Condemns Israel for Forcing Down Arab Plane
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 15The Security Council voted unanimously this afternoon to condemn Israel for intercepting a Lebanese commercial airliner last week and forcing the plane to land in Israel.

title: Payrolls of Cities Reported Up 67% From 1967 to 1972 Level
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15New evidence of the deepening financial plight of the nation's cities was disclosed by the Censiis Bureau today in a report on city government employes.

title: Out of the Show Rings and Into the Winner's Circles
description: Doberman pinschers and horses have played leading roles in the lives of Frank and Eleanor D'Amico of Glen Cove, L. I.

title: Interleague Play Loses On Tie Vote
description: MILWAUKEE, Aug. 16 (UPI)The baseball commissioner, Bowie Kuhn, was put squarely on the spot today but maneuvered off it quickly by declining to cast a tiebreaking vote on interleague play. Kuhn said he preferred using his wisdom rather than his power as commissioner.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 (AP)Dr. William C. Freund, vice president and chief economist of the New York Stock Exchange, said today that new figures on losses by the securities industry underscored the need for higher commission rates on securities trading.

title: Woman Is Stabbed After Giving Purse To Subway Robber
description: A 35yearold Brooklyn woman was stabbed and critically wounded in a subway car last night by a robber to whom she had given her purse without resistance.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: Winning numbers drawn on Aug. 16 were:

title: Union Carbide Plans Closing Of Some Brazilian Facilities
description: The Union Carbide Corporation announced yesterday that it would terminate the opera.tion of the vinyl chloride monomer, acetylene black, and Wulff process olefins sections of its plant in Cubatao, Brazil.

title: If Not a Volunteer Army, What Then?
description: CHARLESTON, S. C.Although the United States had a basic conscription law as early as 1797, for 160 years of our history there was no compulsory military service. The military policy of the United States has been to maintain the smallest possible professional army in times of peace. However, cold war developments after World War II and threats on the international scene outdated many old concepts of. readiness and national strategy. The responsibilities of world leadership resulted in the maintenance of active forces of sufficient size to provide for defense of our nation and to permit action in support of national interests.

title: WALTER A. MOORE
description: Walter A. Moore, who retired in 1967 as vice president and director or marneting ,for the Best Foods Division of C. P. C. International, Inc., died Wednesday at the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. He was 67 years old and lived at 24 Merrilon Avenue in Garden City, L.I.

title: Smile You're on Candid Courtroom
description: From a television reporter's viewpoint it is about as sensible to prohibit the use of film as to deprive a newspaper reporter the use of a pencil. But such is the general rule. In the courtrooms of the United States, the motion picture, either on film or on videotape, which is after all the primary tool of the television news trade, is barred. Because of this exclusion of cameras, tape recorders, and even still photographs, TV, news is reduced to covering trials by means of handdrawings and reporters scribbled recollections.

title: Gibson Calls Demonstration Political
description: NEWARK, Aug. 18 Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson asserted today that the march on City Hall yesterday that resulted in melee between riot police and about 300 demonstrators was political maneuver designed to force a confrontation with the police.

title: Charles, Carroll Lee Dies; Held Stock Exchange Seat
description: Charles Carroll Lee, a retired member of the New York Stock Exchange, died yesterday in Roosevelt Hospital after a brief illness. He was 70 years old and lived at 170. East 77th Street.

title: A Look at Britain's National Theater
description: LONDONWhat is a national theater? How respectable should it be? The questions are particularly relevant to us in America as we are struggling toward our own concept of an institutionalized theater. Should it be entirely classical? Should it be resolutely Establishment? Or should it be wholeheartedly experimental?

title: At Monmouth...
description: Locust Hill Farm's Indian Sign, the longest shot in the field, raced to a sixlength victory in the feature.

title: Threat to Koreans in U.S. By Seoul Stirs Concern
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16South Korean intelligence agents stationed in the United States have been engaging in an increasing program of harassment and serious intimidation against Koreans living in this country.

title: 3 Atlantic City Officials Testify in Bribery Study
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Aug. 16  A state grand jury investigation of alleged corruption among Atlantic City police and inspection officials has dealt a new blow to reformers intent on rebuilding this city's battered triage as an outstanding resort and convention center.

title: San Diego Bid Denied
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 16 (AP)  The California Supreme Court denied today a request from the City of San Diego, that the transfer of the Padres baseball team to Washington be blocked. In denying the petition for a hearing, the court made no comment.

title: At Monmouth...
description: Locust Hill Farm's Indian Sign, the longest shot in the field, raced to a sixlength victory in the feature.

title: Gladys Knight Delights Park Show Fans
description: You know how to make a girl nervous, exclaimed Gladys Knight at the roar of approval that went up on Monday when shewith the Pipsappeared at the Schaefer Music Festival in Central Park. Miss Knight then went on to demonstrate how superbly relaxed she actually was. The foursome ripped throughsometimes at stunning tempo, with the three male Pips raising the mere repetition of whoopwhoop almost to arc roan statusa collection of familiar songs from their decadesold collection, culminating with their biggest success, I Heard It on the Grapevine.

title: Secret Service Says Aide Gave Out McGovern Data
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16The Secret Service acknowledged today that confidential information was passed to the White House from an agent guarding Senator George McGovern in last year's Presidential campaign.

title: No Defense...
description: President Nixon's speech on the Watergate scandals tne supplementary statement issued by the White House are as remarkable for what they omit as for what they contain. In essence, they constitute a concession by Mr. Nixon that he has no detailed defense to offer against the damaging testimony before the Senate Watergate committee. In place of a rebuttal, he offers an omnibus denial and a plea for the public to turn its attention to other pressing public issues. It is a sad, disappointing and wholly unconvincing performance.

title: MISS FURNESS FACES A $1MILLION SUIT
description: The owner of an agency that promises to help people find jobs overseas said yesterday he had been blasphemed by Consumer Affairs Commissioner Betty Furness and intended to sue her for $1million.

title: Ziegler, 2 Others Reportedly Questioned
description: WASHINGTON, Aug., 16 (UPI)Three members of President Nixon's present staff, including his press secretary, Ronald L. Ziegler, have been questioned by staff lawyers for the Senate Watergate committee, it was learned today.

title: ConnorsIs Defeated by Gottfried
The Marriage Maker Dies in Gretna Green
description: LOCKER BIE, Scotland, Aug. 16. (AP)Tbe man from Gretna Green who married thousands of runaway couples from almost every country in the world is dead. Robert Hastings, who acted as registrar of Gretna until 1970, died here latt night at the age of 45. The cause of death was not disclosed.

title: 2d Chance for Trotter
description: Another blood test will be made tomorrow on Carosio, the Italian trotter who won a prestigious race on Wednesday after a blood sample showed that he had swamp fever.

title: BITTMAN RESIGNS AS HUNT'S LAWYER
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 (AP) William O. Bittman, a Watergate defense lawyer who testimony says was paid thousands of dollars in a clandestine cash drop, withdrew today as the attorney for a convicted conspirator, E. Howard Hunt Jr.

title: Timbering in U.S. Forests Will Cut Recreational Use
description: BIG TIMBER, Mont., Aug 14 Forest Service rangers across the country have begun implementing basic new policy directives from Washington that favor increased timber production over recreational uses on the 187 million acres of national forest lands

title: British Researchers Develop an Experimental Vaccine Against a Major Cause of Mental Retardation
description: LONDON, Aug. 16  Two British researchers have de veloped an experimental vac tine against a common vira disease that is considered ar important cause of mental re tardation throughout the world

title: ... No Excuse
description: Perhaps the most extraordinary passage of President Nixon's speech was his bald assertion that it is Watergate that stops him from acting on the nation's urgent problems. Legislation vital to your health and wellbeing sits unattended on the Congressional calendar, he declared. That is a strange remark from a Chief Executive who has vetoed three out of the last four Health, Education and Welfare appropriations bills, has impounded health funds and has blockedeven illegally pocketvetoedhealth bills passed by Congress.

title: Babylon Officials Reject Wyandanch Housing Plan
description: NORTH LINDENHURST, L.I. Aug. 16  The Babylon Tow Board today turned down till controversial proposal by till state's Urban Development Cor poration to build 182 units 01 housing in the mostly blacl hamlet of Wyandanch.

title: RENATO ANGIOLILLO
description: ROME, Aug. 16  Former Senator Renato Angiolillo, who for more than 28 years had been publisher and managing editor of the Rome newspaper Il Tempo, died of heart failure at his home here today. He was 72 years old.

title: FLORIDA JURY GETS REPORT ON RIFLES.
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla.. Aug. 16 The third in a series of informers testified today that the alleged ringleader of a plot to disrupt the Republican National Convention last summer told him he was stockpiling rifles and grenades.

title: Nixon and the Political Prospects
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 In his book Six Crises, written several years before he became President, Richard M. Nixon suggested that one of the tests of a great political leader was whether he would risk all when the stakes were such that he must win or lose all. President Nixon's speech to the nation last night was, in the opinion of many persons here, considerable political risk. In the speech Mr. Nixon declined to answer specifically the charges made against him in the Congressional Watergate hearings and called on Congress to quit pursuing the matter so he could get on with governing the

title: Where Do We Go From Here?
description: The President's effort to talk his way out of the Watergate tragedy has failed, but he still has the power to act, and to propose remedies for the crimes he admits were committed. So maybe now he will come forward with practical legislation to correct the system that made Watergate possible.

title: Wedding Is Held for Mrs. Erpf And G.P. Van de Bovenkamp
description: Mrs. Sue Stuart Mortimore Erpf, widow of Armand G. Erpf, the investment banker, patron of the arts and financial architect of the current New York magazine, was married in the Catskills last Saturday to Gerrit Pieter Van de Bovenkamp, an architect.

title: On Top Of Old Blackdome
description: AMHERST, Mass. August 1,  midsummer, from Maplecrest in the northern Catskills up Elmer Barnum Road, dirt, to the trail's foot where I park carrying small plastic shopping bag containing water flask, sandwich (peanut butter), fig newtons, sunglasses, eyeglasses, trail map and banana.

title: SKYLAB 3 TO STUDY A BRILLIANT COMET
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 16 (AP)The space agency said today that Skylab 3 would be launched Nov. 9, a date that wills place astronauts in orbit during a dazzling pass around the sun of a comet that experts believe may be the most awesome of the 20th century.

title: Housing for Wyandanch
description: All the problems posed by the unmet need to provide adequate housing for a booming suburban population have converged on the Long Island hamlet Wyandanch. How much housing is actually needed? What will new development do to local taxes and the school system? Will new people flood in to settled neighborhoods, and if so, who will they be? Who has the right to make the final decision?

title: Board Votes to Demolish Jail in Greenwich Village
description: The Board of Estimate voted unanimously last night to demolish a Greenwich Village symbol of unhappy memories  the onetime Women's House of Detention, at Greenwich Avenue and 10th Street.

title: Advertising: L'eggs Stepping Out
description: One step at a time, L'eggs has been moving across the country into every major marketing area. Now it's here, it's national and it's ready for a fullscale advertising program to break.

title: A LIBYAN HIJACKS PLANE TO ISRAEL
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 16An apparently drunken Libyan hijacked a Lebanese airliner carrying 125 passengers and crew members and forced it to land at Israel's Lydda airport today.

title: Brazilian Court Backs U.S. Over the Sale of Residence
description: BRASILIA, Aug: 16 (AP)The Brazilian Supreme Court has cleared the way for the United States to. sell its ambassadorial residence in Rio de Janeiro to West Germany for $2million, although Brazilian officials claimed it for half that price.

title: Red Smith
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Aug. 16Three Pinkertons with sixguns on the hip made a semicircle around Secretariat as the world's most famous case of sniffles left off plucking at the coverlet and walked from Barn 24 to the race track with George Davis on his withers. Lucien Laurin, the trainer, and Mrs. John Tweedy, the colt's owner, mounted an observation post on the backstretch and watched with fixed attention as Davis galloped Secretariat slowly once around the course. Then everybody walked back to the barn, where the red horse bucked and played while Eddie Sweat washed him down. It was obvious he had shaken off the cold that had dictated his withdrawal from Saturday's Travers Stakes, but not even this assurance that his champion was feeling himself again could relieve Laurin's depression. Only half an hour earlier the fast 4yearold, Spanish Riddle, owner of the Saratoga record for six furlongs, had broken down and the trainer was waiting for Xrays to indicate whether the horse's life could be saved.

title: Inmate's Plan to Cut Sentence By Forgery Foiled by His Death
description: A convicted burglar who died before he could. benefit from his own scheme, apparently arranged to have a burglary conviction reduced from a felony to a misdemeanor in Brooklyn Supreme Court last March. This would have meant a fouryear reduction of what had been a 6 to 14year sentence.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Twentyfour New York streettheater companies will join eight outoftown groups for the third annual Lincoln Center Community / Street Theater Festival, to run at Lincoln Center Plaza from next Tuesday through Sept. 3.

title: Yankees Hope for a Bon Voyage
Father Recalls Vain Search for Son Feared to Be Among 27 Slaying Victims in Houston
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 16Fred Hilligiest has trouble explaining it. Scarred by the Depression, he had made his goal to build walls of security around his family. It took much of his 51 years, working for the Houston Highway Department, but he succeeded.

title: His Play for Giants Surprises Clements
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, N. J., Aug. 16You'll have to pardon Vin Clements if he seems surprised, even a trifle amazed, at his current state of affairs with the New York Giants.

title: Japanese Will Pay All the Passengers Of Hijacked Plane
description: TOKYO, Aug. 16Japan Air Lines announced today that foreign as well as Japanese passengers in the company's jet that was hijacked last month would each receive 500,000 yen about $1,887as a token of sympathy for their 87hour ordeal as captives.

title: Selman Waksman, Nobel Winner, Dies
description: HYANNIS, Mass., Aug. 16Dr. Selman A. Waksman, a Nobel laureate and principal discoverer of streptomycin, died today at Hyannis Hospital, He was 85 years old.

title: Harvester Profit at Peak In Quarter and 9 Months
The TShirt Has Become the Medium for a Message
description: The Tshirt is of itself nothing but knitted cotton affair whose ancestor an undershirt. It's a nonfashion, says Anne Drew Fox, an artist who designs Tshirts. All it does is cover you. What's interesting about it is the message it communicates.

title: Boating Outlook
description: The National Weather Service issued this forecast at 6:45 P.M. yesterday for New York Harbor, Long Island Sound, Long Island south shore and nearby coastal areas:

title: Chrysler Workers Return
description: DETROIT, Aug. 16 (UPI)With about 1,000 union loyalists at plant gates to insure peace, workers returned to their jobs today at a key Chrysler plant shut for nearly 30 hours by a radical labor group.

title: Acknowledging the Variety Factor in Marriage
description: Despite the vast outpouring of articles, books and symposia that attack marriage, I believe that it is worth saving: for its own sake, for the children, for the future of the nation and for the continuation of the human race. In every civilized society the family still remains the fundamental social unit. For the happiness and wellbeing of children there is no adequate substitute for a home and the love of mother and father. I wish it were possible for all men and women to experience the joy of having children and, indeed, grandchildren. If marriage is to survive, however, it must be transformed into a healthier institution than it has hitherto been.

title: Abby Warner Has Nuptials
description: Miss Abby Claire Warner, daughter of Aaron W. Warner of New York and the late Dr. Charlotte R. Warner, was married here yesterday morning to Alan L, Myerson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Myerson of Kings Point, L. I., and New York. Civil Court Judge Irving Younger performed the ceremony in his chambers.

title: A FRENCH CHARGE STIRS BONN ANGER
description: BONN, Aug. 16A Cabinet official set off a of indignation in West Germany this week by accusing the ernment of Chancellor Brandt of becoming aloof from the rest of Europe.

title: Mexican Floods Kill Two
description: MEXICO CITY, Aug. 16 (Reuters)  Two people have died, 16 disappeared and thousands have been made homeless in storms and widespread floods in central Mexico in the past 48 hours, the police here said today. They estimated the damage at $40million.

description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 The Secret Service acknowledged today that confidential information was passed to the White House from an agent guarding Senator George McGovern in last year's Presidential campaign.

The Varied Cuisine of Brazil
description: The restaurants reviewed here each Friday are rated four, stars to none, based on the author's subjective judgment of quality in relation to the price of meals and the quality of comparable establishments. Roughly, one star may be translated as fair, two stars as good, three as excellent and four as superb.

title: Increase Termed Largest Since Rally That Followed Imposition of Phase 1

description: The Fire Department yesterday urged that city residents use special telephone numbers in each borough report fires. The calls are received at the department's borough communications centers.

description: David Begelman has been elected president of Columbia Pictures, succeeding Stanley Schneider who resigned on June 7 to become an independent producer.

title: New HoldupAlert System Being Tested by Police
description: Police Commissioner Donald F. Cawley yesterday demonstrated a new computerized robberyalert system for stores and banks. It will be tested at 16 sites in a pilot program that begins today,

title: Fishing Prospects: No Dearth of Blues
description: AREA A  Blues are the one consistently good catch in this area, which has been bothered by midweek storms. Catches on the surf have averaged three pounds and outside boats have brought in blues up to 11 pounds chumming. Striped bass have appeared from Midway Beach to Barnegat Inlet and fishermen using plugs say the catches. average about seven pounds. Fluke fishing is generally good, especially at Barnegat and Point Pleasant. In Barnegat Bay, snapper blues are plentiful and crabbing remains excellent.

title: EGYPTIANS ARE QUIET ON ISRAEL'S CHARGE
description: CAIRO, Aug. 16  Egyptian Government sources today declined to confirm or deny an Israeli charge that 10 to 20 North Korean pilots were flying Egyptian military planes.

title: 7 Watergate Signatures Are Bought for $180
description: A collection of seven signatures of key Watergate figures was sold last night by the Charles Hamilton Galleries for $180 at the WaldorfAstoria Hotel.

description: HEMPSTEAD, Aug. 16 "John is not a rahrah type of player, Maybe that's why he and I get along so well together.

title: Board Votes to Demolish Jail in Greenwich Village
description: The Board of Estimate voted unanimously last night to demolish a Greenwich Village symbol of unhappy memories  the onetime Women's House of Detention, at Greenwith Avenue and 10th Street.

title: U.S. Is Off Slowly at Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 16 (AP)The young, eager United States basketball team won its opening game impressively today, but the host Soviet Union won four of the gold medals awarded on the first full round of competition in the seventh World University Games.

title: U.S.Enriched Loaf Is a Bargain at 23c In Moscow's Stores
description: MOSCOW, Aug, 16While American housewives are paying higher prices for baked goods, Russian bread remains one of the biggest consumer bargains in the Soviet Union.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: It may be five days before private beaches on a stretch of Barnegat Bay will be clean enough to reopen, according to Mohamed Elsaady, chief chemist of Jersey Testing Laboratories of Newark.

title: Notes on People
description: The plot involving the reporter who hit the guru in the face with a cream pie seemed to be thickening in Detroit. The pie was thrown last week at City Hall by Pat Halley, who works for an underground paper, The Fifth Estate.

title: Rail TonMileage Up 5.7%
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the latest week totaled an estimated 15.9 billion tonmiles, 5.7 per cent above the corresponding week last year. Carloading during the same week totaled 532,557 cars, 3.1 per cent above last year.

title: 3 OF OASIS GROUP YIELD TO LIBYANS
description: Libya won another victory yesterday in its running confrontation with Western oil interests when three of the four members of the Oasis Group of oil companies, the Continental Oil Company, the Marathon Oil Company and the Amerada Hess Corporation announced they were giving the North African Government 51 per cent participation in their operations.

title: ELIZABETH DE VRIES
description: ROSSMOOR, N. J., Aug. 16Elizabeth Smith De Vries, a former president of the New Jersey League of Women Voters and a delegate in 1961 to the White House Conference on Education, died at her home here yesterday. She was 68 years old.

title: Sihanouk Aide Bars Negotiations on a Compromise Pact and Predicts Victory
description: PARIS, Aug. 16A representative of Prince Norodom Sihanouk said here today that there would be no negotiations, not even preliminary contacts, for a compromise Cambodian settlement, and that his side's forces would ultimately take Phnom Penh whatever happens.

title: 6 Named in Indictment on MortgageFraud Plot
Texas Commerce Planning Bank Merger
description: Texas Commerce Bancshares, Inc. announced yesterday it had reached preliminary agreement to acquire the Austin Bancshares Corporation.

title: Shipping/Mails
NIXON SIGNS A BILL ON NOW ACCOUNTS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 (AP) President Nixon has signed a bill permitting savings institutions in Massachusetts and New Hampshire to continue providing interestbearing accounts with the equivalent of checking privileges, the White House said today.

title: BOYS LOSE PLEA ON FINGERPRINTS
description: NEWARK, Aug. 16  A ;tate Appeals Court ruled tolay that 22 eighthgrade boys who had been fighting a court irder to be fingerprinted in a nurder investigation must cornply.

title: U.S. SAYS SAIGON COULD USE ARMS INSIDE CAMBODIA
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16The Defense Department said in a letter made public today that Saigon could legally use Americansupplied military equipment to attack North Vietnamese sanctuaries in neighboring Cambodia that posed a direct threat to South Vietnam.

title: Lotz's 67 Leads Golf; Devlin Is Disqualified
For Weekend Chefs
description: In the menus below, the dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: AID PLAN RESUMED FOR RURAL HOUSING
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16The Farmers Home Administration announced today that it was resuming, under court order, a program to help lowincome families buy rural housing.

title: U.S. SAYS SAIGON COULD USE ARMS INSIDE CAMBODIA
Merger Will Give Texans 15% of Stock in Time Inc.
So Ho Made a Historic District
description: SoHo, a 26block area in lower, Manhattan with an abundance of mid19thcenury castiron architecture, was designated yesterday historic district by the city's Landmarks Preservation. commission.

title: National Gallery Unveils Group Portrait by Rubens
description: The National Gallery of Art has finally unveiled a star acquisition: Deborah Kip, Wife of Sir Balthasar Gerbier, and Her Children, an expansive painting by Peter Paul Rubens that was bought two years ago and has been under study since.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Perhaps only a vintner who has seen Thunderbird risen like an Edsel from the ashes of his revulsion can fully savor the plight of latterday designers. Once they could count on the public for quick and decisive reaction to the tastefulness of seasonal offerings.

title: Woman Amateur Golfer Finds Tourneys Costly
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., Aug. 16The defending woman's National Amateur golf champion was not permitted to stay (for free) at the Montclair Golf Club, where the title tournament is being staged, or at the homes of any club members.

title: Selman Waksman, Nobet Winner, Dies
description: HYANNIS, Mass., Aug. 16 Dr. Selman A, Waksman, a Nobel laureate and principal discoverer of streptomycin, died today at Hyannis Hospital. He was 85 years old.

title: Gibson Says Political Rivals Plotted Clash
Swarm of Bees Evicted From Brooklyn Building
description: A swarm of bees was evicted from a residence in the Park Slope section in Brooklyn last night by a beekeeper who, with the aid of a Fire Department tower ladder and a tranquilizer spray, moved them to the Brooklyn Botanic Garden.

title: Sesame Street Denounced by Soviet as Imperialistic
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 16  The American educational television program Sesame Street has been denounced in the Soviet Union as the latest example of United States cultural imperialism.

title: People in Sports: To Err Is Angelic
description: The stock of Bobby Winkles has dropped as quickly as the California Angels in the American League Western Division standing. The slide by the Angels has revived reports that Frank Robinson will replace Winkles and become the major league's first black manager.

title: Steel Haulers Will Vote On a Revised Contract
description: WASHINGTON, Aug.16 (UPI)  Teamsters Union officials said today that they would resubmit to their steel hauler members a revised contract that was rejected last month while other truck driver members were approving a national master agreement.

title: A LIBYAN HIJACKS PLANE TO ISRAEL
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. I6An apparently drunken Libyan hijacked a Lebanese airliner carrying 125 passengers and crew members and forced it to land at Israel's Lydda airport today.

title: MORTON I. BERSON, PLASTIC SURGEON
description: Dr. Morton I. Berson, an in ternationally known plasth surgeon, died Wednesday Lenox Hill Hopital. He wa 76 years old and lived at 11 East 60th Street

title: Aaron Clout Helps Braves Crush Cubs
CHAVEZ PICKET SHOT TO DEATH ON COAST
description: DELANO, Calif., Aug. 16 (AP)A picket for the United Farm Workers union was shot to death today, and the union's leader, Cesar Chavez, called off picketing amid mounting violence in the farm workers grape pickers strike. The police said two men had been booked for investigation of murder.

title: Justice Blocks an Order On Employment of Indians
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 (AP) Supreme Court Justice Thurgood Marshall blocked today the effect of a lower court ruling that knocked out employ. ment preference for Indians in the Federal Bureau of Indian Affairs.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: MIME In the Sculpture Garden of the Museum of Modern Art, tonight and tomorrow night at 8 o'clock, Jon Harvey will do what he calls mimetic sculpture. It is an art of no small pretensions: Using his body much as a painter uses his brush, Mr. Harvey seeks to create a living, multidimensional interaction of form, space and time, we are told. Mimetic sculpture creates an everchanging interplay of emotional realities that emerge as an abstract continuity with roots in the particular everyday reality of each man's life.

title: U.S. Aides in Chile Put on Alert as the Crisis Deepens
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 16The United States Embassy put all its personnel on the alert today after unsuccessful bombing attempts at the homes of three embassy officials and a rising antiAmerican campaign in the leftwing press.

title: WorId Bank Will Extend Kenya RoadBuilding Loan
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 (UPI) The World Bank announced today it will lend $29million or improvements of about 440 piles of road in Kenya where he World Bank will hold its  nnual meeting next month.

title: San Diego Bid Denied
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 16 (AP)  The California Supieme Court denied today a request from the City of San Diego, that the transfer of the Padres baseball team to Washington be blocked. In denying the petitiod for a hearing, the court made no comment.

title: NIXON AIDES SURE HE HAS DEFLATED WATERGATE ISSUE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16The White House sought today to convey confidence that President Nixon had pulled the stinger of the Watergate scandal.

title: Department Store Sales Up
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales last week were an estimated $922,000,000, up 10 per cent from the yearearlier $838,000,000). Total retail store sales were about $9,468,000,000, up 12 per cent from last year's $8,427,000,000.

title: MARSHALS CALLED TO TENSE ST, CROIX
description: CHRISTIANSTED, St. Croix, V.I., Aug. 16The Governor of the Virgin Islands_ announced tonight that a force of Federal marshals was flying here to help maintain order on this racially tense tourist island.

title: 5 Shot on East Side
description: Five persons, Including three bystanders, were shot on the Lower East Side last night in what was apparently a clash between two groups of Chinese teenagers. Details on Page 29.

title: RICHARDSON AIDE AND MATZ CONFER
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 16Lester Matz, a key witness who has been given partial immunity by Federal investigators looking into alleged kickbacks from contractors to Vice President Agnew, met here today with Henry E. Petersen, Assistant United States Attorney General, in the offices of United States Attorney George Beall.

title: State Schedules Public Hearings On First Part of Noise Controls
description: TRENTON, Aug. 16  The State Department of Environmental Protection announced today the first in a series of proposed regulations to control noise in New Jersey.

title: With Secretariat Out, 10 Are Expected to Start in Travers
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Aug. 16Kenney Noe Jr., the racing secretary for the New York Racing Association, is satisfied with the possibiilty of a field of 10 for the Travers on Saturday.

title: Nixon Is Doubted In City on Coast
description: CONCORD, Calif., Aug. 16  He didn't explain himself, he didn't come out with what the people wanted to hear, Alma Ward said this morning, as she put some carrots into a plastic shopping bag. He's still trying to hide the one thing the people wanted to hearthe truth, what really happened.

title: Price Freeze to Continue On Gas and Diesel Fuel
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 (AP)  A price freeze on gasoline and diesel fuel will be continued until Aug. 31, but will be lifted from other petroleum products this coming Monday, the Cost of Living Council announced today.

title: JOHN M. GREENE DIES; A NEWSMAN 50 YEARS
description: ALBANY, Aug. 16John M. Greene. legislative correspondent for The Long Island Press and a newspaperman for more than half a century, died yesterday in the Albany Medical Center. He was 80 years old and lived in Rockville Centre, L.I.

title: F.C.C. Asked to Hold Hearings on Jackson License
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16The Federal Communications Commission was asked today to hold new hearings on the award of a television license for station WLBTTV, Jackson, Miss., on the ground that new evidence had been discovered of corrupt dealings by the group that appears likeliest to get the license.

title: With Secretariat Out, 10 Are Expected to Start in the Travers
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Aug. 16Kenney NoeJr., the racing secretary for the New York Racing Association, is satisfied with thepossibiilty of a field of 10 for the Travers on Saturday.

title: Road to New Haven Is Slow but Sure
description: The act of getting therehas always been a challenging aspect of the annual GiantsJets exhibition game at the Yale Bowl in New Haven.Traffic moves slowly on the twolane access roads from the Connecticut Turnpike and the Wilbur Cross Parkway to the parking areas adjacent to the 59yearold stadium.

title: Chavez Asks Mourning Fast
description: DELANO, Calif., Aug. 16 (UPI)Cesar Chavez, United Farm Workers Union leader, called today for a threeday fast of union members to commemorate a dead union member and repudiate increasing violence in the grape fields. Nagi Daiffullah, a 24yearold immigrant U.F.W. member from Yemen, died yesterday of head injuries suffered during a scuffle with Gilbert Cooper. a Kern County sheriff's deputy, outside a Lamont tavern Tuesday night.

title: Lexington Papers Sold
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Aug. 16 (AP)  The Lexington HeraldLeader Company will be sold to the Knight Newspapers, Inc., the Knight organization and the First Security National Bank and Trust Company, of Lexington, announced today. The HeraldLeader Company publishes the morning Herald, the afternoon Leader and the Saturday and Sunday HeraldLeader.

title: Soviet Defector Takesto Raft
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Aug. 16 (AP)A Soviet engineer rowed a rubber raft across the Black Sea for three and a half days, arrived in Turkey and asked for political asylum, Turkish officials said today. The engineer, Valery Yanin, 26 years old, told the authorities that he jumped overboard with the raft from a Soviet ship.

title: Dollar Up to Best Levels In Two Months in Europe
description: LONDON, Aug. 16 (AP)The longtroubled United States dollar improved sharply today, in European money markets, rising to its best levels in two months. It was the seventh consecutive day that the dollar advanced.

title: Gainesville Testimony Conflicts With That in a Fire Bomb Trial
description: FAYETTEVILLE, Ark., Aug. 16Testimony by an F.B.I. informer, William W. Lemmer, in the Gainnesville Eight trial conflicts with F.B.I. testimony at the trial of a teenager convicted of firebombing a University of Arkansas landmark here.

title: PLANTS MUST PAY TO TREAT WASTE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 (AP) The Environmental Protectio Agency established regulations today requiring industries that discharge waste water into federally aided municipal treatment systems to pay their share of the costs.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: PLYMOUTH, England, Aug. 16 (Reuters)West Germany today appeared the likely winner of the Admiral's Cup, recognized as the world championship of ocean yacht racing. The nation's three cup entries have completed the 605mile Fastnet race, final event of the fourrace series.

title: Further Climb Reported For U.S. Crop Exports
description: A further sharp rise in export bookings of wheat, corn and soybeans, the key farm crops, was reported after the close of commodities trading yesterday by the Department of Commerce.

title: Cox Opposes Use of Milk Issue To Settle Dispute Over Privilege
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 Archibald Cox, the special prosecutor in the Watergate case, joined with the Administration today in its attempt to delay producing White House documents on a controversial increase in milk price supports in 1971.

title: Actor and Intruder Battle To Death in Village Flat
description: A 3Iyearold actormodel and an intruder into his West Village walkup apartment killed each other in a bloody knife and gun struggle early yesterday as the actor's wife watched in horror, the police said.

title: Black Mortgage Banking Is Seen Missing Target
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16The president of a Governmentsponsored agency that deals in mortgages conceded today that a threeyearold effort to start and help black mortgage banking companies had been an almost complete failure.

title: HAYDEN STONE, INC. REPORTS A DEFICIT
description: Hayden Stone, Inc., one of Wall Street's larger brokerage and investment banking concerns, reported yesterday a net loss for the quarter to June 30 of $1,356,000 and a net loss for the year to June 30 of $1,347,000.

title: 2d Chance for Trotter
description: Another blood test will be made tomorrow on Carosio, the Italian trotter who won a prestigious race on Wednesday after a blood sample showed that, he had swamp fever.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: It must be very disheartening for man to read constantly that he is bungler and a fool. Especially when it is far from true.

title: Big Board List Weakens Despite Brisk Early Rally
Seoul's Man in the U.S. Is Mr. Lee and Mr. Yang
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 The chief of the Korean intelligence agency in the United States calls himself Sang Ho Lee and is listed as a minister of the South Korean Embassy. He says he is responsible for security affairs in the Embassy.

title: SHOOTING VICTIM IDENTIFIED HERE
description: A former student of a man who was shot and killed Wednesday night in an exchange of fire with policemen identified the victim yesterday as Dr. Jerome Walker Jones, former professor at Paine College at Augusta, Ga., and holder of a doctoral degree from Harvard University, the police said.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: PISCATAWAY, Aug. 16Label this one The Loneliness of the LongDistance Discus Thrower.

title: Sticks and Bones
description: Peace with more or less honor concludes the running battle between producer Joseph Papp and the Columbia Broadcasting System over the delayed presentation the TV version of Sticks and Bones. The controversial play about a blind Vietnam veteran home from the wars to a strained household and town will be broadcast over the C.B.S. network this eveningbut only some Americans will be permitted to watch it and judge its worth for themselves. About half of C.B.S,'s affiliated stations have decided to black it out or to present it outside prime time.

title: Canarsie Board Ordered To Vote Again on Principal
description: School Chancellor Irving Anket yesterday ordered the Community School Board for District 18, covering Canarsie and East Flatbush sections of Brooklyn, to hold a new vote on the selection of a permanent principal for Public School 208.

title: Gas Stations to Halt Sales
description: DETROIT, Aug. 16 (UPI)A group representing more than 40 per cent of Michigan's service station dealers has voted overwhelmingly to stop selling gasoline the week of Aug. 1925 to protest federallyordered price rollbacks. The vote came last night at a meeting attended by about 400 dealers. The resolution to stop selling gasoline in protest of an order by the Cost of Living Council rolling back gasoline prices was passed without dissent.

title: US. ORDERS CURB ON WHEAT LIFTED; Restrictions on Planting Are Removed to Spur Output
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 (UPI) Agriculture Secretary Earl L. Butz lifted all planting restrictions today on wheat, which soared past $5 a bushel this week on Midwestern grain markets, in an effort to raise 1974 production enough to exceed heavy demands.

title: Maryland Inquiry Suggests Millions in Kickbacks
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 16Under a pattern of kickbacks described to a Federal grand jury here, some $3million to $5million has been used in the last 10 years for underthetable payments and campaign contributions to Maryland public officials from consulting engineers.

title: ANDREA DORIA QUEST IS ENDED FOR SEASON
description: NANTUCKET, Mass., Aug 16 (AP)The crew of the Andrea Doria salvaging expedition was headed for port today after completing attempts to recover an estimated $4million in cash and valuables from the sunken luxury liner.

title: Mounted Policeman Accused Of Selling Marijuana on Duty
description: A mounted policeman who allegedly made his deals while riding his beat in Central Park has been indicted on charges of selling marijuana, the state's special prosecutor, Maurice H. Nadjari, announced yesterday.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: Winning numbers drawn on Aug. 16 were: NEW YORK 135233

title: BLUMENTHAL ASKS AID FOR THE AGED
description: Assemblyman Albert H. Blumenthal, the Liberal party candidate for Mayor, called on the city administration yesterday to provide improved housing and other services for the elderly.

title: FACTORY OUTPUT CLIMBED IN JULY; HOUSING UNITS UP
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16Industrial production rose strongly in July and housing starts continued at a high level, Government reports disclosed today.

title: HARASSMENT LAID TO CREDIT AGENCY
description: The city's Department of Consumer Affairs has filed a suit against the owners of a Bronx collection agency, charging threats to debtors children, obscene telephone calls and masquerading as police detectives.

title: Equity Financing
description: A public offering of 600,000 shares of beneficial interest of Guardian Mortgage Investors at 33% per share was made yesterday by underwriters headed by Lehman Brothers. The company's stock was up  at 33 on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: FACTORY OUTPUT CLIMBED IN JULY; HOUSING UNITS UP
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16Industrial production rose strongly in July and housing starts continued at a high level, Government reports disclosed today.

title: The Pop Life
description: Now nearly over (the last concert, Ike and Tina Turner, is on Sunday), the 16day Soul at the Center 73 festival of black music and art expects a deficit of between $100,000 and $150,000. And Ellis Haizlip, coproducer, expects some relaxation. Not only is he on duty during the festival (with several of the shows starting at midnight), but also he is working daytimein Atlanta. He is assisting a black sorority group with its national convention, and every morning he flies down to Atlanta, returning in the afternoon. him. We are not a profit It just happens to coincide, he shrugs.

title: Futhsberg Deplores Vacant Courtrooms
description: Since it is the height of the summer, 30 of the 34 courtrooms of the State Supreme Court in Manhattan at 60 Centre Street are unused. No trials are scheduled.

title: Dealers at Hunt's Point Market Call It Thieves'
description: The Hunt's Point produce market, part of a vast tract of cityowned land and buildings first opened in 1967 and still being developed, is a community of merchants who say they are terrorized by crime.

title: A. T. &
description: The American Telephone & Telegraph Corporation has asked the Federal Communications Commission for permission to extend for another year its development telephone service on Metroliner trains operated by Amtrak between New York and Washington.

title: Dealers at Hunt's Point Market Call It Thieves'
description: The Hunt's Point produce market, part of a vast tract of cityowned land and buildings first opened in 1967 and still being developed, is a community of merchants who say they are terrorized by crime.
