Construction Contracts Set
description: Arthur G. McKee & Co., construction engineers of Cleveland, reported yesterday that its Italian subsidiary, Compagnia Tecnica Industrie Petroli, S.P.A., has been awarded contracts for two chemical projects in southern Italy valued at $200million.

title: Richard Tregaskis, Author, Dead at 56
description: HONOLULU, Aug. 16 (UPI)  Richard Tregaskis, veteran war correspondent and noted author, died yesterday at the age of 56, apparently a drowning victim.

title: STOCK PRICES SLIP ON AMEX AND OTC
Israel Is More Isolated, Some Arab Envoys Say
description: CAIRO, Aug. 16Arab diplomats here say that events of the last few days show that Israel is getting steadily more isolated morally and politically, even from the Western European countries that in the past have given her their full support.

title: U.S.Enriched Loaf Is a Bargain at 23c In Moscow's Stores
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 16While American housewives are paying higher prices for baked goods, Russian bread remains one of the biggest consumer bargains in the Soviet Union.

title: Fishing Village Squeezed by. Prosperity and Inflation
description: CALABASH, N. C., Aug. 15 Calabash is a 282yearold fishing village taken to its logical 20thcentury conclusion. It has 160 residents and 17 sea food restaurants. All are thriving, although a certain toll has been extracted by national inflation and by the peculiar nature of Calabash's success. The Talk The town's resof taurants have beCalabash, come so popular, N. C. thanks partly to a growing interest in sea rood among travelers from the inland, that they now serve hundreds of thousands of people a year.

title: MAGRUDER ENTERS A PLEA OF GUILTY
description: WASHINGTON, Aug.16 Jeb Stuart Magruder, the former deputy director of the Committee for the Reelection of the President, pleaded guilty today to a onecount indictment charging conspiracy to obstruct justice, defraud the United States and eavesdrop on the Democratic national headquarters at the Watergate.

title: ERVIN SCORES NIXON ON TALK AND TAPES
description: GASTONIA, N. C., Aug. 16 (Reuters)The Senate Watergate committee chairman, Sam J. Ervin Jr., said today it was unfortunate that President Nixon had taken the attitude that the committee was out to get him.

title: MARSHALS CALLED TO TENSE ST. CROIX
description: CHRISTIANSTED, St. Croix, V.I., Aug. 16The Governor of the Virgin Islands announced tonight that a force of Federal marshals was flying here to help maintain order on this racially tense tourist island.

title: What the Court Has Done to Movies
description: The recent Supreme Court ruling on obscenity, which permits local communities to set up their own censorship boards, has forced some movie producers to cancel projects, others to seek financing in Europe and at least one to shoot risky scenes in several different versions.

title: BIDLESS PURCHASE OFBEEF APPROVED
description: The Board of Estimate yesterday unanimously authorized city purchases of beef and other meat products without public bids for the next four ronths, or for a shorter period iF the meat shortage ends sooner.

title: Books of The Times
description: There is a type of young American who, when he goes abroad, behaves like an orphan without a parent country. Will you adopt me? he asks. Can I live in your culture? Will you love me and dandle me on your knee as my Uncle Sam never would when he was alive? They dream, these travelers, of a oneway ticket to commitment, a faroff assignation with themselves. I'll meet you in Istanbul, they say to that other who always walks beside them, and we'll get it all together there; we'll really make it.

title: Dr. Ann Pollak, 55, Dead; A Former Pathologist Here
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 16Dr. Ann Pollak, a leading pathologist attached to the Michael Reese Hospital of the University of Chicago and a former practitioner in New York, died here yesterday at the age of 55.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: Ali Is Ready to Spar
description: DEER PARK LAKE, Pa., Aug. 16 (AP)  Muhammad Ali said today he would spar next Wednesday for the first time since his jaw was broken in a 12round loss to Ken Norton March 31. All is training here for a heavyweight with Norton Sept, 10.

title: C.B.S. Stations Balk on Sticks and Bones
description: Affiliate stations of the Columbia Broadcasting System have massively defected from, tonight's telecast of the controversial antiwar play Sticks and Bones.

title: Merger Will Give Texans 15% of Stock in Time Inc.
description: An East Texas lumber millionaire named Arthur Temple, his 84yearold aunt and several of their associates and relatives corraled 15 per cent bf Time Inc.'s stock yesterday and thereby became a major force in the United States communi cations industry.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Korean Plumbers
description: Watergatelike mystery enshrouds the strange abduction of a popular Korean opposition leader in Tokyo last week, and his equally strange reappearance at his Seoul home six days later, shaken but unharmed. It is already plain that officials there will be just as happy the mystery is never cleared up.

title: Smut Standard?
description: State Supreme Court Justice Abraham J. Gellinoff, 68yearold grandfather who describes himself as knowing only enough about sex to get by, has handed down an extremely sensible opinion on obscenity and the nation's pornography laws. It exposes, if that is the proper word, the unworkability of the recent series 5to4 rulings through which the United States Supreme Court attempted to define obscenity by relating it prevailing community standards.

title: Safely Panel Cites 3 Spray Adhesives; Production Halted
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 (AP) Two manufacturing corporations s spended today all production and marketing of three spray adhesives that the Consumer Products Safety Commission said might be linked to birth defects.

title: HERBERT WALTERS, EXSENATOR, WAS 81
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Aug. 17 (UPI)Herbert Sanford Walters, former United States Senator, millionaire businessman and a Democratic party stalwart for much of his life, died today at the age of 81.

title: Inflation Around the World
description: The worldwide inflation has historical precedent It is not unusual for the delicate international economic mechanism to blunder out of control. Two major problems are these: the lack of skilled labor and the bidding up of increasingly scarce raw materials.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: PLYMOUTH, England, Aug. 18 (AP) The Brazilian yacht Sala was confirmed by race officials today as the winner of the 605mile Fastnet race, the last contest the Admiral's Cup series, which decides supremacy world ocean racing.

title: SECRET SERVICE SAID TO CHECK 2D AGENT
description: The Secret Service is investigating allegations that another of its agents gave the White House potentially damaging information against Senator George McGovern, C.B.S.TV News said yesterday, according to The Associated Press.

title: Antiques
description: LENINGRADIn this urban repository of vintage decorative arts, the fare is so rich and varied that footweary visitors usually bypass the superb, but little known, collection of native glassware housed in the Russian Museum.

title: Recruiting Offices Bombed
description: DETROIT, Aug. 17 (UPI)Pipe bombs exploded early today at Army recruiting offices in Plymouth and Jackson, Mich., with minor damage and no injuries reported. A group calling itself the Poople's Revolutionary Army of North America said it was responsible.

title: Goodyear Sued on Prices
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 17 (UPI)The Goodyear Tire & Rubber Company of Akron was sued in Federal Court here yesterday for allegedly charging artificially high prices for replacement tires.

title: 102Yard Redskin Return Opens Bills New Stadium
description: BUFFALO, Aug. 17Herb MulKey of the Washington Redskins made the first play in the Buffalo Bills magnificent new stadium a memorable one tonight when he returned the opening kickoff 102 yards for a touchdown. The Redskins went on to defeat the Bills, 3721, before a capacity crowd of 80,020 in Rich Stadium.

title: Swindell Given Contract For Big Polish Foundry
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 17The SwindellDressler Company, an engineering and construction company, has been awarded a $42.86million contract to build an iron foundry on what is now farmland at Koluszki, a suburb of Lodz, in central Poland.

title: Hanoi Leader Back Home
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Aug. 17 (Agence FrancePresse)Premier Pham Van Dong of North Vietnam returned here today from a fiveweek tripto Eastern Europe and the Soviet Union.

title: Art: Scratching Around
description: Somebody at The New York Times who should knowan editor who bosses me around says that I once wrote a column called Yawning and Scratching Along the Avenue. I neither remember it nor really believe that I ever had the gumption to go so frankly on permanent record concerning a temporary condition, but if I did, in whatever year, it must have been in the middle of August.

title: People in Sports: Norton's Team
description: When Ken Norton fights Muhammad All on Sept. 10, it will be without the aid of any hypnotic charm, Michael Dean, the hypnotist who worked with Norton in training. camp before the heavyweight boxer broke Ali's jaw and won a split decision on March 31, has not been invited back.

title: Equity Financing
description: A secondary distribution of 105,000 common shares of Esmark, Inc., at 21 was completed by Goldman Sachs. The company's stock closed at 21 on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: 2 Missing as Dam Breaks At Con Ed Site in Queens
description: Two men were believed drowned and two others were injured yesterday when part of a cofferdam collapsed at the site of a new Consolidated, Edison plant in Astoria, Queens.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A Mobil Oil barge carrying 693,000 gallons of gasoline ran aground near Eastchester Bay in the Bronx yesterday morning, resulting in the closing of a twomile stretch waterway for almost four hours.

title: Our Native Rated 31 Travers Pick
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y. Aug. 17Our Native is the designated favorite for the Travers tomorrow, what with Secretariat not competing.

title: Laura Steibel Wed to David N. Sessions
description: WOODBURY, L. I., Aug. 17 Miss Laura Jane Steibel, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Victor P. Steibel of Manhasset, was married here at noon today to David Noel Sessions of London, son of Mr. and Mrs. Geoffrey Sessions of Denmead, England.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: MEDIEVAL MOOD The Cloisters, the medieval arts branch of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, sits majestically on a high point in northern Manhattan, overlooking 52 acres of trees and lawns and gardens in Fort Tryon Park.

title: Music: Tokyo Quartet
description: The Tokyo String Quartet, a young ensemble born at the Juilliard School just four years ago, made its first appearance in the Mostly Mozart Festival at Philharmonic Hall on Thursday night.

title: Scott Defeats FitzGibbon In Merion Net Semifinal
TV Review
description: Homescreen viewers determinedly dialing for a little night music uncluttered by chatter have two heady samplings of now and then American sounds to ponder.

title: SyriaLebanon Border Reopens 3 Months After Guerrilla Crisis
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 17The border between Lebanon and Syria, which has been closed since Palestinian guerrillas fought the Lebanese army here in May, was reopened today by Syria.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Cincinnati Reds, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 2:15 P.M. Television  Channel 9, 2:15 P.M.) (RadioWHN, 2:15 P.M.)

title: Lord Brookeborough, 85, Dies; Led Northern Ireland, 194363
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Saturday, Aug. 18 (AP)Lord Brookeborough, Prime Minister of Northern Ireland for 20 years in an era of almost complete Protestant ascendency, died early today at his home in Colebrook. He was 85 years old.

title: Suspension of Trading Requested by Pasquaney
description: Pasquaney Bay Company, Ltd., a New Yorkbased insurance holding company, said yesterday that in view of a report from the New York Insurance Department asking for additional capital for a subsidiary, Pasquaney was requesting that trading be suspended in its common stock.

title: Red Bank Is Host Today To PowerBoat Regatta
description: Red Bank, Aug. 17To the resident of Red Bank, it's what the Derby is to Lexington, Ky., and what the 500mile race is to Indianapolis. It doesn't draw as many spectators, the prizes aren't as lavish and the winners won't be laden with roses or doused with champagne.

title: GIANT STORES TAKES A BANKRUPTCY STEP
description: The Giant Stores Corporation announced yesterday it had filed a petition under Chapter XI of the Federal Bankruptcy Act in United States District Court in Boston.

title: New Military Chief Named To Calm Szechwan Area
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 17Peking has named a new commander for the military region that takes in the populous south western province of Szechwan, as well as Tibet, in an apparent effort to bring the huge province under firmer control.

title: Cancer and Contagion
description: It is a measure of man's ignorance of cancer that is impossible to answer definitively so elementary question as: Is cancer in human beings contagious? The traditional view has been that it is not. But that view has been shaken from time to time by unexpected concentrations of cases. In Niles, Ill., a suburb of Chicago, for example, there was an epidemic of childhood leukemia during 195760 with an incidence rate of roughly twenty times normal. More recently physicians in Albany have been astonished by a similar epidemic of another form of cancer, Hodgkin's disease, in cases clustering about a high school class there.

title: Underwriting Loss Cited
description: The RoyalGlobe Insurance Companies reported yesterday that the 14company Americqn group showed sixmonth underwriting loss of $11.8million, up sharply from a $7.1million lot's a year earlier. RoyalGlobe, owned by Royal Insurance Company, Ltd., of Liverpool, England, said its investment income rose by $2million in the same period to $23.9million.

title: Flower Child Trotting for a Twin Goal
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Aug. 17 Joe O'Brien, a Canadian, will represent the United States in the Roosevelt International if his favored Flower Child wins tomorrow night's $50,000 American Trotting Championship at Roosevelt Raceway.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: A Possible Benefit From Watergate

title: Ruckelshaus Says Nixon Should Be More Specific
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17Deputy Attorney General William D. Ruckelshaus suggested today that President Nikon should answer more specifically some of the questions surround. ing the Watergate breakin and subsequent coverup.

title: FRANCIS W. DOHENY, EXASSEMBLYMAN, 63
description: NORTHPORT, L. I. Aug. 17Former Assemblyman Francis W. Doheny, who also had been a Navy man, a lawyer and a teacher, died yesterday in the Veterans Administration Hospital here. He was 63 years old and lived at 47 Northwest Drive.

title: Japan and China Discuss Official Trade. Agreement
description: TOKYO, Aug. 17 (AP)Japan and China began today negotiations aimed at concluding an official governmentlevel trade agreement between the two nations.

title: Shuji Masutani, ExSpeaker Of the House in Japan, Dead
description: TOKYO, Saturday, Aug. 18 (AP)Shuji Masutani, former speaker of the House of Repre sentatives, died of a heart attack today in Note, Ishikawa prefecture. He was 85 years old.

title: Trust Houses Forte Offers 11 a Share In Travelodge Bid
description: Trust Houses Forte, Ltd., of London, in a bid to expand its hotel interests in the United States, offered yesterday to buy Travelodge International, Inc., a Californiabased company, for $30million in cash.

title: GUY HASKINS
description: CHRISTCHURCH, New Zealand, Aug. 17 (Reuters)  Guy Haskins, a middle distance track champion in the United States early in the century, has died here at the age of 89.

title: Exchange Offer Extended
description: The International Banknote Company, Inc. announced yesterday that its exchange offer to holder of the 6 per cent subordinate convertible notes and debentures due Feb. 1, 1984, and scheduled to expire today had been extended to. Sept. 17.

title: Cambodians Back Home To Rubble and Despair
description: KRANG PONG RO, Cambodia, Aug. 17 Cambodian refugees who spent months running from successive battles and air raids have begun returning to their home villages, discovering in most cases that everything they left was burned or destroyed.

title: Bank America Corp. Reviewing Ruling On GAC Merger
description: The BankAmerica Corporation disclosed yesterday that it was studying the additional divestiture requirements imposed by the Federal Reserve Board as a condition of the holding company's proposed acquisition of GAC Finance, Inc.

title: RICHARD STERN
description: CRESTWOOD, N.Y., Aug 17 Richard Stern, who was until 1959 president of CoIonia, Inc., in New York, American distributors of 4711 cologne, died at his home here yesterday.. His age was 79.

title: A Softer View of Chile's Crisis
description: VALPARAISO, Chile, Aug. 12People like to recall the good life in Valparaisowhen they say there was piano in nearly every house. They still enjoy a kind of frayed elegance left over from the days when this was Latin America's key port on the Pacific. And when Valparaisinos talk about the crisis, they generally mean the building of the Panama Canal, which brought slow decline to this port, and not necessarily the faltering attempts of President Salvador Allende Gossens to bring socialism to this Country

title: Walston and duPont Firms Finish Their Realignment
description: Walston & Co. and duPont Glore Forgan, Inc., announced yesterday that they had completed a realignment of their operations on July 2.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Dr. John A. Garraty, professor of history at Columbia University, has been named by the American Council of Learned Societies as the new editor of the Dictionary of American Biography, one of the most authoritative reference works in its field. The appointment, effective Sept. 1, was announced here by Charles Scribner's Sons, publisher of the reference work, which began to appear in 1928.

title: Defense of Privacy
description: The inadequacy of existing statutory safeguards against indiscriminate bugging of telephone calls and other conversations has been highlighted afresh by the Watergate hearings. President Nixon's own nonstop recording marathon makes it plain how far out of control the national obsession with electronic eavesdropping and verbatim recordkeeping has gotten.

title: Books of The Times
description: One of the glories of the modern world is the continuing drop in infant mortality. Not too many, decades ago only 80 per cent or less of all babies survived their first year of life. Now in the United States and many other industrial countries, more than 98 per cent of all babies survive to age 1 and beyond. David R. Zimmerman's book tells the fascinating story of a small but important part of this medical advance, progress that now routinely saves the lives. of thousands of babies each year, babies Who would have died if born even 25 years ago.

title: Platform Shoes Assailed As Hazardous by Doctor
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 (AP) "Sole shoes, the new thickplatform type, pose hazards ranging from fractures and torn ligaments to corns and calluses.

title: Nobody There But Them Chickens
description: On Sunday we had fried chicken for dinner.

title: Mexican Floods Receding
description: MEXICO CITY, Aug. 17 (AP) Floods in Mexico were reported receding today. In the last three months the floods have killed 67 persons, left an estimated 2,000 persons homeless and put at least 7,000 acres of cropland under water.

title: Action in Baltimore On Agnew Awaiting Richardson Ruling
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 17  The United States Attorney's office here has outlined to the Justice Department its investigation into alleged kickbacks to high public officials, including Vice President Agnew, and is now waiting for a decision on whether to proceed to seek indictments.

title: I.T.T. SHAREHOLDER FILES A COURT SUIT
description: A shareholder of the international Telephone and Telegraph Corporatioh this week filed snit in Federal district court alleging that the big conglomerate was defrauded by Lazard Freres & Co. and by several othenoverseas financial institutions.

title: A SOVIET SUCCESS REPORTED IN TEST OF NEW MISSILES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 Secretary of Defense James R. Schlesinger announced today that the Soviet Union has successfully flighttested missiles with multiple warheads that can be directed to separate targets.

title: BOY, 7, MURDERED ON TENEMENT ROOF
description: The body of a 7yearold boy, a large X slashed across his chest, was found on the roof of a Lower East Side tenement yesterday afternoon an hour after he had left his nearby apartment to go outside and play.

title: ROOSEVELT &
description: Roosevelt & Son, Inc., brokerage firm that traces its beginning back to 1797, will cease to do business as a member corporation of the New York Stock Exchange, effective Aug. 22.

title: NIXON'S LAWYERS INSIST HE CAN END A CRIMINAL CASE
To Some U. S. Chinese in China, the Best of Everything Is a Bit Much
description: Thousands of Americans of Chinese extraction have been to China in the two years since Peking and Washington, in dramatic reversal, decided to move toward more normal relations after more than 20 years of hostility.

title: MORE RAIDS ON HUE REPORTED BY SAIGON
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 17 (AP)  Communist forces have stepped up probing attacks on the outer western and southern defense line of Hue, the South Vietnamese military command said today.

title: Con Edison Asks 2d Rise This Year In Rates for Steam
description: Consolidated Edison yesterday asked the State Public Service Commission for an annual increase of $17.8million, or 19.4 per cent, in the steam rates it charges its 2,500 steam customers, primarily large office and apartment buildings from the Battery to the 90's.

title: A SOVIET SUCCESS REPORTED IN TEST OF NEW MISSILES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17Secretary of Defense James R. Schlesinger announced today that the Soviet Union has successfully flighttested missiles with multiple warheads that can be directed to separate targets.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: PLYMOUTH, England, Aug. 18 (AP) The Brazilian yacht Sala was confirmed by race officials today as the winner of the 605mile Fastnet race, the last contest the Admiral's Cup series, which decides supremacy world ocean racing.

title: Everybody Has to Eat The Question Is, What?
description: As food prices have gone skyrocketing toward Saturn consumers in the New York area have generally reacted in two ways: First, they complained. Then they begat Thinking up tricky ways to cope with the high cost a eating.

title: Scott Defeats FitzGibbon In Merion Net Semifinal
description: HAVERFORD, Pa., Aug. 17 Gene Scott, won all 16 of his service games today in defeating Herb FitzGibbon, a fellow New Yorker, 63, 76, 63, if the semifinal round of the $25,000 Pennsylvania lawn tennis championship.

title: Chile, 2,800 Miles Long, Relies On Trucks to Move Her Goods
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 17 Bus and truck traffic is a vital lifeline in this elongated land of rugged mountains and valleysand the striking truckers know it.

title: Blalock 69 Paces Field At St. Paul
Maude Sponsors Who Backed Out Now Face Boycott
description: A consumer boycott was urged by proabortion groups yesterday against seven companies that declined to sponsor reruns of two Maude television shows about abortion.

title: British Retail Index Up
description: LONDON, Aug. 17 (Reuters) The British retail price index for all items rose 0.4 per cent to 179.7 in July (1962 equals 100) from 178.9 in June, the Department of Employment announced today. This was rise of 9.4 per cent over the 164.2 of July, 1972.

title: New jersey Briefs
description: New Jersey officials have asked Chief Justice Warren E. Burger of the United States Supreme Court to permit private and parochial schools to retain for the time being $7.5million in equipment provided by the state. The state aid program has been declared unconstitutional by a threejudge Federal Court and the state is appealing the decision. to the Supreme Court.

title: Laos the Nearest to Peace in Indochina
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Aug. 17  Athough the Government and the Pathet Lao have agreed on the basic structure of a coalition to rule Laos, their quiet and endlessly patient negotiations have been unable to produce a detailed document that both sides are willing to sign.

title: ForHire Haulers Of Mobile Homes Deny PriceFixing
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 (AP) The three largest motor carriers engaged in forhire transportation of mobile homes in the United States pleaded not guilty today to charges of conspiring to fix rates and eliminate competition.

title: Dining Out in Jersey.
description: **Shadowbrook, Route 35, Shrewsbury (201) 7470200.

title: Best Friend of Gainesville 8 Defendant Testifies to Being F.B.I. Informer
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla.,.Aug. 17  The best, friend of the alleged ringleader of a plot to disrupt the Republican National Convention testified today that he had reported to the Federal Bureau of Investigation every conversation the two had had after the ringleader and seven others were indicted.

title: State Seehs Cause of Pollution Closing Barnegat Bay Beaches
description: TRENTON, Aug. 17 (AP) 1 The State Department of Environmental Protection said today it had not determined the cause of pollution that forced the closing of eight Barnegat By beaches..

title: Subway Crime, Contained At Night, Rising in the Day
description: Crime in the subways, which has been contained at night by an eightyearold transit police saturation program, is now spilling over into the busier, afternoon and early,evening hours.

title: Port Washington, on a Moonlit Friday, Seems Less a Suburb Than a Midsummer Night's Dream
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I. At 6 P.M., the commuters are rushing out of the railroad station; mothers are calling their children for supper; the streets of the old harbor town are busy with traffic.

title: A.&
description: A.&P. has moved nearly half its central office staff from its Manhattan headquarters to facilities owned by the supermarket chain in upstate New York and Flushing, Queens.

title: Subway Crime, Contained At Night, Rising in the Day
Lindsay Back, Is Briefed On Crime in the Village
description: Mayor Lindsay, back from a week's stay in Colorado, was briefed at Gracie Mansion yesterday by Police Commissioner Donald F. Cawley on steppedup measures to control crime in the West Village after two murders there within eight days.

title: Adm. Arthur Radford, 77, ExJoint Chiefs Head, Dies
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 Adm. Arthur William Radford, the first Navy man to be chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff and the naval commander of a carrier task force that fought the Japanese in a series of major amphibious landings during World War II, died today of cancer. He was 77 years old.

title: Happy Mothers Day Arrives
Still No Gold Medals for U.S.
LongHaired Worker Wins
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Aug. 17 (UPI)The Kroger Company has been ordered to pay $3,200 in back wages and offer his old job back to a former West Virginia University student who was dismissed for wearing his hair long. The order was issued yesterday by the West Virginia Human Rights Commission on behalf of Paul Perfater.

title: U.S. Dollar Mixed In Markets Abroad
description: LONDON, Aug. 17 (UPI)The United States dollar today ended one of its best weeks on European money markets since the Feb. 9 devaluation, although it lost ground marginally in some centers in endofweek dealing.

title: John Stuart Mill The Dull and Hopeless Life of Woman
description: The independence of women seemed rather less unnatural to the Greeks than to other ancients, on account of the fabulous Amazons (whom they believed to be historical), and the partial example afforded by the Spartan women; who, though nu less subordinate by states, were more free fact, being trained to bodily exercises in the same manner with men, gave ample proof that they were not naturally disqualified for them.

title: NIXON'S LAWYERS INSIST HE CAN END A CRIMINAL CASE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17resident Nixon's lawyers detared today that the executive ranch, not the courts or a rand jury, had the exclusive right to drop a criminal prosemition when other governmental interests outweighed its pursuit.

title: Mocking The Constitution
description: WASHINGTONIn the summer of 1971; Senator Ervin was engaged in fighting a bill which might have narrowed the rights of suspects in criminal proceedings. The Senator then often said that he was sure that anyone who loved the, Constitution would do the same.

title: Kennedy Censured by S.C.L.C. For Appearance With Wallace
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug, 17The Southern Christian Leadership Conference today formally denounced Senator Edward M. Kennedy's participation at July 4 festival with Gov. George C. Wallace in Decatur, Ala., as the height of political opportunism.

title: 165 Bombing Incidents Reported for U.S. in July
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 (UPI) The Federal Bureau of Investigation director Clarence M. Kelley, said yesterday that 165 actual or attempted bombing incidents had been reported during July, with commercial operations and office buildings the leading targets.

title: 3 Alleged Bank Robbers Seized; Linked to 10 East Side Holdups
description: The police yesterday reported the arrest of three men who they said belonged to a gang responsible for 10 bank holdups on the East Side in the last two months. The loot of the robberies totaled $40,400 and helped to finance the $100aday narcotics habits of two of the suspects, the police said.

title: Listing of Prices for Transactions in Commodity Futures
State Institutions Feeling Meat Shortage
description: New York State faced troubles finding sources of meat for state institutions yesterday as regular state suppliers indicated doubt that they would compete, in bidding next Thursday for contracts on deliveries for the two months starting 16.

title: Soviet Soccer Players Shun the Bright Lights
Court Rejects School Plea By Tilden Houses Parents
description: A Federal judge in Brooklyn rejected yesterday a suit by the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People that sought to allow children living in the largely black Tilden Houses in Brownsville to continue enrolling in elementary schools in Canarsie and East Flatbush.

title: Envoy to Bangkok Named
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 (AP) A professor of political science at the University of Pennsylvania, William R. Kintner, will be named ambassador to Thailand, President Nixon announced today. Mr. Kintner, 58 years old, will succeed Leonard Unger, who will receive another assignment.

title: CANCER PROGRAM OFFERED FOR U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17The White House finally made public today a proposal for fiveyear national attack on cancer that would accelerate research into the basic causes of the disease and better methods of treating it.

title: Chile Near the Brink
description: Only a few days ago Chile seemed to be pulling back from the abyss, with at least an outline visible for workable compromise between President Allende's Marxistdominated coalition and the opposition forces. Now the country is again lurching toward chaos, with the statesmanship, restraint and goodwill necessary for averting civil war not yet in evidence.

title: Obscenities, Garbage Drive Thomas Up Wall
description: BUFFALO, Aug. 17 (AP)Duane Thomas, who virtually tore apart the Buffalo Bills in a National Football League preseason game tonight, nearly became engaged in a fight with a fan near the game's end. Thomas was sitting on the Washington Redskins bench when a group of fans shouted obscenities and tossed refuse at him.

title: AMEX PRICES SLIP; OTC INDEXES UP
Stage: Coward in Style
Clam Flats. Are Closed
description: BOSTON, Aug. 17 (AP)Public Health Commissioner William J. Bicknell announced today the closing of some clam flats in Essex Bay because of red tide poisoning. He said the contamination was not dangerous to clam eaters.

title: Nepal Nationalizes Oil Units
description: KATMANDU, Nepal, AUg. 17 (UPI)The stateowned Nepal Oil Corporation took over the import and distribution of petroleum prodUcts from three foreign oil Companies The companies were Indian Oil Corporation, BuimaShell and Esso. The Nepal government earlier had announced its intention to nationalize the oil companies under an agreement with the Indian government.

title: Notes on People
description: Gov. Tom McCall of Oregon was hastily moved from his hospital room at the University of Oregon Medical School after a container of nitroglycerine was found one floor below his room. The nitro was removed from the hospital without incident. Governor McCall had been hospitalized for a urinarytract inflammation after undergoing surgery for the removal of a malignant prostate gland last month.

title: F.B.I. CHECKS FUNDS TO G.O.P. GOVERNORS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 (UPI The F.B.I. is looking into secret transfer of $100,000 in leftover 1968 Nixon campaign funds to Gov. Louie B. Nunn of Kentucky in 1971 for a Republican gubernatorial race, it was learned today.

title: Homer in 10th by Hal King Decides It
DISTURBANCES JOLT SOUTHWEST AFRICA
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Aug. 17A black civilian was killed and several people, including two white policemen, were injured during disturbances in SouthWest Africa yesterday and today, the police said here.

title: 2 Representatives Tour Nixon's Home And Back Spending
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 17 (UPI) Two investigating Congressmen toured the Western White House yesterday, even looking over the President's bedroom, and said the $2.4million in Federal money spent there appeared to be justifiable on security grounds.

title: 32 Police Auxiliaries Resign in Protest
description: The 32member auxiliary police force of the 72d Precinct voted to withdraw its services from South Brooklyn last night. The action was taken to protest the suspension of five auxiliaries on charges of drinking on duty.

title: Nixon Flies to Key Biscayne To Work on V.F.W. Speech
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Aug. 7 (AP)President Nixon flew his Florida home today to pend the weekend resting and writing a speech he plans to eliver Monday at the Veterans of Foreign Wars convention in New Orleans.

title: Sanitationmen Deftly Spur Steel Mounts in a Roadeo
description: With refrains from Oklahoma! echoing from the horns atop a sound truck, with breezes stirring the dust of Randalls Island, and undaunted by the constant threat of rain, the 36 entrants in the only municipal rodeo in the east whipped themselves through time tests, chutes and obstacle courses yesterday as their families watched raptly.

title: Appliance Shipments Rise
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 17 (Reuters) Home appliance shipments in July rose 14 per cent to 2.96 million units from 2.59 million units for the same month last year, the Association of Home Appliance Manufacturers reported today.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: BAYONNETom Baxter is an intelligent young man. After pitching Bayonne High to the New Jersey State Interscholastic Athletic Association's baseball championship, the accolades were flying at the 18yearold righthander. Through the season, he won 11 straight games Bayonne won the Hudson County title. Then he added five more victories in the state tourney.

title: WINE TALK
description: The great white wines of Burgundy have all but priced themselves out of the market. A simple Chablis can cost $6, a Meursault $7 and a Batard Montrachet $16. Even the wines of the Loire, once considered too insignificant to export, are climbing. Sancerres can cost $5 and Muscadets $3.50.

title: Tests on Killed Drivers Show Half Had Imbibed
description: TRENTON, Aug. 17 (UPI)  Slightly more than half of the drivers tested who died in auto accidents in the state in 1972 had been drinking, the state police said today.

title: Enter Dragon, Hollywood Style
About the Mets:
description: Shag Crawford, the plate umpire, felt weak just before the Mets batted in the second inning and left the game. He was found to be suffering from the flu and was sent back to his hotel. The firstbase umpire, Doug Harvey, moved behind the plate while the two others shared the bases.... Both the Mets and Yankees are running into a lot of lefthanded pitching these days, partly because their primary strength at bat is lefthanded. In the Mets case: John Milner, Rusty Staub, Wayne Garrett. Another reason: Cincinnati and Los Angeles are loaded with southpaws.... For the rest of the weekend, both the Mets and Reds will feature lefthanders: Jon Matlack against Fred. Norman today; Jerry Koosman against Ross Grimsley tomorrow. Then two righthanders in the finale Monday: Tom Seaver and Jack Billinghrun.... Mets opened home stand with attendance at 1,186,883, which is 300,000 below last season's. But they hope to recoup some losses in 13 games against the West, probably the best of the four divisions in the major leagues.

title: Abduction of Korean May Cool Tokyo's Relations With Seoul
description: TOKYO, Aug. 17The abduction of Kim Dae Jung, the South Korean opposition leader, from a Tokyo hotel last week has jeopardized the warm relations between Tokyo and Seoul, to the embarrassment of Premier Kakuei Tanaka's Government.

title: Ices Devised for Ski Slopes; Artificial Snow Is Spread on Movable Mat
U.S. Pledges Air Support To Saigon if Hanoi Attacks
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17Defense Secretary James R. Schlesinger called Hanoi the fountainhead of insurrection in Southeast Asia today and said that the United States would support South Vietnamese forces from the air in the event of overt North Vietnamese aggression.

title: Jet Holdout Called Off By Riggins
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Aug. 17 John Riggins, the New York Jets leading rusher last season and this year's No. salary holdout, will report to training camp next Wednesday. Weeb Ewbank, the team's coach and general manager, broke the news today.

title: Stock Prices End Mixed In Listless Trading Day
PRICES OF BONDS GYRATE WILDLY
description: Bond prices gyrated wildly yesterday, surging and declining in bursts rarely seen in the trading of fixedincome securities.

title: Screen: Japanese Drama
Officer and Family Ash Forgiveness and Vanish
description: On Wednesday afternoon, four hours before he was to report for duty, Officer Robert Cameric, a 34yearold member of the Tactical Patrol Force, packed his 1968 blue Pontiac sedan and drive off with his wife, Barbara, 31, and their two children Robert, 11, and Deborah, 9.

title: Soviet MIRV's
description: A tantalizing period of suspense ended with Defense Secretary Schlesinger's announcement yesterday that the Soviet Union has finally achieved success in flight tests of the formidable multiple independently targeted warheads, the MIRV's around which all calculations of strategic arms equation revolve.

title: Orantes and Chris Evert Reach Clay Semifinals
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug. 17 (AP)  Manuel Orantes and Chris Evert, the topseeded players, breezed through to the semifinals of the $90,000 United States clay court open tennis tournament today.

title: Watergate Leaves a Trail of Scarred Lives
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 The Watergate affair has left la trail of scarred and broken lives.

title: Commission Member Named
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 (AP) President Nixon announced today that he would nominate J. Raymond Bell of New York City as a member of the Foreign Claims Settlement Commission. The term will expire Oct. 21, 1974. Mr. Bell, 65 years old, is associated with the Washington office of the Californiabased law firm of Wyman, Bautzer, Rothman & Kuchel.

title: Rollbacks at Many Stations Set Under Revised Ceilings
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 (AP)The Cost of Living Council said today the new price ceilings for gasoline would force many service stations to reduce their retail prices between 1 and 3 cents a gallon on Sept. 1.

title: Truck With Beef Disappears.
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ma., Aug. 17 (UPI) A truck containing 20 tons of prepared beef sides disappeared between Memphit and Birmingham, the Alabama state troopers said today. It was owned by Watkins Truck Lino of Pensacola, Fla,

title: British Treasury Bills Rise at Weekly Auction
description: LONDON, Aug. 17 (Reuters) The average rate at today's tender of British treasury bills rose to 10.9250 per cent from 10.9076 last week.

title: FINANCING IS CITED BY ROCHESTER GAS
description: The Rochester Gas & Electric Corporation expects capital requirements through 1977 will be nearly $485million, according to Francis E. Drake, Jr., chairman.

title: Youth Gangs Involving 200 Members Become Growing Menace in Chinatown
description: There are about six teenage gangs involving as many as 200 youths that have become an increasing menace to residents and visitors in Chinatown.

title: Floods in Pakistan Ruin the Economy; Millions Homeless
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Aug. 17 (Reuters)Floods in Pakistan have caused damage estimated at more than $300million and are threatening the country's economy, the Government said here today.

title: Pakistani Minister Arrives In India for Renewed Talks
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 17Pakistan's Minister of State for Foreign Affairs arrived here today at the head of a 10man delegation to open what is considered a crucial round of talks with Indian officials on the issues dividing the two countries.

title: Pentagon Reverses Decision To Halt Output of F111's
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 (AP) The Pentagon reversed course today and opened the way toward continuing production of the F111 fighterbomber.

title: Market Place:Basic Factors In Trading Dip
description: Why is the stock market so inactiveinactive enough indeed to threaten the existence of scores of brokerage firms?

title: Dr. Walter M. Wallack Is Dead; Penologist and Author Was 76
description: WALLKILL, N. Y., Aug. 17 Dr. Walter Mark Wallack, retired warden of Wallkill State Prison and the author of books on education and penology, died yesterday at Horton Hospital in Middletown, N. Y. He was 76 years old.

title: Horsemeat Store Thrives in Beef Crisis
description: WESTBROOK, Conn. Kent Carlson, who began operating the first Federally inspected horsemeat market on the East Coast here last spring, plans to expand.

title: People and Business
description: Walter M. Schirra Jr., a former astronaut, has been elected chairman of Sernco, Inc., a Los Angelesbased professional and scientific company providing services in environmental and systems engineering. Mr. Schirra, who is 50 years old, retired !from the Navy as a captain and from the National Aeronautical and Space Agency in 1969. He took part in the 11day earthorbiting mission of Apollo 7 in October, 1968.

title: People in Sports: Norton's Team
description: When Ken Norton fights Muhammad Ali on Sept. 10, it will be without the aid of any hypnotic charm. Michael Dean, the hypnotist who worked with Norton in training camp before the heavyweight boxer broke Ali's jaw and won a split decision on March 31, has not been invited back.

title: CANCER PROGRAM OFFERED FOR U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 The White House finally made public today a proposal for fiveyear national attack on cancer that would accelerate research into the basic causes of the disease and better methods of treating it.

title: FAIRCHILD SHOWS A 6MONTH LOSS
U.S. Pledges Air Support To Saigon if Hanoi Attacks
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17Defense Secretary James R. Schlesinger called Hanoi the fountainhead of insurrection in Southeast Asia today, and said that the United States would support South Vietnamese forces from the air in the event of overt North Vietnamese aggression.

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:
description: Tickets matching the number win 62,500 Tickets. with the flve numbers In reverse win $225. Tickets with the first or last four numbers'. In order win $225. Tickets with the first, middle or lest three numbers in sequence. win $25. Tickets with all five numbers scrambled win $25. Tickets matching the first end. second digits, the second and third, the third and fourth or the fourth and fifth win $2.50,

title: 35 at Columbia Complete Minority Journalism Study
description: Thirtyfive men and women were graduated yesterday in Columbia University's sixth an nual summer program to train minority journalists. The course, now known as the Michele Clark Fellowship Program, is named for the Columbia Broadcasting System news correspondent who died in an airline crash in Chicago last December.

title: Fighter Against TB
description: As recently as three decades ago, forty thousand more Americans died of tuberculosis each year, victims of what was then still one of mankind's major enemies among the infectious diseases. By the Midnineteenfifties, however, the annual number of tuberculosis deaths in this country was down to ten thousand and has continued to decline ever since. A vast arrayspecialized hospitals, resorts, screening mechanisms and the like, all set up to ward off and to treat tuberculosis has almost vanished from the United States.

title: Gibson Is Called a Puppet By Baraka in Open Split
description: The two men exchanged angry charges the last two days following a demonstration / tt City Hall during which riot police used horses and clubs to scatter about 200 black residents who came to complain about living conditions in the Central Ward.

title: Action in Baltimore On Agnew Awaiting Richardson Ruling
description: BALTIMORE,. Aug. 17 The United States Attorney's office here has outlined to the Justice Department its investigation into alleged kickbacks to high public officials, including Vice President Agnew, and is now waiting for a decision on whether to proceed to seek indictments.

title: P.B.A. Quits State Police Unit Over Differences on Pensions
description: The Patrolmen's Benevolent Association here, a longtime affiliate of the State Police Conference of New York, has resigned from the organization as a result of differences stemming from the pension dispute at this year's legislative sessions.

title: De Carlo Seized for Unpaid $20,000 Fine
description: MOUNTAINSIDE, N. J., Aug. 17Angelo (Gyp) De Carlo, a onetime powerful Mafia leader who was granted executive clemency by President Nixon last Christmas, was arrested in the master bedroom of his estate here today by United States marshals after he ignored a court order to pay a $20,000 fine.

title: Excerpts From Brief by President's Lawyers in Cox's Court Action to Get Tapes
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17Following are excerpts from the text of a reply brief filed in United States District Court today by attorneys for President Nixon in the action brought by Archibald Cox, the Justice Department's special prosecutor, seeking White House tape recordings and other documents bearing on the Watergate investigation:

title: Soviet Missile Test May Chart a New Course for the Arms Talks
description: The announcement by Defense Secretary James R. Schlesinger yesterday that the Soviet Union had finally flighttested an independently targeted multiple warhead came as no surprise, since Pentagon leaders had been saying for more than, a year that it was only a question of time before the Russians caught up with the Americans in multiple warhead technology.

title: Blalock 69 Paces Field
Andrea Doria Divers Say Treasure Was Not Found
description: FAIRHAVEN, Mass., Aug. 17 (AP)Divers who spent $250, 000 searching for treasure on the sunken luxury liner Andrea Doria recovered nothing of real value, a spokesman said today.

title: Vacation Time: Amerca on the Road
description: Near Elk Mound, Wis., a teenage couple park their bicycles on County Highway H, then stand on the bridge over Interstate 94. There, they while away the warm evening hours waving to the hurried and unusually heavy streams of travelers whistling by underneath in their airconditioned metal cocoons.

title: Bridge: SecondHand High Can Mean Partners Finish Second Best
description: Defenders who play secondhand high, or who even think about playing secondhand high, are a constant delight to opposing declarers. The beginner should certainly acquire the habit of playing secondhand low, and doing so without hesitation. The cases in which secondhand high is desirable are usually obvious enough.

title: State Democratic Chairmen Ask $10Million in Watergate Suit
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 (UPI)  The Association of State Democratic Chairmen, whose phone was the only one successfully tapped at the Watergate complex, filed. a $10.1million civil suit against the 1972 Nixon campaign and 18 principals in the scandal.Association lawyers expected to ask soon that their suit be consolidated with a $6.4million action launched by the Democratic party 14 months ago that is still awaiting trial.Defendants named in the new suit included the seven men convicted for the Watergate breakin, along with former Attorney General John N. Mitchell,. former Commerce Secretary Maurice H. Stans and John D. Ehrlichman, H. R. Haldeman and John W. Dean, 3d, former Presidential aides.

title: Aircraft Contract Is Set
description: United Aircraft Corporation was selected yesterday by the National Aeronautics & Space Administration to build an el. perimental helicopter called the Rotor Systems Research Air. craft. United's Sikorsky Aircraft Division estimated the cost of the project at $25million.

title: P.G.A. Says King Attacked Official and Suspends Him
description: SUTTON, Mass., Aug. 17Jim King, a 37yearold golf professional from Miami, was suspended from the pro tour today following an altercation with an official of the Tournament Players Division of the Professional Golfers Association that conducts and directs the $8.2million program.

title: About the Mets:
description: Both the Mets and Yankees are running into a lot lefthanded pitching these days, partly because their primary strength at bat is lefthanded. In the Mets case: John Milner and Rusty Staub. However, another reason is that Cincinnati and Los Angeles are loaded with southpaws...For the rest of the series this weekend, both the Mets and Itcls will feature lefthanders: Jon Matlack against Fred Norman today, Jerry Koosman against Ross Grimsley tomorrow. Then, two righthanders in the finale Monday: Tom Seaver. and Jack Billingham...Mets opened the home stand with attendance at 1,186,883, which 300,000 below last season...They could recoup some the loss in the 13 games against the West. One promotion is included: Camera Day next Saturday. Fans may click away from front rows between 12:15 and 12:45 P.M.

title: PRICES OF GRAINS RESUME ADVANCE
description: Prices of most grains, soybean and livestock products resumed their advance yesterday in hectic trading, ending two days of limit declines on the Midwest commodity exchanges.

title: Aid Offered on Runaways
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 17 (UPI)An information center to help runaway youngsters has been set up by the Office of Communications of the Archdiocese of Hartford, it was announced yesterday. The Rev. Edmund S. Madolny, communications director, said the office was offering its phone number, 5288148, for use by parents and their children to help reunite them.

title: 81 Loss Drops New Yorkers Three Back
Hockey Transaction
description: BUFFALOSigned TOMMY Abrahamsson, defeseman of Swedish national team.

title: FundSharing Bill May Hurt Newark, But Westchester and L.I.  Would Gain
description: The Nixon Administration I said yesterday that if its controversial communitydevelopment revenuesharing proposal were passed by Congress, then Nassau, Suffolk and Westchester Counties would get a sharp increase in Federal communitydevelopment funds over the next five years, but problemridden Newark would experience a decrease.

title: Marines End Mock War
description: TWENTYNINE PALMS, Calif., Aug. 17 (UPI) Nearly 9,000 marines began heading for home today with the completion of a mock war in which the mythical desert nation of Argos was successfully defend to from an aggressive neighbor. Exercise Alkali Canyon was the most extensive desert training exercise in the history of the Marine Corps.

title: DR. WALTER HESS, PHYSIOLOGIST, 92
description: GENEVA, Aug. 17Dr. Walter Rudolf Hess, the Swiss physiologist who won the Nobel Prize for medicine in 1949, died Sunday at Locarno. He was 92 years old.

title: Biaggi Says Police Lag in Protecting Hunt's Point Market
description: Representative Mario Biaggi charged yesterday that the Police Department's gross neglect of crime at the Hunt's Point produce market was allowing serious financial losses to occur there that he said resuited in higher fruit and vegetable prices for consumers.

title: Neil Amdur
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, N. J., Aug, 17It should come as no surprise that Norman Snead's home in Yorktown, Va., is situated alongside the sites of battlefields from the Revolutionary War and Civil War. For most of his 13 years as a professional football player, the 6foot4inch Snead has lived in the center of a war zone, harassed by blitzing linebackers, booing crowds and bad teams.

title: State Bans Open Burning
description: ALBANY, Aug, 17. (AP36hour ban on open burnin, was put into effect today I,. the state for the lower Hudso Valley, New York City an Long Island, because of a staff not air mass. The ban is likel. to be extended if condition persist a state spokesma, said.

title: Phillips and 3M Co. Report Illegal Gifts To Nixon Campaign
description: Two corporations said yesterday that they had made illegal] contributions to President Nixon's reelection campaign.

title: BRAZILIAN IS WINNER IN INTERZONAL CHESS
description: PETROPOLIS, Brazil, Aug. 17 (AP)  Brazil's 21 year old, Henrique Mecking won the interzonal chess tournament today and remained in the race to become Bobby Fischer's challenger for the world title in 1975.

description: Near Elk Mound, Wis., a teenage couple park their bicycles on County Highway H, then stand on the bridge over Interstate 94. There, they while away the warm evening hours waving to the hurried and unusually heavy streams of travelers whistling by underneath in their airconditioned metal cocoons.

title: Mrs. Sander Gains Final
description: WEST ORANGE, N.J., Aug. 17Mrs. Anne Quast Sander of Seattle, a threetime champion, and littleknown Carol Semple of Sewickley, Pa., gained the final of the 73rd United States Women's Amateur golf championship here today.

title: It's Official: Bettors to Get a Break
description: Horseplayers will get a break at Aqueduct this fall as a result of action taken yesterday by the New York State Racing and Wagering Board.

title: Chile Calls Truck Strike Catastrophic
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 17The 23day truckers strike has had catastrophic repercussions on Chile's already ailing economy, the Government said today.

title: Miners Return to Work After Protest Over Death
description: BELLAIRE, Ohio, Aug. 17 (AP)Some members of the United Mine Workers returned to work early today after twoday walkout at 11 mines that was triggered when miner fell to his death.

title: Aaron:11 Homers To Ruth
description: After he hit the 702d home run of his career. in Chicago on Thursday, Henry Aaron was quoted as saying, I don't really think it's possible that I'll reach the record this year. There aren't enough games left for me to do it this season.

title: Chile Calls Truck Strike Catastrophic
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 17The 23day truckers strike has had catastrophic repercussions on Chile's already ailing economy, the Government said today.

title: State Bans Open Burning
description: ALBANY, Aug, 17 (APA 36hour ban on open burning was put into effect today by the state for the lower Hudson Valley. New York City and Long Island, because of a stagnant air mass. The ban is likely to he extended if conditions persist, a state spokesman said.

title: Business Briefs
description: New York City savings banks continued to suffer an outflow of deposits in the first half of August, but the drain was substantially smaller than in July. Upstate, however, the outflow increased.

title: Plan for FundSharing Would Cut Newark Share
description: The Nixon Administration said yesterday that if its controversial communitydevelopment revenuesharing proposal were passed by Congress, then Nassau, Suffolk and Westchester Counties would get a sharp increase in Federal communitydevelopment funds over the next five years, but problemridden Newark would experience a decrease.

title: Kissinger May Give Talk In Brussels on Europe Ties
description: WASHINGTON, Aug, 17. (Reuters)Henry A. Kissinger has tentatively accepted an invitation to discuss AmericanWest European relations in a speech in Brussels on Sept. 10, a few weeks before President Nixon plans to begin a tour of Europe, the White House announced today.

title: Consumer Notes
De Carlo Seized for Unpaid $20,000 Fine
description: MOUNTAINSIDE, N. J., Aug. 17Angelo (Gyp) De Carlo, onetime powerful Mafia leader who was granted executive clemency by President Nixon last Christmas, was arrested in the master bedroom of his estate here today by United States marshals after he ignored a court order to pay a $20,000 fine.

title: Shipping/Mails All Hours Given in Daylight Saving Time
