description: TORONTO, Aug. 24The president of B'nai B'rith sharply criticized the White House freeze on Federal housing subsidies today, describing it as having crippled construction of lowrent housing for the elderly poor.

title: WINE TALK
description: The disclosure in France this week of what could prove to be a major wine scandal was greeted with considerable caution in the French press.

title: When the Void Is Not a Void
description: If God is dead, says Ivan Karamazov, everything is permitted. He is in despair at the torture of children but, without God, finds no base in reason on which to condemn torturers. Nor do we. The anguished cry of the moralist announcing nihilism has become the dictum of our age: everything is permitted. If God is dead our standards are necessarily manmade, are therefore arbitrary in that no such standard can be endowed with the right to disallow opposing standards. No standard, therefore, holds authority beyond the force with which it is imposed. How many divisions does he have? said Stalin, upon being warned not to incur the disapproval of the Pope.

title: 2 BAKERS REFUSING RETURNS ON BREAD
description: Two bakers said yesterday they would no longer accept returns of unsold breada move that might cut down ordering by retail outlets that have already been complaining of cost pressures.

title: Hencken Wins in A.A.U. And Sets World Record
COTTON FUTURES SET RECORD PRICE
description: The possibility of tight cotton supplies later this year and the current absence of export controls spurred buying of cotton futures by the trade and commission houses yesterday.

title: Auto Production Shows 50% Rise For Latest Week
Sports Today
description: Mets vs. San Francisco Giants, Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 2:15 P.M. (TelevisionChannel 9, 2 P.M.) (RadioWHN, 2:10 P.M.)

title: $150,000 Trot Tonight Has Cast of Unknowns
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Aug. 24 Othello, the chestnut prince of Soviet horses, was unveiled this morning at Roosevelt Raceway, and one American groom turned to a friend and asked, Would you bet this horse?

title: Sports News Briefs
description: VANDALIA, Ohio, Aug. 24 (UPI)Dennis Taylor of Muscoda, Wis., won the Grand American Handicap today at the 74th annual Grand American trapshooting tournament. The 23yearold student at Wisconsin State University broke 99 of 100 targets from the 22 line and then won a shootoff from Kim Alvater of Haven, Kan. Alvater shot from 21 yards. Alvater, 22, a student Kansas State University, broke 99 in a row before missing his 100th target.

title: Too Thin Blue Line
description: The city's Thin Blue Line is thinner still. New Yorkers are now reaping a whirlwind of crime and fearofcrime sown some months ago through a policy of police force attrition that left the force dangerously undermanned. This policy has now been reversedindeed, brightened fiscal conditions have permitted the voting of funds for hiring several thousand additional police officersbut its impact lingers. According to Police Commissioner Donald F. Cawley, the strength of the force in the field at the precinct levelthose actually available for street patrol dutyhas dwindled in recent months from about 17,500 officers to fewer than 16,000.

title: Bank Client Uses Karate To Stop Holdup Suspect
description: An armed man who attempted to hold up a busy bank on Park Avenue during lunchtime yesterday was surprised and subdued by a customer trained in unarmed combat.

title: Dolly Madison Is Ordered To Suspend Its Operations
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 24 (UPI)The Dolly Madison Ice Cream Company has been ordered by a Federal bankruptcy judge to suspend operations, effective today.

title: Roundup: Orioles Bubble Not Bursting
description: The Baltimore Orioles, who have been through the pressure of pennant races and World Series in recent seasons, won their 11th straight game last night, beating the Kansas City Royals, 60, behind the threehit pitching of Dave McNally.

title: Marshal Law
description: The dispatch of Federal marshals to St. Croix is no doubt a necessary expedient in the face of a recent upsurge in murders and other crimes that have terrorized this largest of the American Virgin Islands. This reinforcement for a local police force poorly equipped to cope with the crime wave may help at least temporarily to check violence and to reassure the tourists and foreign investors on whom the economy of the Virgin Islands largely depends.

title: Skylab 2
description: This morning the Skylab 2 astronauts will pass the mark set by their predecessors of Skylab 1 and become participants in the longest manned space mission in history. Perhaps even more remarkable is the whole change of atmosphere and attitude about this mission: Little is heard now of earlier fears that a rescue rocket might have to be sent up next month to bring back the three spacemen. Rather the general expectation now seems to be that they will carry out their twomonth mission as planned and return without extraordinary help from earth.

title: Nathan's Suspends Sale Of Uncooked Not Dogs
description: Nathan's, the hotdog emporium, has temporarily suspended the sale of uncooked frankfurters, a spokesman said yesterday, because an expected shipment from the Middle West has not arrived and all available hot dogs have to go on the grill.

title: Cambodia Cautions Foreign Newsmen On False Reports
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Aug. 24News correspondents stationed in or visiting Cambodia were summoned to the Information Ministry today for warning that measures"presumably expulsionwould be taken against those found guilty of exaggerated or false reporting.

title: 3 Banks Plan to Request Trustee on U.S. Financial
description: SAN DIEGO, Aug. 24Three banks that hold an unsecured $6.8million portion of nearly $300million in debts owed by U. S. Financial, Inc., served notice today that they would seek to block the corporation's own reorganization plan and replace it with a courtappointed trustee.

title: U. S. Beats Soviet Five In World Games Finale
Attempts to Rescue 2 Trapped Miners Continue in Arizona
description: CASA GRANDE, Ariz., Aug. 24 (UPI) Rescuers said, today that they had no idea! how much debris remained between them and two copper miners trapped for more than a week in a tunnel 1,300 feet underground.

title: Diplomatic Clout of Saudis Grows With Oil Exports
description: JIDDA, Saudi Arabia, Aug. 20Saudi Arabia's diplomatic influence as a pivotal country in the Middle East is increasing along with her growing economic importance as the world's leading oil exporter. King Faisal, Saudi Arabia's 60yearold leader, is expected to head his country's delegation to the conference of 70 nonaligned countries in Algeria next month.

title: CHANDLER SCORES CIVIL SUIT BY S.E.C.
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 24 (Reuters)Otis Chandler, publisher of the Los Angeles Times, yesterday charged that the Securities and Exchange Commission had Inflicted maximum and gratuitous damage on him in its civil suit against a northern California company on which Chandler served as a director.

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:
Bank of Japan Planning Rise in Discount Rate
description: TOKYO, Saturday, Aug. 25 (Reuters)The Bank of Japan said today it would raise the official discount rate in the near future, but the bank declined to comment further.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The selection of New York City as the site for a Sept. 24 public hearing on a proposed fare increase on PATH transHudson tube trains was assailed by numerous New Jersey political and business leaders yesterday. Senator Clifford P. Case joined with community leaders served by the bistate commuter line in deploring the decision of the Interstate Commerce Commission.

title: 2 GUILTY IN MURDER OF BRIDEGROOM HERE
description: Two youths charged with stabbing to death a young man on his way to pick up a tuxedo he had rented for his wedding pleaded guilty to murder in State Supreme Court in Brooklyn yesterday.

title: Notes on People
description: The King of Afghanistan, Mohammad Zahir Shah, announced his abdication in a statement issued by the Afghan Embassy in Rome. The King was deposed last month while he was visiting Italy.

title: High Costs Close ChildCare Center For Farm Hands
description: VINELAND, N. J., Aug. 24A daycare center in nearby Rosenhayn for children of migrant and local seasonal farm workers closed today for lack of funds.

title: A BUCK RADICAL SURRENDERS HERE
description: Ronald Myers, who was indicted Thursday along with eight other alleged members of a violenceprone band of black radicals, surrendered late yesterday afternoon in the office of District Attorney Eugene Gold of Brooklyn.

title: U.S PULLING OUT 3,550 OF ITS MEN FROM THAI BASES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24The United States announced an agreement with Thailand today for the start of a phased withdrawal of American forces and aircraft from Thailand.

title: County Withholds Fares
description: MAYVILLE, N. Y., Aug. 24 (UPI)The Penn Central Railroad owes Chatauqua County more than $452,000 in  back taxes, according to County Auditor Richard Rohman, so he is not going to pay the railroad $650 the county owes the line for trips by county legislators.

title: Going Out Guide
description: If you want to see an Austin Healey in the improbable act of melting, make a straight path for the Queens County. Art and Cultural Center, a very big title for so small a museum (sometimes called the Queens Museum), where soft sculpture20 works by 20 artists is on display through Sept. 2. It's called Soft as Art.

title: NOELLE GILLMOR
description: WOODSTOCK, N. Y., Aug. 24Noelle Gillmor, a leading practitioner in dubbing foreign films into English, died Monday of cancer in Kingston at the Benedictine Hospital. She was 58 years old and lived at Willow, a Woodstock suburb.

title: City Rejects Bids for Pork and Poultry as Too High
description: Purchase Commissioner Marvin Gersten voiced anger at the high cost of pork, chicken and turkey in bids offered to the city, ,yesterday, and he said his buying of cattle on the hoof was making it cheaper to serve beef sirloin than the pork loin that had been an alternative.

title: Books of The Times
description: To write as a woman is to write from an extreme situation: the assumption behind Erica Jong's and Adrienne Rich's recent poetry. It gives energy to their lines. And, I suspect, it gives them readers they might not ordinarily have. This can be temptation (I think it is for Erica Jong) to play to that audience. But for the most part it must mean poet touching reader, reader touching poet, in a way that can make both more alive.

title: Misplaced Eden
description: A plastic jungle of ultrabright trees and flowers has swallowed up the city's information center in Times Square. It is hard to suggest that the center's conversion into an outsized fruit salad defiles the area since Times Square long ago sank into a state of squalor that defies worsening. But it is astonishing to learn that the display is all part of a promotion for a private discotheque. We have no quarrel with the belief of the City Department of Commerce and Industry which operates the center, that it ought to let tourists know what attractions New York has for them. But no single restaurant or night spot ought to have a monthlong monopoly on this municipal facility, even if it turned the center into a bona fide Garden Eden, not a synthetic one.

title: Cards Game Not Special To Winner
LIBERIANS SEIZED ON DRUG CHARGE
description: Two young men who told the police they were sons of the late William V.S. Tubman, the President of Liberia who died in 1971, have been arrested here on a charge of criminal possession of a dangerous drug, a felony punishable by up to 15 years in prison.

title: Everybody Does It
description: The saddest sideeffect of Watergate across American society is the degree to which respect for the processes of government has been tarnished. Many Americans of younger and older generations alike have grown cynical about the way politiciansany politicians, of either partyare presumed to operate once they ascend to power. In a poignant moment of the Senate Watergate hearings, a sobered Gordon Strachan advised young people interested in political life to stay away.

title: Name Deputy Housing Chief
description: Mayor Lindsay annouced today the appointment of Charles Yates Masella as Deputy Housing and Development Administrator. Mr, Masella, 32 years old, has served as deputy assistant administrator of management planning and analysis at H.D.A. In his new post, he will receive a salary of $39,563 a year.

title: U.S. Leads Women's Tennis, 20
description: BROOKLINE, Mass., Aug. 24 (UPI)The United States jumped off to a 20 lead in the Wightman Cup tennis competition tonight as Chris Evert whipped Virginia Wade, 64, 62, and Patti Hogan defeated Varonica Burton, 64, 63.

title: Francis Byrne Sr., Father Of Jersey Governor Nominee
description: WEST ORANGE, N. J., Aug. 24Francis A. Byrne Sr., father of Brendan T. Byrne, the Democratic candidate for Governor, died today at Orange Memorial Hospital. He was 86 years old.

title: ISRAELI THEATER FOILS CHALLENGE
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 24While Israel's musicians have been working together as never before, Israel's leading theater company has been going through one of its periodic upheavals.

title: Nixon and Agnew Have Friendly Phone Chat
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Aug. 24  The White House said today that President Nixon and Vice President Agnew had had a friendly conversation over a telephone after the President's press conference Wednesday, in which he expressed confidence in the Vice President.

title: Waldheim Asks Bigger Budget For U.N., Citing Dollar Drains
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 24  Secretary General Waldheim asked today for a $513.4million budget to cover United Nations expenses in the coining two years, and said that dollar devaluation and inflation in the United States had increased the costs of running the organization.

title: Parole Eligibility Is Urged For Girl Friend of Killer
description: LINCOLN, Neb., Aug. 24 (AP) The Nebraska Parole Board recommended today that Caril Ann Fugate, who accompanied her boy friend Charles Starkweather on a killing rampage 15 years ago, be considered for parole.

title: Embryos of Animals Are Being Frozen To Study Feasibility of Storing Them
description: Mouse embryos are being frozen and stockpiled at the Jackson Laboratories in Bar Harbor, Me., to test the feasibility of their being stored for long periods.

title: WITNESS PRESSED IN VETERANS TRIM
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Aug. 24 The Government, after 19 days, tentatively rested its case today in the trial of seven antiwar veterans and a supporter charged with plotting an assault on the Republican National Convention.

title: Business Briefs
description: 20% Drop in Housing Starts Forecast

title: Cost of Food Basket Up $12 in July From June
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24 (AP) The annual cost of a market basket of farmproduced food rose $12 from June to July despite a recent price ceiling imposed by the Nixon Administration, figures released today by the Agriculture Department showed.

title: Dining Out in New Jersey
description: ***Clinton Inn, 6 East Clinton Avenue, Tenafly (201) 567.4800.

title: Clarence J. Henry Dead; Served State Supreme Court
description: ROCHESTER, Aug. 24 (AP)Clarence J. Henry, a retired justice of the State Supreme Court, died yesterday in Strong Memorial Hospital. He was 70 years old.

title: Edward Thomas, 71, Dies; Hofstra Admissions Dean
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Aug. 24 Edward Trudeau Thomas, dean of admissions of Hofstra College (now University) from 1946 to 1961, died here yesterday. He was 71 years, old. and lived in Princeton.

title: Esmark Board Backs Acquisition of ISI
description: Directors of Esmark, Inc., a holding company that owns Swift & Co., the meatpacking concern, yesterday authorized the acquisition by GSI, Inc., an Esmark subsidiary, of the ISI Corporation. GSI is in the lifeinsurance business through its wholly owned subsidiary, the Gulf Life Insurance Company of Illinois. Esmark said it would issue 1,080,000 of its common shares for ISI's 108 Million outstanding shares, making the trans. worth about $23.8million, based on yesterday's closing price on the New York Stock Exchange of 22 for Esmark's stock.

title: 12 Law Officers Indicted For Mistaken Drug Raids
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24 Twelve law enforcement officers were indicted by a Federal grand jury today in connection with a series of mistaken drug raids in southwestern Illinois last April.

title: Rally by Stocks Falters As Dow Falls 0.97 Point
Higher Prices Set In Steel Plate, Oil, Carpets and Sugar
description: Proposed and actual price increases were announced yesterday for steel plate, crude oil, carpets and sugar.

title: Court Fight Over Dodge Estate Begins
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J., Aug. 24  A court battle is under way here to determine who will serve as executor of the estate of one of the nation's richest women, Mrs. Geraldine Rockefeller Dodge.

title: The Return of the Benches
description: PROVINCETOWN, Mass.P town located at the end of a hook of geographical determinism which has left it an apolitical culdesac. But not long ago its citizens swayed their selectmen (an ancient title conferred not by a Calvinistic hand of God, but by town elections) in deciding an issue at special town meeting: whether or not the benches in front of Town Hall should be returned after the selectmen had removed them without public discussion.

title: Rating for QuinnRudd
description: In its first week on the air, the revamped C.B.S. Morning News with Hughes Rudd and Sally Quinn failed to dent the Nielsen rating of the competing Today, show on N.B.C. For the week of Aug. 6.10, Today had a rating of 4.5 and an audience share of 40 per cent, compared to. the Morning News 1.4 rating and 18 per cent share. In the previous week, when N.B.C.'s Today competed with the old version of Morning News, Today" had a 4.4 rating and 40 share, while the C.B.S. program had a 1.4 rating and 26 share.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Representative Edward I. Koch said that more than 70 welfare families were living in the Great Northern Hotel near Carnegie Hall on 57th Street and that the hotel was collecting more than $1,600 a month from some of the families.

title: Bond Rally Speeds Up; Notes Attract Investors
SHULTZ INDICATES BIG RISE IN PRICES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug, 24George P. Shultz, the Treasury Secretary, warned the public today to expect an astounding increase in the wholesale price index for August.

title: Miss Mills, On 67, Leads By 3 Shots
Stanton MacdonaldW right, 83, CoFounder of Synchromist Art
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 24 (AP) Stanton MacdonaldWright, noted artist, died Wednesday, apparently of a heart attack, at his home in Pacific Palisades. He was 83 years old.

title: Equity Financing
description: Hawaiian Electric Company filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission in connection with an offering of 600,000 commonshares and $16million in first mortgage bonds due 2003 both for sale through Dillon Read and Dean Witter. The company's stock closed, at 251/, down % on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Consumer Notes
description: Food prices continue to hold the principal attention of most consumers, but there are other subjects of importance that should not be lost sight of. Some of these received attention recently at the convention of the Consumer Federation of America in Milwaukee. A series of policy resolutions adopted there offered a reminder of the many subjects besides food that are in the forefront of interest of this major consumer organization.

title: Music: A Bit of Americana
description: One of the happier developments in our concert life during the last few years has been its decentralization. The tyranny of established concert halls with their heavy expense and sometimes oppressive formality has begun to crack, as all sorts of unexpected placesindoors and outhave begun to be utilized for musical presentations.

title: VICTIM ARRESTED IN A KIDNAPPING
description: The 20yearold son of the Rev. Wyatt Tee Walker, a special assistant to Governor Rockefeller, allegedly fabricated a bizarre tale of being robbed and kidnapped yesterday and was charged late last night with the armed robbery Thursday of a drugstore in the town of Eastchester in Westchester County.

title: The Middle East: Words, Words, Words
description: TEL AVIVIsrael's rash and regrettable decision to intercept the Lebanese airplane has put into sharp focus the Palestinian guerrillas role, in the Middle East conflict. The guerrillas are not capable of affecting the balance of power between Israel and the Arab states, but by their acts have succeeded in dragging Israel Into a cloak and dagger war which tarnishes its image and enhances its isolation in the international community. Israel will find it increasingly difficult to explain this new war against what many people regard as desperate Palestinian refugees who have adopted guerrilla tactics in their fight against Israel. In the public imagination, a Palestinian is often conceived as being a refugee and either an actual or potential Arab guerrillamenaced by both Jordan and Israel. Yet such an image is not supported by facts and, moreover, the three words, guerrilla, Palestinian and tend

title: Court Battle Begins Over Executor for Dodge Estate
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J., Aug. 24  A court battle is under way here to determine who will serve as executor of the estate of one of the nation's richest women, Mrs. Geraldine Rockefeller Dodge.

title: DOLLAR SUSTAINS A MINOR SETBACK
description: LONDON, Aug. 24 (AP)The dollar closed marginally lower today on most European foreign exchange markets in minor setback to the dollar's monthlong recovery.

title: FARM HANDS LOSE DAYCARE CENTER
description: VINELAND, N. J., Aug. 24A daycare center in nearby Rosenhayn for children of migrant and local seasonal farm workers closed today for lack of funds.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Village Murder Suspect Arraigned

title: ATHENS IN MOVE TO CAR CYPRUS
description: ATHENS, Aug. 24President George Papadopoulos intervened today in an effort to remove one of the last obstacles to a peaceful settlement on Cyprus of the conflict between the island's Greek majority and Turkish minority. He appealed to Gen. George Grivas, leader of the movement for Cyprus's union with Greece, to give up his campaign of violence against the Government led by Archbishop Makarios and lay down arms.

title: Charges Against 5 of 7 Blacks In Virgin Islands Trial Dropped
description: CHRISTIANSTED, V.I., Aug. 24 (AP)Charges against five of the seven black defendants in the Brauhaus murder trial have been dismissed.

title: Bray Is Reported to Have Quit Rather Than Serve Kissinger
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24Charles W. Bray 3d has resigned as the State Department's spokesman because he does not want to work for Henry A. Kissinger if Mr. Kissinger is confirmed by the Senate as Secretary of State, a reliable source reported today.

title: Judge Blocks Price Curbs On Gasoline Set for Sept. 1
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24A Federal judge ruled today that the Government's Phase 4 regulations on most gasoline sold at the pump could not go into effect when the present extended freeze on retail gasoline prices expires Aug. 31.

title: Selden and Shanker Differ on Outlook for Merger
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24The American Federation of Teachers ended its annual convention here today with a strong endorsement by delegates of their leadership's forthcoming merger talks with the National Education Association but with contrasting views of the outlook for merger expressed by its two top officers.

title: Tips on Low Life Make Pan Am Guide Big Seller
description: A Pan American World Airmays guidebook to New York City that's been on bookstore shelves for more than a year bec,ame a best seller yesterday :after disclosure that it contained a guide to the city's prostitutes.

title: Senator Bible Expected Not to Seek Reelection
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24Senator Alan Bible, Democrat of Nevada, will announce Tuesday that he will not run for reelection next year, sources close to him confirmed tonight. The Nevada Senator, fi3 years old, has been bothered by high blood pressure.

title: Mrs. Simon Wed to Herbert Adler
description: EAST HAMPTON, L. I., Aug. 24  Mrs. Susan R. Simon of Hartsdale, N. Y. was married here this afternoon to Habert S. Adler, a first vice president and treasurer of E. M. Warburg, Pincus & Co., Inc., investment bankers in New York, and a general partner of Lionel L. Pincus & Co. Rabbi Elihu Schagrin performed the ceremony at the bridegroom's home.

title: Bridge: Reader Gains Disadvantage From an Example of Game
description: On rare occasions, readers of this column are able to gain a direct practical advantage by recalling something they have read. Even more rarely they get a direct disadvantage. This reflection is provoked by a plaintive letter from Hugh Levy of Rockaway, N. J., blaming this writer for a bad result he obtained in a recent New York tournament.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: EATONTOWN, Aug. 24  When most golfers think of changes in their favorite game over the years, they think of equipment modifications, the influence of women on the game and the way the rich man's sport has become a recreation for millions.

title: Steel Shortage May Cut Japan Auto Production
description: TOKYO, Aug. 24 (AP)Japanese automobile manufacturers are facing possible production cuts as a result of a shortage of steel and other raw materials, industry officials said today.

title: Edwin J. Lukas Dies
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 24Edwin J. Lukas, a former director of national affairs for the American Jewish Committee and an early exponent of the involvement of Jews in the civil rights movement, died Wednesday at a convalescent home in nearby Kentfield. He was 71 years old.

title: Restaurants Innovate to Cope With Beef Situation
description: Faced with drastically curtailed supplies of their most important offeringbeefrestaurants in the metropolitan area are trying to make do in a variety of ways,. adding surcharges to beef dishes on the menu, creating new nonbeef dishes, even deliberately running out of beef in the belief that it is not worth the trouble to find and that the customers will understand.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: LINDA LINDEBERG
description: Linda Lindeberg, abstract painter of landscapes and, nudes, died Thursday of cancer at the Presbyterian Hospital. Her age was 58 and she lived at 178 East 95th Street. She was the wife of Giorgio CavalIon, also an artist.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX SHOW MIXED TONE
Blumenthal Says Courts Should Speed Calendars
description: Assemblyman Albert H. Blumenthal, the Liberal party candidate for Mayor, yesterday urged the use of sound management procedures in the criminal courts to permit more efficient handling of cases and to speed their priorities.

title: 3d Church Fire in Month
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 24 (UPI)Firemen battled the third church fire in a month today and Fire Chief Keith Calden declared, We have a church arsonist. Fire at the People's Temple of the Disciples of Christ, denomination brotherhood, caused $1000,000 damage yesterday.

title: 2 Police Sergeants Indicted for Lying About Extortion,
description: Two longtime police officers were indicted yesterday on charges that they lied to Staten Island special grand jury about knowledge of a sergeants club, which, according to lawenforcement sources, has extorted close to $26,000 from merchants in the 120th precinct since 1966. The indictments were part of

title: News Summary and Index
More Vacationers Turn to New Sites
description: GALLATIN GATEWAY, Mont., Aug. 24I go to different wilderness places every year, said Mrs. Mary Muhlhausen, a widow from Huntington, LI., who spent last summer on a fiveweek camping trip in Nepal.

title: U.S. Wives in Japan: A Marriage of Cultures;I'm American. It's impossible for me to be Japanese.;In the United States everyone is;expected to become American, but in Japan they don't;think you can become Japanese.
description: TOKYOAfter almost eight years of marriage to a member of a distinguished Japanese family, Mrs. Joan McCullough nob now easily kneels in the tradition of a good Japanese wife and almost touches the tatamimatted floor with her forehead when guests come to their house.

title: SHOP TALK
description: How about a photograph of a loved one, maybe yourself, emblazoned on your chest? It can happen in a metter of seconds in Bloom?? newest nook for men. T his one, which opens today, is downstairs on the 59 Street side of the store the 59 Shop, to be exact), is called Let the Good Times Roll and, like a lot of other places these days, is supposed to promote nostalgia, this time for the fifties.

title: William N. Wallace
description: The wife of an owner of a team in the National Football League is a witch. On three occasions she has applied her powers to field goals, willing that two go awry and one be true. I don't like to do it too often, she said. But I know I can.

title: Masuo Araki Is Dead at 72; ExJapanese Cabinet Aide
description: TOKYO, Aug. 24 (AP) Masuo Araki, former education minister and a member of the ruling Liberal Democratic party in the House of Representatives, died tonight of a heart attack. He was 74 years old.

title: Citizenship Day Proclaimed
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Aug. 24 (AP)President Nixon yesterday proclaimed Sept. 17 as Citizenship Day and the week of Sept. 1723 as Constitutional Week.

title: Astronauts Take Space Walk To Install New Film and Gyros
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 24 (AP)In a space walk lasting 4 hours today, two Skylab 2 astronauts loaded fresh film in solar telescope cameras and installed a new set of gyroscopes.

title: Steeler Game Will Decide if Clover Fits the Giants Mold
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, N.J., Aug. 24  Rich Glover may play the most important football game in his career Sunday afternoon when the Giants face the Pittsburgh Steelers at Yankee Stadium.

title: RIGHT TO INTERVIEW PRISONERS IS UPHELD
description: HOUSTON, Aug, 24 (UPI) A Federal judge today struck down regulations prohibiting newsmen from interviewing prisoners in Federal custoday, saying that such regulations violated the newspaper's rights under the First Amendment.

title: Spaniards Begin to Lose Their Enthusiasm for That Rising Deluge of Tourists
description: MADRID, Aug. 24Close to 6.5 million foreigners, including substantial numbers of Western Europeans, will have basked under the hot Spanish sun this month, but Spain is starting to have second thoughts about the invasion she has so successfully promoted.

title: Gilbert Shaw, 60, Founder Of SyntheticFiber Concern
description: MIDDLEBURY, Vt., Aug. 24 (AP)Gilbert Shaw, founder and president of Polymers, Inc., a syntheticfiber manufacturer in Middlebury, died Wednesday at the age of 60. He was stricken while vacationing at his summer home in Charlotte and died in a Burlington hospital.

title: A.E.C. Curbs Power Of 10 Nuclear Plants Till End of Studies
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24 (UPI) The Atomic Energy Commission ordered 10 nuclear power plants in various areas today to limit their operations and cut back power levels pending further studies.

title: Dr. Arthur Bookman Dies; A Specialist on Diabetes
description: Dr. Arthur Bookman, an internist and specialist on diabetes who practiced for 56 years, died Thursday at his home, 33 East 70th Street. He was 96 years old.

title: Handy Instructions For Vacationers
description: 1. Station wagon and turnpike.Place the children in the station wagon and drive the resulting ensemble over 500 miles of the turnpike. If the children are not (a) crying, (b) fighting, (c) screaming or (d) throwing the suitcases through the rear windows after the first fifty miles of the turnpike, you are doing something wrong. Return home at once and start again.

title: NEW STRIKES ADD TO CHILE'S WOES
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 24Another wave of strikes, involving the, shutdown of shops and transportation, was reported today in nine of Chile's capital, the doctors continued their stoppage.

title: Goolagong Gains Final At Toronto
description: TORONTO, Aug. 24 (AP)Evonne Goolagong and Mrs. Helga Masthoff advanced to the final of the $100,000 Canadian open tennis tournament today.

title: Boulder, Colo., Shocked as Boy Hero Is Stripped of Title in Soapbox Derby Scandal
description: BOULDER, Colo., Aug. 24 Not since some local dentists were accused of wholesaling marijuana has a local scandal set so many Boulderites afire. Corruption in politics is one thing, they say, but cheating at the Soapbox Derby is almost an affront to the flag.

title: 12 Law Officers Indicted For Mistaken Drug Raids
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24 Twelve law enforcement officers were indicted by a Federal grand jury today in connection with a series of mistaken drug raids in southwestern Illinois last April.

title: Charge of Threat to Nixon Dropped for ExPoliceman
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., Aug. 24  The Federal Government dropped today a charge of threatening President Nixon's life that had been brought against Edwin M. Gaudet, but the timing of the action left him in deep trouble in New Mexico.

title: Rain Bringing Return Of African Herdsmen
description: DARMA, Senegal, Aug. 12Cattle herdsmen in many parts of the droughtstricken region below the Sahara are returning to their villages and waterholes now that the summer rains have started and the grasses are growing.

title: $10,069 Big Triple
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Aug. 24 (UPI)The largest big triple in the history of Roosevelt Raceway occurred tonight when the 8.71 combination returned $10,069 to 17 ticketholders. The previous record was $5,360 on April 18, 1972.

title: City Starts Campaign to Cut Nonemergency 911 Calls
description: The city has started a campaign to persuade residents not to use the 911 emergency number unless it is absolutely necessary.

title: Old Mormon Store Is Getting Face Lifting
description: SALT LAKE CITYNo longer will the odor of grocerydepartment cheese waft into the perfume department.

title: DrugCase Suspect Profits by $4,000 Despite Guilty Plea
description: By pleading guilty to destruction of evidence, a Long Island usedcar dealer who was alai suspected of dealing in heroin. wound up yesterday with 54,000 profit and the memory of the best vacation he ever had  all at Government expense.

title: LEGISLATOR SUES FOR ETHICS DATA
description: TRENTON, Aug. 24Assemblyman Kenneth A. Gewertz, Democrat of Gloucester, said today he had filed suit to force public disclosure by the Ethics Committee of confidential reports on state legislators.

title: Civil Suits Against Hanrahan In Panther Deaths Backed
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 24 (AP)A Federal appeals court ruled todaythat former State's Attorney Edward V. Hanrahan may be sued for civil damages in connection with the slaying of two Black Panther party leaders during a police raid four years ago.

title: MEXICO GETS LOAN FOR POWER PLANT
description: The United States ExportImport Bank and the Wells Fargo Bank of San Francisco joined in an agreement yesterday to lend Mexico $54.18million as part of the financing for that country's first nuclear power plant.

title: BURGLARIES BY F.B.I. SAID TO BE COMMON
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., Aug. 24 (UPI)  Federal Bureau of Investigation agents used to make their own lockpicking devices and practice using them in a classroom equipped with grinding wheels in the attic of the Justice Department building, a former agent said today.

title: Spaniards Begin to Lose Their Enthusiasm for That Rising Deluge of Tourists
description: MADRID, Aug. 24Close to 6,5 million foreigners, including substantial numbers of Western Europeans, will have basked under the hot Spanish sun this month, but Spain is starting to have second thoughts about the invasion she has so successfully promoted.

title: Communists Shell Phnom Penh Airport
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Saturday, Aug. 25 (AP)Khmer Rouge insurgents shelled Phnom Penh's Pochentong military and international airport just before dawn today for the first time since the United States bombing halt 10 days ago.

title: Where a Man Was Slain in Jamaica, Children Play and Sand Covers Blood
description: South Jamaica children were playing at a street party yesterday less than 20 yards from the spot where 28yearold Eugene Dantzler was shot and killed Thursday evening as he and his wife were taking a short cut to their home.

title: Tokyo Police Teach Iowan Humane Force
description: TOKYO, Aug. 24 Bruce Brown, an American police officer, ducked inside the slashing arc of the club aimed at his head and jammed a short metal wand against his Japanese assailant's jugular with both hands.

title: Marchi Takes Mayoral Campaign to Hamptons
description: EAST HAMPTON, L. I., Aug. 24The Republican mayoral campaign of State Senator John J. Marchi came to the Hamptons tonight with a lavish splash of the money and high society that each summer finds its way from New York City 100 miles eastward to this seaside resort.

title: PrivateAirport Owners Selling Out to Developers
description: VINELAND, Aug. 24 (AP)Mark Rigor stood in the open hangar of his airport here and watched the traffic.

title: Judge Blocks Price Curbs On Gasoline Set for Sept.1
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24A Federal judge ruled today that the Government's Phase 4 regulations on most gasoline sold at the pump could not go into effect when the present extended freeze on retail gasoline prices expires Aug. 31.

title: Restaurants Innovate to Cope With Beef Situation
description: Faced with drastically curtailed supplies of their most important offeringbeefrestaurants in the metropolitan area are trying to make do in a variety of ways,: adding surcharges to beef dishes on the menu, creating new nonbeef dishes, even deliberately running out of beef in the belief that it is not worth the trouble to find and that the customers will understand. trouble to find and that the customers will understand.

title: Invisible Fence for Pets
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24An animal lover has invented an invisible method of fencing pets in. Richard M. Peck of Allentown, Pa., was granted Patent 3,753,421 this week for his electrical apparatus, called StaPut. A wire covered with neoprene and connected to the house current is buried around the area under an inch or less of soil. Each animal to be kept from roaming wears on its collar a lowpowered, highvoltage receiver with a rechargeable battery. If a pet approaches the wire it gets a mild shock but is not really hurt.

title: 5 HELD IN ROBBERIES IN GARMENT DISTRICT
description: A police stakeout unit arrested five men and recoved, $75,000 worth of stolen merchandise last night after following three of the men from a holdup in the garment district to a nearby loft.

title: Janice C. Dolan Is Married
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N.J., Aug. 24Miss Janice Carolyn Dolan, daughter of Mrs. Harry B. Seng of Livingston and John F. Dolan of Miami, was married here this afternoon to William Thomas Cunningham Jr., widower, and son of Mr. and Mrs. Cunningham of Chatham. The Rev. Ross H. Greer performed the ceremony in the Church of St. Andrew and Holy Communion, Episcopal. The bridegroom is an assistant vice president, corporate trust department, Marine Midland Bank, New York.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: The Metropolitan Museum of Art will open an exhibition of paintings, drawings and prints by the Dutch mannerist artist Abraham Bloemaert on Sept. 11. The exhibition, in the Met's prints and drawings galleries through Nov. 4, will include a newly acquired painting, Moses Striking the Rock. This is the first time the museum has devoted an entire exhibition to Bloemaert, who lived from 1564 to 1651.

title: Auto Tax Based on Gas Use Is Weighed
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24  The Administration is considering a proposal to impose a tax on new cars that use large quantities of gasoline, Eric Zausner, Deputy Assistant Secretary of the Interior, said today.

title: $150,000 Trot Tonight Has Cast of Unknowns
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Aug. 24 Othello, the chestnut prince of Soviet horses, was unveiled this morning at Roosevelt Raceway, and one American groom turned to a friend and asked, Would you bet this horse?

title: Capital Punishment Revived in 19 States Since Court Ruling
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24 (UPI)Nineteen states have revived the death penalty since it was struck down by the Supreme Court, saving 600 persons from execution.

title: Recital: Pellucid Pianism
description: Alicia de Larrocha makes no attempt to charm an audience, though any audience must find the sight of the tiny Spanish pianist irresistibly appealing even before she plays a note. Miss de Larrocha is all business, and it's not show business: She steps up to the piano, briefly acknowledges her admirers and then all but disappears into the music at hand.

title: Hint by Dey, Tourney Head
description: CARY, N.C., Aug. 24Commissioner Joseph C. Dey of the Tournament Players Division of the Professional Golfers Association, one of the leading executives in golf, indicated today he might retire.

title: F.H.A.V.A.Loan Rates Lifted to 8 From 7%
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24 (AP) The interest ceiling on Veterans Administration and Federal Housing Administration homeloan guarantees was raised today from 73A per cent to 8 per cent, effective tomorrow.

title: 56,000 RAIL WORKERS ON STRIKE IN CANADA
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 24 (Reuters)A nationwide walkout of railway workers began last night in Canada and management and union leaders met with a federal mediator today in an effort to reach a settlement.

title: 3 HIGH U.S. AIDES REPORTED TARGET OF TAPS IN 196971
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 24 Three high ranking Foreigr Service officers, including a key assistant to Henry A. Kissinger during the Vietnam peace talks in Paris, were among 13 Gov ernment officials whose tele. phones were tapped on President Nixon's authority betweer 1969 and 1971, according to sources familiar with the open ation.

title: Ellen C. Schramm Wed to Composer
description: REDDING, Conn., Aug. 24 Christ Episcopal Church was the setting here tonight for the marriage of Miss Ellen Christie Schramm, daughter of Prof. and Mrs. John C. Schramm of Redding, to Sherwin Cathcart Day, composer and pianist. He is the son of the late Mr. and Mrs. William L. Day of Bedford, N.Y. The Rev. Randall C. Giddings performed the ceremony.

title: First Firefighters Leave West; All but 3 Big Blazes Contained
description: The first firefighters were sent home yesterday from an army of 10,000 men that battled and defeated the worst outbreak of timber and range fires in the history of the Western states.

title: Kidnapping Leads Japan to Delay Korea Aid Talks
description: TOKYO, Aug 24Japan today postponed an important meeting of Japanese and South Korean Cabinet ministers to register public displeasure over the abduction of a South Korean Opposition leader from Tokyo.

title: 2 IN LONDON HURT BY A LETTER BOMB;High Stock Exchange Aide InjuredScotland Yard Officially Blames I.R.A.
description: LONDON, Aug. 24Scotland Yard ?? blamed elements of the outlawed Irish Republican Army today for a series of explosive devices plaguing London this week. A letter bomb sent to the Stock Exchange in London's financial district injured two people this morning, the first victims of the devices.

title: South Vietnam Lists Loss Of 38 Men in Day's Clashes
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 24 (UPI)  South Vietnamese units withstood a series of shelling attacks, brief firefights and mine traps during the 24hour period ended at noon today, the military command said. It said 38 Government soldiers and 19 Communist soldiers were killed in the fighting. Six civilians were also reported killed.

title: MNUEL SCHEYER, EXTRANSIT AIDE, 88
description: Emanuel Scheyer, who retired in 1955 as design engineer for the New York City Transit Authority, died Thursday at his home, 1717 Avenue N, Brooklyn. He was 88 years old.

title: Swedish Robber Holds Hostages 2d Day
description: STOCKHOLM, Aug. 24 (AP)A gunman today held four hostages in a bank for a second day and said that the standoff was the fault of the police who had barged in while he was robbing the bank.

title: NEW STRIKES ADD TO CHILE'S WOES;Militants of Right and Left Clash as the Pressure
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 24Another wave of strikes, involving the shutdown of shops and transportation, was reported today in nine of Chile's provinces. In Santiago, the capital, the doctors continued their stoppage.

title: R. A. Horowitz Weds Linda Pergament
description: Miss Linda Sue Pergament and Richard Andrew Horowitz were married yesterday evening in the Terrace Room of the Plaza by Rabbis Jerome K. Davidson and Joseph P. Sternstein.

title: Brazilians to Pay $2Million for U.S. Residence
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Aug. 25 (AP)  The state government will buy the former United States ambassadorial mansion here for $2million after failing in a Supreme Court suit to get it for half the price.

title: Meadows to Get Huge Recycling Project
description: LYNDHURSTThe Hackensack Meadowlands may be the site of something other than professional football games in the nottoodistant future. The Meadowlands Development Commission is expected to announce next month plans to set up what may be the nation's largest program or recycling solid waste.

title: OneParty Rule Set in Zambia Under New Charter
description: MULUNGUSHI ROCK, Zambia, Aug. 25 (Reuters)President Kenneth D. Kaunda gave his assent to Zambia's new Constitution today and went on to attack London's financial center and the Western press.

title: Heart Transplants
description: If I felt any better, I couldn't stand it."Louis B. Russell Jr. on the fifth anniversary of his successful heart transplant.

title: Miss Rushton To Be a Bride
description: SALEM, N. H., Aug. 25Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Rushton have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Shirley Anne Rushton, to Stephen William Cole, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph E. Cole of Shaker Heights, Ohio, and Palm Beach, Fla. The wedding is planned for Oct. 14.

title: Southern Cal Is Picked As Best College Eleven
description: Fewer than 30 of the 126 major college football teams have highly successful seasons year after year. Wit'h the start of the 1973 season only six days away, the same names are appearing in preseason predictions and they will probably appear in the final wireservice polls.

title: jeanne M. Boise Wed in Roslyn To R. F. Sheehy
description: ROSLYN, L. I., Aug. 25Miss Jeanne Marie Boisi, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James 0. Boisi of Old Brookville, was married here at noon today to Robert F. Sheehy, son of Dr. and Mrs. Thomas J. Sheehy Jr. of East Hills and Wells, Vt.

title: Narcotics Hard Drugs Face Hard New Law
description: After five years of experimenting with programs that treated drug offenders medically, New York State officially abandons that concept on Saturday and adopts by law a policecourt hard line which has at its heart life sentences for the sale of hard drugs.

title: Girl, 16, Swims to 1,500 Mark
A TENANT SCORES WELFARE HOTEL
description: Bags of garbage were strewn about the hallway of the fourth floor of the Great Northern Hotel yesterday.

title: Dagbury, Pekingese, Best at Newton
description: BETHEL, Conn., Aug. 25A Pekingese, Ch. Dagbury of Calartha, owned by Michael Wolf and Mrs. Walter M. Jeffords Jr. of New York, led a field of 1,507 today at the Newtown Kennel Club show on the grounds of the Frank A. Berry School, winning his eighth top award.

title: Ten years after the March on Washington
description: JACKSON, Miss. Our bus left Boston before dawn on the day of the march. We were a jolly, boisterous crowd who managed to shout the words to We Shall Overcome without a trace of sadness or doubt. At least on the surface. Underneath our bravado there was anxiety: Would Washington be ready for us? Would there be violence? Would we be overcome? Could we overcome? At any rate, we felt confident enough to try.

title: Hopeful to Gusty O'Shay; Az Igazi Is 7th and Last
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 25Another upset of more than small proportion occurred in the $84,000 Hopeful today when Gusty O'Shay won the 6 furlong event and the heavily favored Az Icazi finished dead last.

title: Biology
description: It may be no exaggeration that the advances achieved in the life sciences during the second half of this century equal, in their massiveness and sweep, in their revolutionary intellectual impact and in their practical social significance, those of physics in the first. Some of these advances are now widely familiar. The revolution surrounding the discovery of the role of DNA and the elucidation of the code of inheritance, rivaling the original discoveries of Mendel, is almost universally known. Our widened understanding of the nature of viruses, and of their effects on bacteria and on higher organisms, have become generally familiar, thanks particularly to the extraordinary impact of this understanding on modern medicine. Cell hybridization  that recent dramatic development whereby the chromosomes of very different animals, such as man and mouse, can be combined for periods in the nuclei of single cells and various aspects of the effects of this combined hereditary material investigated in culture  is becoming a given for an increasing audience within and without the ranks of science. The recent extension of the method to the combination of the chromosomes of different plants within single cell nuclei, with its possibility of thereby hybridizing various forms  perhaps including important crop varieties that have never been crossed by conventional means has made headlines.

title: Diagramless, 16 by 23
description: ACROSS

title: Official Crime
description: WASHINGTONTo the lengthening list of Watergaterelated disclosures, add the revelation that, over a 30year period ending in 1966, agents of the F.B.I. periodically burglarized homes, apartments, offices and embassies in this country seeking foreign intelligence, clues in criminal cases and evidence against suspected organized crime figures.

title: ELEVEN LITTLE DECORATING TRICKS
description: 1 The pencil, for coloring lips, eyelids, brows, has a different shade at each end. The combination here is Curry and Copper. Eye Color Stick by Estee Lauder is $3.50.

title: Brownstone Vacant 20 Years Is Rented
description: It took 20 years, but the fivestory brownstone at 13 East 69th Street, just west of Madison Avenue, is finally getting an occupant.

title: Laos Says North Vietnamese Pledge To Withdraw All Troops After a Pact
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Aug. 25The Laotian Government has received assurances from the Communistled Pathet Lao that all North Vietnamese troops will leave Laos if a final peace agreement is signed here, according to the Government's chief negotiator.The pledge was said to have been given before last Mondays abortive coup d'etat, but since then both the North Vietnamete and the Pathet Lao have said their policies remain unchanged.

title: Gypsies In Queens Learning City Ways
description: The Jamaica Hill Community Association is going to work closely with officials of Commissioner Richard M. Clurman's recently established Parks Partnership program to instruct about 100 gypsies on the proper use of the facilities at Capt. George H. Tilly Memorial Park, in Jamaica Hills, Queens.

title: The World
description: SANTIAGOIn the earthquake country, you learn to live with upheaval, a Chilean engineer remarked with a fatalistic shrug last week.

title: STATE QUESTIONS MEDICAID ROLLS
description: Two state monitoring agencies have reported an extremely. high rate of ineligibility 15.3 to 31.5 per cent  among the 250,000 nonwelfare enrollees in New York City's $1.2billionayear Medicaid program for the sick poor.

title: Anne Sprole Wed to R. W. Jacobs
description: BOLTON LANDING, N. Y., Aug. 25Miss Anne Louise Sprole, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Frank A. Sprole of Darien, Conn., and Bolton Landing, was married here at the Sprole summer home this afternoon to Richard W. Jacobs, son of Mr. and Mrs. Winfred O. Jacobs of Golden, Colo.

title: Sunday Observer
description: I wanted to lie for my country. After all, somebody had to protect the national security.

title: Hearing on Correction Unit
description: The City Council's Committee on Civil Service and Labor will conduct an open hearing at 10:30 A.M. Tuesday dealing with the tours of duty of members of the Department of Correction's uniformed force.

title: Mosquitoes Target Of Drive in Bergen
description: ENGLEWGOD The Bergen County Mosquito Extermination Commission will clear streams in Englewood and Upper Saddle River in an effort to eliminate potential mosquitobreeding sites.

title: POINT OF VIEW; An Ombudsman for Executives?; The Idea Is To Avert Corporate Injustice
description: In a recent Supreme Court decision on pornography, Justice Potter Stewart stated that although he did not know how to define it, he knew it when he saw it.

title: BQLI Bulletin Board
description: East HamptonPaintings by Ralph Carpentier, wood sculpture by Raoul Hague, paintings and drawings by Carolyn Tyson, drawings by Mary Jo Schwalbach, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday through Saturday, 10 A.M. to 5 P.M., Upstairs Gallery, 26 Newtown Lane.

title: News of the Stage
description: What is the secret behind the success of Broadway's longrunning mysterythriller, Sleuth?

title: Travel Notes: A New Key to Hotel Security
description: WITH thefts of television sets and guests belongings running into the millions of dollars annually, the American hotel industry is taking a hard look at its inhouse security. And recent developments indicate that the key to the whole problem might be to do away with keys entirely.

title: 80% of Highway Net Is Open to U.S. Traffic
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25 More than 80 per cent of the nation's planned 42,500 mile interstate highway system has been completed and is now in use, the Federal Highway Administration announced this week.

title: Ellen Douglas D'Oench Bride Of Paul Edward Ruimerman
description: MIDDLETOWN, Conn., Aug. 25Miss Ellen Douglas D'Oench, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Russell Grace D'Oench Jr., was married here this afternoon to Paul Edward Ruimerman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Hendrik Ruimerman.

title: Greek Amnesty
description: ATHENS  George Papadopoulos, the glum schoolmaster's son who became an artillery colonel, was installed last Sunday in the Orthodox Cathedal for an eightyear term as President of the new Greek Republic, to the ritual cry of Axios [He Is Worthy] that once accompanied the coronations of ancient Byzantine emperors.

title: REBEL DRIVE SEEN ON PHNOM PENH
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25United States officials con cerned with Cambodia said to day that they were gloomy about the situation in that country because of intelligence reports that a new push by insurgent forces against tin capital of Phnom Penh is imminent.

title: Queens Center Helps Koreans to Adapt
description: Emigrating to a country with a different language and customs can be a difficult and painful experience. But for the Koreans coming to New York, at least, this experience has been eased somewhat by a center in Queens that helps the immigrants to adjust to their new country and to make the most of their skills.

title: Floyd Warner, raging old man
description: The burden fiction about the Midwest has to carry is that the place for many of us is an essential blank: blank land, blank language, blank faces. People read Southern writers, one would believe, because the South is full of a fascinating clutter of insane people. They read about California because California is bizarre. They read about Connecticut because it is close. But the Midwest, oh my!

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was: 69562
description: Tickets matching lise number win Tickets, with the five numbers in reverse win $225, With the first or last four numbers in order win $225, Tickets with the first, middle or last three numbers In memo win $25, Tickets with ell five numbers scrambled win $25, Tickets matching the first and second digits, the second and third, the third an fourth or the With and fifth win $2.50.

title: Stockholm Police Lock Gunman, Others in a Vault
description: STOCKHOLM, Sweden, Aug. 25 (AP)  Policemen locked a gunman, his accomplice and four hostages in the vault of a bank where the gunman was holding out for the third straight day today.

title: CAMBODIAN REBELS REPORTED IN FIGHT WITH HANOI FORCE
description: KOMPONG TRACH, Cambodia, Aug. 25Intense fighting between North Vietnamese and Cambodian Communist troops has been reported by Cambodian refugees coming into this remote area along the South Vietnamese border.

title: Along the Straw Hat Trail
description: MANHATTAN THEATER CLUB, 321 E. 73d St., Stage 73. Tues.Sat., Darryl and Carol and Kenny and Jenny. THE NEW YORK SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL MOBILE THEATER presents Two Gentlemen of Verona. Tonight at Prospect Park West & 11th St., Brooklyn.

title: American Motors Income Rise Revives Its ProfitSharing Plan
description: DETROIT, Aug. 25The strength of the automobile industry was underscored this week When it was announced that 13,000 union workers at the American Motors Corporation would receive bonuses of $150 each.

title: Soccer Is Going West With Expansion Fever
description: Phil Woosnam, commissioner of the North American Soccer League, was absent when the league honored its most valuable player, its coach of the year and its rookie of the year last Tuesday. Clive Toye, general manager of the New York Cosmos, acted on behalf of Woosnam and said the commissioner was on the West Coast on a business trip. What Toye meant was that Woosnam was on the West Coast to talk expansion with people in Seattle, Los Angeles, the San Francisco Bay area and Vancouver, British Columbia. News of Soccer

title: WHAT'S IN A NAME? FOR CHINESE, A LOT; Choice Has Long Reflected Hopes and Principles; The writer of the following article, a member of the staff of The New York Times who was born in Hong Kong, recently completed a 13day private visit to China.
description: For hundreds of years Peking was threatened by a tempestuous river flowing to its west that periodically broke through its dikes, flooding wide areas.. The river was named the Wuting, which means River That Is Never Still. Then, in the 18th century, a Manchu emperor, wishing to calm the river, renamed it the Yungting, or River That Is Always Still.

title: D. Hanover Is First in Rich Trot
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Aug. 25 After relaxing in the slipstream created by the big mare from France, Delmonica Hanover made it on her own tonight with a stretch drive to win the $150,000 Roosevelt International Trot.

title: College Faculties
description: It may come as a surprise to some critics who tend to characterize them as a bunch of godless radicals, but 60 per cent of the country's halfmillion college and university faculty members consider themselves religious and, when it comes to politics, 44 per cent call themselves conservative. These findings are contained in an exhaustive 68page report released last week by the American Council on Education.

title: 75 Years Go By... And the Seuffert Band Plays On
description: The conductor raises his baton, an expectant hush falls over the audience, and a split second later the Seuffert Band is sending waves of delightful music to rapturous listeners. This afternoon, as the captivating scenario is repeated once again, the city will pay tribute to the enduring contingent's 75th anniversary.

title: Seven Suffocate in a Blaze At $74,000 Jersey Home
description: NORTH CALDWELL, N. J., Aug. 25A Wall Street executive, his wife, their three young children and two of the wife's nieces died today in an earlymorning fire in their home.

title: THE FALL
description: The laissezfaire, doyourownthing, protest movement of few years back has left its mark. Nobody's pushing anybody into any kind of a uniform. Nobody dares. There are suggestions: sweater coats, blousedtop dresses, voluminous capes, straighter pants. But the thou shalt wear white gloves attitude has faded away.

title: Passaic's Shoreline To Be Cleaned Up
description: KEARNY  Project CUOP, an ecologyoriented organization composed of Kearny High School students, is sponsoring a cleanup of the Passaic River shores in Kearny on Sept. 29. The river is said to be one of the mostpolluted streams in the country.

title: Gardens
description: THERE is a special mosphere inside an house, a nostalgic fe ing of old wood, rough plaster, wrinkled panes of glass and memories. And so it is with oldfashioned gardens. They are graceful places, casual yet carefully formed. They have a peace that does not exist in a more modern setting.

title: SHOP TALK
description: FAIR LAWN  Browse is a sort of general store, one where the stock consists of other people's mistakes.

title: Singers in Greece Resume Performing Theodorakis Music
description: ATHENS, Aug. 25Athens nightclub performers have resumed singing the songs of Mikis Theodorakis, despite uncertainty whether the sixyear ban on his music has been lifted.

title: HEATINGOIL LACK FEARED HERE SOON
description: Heatingoil dealers in the metropolitan area and in the Northeast generally have less than a third of their normal seasonal inventory on hand and the dealers and public officials are warning that supplies may be available only at sharply inflated prices unless the major oil companies release some of their supplies.

title: Part II The NewYork Times Magazine Fashions of The Times Fall1973
description: They're young and pretty, have famous husbands and attractive children. They could easily join the languid ladies on the restaurantlunch circuit and while away their afternoons in the Madison Avenue boutiques. But once they've packed the children off to school, you'll see them dashing around Dry Dock Country, off to their jobs. Their shopping bags are full of papers, rather than Blooniingdale's goodies.

title: Cab Strike Continues
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 25 (AP)Efforts to end a fourmonthold strike by 2,000 drivers and maintenance workers of the Yellow Cab Company failed today when the workers voted 703 to 10] to reject the company's latest contract offer.

title: This Week in Sports
description: The Yankees will be in Anaheim, Calif., Tuesday and Wednesday night for games with the Angels, then re turn to New York to meet the Baltimore Orioles on Friday at 7:30 P.M., Saturday at 2 and Sunday at 2. Saturday will be Shirt Day at Yankee Stadiumevery child under 14 accompanied by an adult will receive a free Tshirt carrying the Yankee insignia.

title: Youth Seized for Vagrancy Charged in Jersey Murder
description: ASBURY PARK, N. J., Aug. 25 (AP)A Pennsylvania youth arrested today for vagrancy was charged with murder in the strangulation of a teenaged girl whose body had been found in a vacant lot last Wednesday.

title: HERON 0.SINGHER, BLOOD SPECIALIST
description: WARREN, N.J., Aug. 25Dr. Heron 0. Singher, who contributed to coagulation, immunology and serodiagnostic tech niques, died yesterday at Hunterdon Medical Center, Flemington. He was 59 years old and lived here at 130 Mountain Avenue.

title: Social Announcements
TRAINING FOR U.S. OFFERED DOCTORS
description: Twentyfour American graduates of foreign medical schools will be spending the next year at Queens Hospital Center here, preparing to practice medicine in the United States.

title: Kalil Prediction Beats Skippers In 32Mile Sail
description: NEW ROCHELLE, Aug. 25 Elias A. Kalil in his 75foot ChrisCraft, won the 16th annual predicted log contest of the Huguenot Yacht Club today. His error was 1.22 per cent, representing a total error of 141 seconds in an elapsed running time of 11,541 seconds.

title: Stamford Finds Police Records Of 2 Men About to Join Force
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Aug. 25 Mayor Julius Wilensky refused at the last minute yesterday to swear in as policemen two applicants who had passed a series of tests and interviews after it was discovered that they had criminal records.

title: Home Improvement
description: ALTHOUGH they are not one of the most frequently required tools for ordinary home repairs, no tool kit or home workshop would ever be considered complete without at least one or two wood chisels of different sizes. Basically a sharpedged shaping and cutting tool, a chisel will often do fitting or trimming jobs that no other hand tool would be quite as suitable for.

title: Queens Novelists and Manhattan Reviewers
description: There once was a system in which all major reviewing was done in Edinburgh, in Scotland, and all the writing was done in England. The reviewers were winning this one on blood lines alone. One Edinburgh reviewer, Francis Jeffrey, got so far into the game that in one smashing review he wrote three pages of his autobiography and then used the last two paragraphs of the review to sneer at the lifetime work of a writer from.London. When they put Jeffrey's review into the forms, it came out two paragraphs too long. Jeffrey told the makeup man, Cut from the bottom.

title: The Black Panthers: large threats, small guilt
description: We have lived through a season of political trials, and of books about themJessica Mitford on the Boston resisters, Jason Epstein, Anthony Lukas on the Chicago demonstrators, Daniel Berrigan on Catonsville, William O'Rourke on Harrisburg, John Sack on Calley, Mary McCarthy on Medina; plus Elmer Getz on Ruby, Ed Sanders on Manson, Bradford Huie on James Earl Ray and Robert Kaiser on Sirhan Sirhan. Those who see racism everywhere may observe that black trials have produced nowhere their share of books.

title: Libyan Deadline Expires On Oil TakeOver Demands
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 25 (Reuters)  Libya's deadline on her takeover ultimatum to four major American oil companies expired today, and wellinformed oil sources said that a major confrontation was possible.

title: Bergen Continuing Bus Line Subsidies
description: HACKENSACK  The Bergen County Board of Freeholders has approved the continuation of $131,844 in subsidies to four bus lines that operate in the county. The amount represents Bergen's share of the total subsidies, which are shared with the state's Department of Transportation

title: Study Finds a Marked Increase In Jewish Studies in 10 Years
description: TORONTO, Aug. 25When Mrs. Bruce Saypol was graduated from Brandeis University in 1964, she said, her classmates considered me a curiosity.

title: 3 of 5 Slain by Police Here Are Black, Same as the Arrest Rate
Sewer Gratings Termed Hazard to Bicycle Riders
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25 (AP) The Center for Auto Safety asked the Federal Highway Administration today to redesign sewer gratings to cut down on a hazard to the growing number of bicycle riders.

title: General From the Jungle
description: The battle for a new Mexico

title: Laura Johnson:
description: Mrs. F. Raymond Johnson, Laura to her friends, is flamehaired, owns 68 evening gowns, and has been called the most flamboyant woman in. Manhattan. She is also one of the few wealthywomenabouttown who will still admit that she LOVES fashion, and the frenetic, highvoltage life that often goes with it.While other women in her economic bracket show up at parties, balls and openings in their understated little $2,000 numbers, you can bet that Laura Johnson will be there looking like a bird of paradise (another of her newspaper nicknames). Her plumage will most likely be feathers, or sequins, or nexttonothing dresses that reveal her ample bustline, or her shapely legs, or, more likely, both.

title: 5 Women Honored in Suffolk
description: EAST HAMPTON, L. I. Although Jeanette Edwards Rattray has always felt that I've had my rights without fussing about them, the author and newspaper publisher will join in a Women's Rights Day celebration today.

title: Miss Kathleen E. Moore Has Bridal
description: Miss Kathleen Elizabeth Moore, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Douglas S. Moore of New York and Fenwick, Conn., was married here this afternoon to Christopher Carter Browne, son of Mrs. Louis E. Browne of MacLean, Va., and the late Mr. Browne.

title: ROGERS CRITICIZES THE WHITE HOUSE FOR TAPS ON MD
description: Paul J. Hare, the acting State Department spokesman, said last night and again this morning that Mr. Rogers had told him that he was never informed by the White House about the wiretaps and would not have approved them.

title: Numismatics
description: NEXT week New York City will serve as a meeting ground for numismatic scientists with the opening of the second New York International Numismatic Convention on Friday and, then, two days later, the opening of the International Numismatic Congress. The following Thursday, Sept. 13, these groups will travel to Washington to participate in the biennial dealer's meeting of the International Association of Professional Numismatists.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International Intense fighting between North Vietnamese and Cambodian Communist troops has been reported by refugees coming into Kompong Trach, a remote area in Cambodia along the South Vietnamese border. The refugees say the fighting was initiated by the Cambodian Communists after a conflict over scarce rice supplies and territorial control and has resulted in hundreds of casualties for the North Vietnamese and Cambodians. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Miss Mills, Miss Rawls Lead Golf
description: DENVER, Aug. 25 (UPI)Betsy Rawls turned to a scrambling wedge and putting game today for a oneunderpar 70 and moved into a tie with the openinground leader, Mary Mills, for the top spot after two rounds of the $30,000 National Jewish Hospital open.

title: DANCES OF INDIA BY MANJU PRASAD
description: There was a genial lack of organization in Manju Prasad's concert Friday evening in the Museum of Modern Art's sculpture garden, but the dancing itself was attractively conceived. Miss Prasad effectively presented selections from various Indian dance styles, including Kathak and Bharata Natyam.

title: WEINSTEIN VICTOR IN U. S. PERCHER
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 25 (AP)Norman Weinstein of Allston Mass., won the United States Open Chess Championship early this morning after the defending champion, Walter Browne was upset.

title: 7 ReadytoRoll Antique Rail Cars Up for Sale
description: FLEMINGTONA 25yearold railroad buff, a man who has owned enough vintage passenger cars in his time to put together an eightcar artique train, is selling off his remaining stock at a. public auction here on Sept. 4.

title: The Soviet Union
description: MOSCOWThe lines of confrontation were sharply drawn last week between the Kremlin and one of its most prominent domestic critics, Andrei Sakharov, the 52yearold physicist and reputed father of the Soviet hydrogen bomb.

title: Taiwan, Acting to Save Wildlife, Bans Trade in Animal Specimens
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Aug. 25Souvenir shops along Taipei's Hagglers Alley and at scenic spots outside the city no longer display the vividly colored stuffed birds and giant hairyfooted flying squirrels they used to sell in great numbers. Dealing in wild animal speci cens has just been made lifeal, punishable by heavy fines.

title: Arab Hijacks Yemeni Airliner And Wins Pledge From Kuwait
description: KUWAIT, Aug. 25 (Reuters) An armed Yemeni hijacked a Yemen Airways airliner today and forced it to fly across Arabia to Kuwait, where he gave himself up after receiving written guarantees from the Kuwaiti Government.

title: Blue's 4Hitter Sends Yanks to 5th Loss in Row, 20
description: OAKLAND, Aug. 25Vida Blue, gradually regaining the form that made him the baseball sensation of 1971, posted his sixth straight victory for the Oakland A's today as he defeated the New York Yankees, 2.0, on a fourhitter.

title: Skylab Astronauts Surpass the Record For Time in Space
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 25 (UPI)The Skylab 2 astronauts returned to orbital research today with their second successful space walk behind them and swept past _ the space endurance record.

title: Letters
description: Professor James W. Kuhn takes what I consider to be a dangerous position in Inflation: It may. hurt only a little (Aug. 5). While he concludes that inflation ... denies expectations and frustrates hopes... , the overall thrust of his article strikes me as saying that inflation is not as serious an economic ill as it is usually pictured in the press and in the statements of public officials.

title: American Tourism in Europe Reduced by Rising Prices and Weakened Dollar
description: LONDON, Aug. 25Tourist authorities throughout Europe are concerned that the lucrative tide of American visitors is being stemmed by rising prices and the depleted value of the dollar.

title: Trevino Conquers Nicklaus
description: CARY. N.CNug. 25Lee Trevino tossed birdies and an eagle at Jack Nicklaus instead of a rubber snake as he defeated his archrival, 4 and 3, to gain the semifinals of the United States matchplay championship today.

title: COAST CLINIC HELD BY CHARISMATICS
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Aug. 25The growing interest in the charismatic religious movement is exemplified this week by the large turnout here for the annual clinic sponsored by the Melodyland Christian Center.

title: Help Wanted: TollTaker for Footbridge in Maine
description: WATERVILLE, Me., Aug. 25The company that owns the TwoPenny Bridge is looking for a tolltaker for the footbridge that spans the Kennebec River between Waterville and Winslow.

title: Plan to Keep School Open 12 Months Faces Vote
description: GLOUCESTER TOWNSHIP Residents of this Camden County municipality will vote on Dec. 4 on whether the township's school district should institute what could evolve into New Jersey's onlr compulsory yearround education program.

title: TV Mallbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Barbara Harry Is Bride of Timothy Lusk
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Aug. 25Miss Barbara Harry and Timothy John Thomas Lusk of Haworth, N. J., and Cold Spring, N. Y., were married this afternoon in the Congregational Church of New Canaan. The Rev. Charles Crawford Smith performed the ceremony.

title: Brookdale Assisting Dropouts
description: LONG BRANCH  Some time ago, a friend gave Edward Davis, director of the Brookdale Community College Learning Center, a small sculpture of a figure pushing against a boulder. The sculpture now rests on Mr. Davis's desk at the center.

title: Vikings Beat Raiders For 3d Straight, 3410
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Aug. 25 (AP)A safety, Jeff Wright, opened the Minnesota scoring with a 15yard interception return today and a rookie, Chuck Foreman, ran for two touchdowns in a 3410 victory over Oakland. The victory kept the Vikings undefeated in three National Football League exhibition games.

title: Economic Geographers Watch the West
description: The geography of the American economy is shifting. This development is of considerable pertinence to business, particularly to producers of consumer goods.

title: Island Hopping on A Maine Mail Boat
description: IF you live on an island off Maine  which to my mind is the only way to live up there if you're a summer resident  how do you manage the nittygritty of survival you don't have (1) a boat, (2) electricity or (3) a telephone? Need caviar and chablis for a dinner party? How do you get your guests transported? What about laundry? And how do you double check that your office has taken care of the XYZ matter?

title: Tricks of the trade
description: ACROSS

title: Veterans'
description: TRENTONThe Legislature will he asked to provide an emergency program of longterm, lowinterest business loans for veterans of the Vietnam War era.

title: Brooklyn Volunteers Serve Firemen
description: Last year the 255 Fire Club of Brooklynan all volunteer group of 35 fire buffs, who officially serve as the disaster representatives of the American Red Cross Canteen unitresponded to 567 fires and helped relocate more than 6,000 people.

title: When Artists Cast a Shadow Beside Every Cow
description: CAPE ANN, MASS. THIS rugged cape, jutting out into the Atlantic some 30 miles north of Boston, has exercised a fascination for both major and minor American painters for a century or more. Artists as diverse as Winslow Homer, Stuart Davis and Marsden Hartley have summered here, painting the ships in Gloucester Harbor, the bustling activities of its wharves, the tough, sturdy panorama of its rockbound coastline.

title: Peking Leaders Attend Table Tennis Contest
description: PEKING, Aug. 25 (Reuters)  Premier Chou Enlai and almost the entire active Chinese leadership attended a colorful ceremony in Peking's Capital Stadium tonight at the opening of a tricontinental table tennis tournament.

title: Miss Courtney Cleveland Gore Wed to Todd Hackney Graham
description: TANNERSVILLE, N. Y., Aug. 25  In All Souls Church at the Onteora Club here this afternoon, Miss Courtney Cleveland Gore was married to Todd Hackney Graham in an Episcopal Ceremony performed by the Rev. James A. Reynolds.

title: BAPTISTS IN TEXAS TAKE TO LOBBYING
description: DALLAS, Aug. 25The social activism of the Southern Baptists in Texas during the recent session of the Legislature prompted former Presidential aide Bill O. Moyers to call it the most effective voice in Texas on concerns of the Christian faith.

title: State Acting to Help Aspiring Attorneys
description: TRENTON  A huge increase in the number of law school applicants in New Jersey has prompted the creation of a study committee to consider radical changes in the training of attorneys.

title: How to Get Out of Manhattan A Guide for City Drivers
description: THERE are several quick, convenient and comfortable ways to leave Manhattan on a Friday afternoon in the summer, says a spokesman for New York City's Traffic Department. There are rowboats, helicopters, balloons....

title: Armstrong's Grave Dedicated; Bronze Trumpet Pays Tribute
description: Dozens of Louis Armstrong's closest friends, musical associates and his widow, Lucille, attended services in Flushing (Queens) Cemetery yesterday dedicating the jazz musician's gravestone, of polished black granite with a bronze reproduction of his trumpet on top.

title: The Cape Island Folk Festival Is Tiptoeing Into Cape May for Its Second Year
description: CAPE MAY  The Cape Island Festival of Folk Music and Crafts makes its second annual appearance here next weekend in much the same fashion as its unostentatious debut a year ago.

title: Changing seasons
description: Fall comes back with vests and bow ties

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: IN the great American tradition of vigorous resistance to foreign aggression, the Texasgulf Corporation and the Canada Development Corporation are locked in combat in the Federal courthouse in Houston.

title: Bonnie Stone Affianced
