description: The collapse of RollsRoyce, Ltd., in 1971 provided Britain with a spectacular financial crash and businessschool students with a classic case in technical and financial mismanagement.

title: Surprise packages
description: Box lunches. Cold steak and chicken. Dullsville. Not necessarily. When the Chinese gymnasts took a boat tour around Manhattan last spring, the food was half the fun. It was chicken flavored with lemon and lime and dill, and cubed sirloin in an artichoke, mushroom and tomato salad. The boxes it was packed in were equally elegant  lined with bright papers and tied with ribbons. But you don't have to be Chinese to enjoy a boxlunch picnic. It would be a great windup for Labor Day weekend. Or forget the boxes and serve our picnic menu as a buffet in the back yard. (If beef prices are still irrational, save that recipe for next year.) And for a sweet finale, serve fruit or lichee and kumquat kebabs.

title: IndiaPakistan Talks Reach Impasse
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 25Talks between India and Pakistan moved into angry deadlock tonight.

title: Caso Asks Whether Oil Industry Has Guarantees to Drill off L.I.
description: GREENVALE, L.I., Aug. 25Nassau County Executive Ralph G. Caso has called for a Congressional inquiry into the possibility that the Interior Department has guaranteed Atlantic offshore ad drilling rights to the oil industry before holding the required environmentalimpact hearings.

title: Same Old Peron
description: Although Juan Domingo PerOn has not yet been elected President of Argentina, the provisional Government functioning in his name has already begun to curb press freedom in ways reminiscent of the Peronist repressions of 194655. Interim President Raid Lastiri has signed a decree forbidding foreign news agencies, including The Associated Press and United Press International, to supply Argentine newspapers with news of Argentina

title: F.B.I. WARNS STAFF ON LEAKING DATA
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25The Federal Bureau of Investigation has directed all its 18,500 employee to sign a written statement recognizing that the work of the bureau is confidential and that unauthorized disclosures of investigative information may result in criminal prosecution.

title: Summer Frays Out
description: August is frayed at the edges, now, and summer approaches its conclusion. This week will see the end of it. Next week autumn, the fall season, will be at hand.

title: Satellite Locked in Orbit
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Aug. 25 (AP)A rocket motor was fired successfully aboard a new Intelsat 4 communications satellite today, locking it in stationary orbit 22,300 miles above the Atlantic Ocean. The fifth in the series of Intelsat 4 payloads was launched from Cape Kennedy Thursday into preliminary orbit ranging from 340 miles to 22,300 miles high.

title: The Impeachment Precedent
description: COLUMBUS; OhioWith the newly reawakened interest in impeachment, commentators have turned for insight to the only precedent in American history for impeaching a Presidentthe impeachment and trial of Andrew Johnson, Lincoln's successor and seventeenth President of the United States. That look has sobered them because it has been an article of historical faith that the Johnson impeachment was a travesty of justice a partisan effort by rabid Radical Republicans, intent on achieving Congressional supremacy and to eliminate a President whose only offense was to urge a humane policy for reconstructing the South and the Union after the Civil War.

title: SEALAW OUTLOOK IS SAID TO BE DIM
description: GENEVA, Aug. 25The outlook remains dim for the success of the United Nations effort to establish a widely ac cepted body of international law governing the use of the oceans at a world conference next year despite the completion of three years of preparatory work yesterday.

title: Mrs. Leslie Berge Is Married to Student
description: SCARBOROUGH, N. Y., Aug. 25The Scarborough Presbyterian Church was the setting this afternoon for the marriage of Mrs. Leslie Simmons Berge, daughter of Mr. and Mrs, James L. Simmons of Briarcliff Manor, to Charles P. F. Lawrence, son of Mrs. Murray Wheeler of New Hartford, N. Y., and Arthur B. Lawrence Jr. of Leesburg, Va.

title: One crisis alone justified the hot line
description: Molink is always ready

title: Prisoners In Nassau Temper Demands
description: EAST MEADOW, L.I. Serious charges by a group of inmates at the Nassau County jail here that alleged injustices and inhuman and illegal treatment by the administration and correction officers were not discussed at a meeting held at the jail last week attended by County Executive Ralph G. Caso.

title: Suf f olk Agency's Closing To Cut School Services
description: Services in many schools in Suffolk County will be cut as a result of the closing of the Suffolk County Regional Educational Planning Office last month.

title: Saint Alec Wants to Dance
description: IN a sense, all good performances are cumulative performances. That is to say, the actor or actress builds the role at hand from moment to moment, taking on psychic weight as the evening rises in temperature, adding an ounce of magic here and a threat of mystery there untilat the endthe figure on stage can take a stance or make a gesture that seems the sum of all its speeches plus the sum of all its silences plus a little something in the way of compound interest left over. Sure. Everybody does it.

title: Milk Price Hearing Set
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25 (UPI) Faced with declines in milk production, the Agriculture Department has announced plans for a public hearing that could lead to a substantial increase in minimum prices for bottling milk. The department said the hearing would be held on Tuesday at Clayton, Mo.

title: Porter of England Wins Cycling Title
description: SAN SEBASTIAN, Spain, Aug. 25 (AP)Hugh Porter, a 33yearold Englishman, became the first fourtime champion of professional pursuit bicycling today. Porter was timed in 6 minutes 2.97 seconds over the 5,000 meters (about 31/8 miles), almost 10 seconds faster than Rene Pi,jnen of The Netherlands.

title: Indian Culture At L.I. Outpost
description: MONTAUK, L. I.Tacked to lengths of fishnet that are strung from swamp maple, dogwood and hickory rods In the backyard of the Atlantis on Main Street are the artifacts that make up the new outdoor Montauk Indian Museum.

title: Ives? They Love Him in Hungary
description: LAST June, an article on the forthcoming celebration in Miami of the centenary of Charles Ives's birth was headlined Ives: American as Miami. It brought a response from Vivian Perlis, of the Ives Collection at Yale University's music library. She wrote that the heading could have read American as Houston, University of Minnesota, Amsterdam, University of Exeter, Brooklyn, New Haven.... What she was saying was that all these places and many others besides will be honoring the American composer in 1974.

title: PANEL TO OVERSEE ALASKAN PIPELINE
description: ANCHORAGE, Aug. 25Rogers C. B. Morton, Secretary of the Interior, and Gov. William A. Egan announced yesterday that construction of the proposed 789 mile trans Alaska pipeline would be supervised by is joint Federalstate commission.

title: Vatican Sets Theme Of Day of Peace in 74
description: ROME, Aug. 25The Vatican has disclosed the theme of the next Day of Peace to be observed by Roman Catholics around the world.

title: Craig S. Moore Weds Kristina B. Strateff
description: AKRON, Ohio, Aug. 25Miss Kristina Briggitte Strateff and Craig Scott Moore, son of Mr. and Mrs. Craig Moore of Kintnersville, Pa., were married here this afternoon in the garden at the home of the bride's parents, Dr. and Mrs. Stephan Strateff. The bride's mother, Dr. Liselotte Strateff, is an anesthesiologist.

title: A Shattered Record Lures Shane Back Into the Pool
description: It may go down as the shortest retirement in swimming history.

title: Taiwan, on 3d NoHitter , Wins Little League Title
description: WILLIAMSPORT, Pa., Aug. 25 (AP)  Tainan City of Taiwan won the Little League world series today on its third straight nohitter, beating Tucson, Ariz., 120. It was Taiwan's third straight championship and fourth in five years.

title: Weather enigma
description: India's most spectacular weather eventthe torrential rains of the summer monsooncomes about because of an extreme temperature difference in the air over land and sea. Or so goes the standard explanation of the phenomenon. As the sun moves higher in the cloudless sky of May and June, it heats the atmosphere over the Indian plains. The theory is that when the hot air rises and leaves a vast lowpressure zone below it, enormous amounts of warm, wet air rush into the breach from the Indian Ocean and the Bay of Bengal. These winds continue blowing northeast across the subcontinent. Along the way, their clouds may dump water on some places and pass over others, but the real downpours occur when the winds encounter the high Himalayas in northern India and, as a consequence, rise to cooler altitudes, where their vapor condenses into water. Much of the wind is then deflected toward the northwest and travels along the Ganges and the barrier

title: FourDay North Shore Horse Show Will Have Two Pluses and One Minus
description: The North Shore horse show, the last of the remaining major events on Long Island, gets under way Sept. 6 for four days at the Old Field Club in Stony Brook with one division scratched, one section added, and one major new trophy on the shelf. Ninety classes have been scheduled for the 40th edition of the show, with jumpers competing all four days and the juniors on the weekend. We have eliminated the open jumper division, said Mrs. James Blackwell, the president, because of a conflict with the American Gold Cup in Philadelphia. We felt

title: YET ANOTHER SWEATER
description: The sweater suit, and there are scores of them around for fall, can be much more than something casual. The dressup version  tweedy, slinky and frankly sophisticated  is hardly for country hikes or that mundane lastminute dash to the supermarket (unless, of course, an elegant lunch party lasted until just short of the dinner hour). Instead, the more opulent sweater suits are intended for that cool, autumn evening on the town a theater opening, perhaps, or anything after 6 when the invitationis definitely not blacktie. Without the fur, which is a little more glamour than some women want, the suit could go to the office or the PTA. It all depends upon the shoes, the bag and the jewelry.

title: Atlantic Air Fares Decision Challenges Power of C.A.B.
description: The chronically confused issue of how much it should cost to fly across the Atlantic Ocean was thrown into more confusion last week by a Federal court in Washington.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: Trading activity in the stock market early last week shriveled in the August heat. Prices on the New York Stock Exchange declined amid a general lethargy that was not surprising for the period prior to Labor Day.

title: Riggs Top LaughGetter at Forest Hills As Celebrities Serve in a Good Cause
description: Forest Hills Stadium, Queens, was the scene yesterday.

title: OTB Breaks Down
description: A threehour breakdown occurred yesterday in the Offtrack Betting Corporation's wagering computer system. Frustrated horse players milled around the city's 112 OTB branches as some $500,000 in bets could not be placed. Details in Section 5.

title: Land Development Concern Curbed in Court Judgment
description: LANSING, Mich., Aug. 25A national land development concern has agreed in court to refrain in Michigan from telling prospective lot buyers that their property can be resold for a big profit In a year or two.

title: How to Get Into Manhattan Tips for Suburban Drivers
Instrumentalists Dominate Folk Fete
description: UPPER SALFORD TOWNSHIP, Pa., Aug. 25Folk music, by its nature, is usually vocal music, and folk festivals are usually dominated by singers. There were singers aplenty on the afternoon and evening programs of the first day of the 12th annual Philadelphia Folk Festival yesterday at the Old Poole Farm in the rolling, wooded countryside northwest of Philadelphia. But instrumental groups kept moving to the forefront even when the principal performer was a singer.

title: Dash Foresees an Era Of Morality in Politics
description: BOSTON, Aug. 25 (UPI)Samuel Dash, chief counsel for the Senate Watergate Committee, believes the outcome of the Watergate scandal and the subsequent investigations will be a new era of morality in American politics.

title: From the Court House to the White House, Palladio Had Influence
description: ANDREA PALLADIO is the most popular and imitated architect in the world. Ever since the exceptionally gifted northern Italian master created his grand churches, villas and public structures throughout Venice and Vicenza 400 years ago, he has inspired architecture everywhere from London and Leningrad to Washington. In fact, America has been one of Palladio's most fervent disciples, assimilating and often shamelessly pastiching his style in buildings as diverse as the White House, Thomas Jefferson's Monticello, many Southern mansions and about every bank and courthouse in the country. To many, Palladio means almost any building that might contain a Greek column or a Roman pediment.

title: Letters
description: Force feeding a goose enlarges its liver to produce a tasty and expensive pate. Nobody has ever argued that the production of superior chopped liver is good for geese.

title: The banana's revenge
description: No one will ever win against the green fire! No one will ever dispute the rule of the land by the green fire, which is red fire inside and turns green on the outside!... Machines will grow weary someday! Someday the foreigners will be overcome by a desire to sleep, and that instant, by just closing their eyes, by just slowing down their machines, they will be buried along with everything that is theirs, what had once been beauty and metal glowing with oil and motion will turn into skeletons and old iron!... The darkest blindness, green blindness, the blindness of advancing vegetation, drunk and spongy, will take over everything alive and everything dead, and roots, appearing from under the earth, will perforate, drill, raise up houses and buildings, crumble them, will destroy foundations, walls, roofs, dams, will ravage uninhabited churches, raping them, leaving nothing but empty spaces, gaps, pieces of terrace for the wind to shake and tremble.

title: A LITTLE SOMETHING FOR PLAYING HOSTESS IN
Gayle Iselin and Hilton Slung Married in Albany Synagogue
description: ALBANY, Aug. 25  Miss Gayle Iselin, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Alan V. Iselin of Albany and Bondville, Vt., was married here tonight to Hilton Barth Slung. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Marvin L. Slung of Lousiville, Ky.

title: Roxana B. Carnes Bride Of Timothy M. Pickering
description: RYE, N.Y., Aug. 25In Christ's Episcopal Church here this afternoon, Miss Roxana Beecher Carnes, daughter of Sheldon Yates Carnes of Englewood, N.J., and Cragsmoor, and Mrs. Roxana Park Carnes of Englewood, became the bride of Timothy Murdock Pickering. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs, Frederick Butterfield Pickering of Rye.

title: With Joy in Its Own Violence
description: ELECTRA GLIDE in Blue is the kind of film that splits the movie audience into two camps: those who thrive on vivid images, eruptions of cleverly orchestrated violence, outbursts of raucous humor, and generous dollops of rock music; and those who want a film also to have a point of view, a meaningnot a message, mind you, not moralizing, just an aesthetic and moral sensibility that informs it. This may, though it need not, mean younger versus older viewers; it certainly means coasting versus thinking ones. It also means those who will love Electra versus those whose respect is

title: Texas Trapshooter Wins OverAll Title
description: VANDALIA, Ohio, Aug. 25 (UPI)Larry Gravestock of Amarillo, Tex., won the overall championship of the 74th annual Grand American trapshooting tournament today. He broke 958 of 1,000 targets during the six days of competition.

title: Shopping Downtown Emerges on Queens Boulevard
description: Without government planning or unified building program, Queens Boulevard between Rego Park and Elmhurst may be on its way to becoming the major shopping hub of Queens.

title: MICHIGAN PUSHES HOME INSULATION
description: LANSING, Mich., Aug. 25The state of Michigan is prod ding gas utilities to stretch limited gas supplies by underWriting gassaving insulation of residential users homes.

title: The Hospitality Crusade
description: MEMPHISA 55foothigh, starcapped neon sign could pose stiff competition for the stars and spires of Red Square, which may be one reason that Holiday Inn's proposal to build a convention center motel in Moscow is in dormant status.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 2 Museums Fan Interest of Fire Buffs
description: NEWARKFire buffs and others interested in the colorful history of fire fighting have two museums in Northern Jersey that cater to their specialty.

title: PROGRESS SHOWN AT WILLOWBROOK
description: When the Willowbrook State School for the Mentally Retarded was ordered by Federal Judge Orrin G. Judd in Brooklyn to improve its patient care and other operations, he described the condition of the Staten Island institution as inhumane and shocking.

title: Pollen Is Taking Toll on L.I.
description: NEW HYDE PARK, L.I.The balmy breezes are blow Mg pollen up from the Jersey Plains, the ragweed is in full blossom along the edges of Long Island parkways and the reverberation of rapid fire sneezing marks the height of an unusually early and severe hay fever season,

title: Nancy Green to Marry
description: Mr. and Mrs. Philip Green of Hewlett Harbor, L. I., and Hollywood, Fla., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Nancy L. Green, to Howard Waxman, son of Mrs. Shirley Waxman of Sharon, Mass., and the late Harry Waxman.

title: Tokyo's Subway Even Draws Praise in the Summer
description: TOKYO, Aug. 25  With temperatures above 90 degrees in the heat wave now scorching this humid, smoggy capital, countless Tokyoites are finding relief by going undergroundinto the city's many airconditioned subways.

title: Meany Criticizes Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25 (AP) George Meany, president of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations, has accused President Nixon of ignoring the right of the people in his television address on the Watergate scandal by continuing his refusal to withhold Presidential tape recordings about Watergate. The labor leader's comment came in a signed editorial in the A.F.L.C.I.O. weekly newspaper.

title: Argentine Curb Protested
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 25 (UPI)The Association of Argentine Press Entities protested yesterday against a Government decree that would keep foreign news agencies from providing domestic news services within Argentina and give the Government news agency, Telam, a monopoly on national news distribution. The Peronist Government announced the decree Monday, also requiring that newspapers and radio and television broadcasts contain at least 50 per cent national news and that all foreign words, or expressions be translated into Spanish.

title: A Skirmish Is Won By HighRise Foes In Old Charleston
description: CHARLESTON, S. C., Aug. 25  Plans for a $6million highrise condominium project next to this city's historic section is arousing the ire of many preservationists.

title: ADVERTISING POINT OF VIEW
description: The men who serve as the direct and most important link between the food and grocery manufacturers and the food retailers are being viewed in a new and favorable light.

title: Criminals At Large
description: The Howard Hunt who has written THE BERLIN ENDING (Putnam's, $6.95) is the E. Howard Hunt of Watergate. The Berlin Ending is typical of his previous books, with coldwar elements, the C.I.A., a touch of romance. And some of the stiffest writing this side of E. Philips Oppenheim.

title: Late Listings for Today's TV
description: Right Now: Florence V. Lucas, deputy commissioner of human rights, New York City; Vivian Walker Smith, executive director, CoWorkers Development Corporation; Janet Mackey, CoWorkers Development Corporation; Robert Gambel marketing project executive of ITT Continental Baking Company, Channel 9, 9:30 A.M.

title: City Campers at Fishers Island Also Learn to Earn by Caddying
description: FISHERS ISLAND, N. Y.,  Having finished their Bloody Marys, the golfers of the Fishers Island Country Club had moved on to lobster and white wine. They were now nearly ready to begin playing in one of their golf tournaments.

title: UNIONS DEFENDED AS HELPING BLACKS
description: In the last year, black trade unionists here have been moving collectively to counteract some of the criticism and skepticism of the labor movement that many people in the black community have voiced over the years.

title: Cambodian Rebels Shell 2 Airports Near Capital
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Aug. 25 (AP)Fighting was reported at five points within 50 miles of Phnom Penh today. Communistled Cambodian insurgents shelled two airports, including Pochentong, Phnom Penh's military and international airport, cut the country's rice road to the northwest and attacked Government positions defending two provincial capitals.

title: Ridgewood to Hear Saddle River Band
description: RIDGEWOOD  The 50member Saddle River Valley Concert Band will be heard today in a concert in Saddle River Count Park's Wild Duck Pond Area on East Ridgewood Avenue.

title: THE GOOD EARTH... COLORS
description: The fall accessories harvest is earthy, indeed. Wood tones mingled with autumn rusts. Plastic mimicking nature. The glitter of gold, by itself or wedded to silver. And walking shoes with downtoearth heels. The clutch, is THE bag to clutch (for shoulder bag addicts, there are detachable straps). But if all this seems a bite trendy, to say nothing of earthy, remember that there's never been a season without classic accessories in every color, and this one is no exception.

title: U. A. W., in Choosing Chrysler as Its Target, Concentrates on Humanizing Assembly Lines
description: DETROIT, Aug. 25  It had been seen coming a long way off. And now, at last, here it was: The country's largest industrial union had challenged one of the Big Three automakers to humanize the assembly line and surrender a measure of control over its employes freedom. Or else.

title: MOSCOW STRESSES IDEOLOGICAL WAR
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 25  The EastWest war of ideas, in which the NixonBrezhnev summit meeting was little more than an interlude, is being waged with renewed vigor on several levels.

title: A Lot More Than a Ball Game
description: MOSCOWIsraeli athletes competing in the World University Games became the focus of political tensions here last week as Soviet spectators, in apparently inspired demonstrations, whistled and jeered while Moscow Jews rallied to the Israelis support.

title: College Degrees Facilitated At Adelphi
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I. Housewives eager to plan for future careers, midcareer executives seeking a college degree for upgrading purposes, and others will have an opportunity to earn a degree at Adelphi University here by attending classes just two mornings or evenings a week.

title: AROUND THE.
description: Plant evergreens, perennials and potted mums for quick fall color.... Continue weekly rose spray to control black spot.... Blackened spots on ends of tomatoes are caused by lack of lime/calcium in the soil and inadequate watering.... Cut faded flowers from annuals to prolong bloom.

title: Masseurs Hope New Law Aids Image
description: Professional masseurs, who use massage to soothe and relax other people, are themselves anxious these days about how the public views their profession.

title: Long Captures Amputee Event By Four Shots
Sands of Time Ebb for Battered Beaches
description: TRENTONThe state is trying to find more sand for its embattled beaches and more public beaches for millions of annual visitors.

title: Early Birds on Wheels Ride Through Queens
description: Bicycle riding through the streets of New York City can be an interesting, if not challenging, experience at any time during the day. At 4 A.M. on Sunday morning, it is fantasy come to life, as 225 enthusiasts discovered last week.

title: Carvel's Recipe for Success
description: The distinctive voice of Thomas Andrew Carvel coming from the radio stops many a listener in his tracks, and that may be its purpose.

title: Miss Mildred Sprow Bride of Gary Wilson
description: MENDHAM, N.J., Aug. 25Miss Mildred Elizabeth Sprow, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Howard T. Sprow of Morristown, was married here this afternoon to Gary Carleton Wilson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward W. Wilson of Hudson Falls, N.Y. The Rev. Dr. Vern A. Jensen performed the ceremony in the Hilltop Presbyterian Church.

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:
Aussie Cup Challenger Will Use American Methods
the traveler's world
description: WITH the dollar about as valuable in Europe as the Albanian lek, and the scandals running through Washington like hot gossip over a back fence, many Americans traveling abroad have taken to hiding their nationality. Some are now passing themselves off as nationals of another country, especially when traveling in confined circumstances, such as compartment in a European train.

title: Agnew
description: WASHINGTONAwash in a flood of publicity implicating him in political corruption in Maryland, Vice President Agnew struck out last week in the kind of frontal assault that has endeared him to conservative Republicans for years.

title: In Maplewood, Politics Is a Paradox
description: MAPLEWOOD  This affluent Essex County community of 26,000 people probably offers the state's major political paradox: The Republican party has been in control of municipal affairs here for as long as anyone can remember, and the Democratic opposition offers the strongest praise of the commissioners who run the government. As one Democratic leader put it: We'd like to get a couple of people elected just so we can have representation. But I don't think you'll find anyone in town who will condemn the way things have been done here and are being done.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LONDON, Aug. 25 (Reuters)A bomb scare failed disturb the West Indies drive toward victory against England in the third and final cricket test at Lords today. When play ended 30 minutes later than scheduled tonight, an extension to make up for 90 minutes lost as a result of the scare. England was at 42 for three wickets in its second innings after a firstinnings 419; The West Indies first innings was 652 for eight declared. The English still need 377 runs to avoid an innings defeat with two days remaining.

title: Carucci Captures Bay Sail
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I., Aug. 25Wally Carucci captured his third straight Lightning Class victory today as 207 yachts sailed with the Manhasset Bay Yacht Club in the penultimate round of its 41st annual Race Week.

title: After the Match: Waltz, Anyone?; A tennis court in a hotel ballroom?
description: That unusual setup will be part of the annual National Tennis Teachers Conference starting Wednesday at the Roosevelt Hotel here in conjunction with the United States Open championships.

title: Sadat Visiting Saudi Arabia
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug, 25 (UPI)  President Anwar elSadat of Egypt is visiting Saudi Arabia, the Iraqi news agency said today. It said Mr. Sadat arrived in Saudi Arabia yesterday for important talks with King Faisal.

title: Tuxedo Autumn Ball Returns To Social Calendar on Oct. 20
description: TUXEDO PARK, N.Y. Aug. 25The Tuxedo Autumn Ball, oldest and most prestigious debutante presentation in the New York area, is back on the social calendar after an absence of two years. Five young women will be introduced at the 82d event, scheduled for Oct. 20 at the Tuxedo Club, an improvement over 1970 when only three debutantes made their bows.

title: Ali Is Dancing on His Mountaintop
description: DEER LAKE, Pa., Aug. 25 When the National Broadpasting Company called to tape its Monitor interview, Muhammad Ali was ready and waiting.

title: Turkey Seizes Ton of Opium
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Aug. 25 (Reuters)  Turkish security forces seized 2,330 pounds of raw opium near the southern city of Adana, the police reported today.

title: Susan Larsen Wed To David Hydinger
description: NOROTON, Conn., Aug. 25 Miss Susan Larsen, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. E. F. Larsen of Stamford, was married at sunrise here this morning to David Hydinger, son of Mr. and Mrs. Rolland Hydinger, also of Stamford.

title: 7th Man Dies in Lodi Blast
description: HACKENSACK, N. J., Aug. 25 (UPI)The seventh victim of a chemicalplant explosion in Lodi on Aug. 14 died today at 3 P.M. at Hackensack Hospital, a hospital spokesman said. The victim was Walter Edmunds, 27 Nears old, of Passaic. The blast occurred at the Washine Chemical Corporation plant.

title: Top Tennis Players of World to Seek U.S. Titles in 12 Days of Forest Hills
description: The 12 Days of Forest Hills, otherwise known as the United States Open tennis championships, will begin Wednesday at the West Side Tennis Club's grass courts in Queens. By Twelfth Night, (Sept. 9) the winner of the men's singles tournament should be considered the genuine world champion for 1973.

title: In Cold Print: Bean, Cod and Book
description: A few years ago, the Kinney National Services conglomerate, which got its start in parking lots, office cleaning services and funeral parlors, decided to go into the leisuretime business. So they acquired Warner Brothers and Paperback library, among other leisuretime companies and commissioned a bright young alumnus of Random House, Bennett Sims, to find the most profitable way for Kinney Services to become a significant factor in... academic publishing within five years.

title: Is It Better to Be Shaft Than Uncle Tom?
description: BROUN: Mr. Bogle, as I understand It from reading your book, black actors do make more money now than in the past, but films have really just changed the ways in which they stereotype the black.

title: MRS. I. H. GOLDBERGER
description: Mrs. Minnie Snow Goldberger, widow of Dr. I. H. Goldberger, pediatrician and director emeritus of health education for the Board of Education, died Friday at the Jewish Home and Hospital for the Aged, 120 West 106th Street. Her age was 91.

title: British Win In Doubles, Trail by 31
description: BROOKLINR Mass Aug. 25 (UPI)  Britain kept its wightman Cup tennis hopes alive today, winning the doubles match as Virginia Wade and Glynis Coles defeated Chris ??? ma and Marita Redondo, 63, 26, 64, at the Longwood Cricket Club.

title: Agriculture Dept. Seeks to Turn St. Albans Naval Hospital Into Animal Quarantine Center
description: If the United States Department of Agriculture has its way, a regional center housing hundreds of quarantined horses, birds, cattle and other animals will be built on the site of St. Albans Naval Hospital in Queens, which the Navy is closing.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: The Morgan Guaranty Trust Company of New York has leased approximately 250,000 square feet of office space at 9 West 57th Street to house its trust and investment division.

title: Mrs. Harrison Has Son
description: A son was born Aug. 4 to Mr. and Mrs. Robert Harrison of East 79th Street at the LyingIn Hospital. Mrs. Harrison, the former Miss Helen Glynn of West Caldwell, N.J., is a professor of French at Bronx Community College. Mr. Harrison is an investment broker. The child has been named Zachary Michael.

title: Rebecca T. Chambless Bride of Surgeon
description: WINSTONSALEM, N. C., Aug. 25Miss Rebecca Till Chambless, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. John Henry Chunbless of Lexington, was married here this afternoon to Dr. John Edwin Scarff Jr., son of Dr. and Mrs. Scarff of Riverdale, the Bronx, New York, and Ocho Rios, Jamaica, W.I.

title: White Sox Beaten, 42, By Tigers
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 25 (AP)Jim Northrup's tworun single paced a threerun second inning today as the Detroit Tigers posted a 42 victory over the Chicago White Sox.

title: Babies on Parade At the Shore Today
description: ASBURY PARKThis resort city is reviving its oncefamous Baby Parade today. It was first held in 1890, but has not been staged since 1949, when a polio epidemic prompted many parents to withdraw their children.

title: Curb Sought on APlants Water Output
description: TRENTONFear that even. slight changes in the water temperature might cause serious damage to fish in the state's waterways has prompted proposals to require nuclear power plants to install expensive cooling equipment.

title: Recordings
description: THE chart success of Manu Dibango's Soul Makossa, and of Eumir Deodato's Theme from 2001, indicates a burgeoning interest in rhythmic subtlety among a sizeable portion of the American pop/jazz audience. Dibango's single has a repetitive, monochromatic surface; Deodato's FM hit is a shotgun marriage between Strauss's familiar fanfare and the equally familiar conventions of jazz/rock. But each record has a uniquely kinetic vitality which stands out amid the foursquare rhythmic sameness of much American AM and FM programming.

title: PETE STINCHCOMB, FOOTBALL STAR, 78
description: FINDLAY, Ohio, Aug. 25 (UPI)Gaylord R. (Pete) Stinchcomb, former Ohio State University football star, died last evening at Blanchard Valley Hospital. He was 78 years old and lived here.

title: Armstrong Is Considering Race For Full Term as Queens D.A.
description: Michael F. Armstrong, who is serving as interim District Attorney of Queens by appointment by Governor Rockefeller, is exploring the possibility of running for a full fouryear tenn as the candidate of the Liberal and Conservative parties.

title: GENETICISTS VOTE TO MEET IN SOVIET
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Aug. 25In a decision that marks the formal end of the long estrangement of Soviet biology from the mainstream of Western science, geneticists meeting here have voted to hold their next International Congress of Genetics in Moscow.

title: Cigarettes
description: Every pack of cigarettes since 1970 has carried the legend, Warning: The Surgeon General Has Determined That Cigarette Smoking Is Dangerous to Your Health. And cigarette commercials on television have been banned since Jan. 1, 1971. Nevertheless, cigarette sales continue to gain and new reports of health hazards accumulate.

title: LilacHill,$14, Triumphs at Liberty Bell
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 25 Lilac Hill raced to a twolength victory today in the fifth running of the $57,650 Cotillion Handicap at Liberty Bell Park.

title: Citizen Action
description: It was, perhaps, only the logical outgrowth of a trend that had been gathering momentum all summer. New Yorkers, famed for their indifference to neighbors in distress, haveoften at considerable personal riskbegun chasing muggers down the street, cornering purse snatchers until the police arrived, all on behalf of total strangers.

title: Music: Flutist Conducts
description: There can be little doubt that the Mostly Mozart Festival is Lincoln Center's most spectacularly successful invention. Plunked down in the month of August when, theoretically, public attention is turned to nonart pursuits out of doors, it has attracted nearcapacity audiences to Philharmonic Hall night after night for concerts of indisputably high musical content. The featured composers this year were Bach, Handel and Mozart, and it would be hard to fault them for quality.

title: Frank Randolph Lyon 3d Marries Natalie du Pont
description: FISHERS ISLAND, N. Y., Aug. 25The marriage of Miss Natalie Price du Pont to Frank Randolph Lyon 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Lyon Jr. of Rye, took place here this afternoon.

title: Camera World
description: The Fashion Institute of Technology, 227 West 27th Street, will conduct evening courses in the fundamentals of photography on Monday, Tuesday and Friday evenings, and on Saturday mornings. Each will meet for 15 sessions, and each will include instruction in studio and darkroom techniques, with models supplied. The tuition fee will be $43.50 for New York Sate residents, plus a registration fee, and registration will take place on the evenings of Sept. 5 and 6 from 6 to 8 P.M. For information phone (212) 2397647.

title: Teachers
description: WASHINGTONAn American Federation of Teachers insider was talking about the rift between David Selden, the union's president, and Albert Shanker, its first vice president and head of its powerful New York City local. Whatever else can be said about Dave, you've got to admit he has the goal of teacher unity at heart, the A.F.T. man said. And he won't allow anything to upset that.

title: Pamela Joan Weigl Is Married To Wayne R. Coulter, Lawyer
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Aug. 25ln the Second Congregational Church of Greenwich this afternoon, Miss Pamela Joan Weigl, daughter of Henry Weigl of Greenwich and the late Mrs. Weigl, the former Gladys Hines, became the bride of Wayne Ramsey Coulter. He is a son of Mrs. Henry B. Coulter of Dade City, Fla., and the late Florida State Senator Coulter.

title: JOSE DA COSTA
description: DARTMOUTH, Mass., Aug. 25 Jose da Costa, a senior member of the faculty of the New England Conservatory of Music in Boston since 1938, died yesterday at his home here. He was 75 years old.

title: FISHING MISHAPS KILLING DOLPHINS
description: LA JOLLA, Calif., Aug. 25Operators of the American tuna fleet told a Congressional panel here this week that, despite intensive efforts, they cannot meet the Government's deadline for halting the slaughter of porpoises accidentally trapped in their nets.

title: Auxiliary Policemen Win Dispute
description: The resignation of the 32member auxiliary police force of the 72d Police Precinct in South Brooklyn recently to protest the summary suspension of five auxiliary police officers on charges of drinking on duty brought to light similar problems at another Brooklyn police installation.

title: Desperate Hours
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25These are desperate hours for President Nixon. The gravest question ever raised concerning the personal integrity of an American President, the question of his personal involvement in a conspiracy to obstruct justice and in related crimes, casts a dark shadow across his path. Until that question is resolved one way or the other, he can hardly function as President. There can be no effective Presidential leadership when the majority of the people suspect the President may be guilty of felonies.

title: Rosewall to Teach Harlem Youngsters
description: If 150 Harlem youngsters suddenly develop a superb backhand, credit Ken Rosewall, one of Australia's greatest tennis players.

title: MY FAVORITE PERFUME
description: The sales personnel at most of the perfume counters know the regulars. They come in, some of them daily and others weekly, to sniff delicately and spray liberally. Sampling, they say.

title: Stamps
description: IN a restructuring and reorganization of significance to all collectors of American stamps, the United States Postal Service has consolidated all its activities involving stamps into a single department called the Stamps Department. The change does not affect overthecounter retail sales of stamps:

title: COURT IS URGED TO BAR KUNSTLER
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 25  The Government, the American Bar Association and a group of 21 lawyers from Indianapolis are ???ing a United States Appeals Court here to reverse a ruling it made in May ordering Federal District Court in Indiana to allow William M. Kunstler to represent a prisoner.

title: Orioles Top Royals, 71, For 12th Victory in Row
Bridge
description: It is second nature for those involved in intellectual activityphilosophers, mathematicians, historians and othersto fire questions at themselves. For the bridge expert this is absolutely vital during the play of the hand. He must ask himself not only the obvious questions about finesses and timing and endplays, but also less obvious ones.

title: Howard Says Energy Crisis Calls for New Mideast Policy
description: ASBURY PARKWe have a great reputation for handing out money and patting countries on the head, Representative James J. Howard observed last week. Well, we can't do that anymore. We've got to learn how to deal with rich countries, too.

title: The Ubiquitous Road Sign: American Art or American Mania?
description: Y CITY, Ark., Aug. 23There are six signs in this tiny community. Three proclaim the town's mysterious name, one is for a distant motel, another is illegible and the sixth is for McConnel's Gro. & Sta.

title: Computer Conks Out, Stops OTB
description: Frustrated horse players milled around the 112 branch offices of the city's Offtrack Betting Corporation for three hours yesterday as the result of a breakdown of the wagering computer system.

title: Tanya Thomas Wed in Vermont
description: GREENSBORO, Vt., Aug. 25  Miss Tanya Diane Thomas, daughter of the late Dr. and Mrs. John Atlee Light Thomas of Denver, was married here this afternoon to William Harmon Smith, son of Mrs. Audrey H. Smith of Woodstock and the late Harvey Linwood Smith Jr. of Richmond.

title: Earthquake Jars Aleutians
description: PALMER, Alaska, Aug. 26 (AP)An earthquake measuring 5.4 on the Richter scale occurred today about 120 miles southwest. of Adak Island in the Aleutians, the National Oceanic and Admospheric Administration reported, The quake occurred at 5:47 P.M. Eastern daylight time, according to the administration's observatory here. there were no immediate reports of damage.

title: 35Nation Study Seeking Cause of Tropical Storms
description: To seek out the causes of hurricanes, typhoons and the tropical heat engines that drive much of the world's weather, about 35 nations are engaged in the most elaborate and ambitious international scientific experiment ever undertaken.

title: Marcos Rival, Held In 72, Denounces Trial as Mockery
description: MANILA, Monday, Aug. 29Senator Benigno S. Aquino, looking pale anti considerably thinner after 11 months of military incarceration, announced dramatically at the start of his trial today that he would have no part of it because it is a mockery.

title: BRONX LEADS CITY IN HOUSING STUDY
description: The City Planning Commission reported yesterday that the Bronx accounted for just over half the 22,235 new apartments and homes completed here last year.

title: NUDE'S OUSTER NOT AIM, FOE SAYS
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 26The leader of the principal Opposition party here says that his group is not seeking to overthrow President Salvador Allende Gossens.

title: Bills Bow ToBears By 1310
AIR TRANSPORT UNIT PLANS OWN CURRENCY
35Nation Study Seeking Cause of Tropical Storms
description: To seek out the causes of hurricanes, typhoons and the tropical heat engines that drive much of the world's weather, about 35 nations are engaged in the most elaborate and ambitious international scientific experiment ever undertaken.

title: VIENTIANE SHRUGS AT ABORTIVE COUP
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Aug. 26 The curfew has been relaxed, and although soldiers in battle gear still guard officials houses, the little city of Vientiane has shrugged off last Monday's attempted coup d'etat in a spirit of nonchalance and selfdeprecating humor.

title: Books of The Times
description: People sometimes seem so domitable these days that it's heartening to read about instances of indomitability. Determination, resourcefulness, faith  meeting these oldfashioned qualities is rather like revisiting a small town where one grew up and finding it miraculously unchanged. There is a strong temptation to sentimentalize: where are the virtues of yesteryear? Perhaps they are intact but dormant, awaiting an unambiguous opportunity to roll up their sleeves and go to work.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The police will resume a full investigation today find out what caused the fire that resulted in the deaths of a Wall Street stockbroker and six members of his family without flames showing outside the family's $74,000 home in North Caldwell.

title: THREAT CASE FIGURE EXPLAINS HER SHIFT
description: NEW ORLEANS, Aug, 26 (UPI)The witness who said she heard Edwin Gaudet threatening the life of President Nixon but later refused to make an official identification of the former policeman has told the authorities that her conscience would not let me get up on a court stand and say for sure that Gaudet was the man.

title: Rallies Muted as Women End Suffrage Celebration
description: The 53d anniversary of women's suffrage passed in quiet, even discreet, observance yesterday.

title: Presidential Character
description: One of the most thoughtful political studies of recent years was The Presidential Character, by James David Barber of Duke University. The book argued that the performance of Presidents related significantly to their character patterns.

title: MANY VISIT CHINA FROM HONG KONG
description: While tens of thousands of Americans await Peking's response to their visa applications, large numbers of Hong Kong residents cross the border into China every daywithout passports or visasto see relatives, get medical treatment or just sightsee.

title: Carole Shulman Wed
description: GREAT NECK, L.L, Aug. 26Miss Carole Geraldine Shulman, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Irving Shulman of Bayonne and Bradley Beach, N.J., was married in Temple Israel of Great Neck this evening to David Alan Zwillenberg, son of Rabbi and Mrs. Herman Zwillenberg of New Rochelle, N.Y. The bridegroom's father performed the ceremony. The bride was graduated from New York University and is studying for a master's degree at the N.Y.U. Graduate School of Education. Her father is a urologist. Mr. Zwillenberg, a graduate of Yeshiva University, will enter the Medical College of Ohio at

title: WALDHEIM CALLS GLOBAL CONCORD NEVER SO URGENT
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 26  Secretary General Waldheim declared today in his annual message that the necessity for international cooperation has never been so great or so urgent.

title: Sandra Palmer Wins by Stroke
Slates Backed by Saigon Reportedly Sweep Senate Election
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, Aug. 27South Vietnamese voters went dutifully to the polls yesterday in largely predetermined Senate election that has given President Nguyen Van Thieu a firm grasp on the legislature at the expense of his dwindling legal opposition.

title: Weekly List of Mutual Funds
Red Smith
description: Nineteen hundred years ago the Emperor Nero won championships in the Olympic Games by bribery and intimidation, and when Roman kids of his day raced their toy chariots down the Capitoline Hill, some of them cheated. It was their example, most qualified students of history and human behavior agree, that led to the Soapbox Seendal of 1973 in which it was discovered that the winning car in the All American Soapbox Derby in Akron, Ohio, was illegally souped up. Winning isn't the most important thing, Nero said, tilting his laurel crown at a rakish angle, it's the only thing. When it's listed under w, said his disciple Leo Durocher, referring to the wonandlost columns in the league standings, nobody asks how it got there. He had different definition of being a good loser, Richard M. Nixon has said of his coach at Whittier College. He said: You know what a good loser is? It's somebody who hates to lose...."

title: Uneven Gains Deepen Pressures on Blacks
description: I see myself as two people, said 24yearold Patricia Joyce Anderson, who recently started work as a marketing analyst in the Chicago offices of Standard Oil. I came here to work and produce, so I have to establish a certain rapport to accomplish my job. That's one side of me. But outside I go back to a black community and my goal is in some way to help solve my people's problems. That's the other me.

title: PUERTO RICO FETE DRAWS THOUSANDS Speeches and Music Mark Central Park Event
description: The pulsing of drums resounded and the fragrance of sizzling, pungent foods wafted across Central Park yesterday as tens of thousands attended the Puerto Rican Folklore Festival in the Mall and Sheep Meadow.

title: U.S. Environmentalists End Study of Lake Baikal
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 26  A group of American environmental experts left here today after a study trip to pollutionthreatened Lake Baikal in Siberia, taking with them samples of the lake's water for analysis in United States laboratories.

title: Nutrition Is Now a National Controversy
description: Nutrition, once a subject relegated to gradeschool health classes, has emerged as a household word and become the subject of national concern and intense controversy.

title: Gen. Walter De Lamater Dies; Leader in the New York Guard
description: RHINEBECK, N.Y., Aug. 26 (AP)Walter Allen De Lamater, former commander of the 93d Brigade of the New York National Guard, died yesterday at his home here. He was 93 years, old.

title: Questions on Detente...
description: In his new post as Secretary of State, Henry A. Kissinger may find it necessary to take a fresh look at his conception of dtente with the Soviet Union. It envisions that increasing relations between American and Soviet citizens will build mutual trust, with benefits for both countries. From Moscoik's point of view, the anticipated fruits of dtente include massive transfers of American capital and technological knowhow to speed up Soviet development andinevitablythe growth of Soviet power.

title: HOWARD CALKINS, AD OFFICIAL DIES
description: YONKERS, Aug. 26Howard William Calkins, former chairman of Albert FrankGuenther Law, Inc., national advertising and public relations agency with headquarters in New York, died yesterday at his home, 81 Cayuga Road, Crestwood. His age was 71.

title: Mrs. Gandhi, Pakistanis Meet on Impasse in Talks
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 26Senior Pakistani officials met with Prime Minister Indira Gandhi tonight in a lastminute effort to break the political stalemate between India and Pakistan.

title: More Dirty Work
description: COLUMBUS, OhioThe revelation in recent days of clandestine crossborder operations by American ground troops in Cambodia, Laos and North Vietnam during the war reminds me once again that, somewhere in the United States, at least one Vietnam veteran has some important stories to tell.

title: Communication Satellite Ages
description: Ten years ago a communications satellite first took up a stationary post above the equator. Today a battery of these manmade intruders space carries television programs between continents every dayand already handies more international telephone traffic than undersea cables. Yet another one was launched from Cape Kennedy last Thursday.

title: Pros Dazzle to Make the Point: Stavin School
description: Julius Erving, known to every kid in Harlem as Dr. J, swooped toward the ceiling of the City College gymnasium, came down flying with the ball and loped down court toward the basket. In the crowd, a rising cheer began, like a wave gathering to break on a rocky shore.

title: Mini Branch Banks Offer NearMaxi Service
description: When two of the largest commercial banks in the country, First National City Bank of New York and Bankers Trust Company, take over storefronts in Brooklyn formerly occupied by outlets of the defunct chain of Ebinger Bakeries, it's a sign of a new phenomenon in bankingthe mini branch.

title: Invasion of Fleas Sets Rome Itching; Some Blame Cats
description: ROME, Aug. 26The Eternal City has been invaded by Gauls, Ostrogoths, Vandals, Saracens, Spaniards, Frenchmen, Nazi soldiers and American tourists. Now, yet another invasion is threateningby fleas.

title: West Side Rail Line Urged Instead of a New Highway
description: A rail transit line rather than an interstate highway should be built along Manhattan's Hudson shorefront to replace the dilapidated West Side Highway, according to Theodore W. Kheel, a persistent critic of transportation plans for the city.

title: A's Get Both Hits in 8th To Beat Stottlerhyre,10
description: OAKLAND, Aug. 26The divergent paths of the New York Yankees and Oakland A's followed their appointed courses today as a pinchsingle by Vic Davalillo, the second and last hit off Mel Stottlemyre, gave Oakland 10 victory and a sweep of the threegame series.

title: Curb That Taxicab
description: The Taxi and Limousine Commission has inched forward in trying to bring a safer, more comfortable taxicab to the streets of New York. Chairman Michael J. Lazar of the commission displayed the other day a prototype of the new vehicle scheduled to become standard by 1975. Smaller than a Checker taxicab, it offers utterly inadequate improvement over the cramped quarters too often given passengers today.

title: Riches a Lure To Dreamers
description: Arthur M. Louis, the 35. yearold Fortune magazine staff member who spent more than two months researching and writing The New Rich of the Seventies,

title: Soviet Terms Attacks at Games The Doing of Overzealous Fans
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 26The Soviet Union, evidently embarrassed by adverse publicity over the World University Games, today attributed incidents surrounding Israeli athletes to unruly fans of a type that could be found at any sports event.

title: Abducted Cyprus Aide Freed
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Aug. 26 (Reuters)The Cypriote Justice Minister, Christos Vakis, was freed tonight, a month after he was kidnapped by supporters of the underground leader, Gen. George Grivas, the Government announced.

title: African Rail Job Is Ahead
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Aug. 261 (UPI)A crew of Chinese engineers and laborers building the $500million Tanzam Railroad, Peking's most ambitious overseas project, reached the Zambian border today, two years ahead of schedule. The 1,000mile railroad cuts through East Afrika, linking the Tanzanian capital of Dar es Salaam with Zambia's rich copper belt.

title: Jersey Politicians Trials May Sway Governor Vote
Metropolitan Briefs
description: Theodore W. Kheel yesterday assailed the idea of building a new West Side Highway along Manhattan's Hudson shoreline and proposed instead that a rail transit line be built there.

title: Dibley, Miss Bonicelli Win Eastern Net Finals
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N.J.Aug. 26Colin Dibley of Australia, who possesses one of the games fastest serves, proved too strong for young Vijay Amritraj of India in the men's singles final of the $30,000 Eastern tennis open today at the Orange Lawn Tennis Club.

title: Greene, Akre Take Prizes In Manhasset Bay Sailing
Waldheim View of Issues
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 26Secretary General Waldheim in his annual report to United Nations members discussed a number of wideranging matters that will be taken up at the General Assembly session beginning Sept. 18:

title: Bridge: Confusion Over Blackwood Can Produce a Quandary
description: That most ancient of all riddleswhen is a door not a doorhas its bridge equivalent. Ajar is of course the answer, and that is what bridge experts get when they try to answer the question, When is a Blackwood not a Blackwood? The answer, of course, is, When it is natural, or unusual, or takecut, or an artificial response to Gerber.

title: SKYLAB CREW PASSES THE HALFWAY POINT
description: HOUSTON, Monday, Aug. 27 (AP)The Skylab 2 astronauts passed the halfway point of their planned 59day mission early today as the crew of the orbiting space station began its 4:10th trip around the earth.

title: Hugh Auchincloss Jr. Weds Laurie Glimcher
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Aug. 26Miss Laurie Hollis Glimcher, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Melvin Glimcher of Brookline and Menemsha, was married here this afternoon to Hugh Auchincloss Jr., son of Dr. and Mrs. Auchincloss of Ridgewood, N. J., and Manchester.

title: Let Everything Fall
description: On Sept, 1, the nation's most barbaric antidrug law goes into effect in New York State. An arrest for selling, sharing or possessing even an ounce of cocaine, heroin, morphine or opium could get you anywhere from fifteen years to life. Illegal sale or sharing of five milligrams of LSD could bring six years to life; one gram of any stimulant, one year to life; ten ounces of a dangerous depressant, one to fifteen years.

title: MAN FOUND SLAIN BY SWORD IN BRONX
description: A 22yearold psychotherapist, his hands bound, was found dead in his apartment in the Riverdale section of the Bronx yesterday with a long souvenir sword in his back.

title: Liddy as Teenager Was Intense and Tenacious
description: WEST CALDWELL, N.J., Aug. 26  It was spring of 1943, in the middle of World War II when patriotic fervor gripped small rural American towns like West Caldwell.

title: Street Action
description: Murders and other violence by New York City youth gangs contrast starkly with the vitality and talent being exhibited by street theater companiesmany from similarly deprived environmentsin the Lincoln Center Community Street Theater Festival.

title: Medical School Plans Project to Help Likely Victims of Coronary Disease
description: NEWARK, Aug. 26A research project aimed at helping people with certain risk factors that could lead to coronary disease will be undertaken by the College of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jersey Medical School, one of 20 clinical centers in the country doing research in preventive medicine.

title: Invasion of Fleas Sets Rome Itching; Some Blame Cats
description: ROME, Aug. 26The Eternal City has been invaded by Gauls, Ostrogoths, Vandals, Saracens, Spaniards, Frenchmen, Nazi soldiers and American tourists. Now, yet another invasion is threateningby fleas.

title: Carla Tyson Wed in Own Chapel
description: SPRINGDALE, Ark., Aug. 26 Don Tyson, chairman and chief executive officer of Tyson Foods, Inc., had chapel specially built in his garden for the marriage this evening of his 17year old daughter, Carla, to her high school classmate, Charles Howard, who is 18.

title: Miss Edelston Bride in Boston Of Robert Krim
description: BOSTON, Aug. 26Miss Jocelyn Edelston, daughter of Mrs. Henry Jacobs of New York and Towson, Md., and the late Joseph Edelston of Chicago, was married here this afternoon to Robert Krim, son of Mr. and Mrs. Norman Krim of Newton sohn performed the ceremony in his study. A reception was held at the Krim home.

title: AMEX TO INTRODUCE NEW INDEX SYSTEM
description: The American Stock Exchange announced over the weekend that on Sept. 4 it would Introduce a new index system that goes well beyond its present price change index.

title: Truck Is Overturned; Atomic Cargo Is Intact
description: BORDENTOWN, Aug., 26 (AP)A trailertruck carrying four containers of radioactive material crashed into a deadend barricade and turned over on Route 295 near here today.

title: American Way Wins For Atoms
description: The Philadelphia Atoms gave American soccer a shot in the leg Saturday night in Dallas by capturing the North American Soccer League title with a 20 victory over the Dallas Tornado before 18,824 paying fans.

title: HAROLD LEVIN, 73, OF Y.M.H.A, DEAD
description: Harold H. Levin, a partner in the law firm of Proskauer Rose Goetz & Mendelsohn and a past president and chairman of the 92d Street Young Men'sYoung Women's Hebrew Association, died, yesterday at his home, 138 East 78th Street. He was 73 years old.

title: Roundup: Brock, Morgan Set Records
description: Lou Brock and Little Joe Morgan, two of baseball's speed kings, stole and slugged their way into the major league record books yesterday during a Cincinnati's 41 victory over the St. Louis Cardinals.

title: State N.A.A.C.P. Lists Theme for Its Conference
description: Dr. Eugene Reed, president of the New York State National Association for the Advancement of Colored People, said yesterday that this year's 37th annual conference theme would he Survival 1974 hecause there is a real question, in the minds of many whether, concepts of freedom can survive another three years of the Nixon Administration.

title: LUCILLE CORCOS DIES; ILLUSTRATOR WAS 64
description: NEW CITY, N.Y., Aug. 26Lucille Corcos, a painter and illustrator, died of a heart attack yesterday in Good Samaritan Hospital in Suffern. She was 64 years old and lived here with her husband, Edgar Levy.

title: FREDERICK H. ROBINSON
description: STAFFORD, Va., Aug. 26Frederick H. Robinson, who retired in 1968 as board chairman of Panhandle Eastern Pipe Line Company, died yesterday at his home here. His age was 70.

title: Challenge of Genetics Fades for Scientists
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Aug. 26Genetics, the reigning queen of the life sciences for the last generation, seems to have her glitter. This was the impression that emerged as 2,700 specialists from all over the world prepared to head home this week after a major 10day congress of genetics here.

title: Deborah Greene Wed To John H Fulford 3d
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Aug. 26The marriage of Miss Deborah Greene to John Hultman Fulford 3d, son of Mrs. Fulford Jr. and the late Mr. Fulford, took place here this afternoon. Rabbi Edward D. Kiner performed the ceremony in the garden at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Robert B. Greene, parents of the bride.

title: Gustaf's Condition Worsens
description: STOCKHOLM, Aug. 27 (UPI)  King Gustaf VI Adolf of Sweden took turn for the worse today, and was reported in extremely critical condition. The 90yearold monarch's chief physician issued a bulletin tonight saying: The condition remains extremely critical. The King is bleeding and we have not been able to get the situation under control. His heart activity is strained and unstable. The kidneys have practically stopped functioning.

title: Black Group Says It Killed 2 Pushers In a War on Drugs
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 26An underground group calling itself Black October, which says it has killed two heroin dealers here, issued a public last warning this weekend that it would kill others.

title: JAMES M. MAGILL JR.
description: GREENVILLE, S. C., Aug. 261 James M. Magill Jr., son of Dr. J. Marion Magill of Greenville and New York, who is head of the music department at Teachers College, Columbia University, was killed in and automobile accident today in Lexington. He was 21 years old and a senior at the University of South Carolina and a page in the State Capitol at Co

title: Gail Erway Bride of R. A. Gerard
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Aug. 26Miss Gail Marie Erway, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Charles Eugene Erway 2d of Elmira, N. Y., was married here this afternoon to Richard Avery Gerard. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Philip Richard Gerard of Westport.

title: YearRound Music Season at Hand
description: It begins to read like bedroom farce. No sooner have we pushed the old music out the back door than a new season is knocking at the front door.

title: HAK Meets SSK
description: WASHINGTON  A tape recording of SCHLSSM1, the supersecret initial meeting between Secretary of State Kissinger (hereinafter known as SSK) and the national security adviser to the President, Henry A. Kissinger (already known as HAK), has been made available to the 17 interested parties.

title: Environmentalists Join Truckers in Opposing Gateway Routes as Wasteful
description: I Environmentalists, who often find themselves opposing trucking firms on pollution issues, have joined forces with some truckers to oppose Interstate Commerce Commission regulations that one environmental group contends are wasting hundreds of thousands of gallons of fuel a day, contributing tons of pollutants to urban areas and adding needless costs for the consumer.

title: Grocer Is Slain by Who Followed Him After Robbing Store
description: A 34yearold Brooklyn gm cer was slain early yesterday outside his home in the Bush, wick section by two gunmer on whom he had opened fire a short time earlier when they robbed him of $500 outside hit store nearby, according to the police.

title: Advertising: Film Theatre Debut
description: The American Film Theatre, a new effort to create a national theater on film, gets under way this fall after two years of planning. Beginning next month, the big advertising push for this unique project will also get under way.

title: U.S. Aids Development Of New AShip Engine
description: An effort is under way to develop a secondgeneration nuclear ship power plant that can compete economically with fossilfuelled ship engines.

title: Ky Hurt in Accident
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 26 (UPI)Nguyen Cao Ky, the former South Vietnamese Vice President, suffered deep cuts and was hospitalized Friday when a ladder fell on his head, friends said today. They said the accident had occurred while he was working on his farm, outside Saigon. He returned to his home in Saigon today.

title: About the Yankees:
description: In three games at Oakland, the Yankees scored one run and they go to Anaheim with a string of 22 straight scoreless innings... In the process, they wasted three complete games by their own pitchers.. Mel Stottlemyre has not won a game in nine starts since July 13, Sam McDowell hasn't won in six starts since July 20, Fritz Peterson hasn't won in four starts since July 22 and Pat Dobson has won only once since the AllStar break... The Yankees wound up their season's business against Oakland with a 48 wonlost mark and are now 2441 on the road this year.

title: Pulse of City Beats Languorously on the Final Sunday in August
description: On the last lazy Sunday in August, downtown New York looked like a city asleep.

title: Donohue Is Victor In CanAm
description: ELKHART LAKE, Wis., Aug. 26Captain Cool, also known as Mark Donohue, succeeded in making 95degree heat seem comfortable today as he breezed away with the Road America CanAm.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I have read with interest the press recent attempts to understand the increasing number of suicides in the New York City prison system. There can be no simple answer to this problem, for each suicide seems to point to a different problem within the prisons, the courts, the hospital prison wards or at times the very structure of our society.

title: Ailing Runaway. 17, Returns On Promise She Can Wed
description: KOKOMO, Ind Aug. 26 (UPI)A runaway teenaged girl with a serious blood ailment was on the way home with her boyfriend today, with a promise !that their parents would no longer object to their marriage.

title: U.S. KNEW OF FEUD OF CAMBODIA REDS
description: Secretary of Defense James R. Schlesinger said yesterday that the United States had received periodic reports of fighting between North Vietnamese troops and Cambodian Communist forces.

title: Spain Accused of Torturing Jailed Opponents Regularly
description: LONDON, Aug. 26 (AP)Amnesty International charged today that Spanish authorities use widespread, regular and virtually unrestricted torture tactics on imprisoned opponents of the Government.

title: A John V. Lindsay Assn. Was Circulating Petitions for Beame
description: A curious sidelight of this year's campaign for Mayor emerged in Mayor Lindsay's office last week shortly after the Mayor swore in trustees for the Queens Borough Public Library.

title: WALDHEIM CALLS GLOBAL CONCORD NEVER SO URGENT
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 26  Secretary General Waldheim declared today in his annual message that the necessity for international cooperation has never been so great or so urgent.

title: A Friend Reports Mrs. Mitchell Plans To Ask Separation
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26 (Reuters)Mrs. Martha Mitchell, the wife of former Attorney General John N. Mitchell, has told a friend that she plans to leave her husband and has retained a lawyer to advise her on a separation.

title: RIGHTIST IS SEIZED IN CHILE TERRORISM
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 26The Chilean police announced the arrest today of a leader of a rightwing extremist group held responsible for much of the terrorism and sabotage here in the last month.

title: $4 Wheat a Mixed Blessing to Farmers
description: LIMON, Colo., Aug. 26Year after year it had been a bitter, losing struggle against wind, hail and overdue bank notes. Family after family gave up and moved out, turning the high, rolling plains of eastern Colorado into a vast and eerie cemetery of abandoned homesteads, rotting houses, brokendown barns and creaky windmills.

title: Phnom Penh Reports Supply Roads Cut; Mekong River Is Now City's Lifeline
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia,, Aug. 26The Phnom Penh. military command reported today that Communist forces had cut both of the capital's overland supply routes and that the lull that followed the cessation of American bombing in Cambodia on Aug. 15 was apparently over.

title: Nixon Honoys Johnson
description: STONEWALL, Tex. Aug. 26 (AP)  A black wreath from President Nixon was placed on the grave of Lyndon B. Johnson during memorial ceremonies today. Tomorrow is the 65th anniversary of the former President's birth and the wreathlaying ceremony was the first of a series of events honoring ?? He died in January.

title: American Airlines to Halt Ads Held to Be Misleading
description: American Airlines has agreed to discontinue advertisements found misleading by the State Attorney General. The airline, while not admitting any viola. firm of law, paid the state $1,000 in costs.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: FICTION

title: Death Toll Reported at 2,300 As Pakistani Flooding Spreads
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Aug. 26 The death toll in the Pakistani floods was reported today to be more than 2,300 as the swollen Indus River coursed southward through heavily populated districts.

title: U.S. Arms Sales to Iran Worrying India
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 26India, worried about American arms sales to Iran, has begun a major reassessment of her powerful armed forces.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Inmates at the Federal House of Detention in lower Manhattan presented a list of grievances last night about food, medical care and other aspects of their treatment. Submission of the list to the duty officer, Lieut. James Baucom, followed two days in which many of the 470 men in the institution boycotted the mess hall in protest.

title: Iroquois Smoke Signals To Mark Fair's Opening
description: SYRACUSE, Aug. 26 (AP) Smoke signals sent aloft by members of the Iroquois Indian Confederacy will mark the opening Tuesday of the weeklong, 126th New York State Fair.

title: Salvos of Erotic Songs Traded In Friendly Exchange of Ribs
description: UPPER SALFORD TOWNSHIP, Pa., Aug. 26 Several years ago the Philadelphia Folk Festival scheduled a workshop on bawdy songs that turned out disastrously when the participants chose to focus on blunt banality rather than on wit and imagination.

title: HIGHER EDUCATION LAGGING IN CHINA
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 26Since the Cultural Revolution China has made tremendous strides toward universal education up to the junior high school level, but in higher education development has been hampered by controversy and uncertainty.

title: Benefit Tied to Visa Cost
description: SUFFERN, N.Y., Aug. 26Fifty couples paid $1,100 each said to be the cost of an exit visa for a Soviet Jewto hear Senator Edmund S. Muskie speak at a cocktail party here today sponsored by the Rockland County chapter of the United Jewish Appeal.

title: Personal Finance: Disposing of Assets Before Death
description: It is axiomatic that estate planning begins with the living. It also often involves giving, while living.

title: A Health Food Store Owner With Theories of His Own
description: DETROIT  People come to Harry Zerbo, a 36yearold former chinchilla raiser who runs a health food store here, for the foot treatment he says is the key to better health.

title: U.S. Takes Wightman Tennis, 52
description: BROOKLINE, Mass., Aug. 26 (UPI)The United States retained the Wightman Cup today with Chris Evert gaining the decisive point in the sevenmatch BritishAmerican tennis series for women.

title: CHARLIE MONROE PLAYS BLUEGRASS
description: Part of a bluegrass legend came to New York on Thursday: Charlie Monroe, older brother and onetime partner of Bill Monroe, who is widely acclaimed as the father of bluegrass.

title: New Orders Climbed 80% From July, 72 For Machine Tools
description: Despite a normal midsummer slackeningin comparison, with earlier months of the yearorders and shipments of machine tools in July were substantially higher than in July last year, according to the monthly report of the National Machine Tool Builders Association.

title: Soviet Says China Seeks Nuclear Superpower Role
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 26The Soviet Union raised its public attacks against China to a new level of hostility today by charging that Peking was intent on becoming a new nuclear superpower aiming at domination over Asia.

title: SENATE WILL GET POLLUTION STUDY
description: A scientific review of the impact of air pollution by automobiles on human health, ordered by the United States Senate, has begun.

title: Screen: A Dying Athlete
Models Who Are So Alike Even Their Children Have Trouble Telling Them Apart
description: During the spate of fall fashion openings on Seventh Avenue, a pretty blond model showed up so often on the runways that some members of the audience thought they were seeing double. They were.

title: STATE RELIEF ROLLS SHOW RECORD DROP
description: Governor Rockefeller said yesterday that the state's hopes for a downward trend in welfare rolls had been confirmed by the figures for the April through June quarter, which showed a record decrease of 59.397 persons.

title: Marchi Calls for City Assistance In Rehabilitating Neighborhoods
description: Before the heavy blade of the bulldozer becomes the only answer, the city should help property owners rehabilitate their neighborhoods, State Senator John J. Marchi of Staten Island said yesterday.

title: AGNEW WITNESS GOT LIE TEST, TIME SAYS.
description: Time magazine said yesterday that a key witness against Vice President. Agnew in an investigation of an alleged kickback scandal had taken a lie detector test. Time said the test had shown that the witness, Jerome Wolff, told the truth about delivering funds extorted from contractors to Agnew.

title: Merril Gersten Is Wed
description: At Congregation Kehilath Jeshurun here last evening, Miss Merril Joy Gersten, a student at the Cornell University Medical College, was married to Noah Ezra Rockowitz, a June graduate of the Fordham University Law School, by Rabbi Haskell Lookstein. The parents of the couple are Mr. and Mrs. Richard Gersten of Jamaica Estates, Queens, and Dr. and Mrs. Murray Rockowitz of Flushing, Queens. The bridegroom's father is chairman of the Board of Examiners of the New York City Board of Education.

title: Schroeder Takes MatchPlay Final
Deadly Cobra Still at Large
description: BUFFALO GROVE, III., Aug. 26 (AP)  The authorities resumed their search today for a deadly Egyptian cobra that escaped from an aquarium in a garage. Parents in this suburb northwest of Chicago were urged to supervise the outdoor play of their children until the fivefoot snake is found.

title: Rogers to Rejoin Gannett
description: William P. Rogers, whose resignation as Secretary of State was announced last week, will rejoin the board of directors of the Gannett Company, Inc., communications company with headquarters in Rochester, on Sept. 3, Gannett said yesterday.

title: $4 Wheat a Mixed Blessing to Farmers
description: LIMON, Colo., Aug. 26Year after year it. had been a bitter, losing struggle against wind, hail and overdue hank notes. Family after family gave up and moved out, turning the high, rolling plains of eastern Colorado into a vast and eerie cemetery of abandoned homesteads, rotting houses, brokendown barns and creaky windmills.

title: ... Chauvinistic Sports
description: International athletic competition, though often hailed as a means of fostering amity among nations, has a long history of doing exactly the opposite. Perverted by the intense nationalism of ceremonial flags and anthems, the Olympic spirit tends to give way to individual and group chauvinism.

title: Raise's Condition Good
description: GALVESTON, Tex., Aug. 26 (UPI)A former Apollo astronaut, Fred Haise Jr., recovering from a crash of a light plane last week, walked about his hospital room for brief periods today and doctors said his condition was good.

title: BOMB IN ULSTER DAMAGES CHURCH
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland Aug. 26A man and three girls were injured today whet a bomb exploded in an auto mobile near a packed Romar Catholic church.

title: America's New SuperRich Men: Fortunes Founded on the Prosaic
NEW 73 HIGHS SEEN IN INTEREST RATES
VIENTIANE SHRUGS AT ABORTIVE COUP
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Aug. 26 The curfew has been relaxed, and although soldiers in battle gear still guard officials houses, the little city of Vientiane has shrugged off last.\Monday's attempted coup d'etat in a spirit of nonchalance and selfdeprecating humor.

title: Okker Wins 3Set Final At Toronto
description: TORONTO, Aug. 26 (Reuters) Tom Okker of the Netherlands defeated Manuel Orantes of Spain, 6.3, 62, 61, today in the final of the $100,000 Canadian open tennis tournament.

description: Following are some of the highlights of the 197374 music season:

title: Soviet Says China Seeks Nuclear Superpower Role
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 26The Soviet Union raised its public attacks against China to a new level of hostility today by charging that Peking was intent on becoming a new nuclear superpower aiming at domination over Asia.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: DU QUOIN, III., Aug. 26 (AP)Sixteen of the nation's best 3yearold trotters were entered today in the richest Hambletonian stake in the 48year history of the classic.

title: Dr. Francis L. Childs. 88, Of Dartmouth Is Dead
description: HANOVER, N.H., Aug. 26Dr. Francis Lane Childs, who retired in 1954 as Winkley Professor of AngloSaxon and English Language and Literature at Dartmouth College, died today. He was 88 years old and lived here.

title: Liddy Is Recalled As Youth in Jersey
description: WEST CALDWELL, Aug. 26It was spring of 1943, in the middle of World War II, when patriotic fervor gripped small rural American towns like West Caldwell.

title: THOMAS F. WAGHORN
description: Thomas Frederick Waghorn, purchasing agent for Boaz Allen & Hamilton, Inc., management consultants, died Saturday in Astoria General Hospital in Queens. He lived at 3115 21st Avenue, Long Island City, Queens.

description: That most ancient of all riddleswhen is a door not a doorhas its bridge equivalent. Ajar is of course the answer, and that is what bridge experts get when they try to answer the question, When is a Blackwood not a Blackwood? The answer, of course, is, When it is natural, or unusual, or takeout, or an artificial response to Gerber.

title: CHRYSLER WORKERS AUTHORIZE STRIKE
description: DETROIT, Aug. 26 (AP)More than 90 per cent of the Chrysler Corporation employes represented by the United Automobile Workers have voted to authorize a strike, the union said today. The vote today is routine and gives little indication of whether a strike is likely.

title: 3 ARE HOSPITALIZED AFTER BRONX BLAZE
