description: A stubborn, twoalarm fire in a sixstory Bronx apartment house yesterday afternoon sent three persons, including 2monthold twins, to the hospital and felled 14 firemen, who suffered smoke inhalation and heat exhaustion.

title: Cedarhurst Polo Victor
description: BETHPAGE, L. I., Aug. 26  Charles Bostwick, Curt Rosche and G. H. (Pete) Bostwick each scored two goals to lead the Cedarhurst nolo team to a 6.4 victory over Brookville today. Alan Corey 3d scored all the Brookville goals.

title: John R. MacGregor Weds Linda Dalton
description: BROOKVILLE, L.I., Aug. 26The marriage of Miss Linda Sue Dalton to John Russell MacGregor, son of Mr. and Mrs. Woodrow MacGregor of Holden, Mass., took place here this afternoon. Cantor David Bendict performed the ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Philip B. Dalton, parents of the bride.

title: Nutrition Is Now a National Controversy
description: Nutrition, once a subject relegated to gradeschool health classes, has emerged as a household word and become the subject of national concern and intense controversy.

title: OIL IMPORT CURBS URGED BY SENATOR
description: DENVER, Aug. 26Senator Peter H. Dominick, a member of the Armed Services Committee and the Joint Committee on Atomic Energy, called on the Administration today to undertake at once a program for the maximum development of energy resources to reduce dependence on overseas oil supplies, particularly those in the Middle East.

title: Pope Denounces Film On the Loves of Jesus
description: CASTELGANDOLFO, Italy, Aug. 26Pope Paul VI today denounced a film, The Loves of Jesus Christ, that is to be produced in Denmark, as an 'ignoble and blasphemous outrage.

title: Mayor Rizzo of Philadelphia, Beset by Growing Problems and Disputes, Finds Himself at a Crisis Point
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 26Mayor Frank L. Rizzo, the self styled toughest cop in Ame ica who took office 18 months ago and quickly established reputation rivaling that of Chi cago's Mayor Daley as the most powerful bigcity mayor in the country, now finds himself at a crisis point in his short but flamboyant political career.

title: American Team Crosses Today Into East Berlin for Negotiations
description: BERLIN, Aug. 26  A United States State Department team is scheduled to cross the border wall to East Berlin tomorrow in a move marking a further approach toward normalization in Central Europe.

title: Brooks, Reiner Revive 2,000YearOld Man, Now 2,013
description: BURBANK, Calif., Aug. 26Despite severe cases of nervous tension, Carl Reiner and Mel Brooks brought to life their classic comic character, the 2,000yearold man, for the first time in 10 years last night.

title: Alison Cohen Married to Donald Abelson
description: BRONXVILLE, N.Y., Aug. 26Miss Alison Rose Cohen, daughter of Dean and Mrs. Henry Cohen of New York, and Gay Head, Mass., was married here this afternoon

title: All Major Fires in West Reported Under Control
description: All 52 major fires that blackened 195,000 acres of rangelands and forests in the West were extinguished or under control yesterday, The Associated Press reported,

title: PrimeRate Rises Stir Varied Views
description: This morning at 7:30 or little later, a handful of top executives of the First National Bank of Chicago met for about a half hour to discuss what the prime rate should be. The prime is the interest rate charged by commercial banks on loans to their best customers.

title: A Conflict of Cultures Marks Veterans'
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Aug. 26The blue van with New Jersey plates pulls up to the steps of the Federal Building shortly before 9:30 in the morning and out springs an astonishing number of lawyers, defendants and legal assistants carrying file cases and cardboard boxes filled with papers.

title: International Driver Wins In U.S., Loses in Canada
GOING OUT Guide
description: GOLDEN MEADOW One of the largest and loveliest of the city's parks is Flushing MeadowCorona Park, a great expanse of green divided by a series of long arboreal walks, far too good to leave to Queensfolk alone. It belongs to everybody, but it is often underused, which gives its sweeping lawns some of the look of a vast private manor.

title: Presidency Under Law
description: The court arguments in Washington last week over the availability of the disputed Presidential tapes for use the Watergate criminal proceedings have put this crucial issue into sharp focus.

title: H.E.W. Chief in Poland
description: WARSAW, Aug. 26 (UPI) The United States Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, Caspar W. Weinberger, arrived today for a fiveday visit to Poland at the invitation.of the Polish Health Minister, Marian Sliwinski. Mr. Weinberger was to hold talks on PolishAmer: ican cooperation in the medical field.

title: Mysterious Blight Decimates Peach Crop in the Hudson Valley
description: HIGHLAND, N. Y., Aug. 26  New York's peach crop is being decimated by X disease.

title: Boy Dies in Bronx Plunge; Mother Held for Homicide
description: A 23yearold Bronx woman was charged yesterday with homicide in the death of her 6yearold son, who had been thrown off the roof of 1541 Shakespeare Avenue in the Morrisania section, the police said,

title: CITY HARDENS RULES ON PRESCRIBED DRUGS
description: Nineteen prescription drugs; that present acute problems of abuse will be brought under strict New York City regulation, Dr. Joseph A. Cimino, the health commissioner, said yesterday. dates on which such substance might be sold in the city only through nonrefillable prescriptions, with 30day maximum, supplies and no oral prescrip;dons in emergencies.

title: Asbury Park Revives Its Baby Parade
Police in Stockholm Drill Hole In Bank Vault to Reach Gunman
description: STOCKHOLM, Monday, Aug. 27 (AP)The police said last night that they had drilled small hole through the bank vault where a gunman Alas been locked up with four hostages and a convicted murderer since Saturday morning.

title: Libyan in Cairo Unexpectedly, Apparently on Union
description: CAIRO, Aug. 26  Col. Muammar elQaddafi, the Libyan leader, flew here at midnight yesterday in an apparent effort to apply pressure to reluctant Egypt for lastminute acceptance of his plans for a union between the two countries.

title: Leslie Jones Is Bride Of Michael P. DeStio
description: ROSLYN, LI., Aug. 26In St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church here this afternoon, Miss Leslie Jones was married to Michael P. DeStio, a graduate student at C. W. Post College, from which he received a B.S. degree last year. The Rev. Thomas Minogue performed the ceremony.

title: Howfield Is Kicking Himself for the Jets'
Mets Foiled
City's Pulse Is Languorous On Final Sunday in August
description: On the last lazy Sunday August, downtown New York looked like a city asleep.

title: Uneven Gains Deepen Pressures on Blacks
Carling Is Brewing Profit From New Tuborg Beer
description: The old question of What's in a name? can be answered by the Carling Brewing Company with one word: Profits.

title: Pros Dazzle to Make the Point: Stayin School
description: Julius Erving, known to every kid in Harlem as Dr. J, swooped toward the ceiling of the City College gymnasium, came down flying with the ball and loped down court toward the basket. In the crowd, a rising cheer began, like a wave gathering to break on a rocky shore.

title: In Vietnam, the Queen Mother Clings to a Faded Court Life
description: HUE, South VietnamAlmost 50 years after the reign of South Vietnam's last truly traditional Emperor, Khai Dinh, his queen and his chief concubines are still playing cards together and acting out a defunct court life.

title: Business Briefs
description: The Cerro Corporation announced yesterday that will build a $75million copper smelter refinery complex on a 1,500acre site on the Arkansas River at Pine Bluff, Ark. Construction is expected to start in late 1974, pending completion of financing.

title: GENERAL MILLS SET TO REDEEM SHARES
description: General Mills, Inc., announced yesterday that it would redeem $1.75 cumulative convertible preference stock on Sept. 28 with the payment of $63.4375 a share.

title: Tennis Weathers One Eligibility Crisis Over U.S. Open but Another Is Brewing
description: Organized tennis appears to have averted another political storm on the eve of its richest event, the United States Open championships.

title: MRS. JOHN PIEROTTI
description: Mrs. Helen Mastrangelo Pierotti, wife of John Pierotti, cartoonist for The New York Post, died yesterday in Brooklyn Methodist Hospital. She was 61 years old and lived at 72 Bay 25th Street in Brooklyn.

title: Crampton Leads
description: Bruce Crampton continued yesterday to lead the golf moneywinners list with $273,351, despite missing the United States professional matchplay tournament over the weekend.

title: Trees Grow on Money
description: More trees than ever are to be chopped down in this country's national forests while fewer people are to enjoy camping, swimming and hiking in these lands which Congress long ago decreed were to be balanced in their four great usestimber production, recreation, wildlife protection and watershed control. John R. McGuire, Chief of the Forest Service, concedes that these uses have been out of balance for some time, thanks to prolonged emphasis on timber production, but the imbalance is now to be seriously aggravated by the Administration's order for an additional forest yield.

title: Organically Grown Foods: Some Fall Short in Nutrition
description: It is generally recognized that vast gaps still exist in the scientific understanding of human nutrition. But while a great deal has yet to be learned, enough is already known to answer many of the questions now being asked.

title: SADAT BACK HOME AFTER ARAB TALKS
description: CAIRO, Aug. 27President Anwar elSadat returned today from a fiveday visit to Saudi Arabia, Qatar and Syria in which he sought to tighten his relations with the oilproducing countries of the Persian Gulf and to mobilize Arab oil wealth against Israei.

title: Skydiver Death Investigated
description: TAFT, Calif., Aug, 27 (AP)A 20yearold skydiver from Los Angeles fell 6,000 feet to his death after a collision broke up a group of skydivers trying to.form a star. The authorities said today that they were attempting to determine if Terry Roberts Johnson lost consciousness after another diver crashed into him, They said Mr. Johnson never opened his parachute although investigators at the scene said his gear was in working order,

title: MRS. WALTER JOHNSON
description: Mrs. Isabelle McWilliams Johnson, widow of Walter Lathrop Johnson, a past vice president of the New York Stock Exchange, died Saturday at her home, 175 Holbrook Lane, Briarcliff Manor, N.Y. She was 86 years old.

title: BENJAMIN RACHLIN
description: BELMAR, N.J., Aug. 27 Benjamin Rachlin, who retired in 1951 as head of the Franklin Lumber Company of Newark and later engaged in the real estate business there, died yesterday at his home. His age was 78.

title: Marcos Rival, on Trial, Refuses Defense
description: MANILA, Aug. 27A former Philippine Senator who led the opposition against President. Ferdinand E. Marcos before being jailed 11 months ago went before a military tribunal today and refused to defend himself against charges of subversion.

title: Likely F.C.C. Nominee Stirs Dispute
BENDIX Will BUY AUTOLITE PLANT
description: The Ford Motor Company agreed yesterday to sell its Autolite Spark Plug plant at Fostoria, Ohio, and the Autolite trademark, to the Bendix Corporation for abdut $29million.

title: HOMOSEXUAL NINE LOSES TO POLICE
description: A softball team sponsored by the New York Mattachine Society and composed of men and women from the homosexual community was defeated badly by the police from the Sixth Precinct last night"about 15 to 0, most players agreed. Both teams also agreed that the confrontation on the playing field of the Leroy Street Park was a lot of fun.

title: Roundup: Orioles Defeat Rangers, Run String to 14
description: The Orioles extended their winning streak to 14 games, the longest in the major leagues since 1966, by defeating the Texas Rangers, 61, last night in Baltimore Memorial Stadium.

title: HOLDING COMPANY OF AIRLINE BACKED
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (AP)  A Civil Aeronautics Board judge ruled today that airlines should be allowed to reorganize under holding companies if they agree to meet certain requirements.

title: REBOZO IDENTIFIED AS HELPING NIXON TO BUY COAST LAND
description: LAGUNA BEACH, Calif., Aug. 27The White House today identified C. G. Rebozo, a close friend of President Nixon, as one of two financial backers in the President's real estate purchases in San Clemente, Calif.

title: U. S. Isn't Only Country With Soaring Food Prices It's a Worldwide Trend
description: Mrs. Anneliese Faber lives in Bonn, West Germany, and says that her family has had to change its eating habits because of higher food prices, turning to more fish and eggs.

title: Two Newspapers Merge
description: FITCHBURG, Mass., Aug. 27 (AP)The Leominster Enterprise and Fitchburg Sentinel newspapers have merged and will be published as The Daily Sentinel and Leominster Enterprise, effective Sept. 4, it was announced today.

title: U.S. Envoy to Saudi Arabia
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Aug. 27 (Iteuters)President Nixon today nominated James E. Akins, a career diplomat, as Ambassador In Saudi Arabia. Mr, Akins hag been director of the State Department's Office of Fuels and Energy since 1969. He will succeed Nicholas G. Rachel., Ambassador In Saudi Arabia since 1970.

title: Prime Rate 9%
description: Several major banks raised their prime rate yesterday to 9 per cent, a new high, from 9 per cent. The Chase Manhattan Bank began the move. This appears to be the start of the fifth general rise in five weeks in the prime rate, the interest that commercial banks charge on loans to their most creditworthy corporate customers. Bankers said that strong demand for loans showed no sign of letting up. Also, shortterm interest rates in the money market continue to move upward. Page 45.

title: Court Backs Meadowland Parking Lot Despite Protest
description: NEWARK, Aug. 27A group of environmentalists lost in Federal Court today a suit to bar the construction of a 25,000car parking lot for the New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority in the Hackensack Meadows at, Hudson County.

title: Events in Street Theater Festival
description: Here is a schedule of the events for today through Sunday, the final day, at the Lincoln Center Community/ Street Theater Festival:

title: Civilians Begin Directing Traffic on City Streets
description: Twentyfive civilian traffic control agents took up posts at midtown intersections yesterday to contend with problems ranging from a huge streetblocking crane to butterflies in the stomach.

title: RUTH F. M'CLENNIN
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Aug, 271  Ruth Freeman McClennin, retired New York real estate broker, died Saturday at a loeal convalescent home. She was 82 years old.

title: Finnish Credit Quotas Up
description: HELSINKI, Finland Aug. 27 (UPI)The Bank of Finland told commercial banks today, their credit quotas would be raised by onequarter, but the bank said it would enforce the new limits strictly. Finnish commercial banks presently, have credit availability from the central bank of $290million and the bank will raise that from the beginning of, September to $370million.

title: Heating Oil a Problem
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 27 (AP) Availability of crude oil, boa domestic and foreign, is the biggest question mark in this winter's heating oil supply pie. ture, an industry spokesman said today. Charles L. Towers, a Shell Oil Company vice president, said the industry was concerned about beating oil supplies.

title: LowEnd Justice
description: The bill calling for a longoverdue increase in the Federal minimum wage went to President Nixon yesterday, after a threeweek delay designed to rule out the danger of a pocket veto while Congress was in summer recess. For a President committed to the work ethic, approval of the measure is a necessary measure of economic justice to the working poor.

title: IOLUME ON AMEX TITS A 7YEAR LOW
Beame Bids Council Back Lindsay Veto On New Districting
description: City Controller Abraham D. Beame urged the City Council last night not to override Mayor Lindsay's veto of its latest reapportionment plan when it meets to vote on the matter today.

title: LAWYER IN ONE CASE INDICTED IN ANOTHER
description: A lawyer representing Howard Z. Fuchsalleged head of la narcotics ring said to involve welleducated young peoplewas indicted in the Bronx yesterday on charges of submitting false documents to the State Liquor Authority.

title: New Busing Plan Starts Peacefully In Memphis Area
description: MEMPHIS, Aug. 27  One of the South's largest public school systems opened quietly and peacefully with courtordered busing today but more than 13,1 000 students were missing.

title: OffSeason Drills Pay Off As Gogolak Kicks 8 of 9
description: It's the best game I ever have as a Giant, Pete Gogolak said yesterday, reflecting on his five field goals that helped the New Yorkers register a 2924 exhibition victory over the Steelers on Sunday.

title: Seeley Outpoints Santiago at Forum
description: Walter Seeley of Sayville, L. I., won a unanimous decision from Eduardo Santiago of Puerto Rico last night in a 10round featherweight match at Madison Square Garden's Felt Forum.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: McAFEE, Aug. 27Many motorists who pass the Arts Center on the Garden State Parkway think of the center primarily as the home of nighttime entertainment. But the center is very much alive during the daylight hours these summer days.

title: Text of Letter From Auditors to President on Acquisition of His Properties
Reporter Is Termed a Spy in McGovern Camp
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (UPI) Seymour Freidin, who is now head of the Hearst newspaper chain's London bureau, was hired by a top political aide to President Nixon to spy on Senator George McGovern's Presidential campaign last year, according to Jack Anderson and Les Whitten, the columnists.

title: Riggs 52 Favorite
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Aug. 27 (UPI)Jimmy (The Greek) Snyder, an oddsmaker, has made Bobby Riggs a 52 favorite over Mrs. Billie Jean King in their $100,000 tennis match in the Houston Astrodome on Sept. 20.

title: State Racing Chief Linked to N.J. Track
description: Joseph A. Gimma's relationship to the proposed Meadowlands track in New Jersey will be carefully looked at by the New York Racing and Wagering Board, the board's chairman said yesterday.

title: Atlantic Fish Study Starts
description: WOODS HOLE, Mass., Aug. 27 (UPI)The Soviet trawler Belogorsk and the American research vessel Albatross left here today to begin a three. month study of ways to prevent the diminishing fish population off the Atlantic coast from being fished out of existence. Crewmen of the two ships planned to begin their research by comparing the size and capability of their nets in catching fish off the coast of Nantucket.

title: Arthur Daley
description: Bark in the glory days of Sam Huff and his fellow defensive demons who made the Giants such an overpowering force in the National Football League, the defensive platoon acted very condescendingly toward the offensive platoon. Even if there was a certain amount of justification, there still was no need for being so insufferable about

title: Green Hair in Pool
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Aug. 27 (Reuters)Organizers of the world swimming championships here have advised swimmers to use a lemon to combat chemicals that turned their hair green while they trained in the main pool. Dr. Draga Jovic, chief medical officer, said lemon would counter copper sulphate that was used to neutralize excessive chlorine in the pool.

title: Riggins Alone With Decision
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I. Aug. 27To play without a contract or not to play without a contract? That is the decision John Riggins has to make by Saturday, when the New York Jets face the Saints in New Orleans. Meanwhile, Riggins won't practice with the team until he and Weeb Ewbank, the coach and general manager can talk about the sixfigure contract Riggins is seeking.

title: Evictions Postponed
description: The eviction of 10 families in the Northside Williamsburg section of Brooklyn, scheduled for yesterday, was tentatively postponed last night, pending the outcome of a hearing in Federal Court Friday on a relocation suit.

title: MAIL BOMB HITS BRITISH EMBASSY IN WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27An exploding letter bomb blew off the left hand of the military attache's secretary in the British Embassy today as she was opening the morning mail.

title: Fuchsberg Calls for Double Sessions, Not More Courts
description: Jacob Fuchsberg, the Demo: cratic candidate for chief judge of the Court, of Appeals, said yesterday that the $50million proposed to be spent for new courtrooms to hear trials under the state's new stingent narcotics law, could be saved by using existing courtrooms on a double session basis.

title: IMPORTERS SEEKING CURB ON REPORTS
description: The American Importers Association said yesterday that it planned court action to block new Customs Service regulations requiring importers and customs brokers to report cost, insurance and freight data on their import shipments.

title: N.H.L. Reshuffling Is Set for 197475
description: The radicalization of the National Hockey League continued yesterday with the announcement that the league would he split into four divisions starting with the 197475 season and would expand to 20 clubs in 1976.

title: JAPANESE BUYING MERRIL SHARES
description: Japanese financial interests in recent weeks have been buying large amounts of stock in Merrill Lynch & Co., the corpo. rate parent of Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., according to Wall Street sources.

title: WILLIAM CLAPP, 85, CITY MAGISTRATE
description: William Clapp, a city magistrate from 1931 to his retirement in 1949, died yesterday in the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. He was 85 years old and lived at the Andrew Freedman Home in the Bronx.

title: People and Business
description: Retailer Closes a Hess Store With RegretsIt was a beautiful decision once we made it but it was a tough one to make. Philip I. Berman, chairman of Hess's, Inc., Allentown, Pa., departmentstore chain, seemed happy enoughrelieved perhaps is more like itin announcing yesterday the decision to close the concern's twoyearold store in Lancaster, Pa., because it was losing money.

title: WORLD CHURCHES HELP PORTUGUESE
description: GENEVA, Aug. 27  The World Council of Churches voted today to raise funds to aid Portuguese draft evaders and deserters who oppose their country's military activities in Angola, Mozambique and Guinea.

title: CANADIAN G.N.P. RISE IS CUT IN 2D QUARTER
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 27 (AP)Gross national product growth in the second quarter slowed to a third the rate of increase in the first quarter, Statistics Canada said today.

title: Pelorex Accused Of Insider Fraud In. S.E.C. Inquiry
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission yesterday filed fraud charges, based on the alleged misuse of insider information against the Pelorex Corporation, a Buffalo manufacturer of aerosol containers, and against its chairman, Joseph Rait.

title: 69 Policemen to Graduate
description: The Police Department will graduate 69 police officers today at 11 a.m. from the Police Academy, 235 East 20th Street.

title: Houston Space Center Is Rededicated to Johnson
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 27  The Manned Spacecraft Center here was rededicated today as the Lyndon B. Johnson Space Center as the late President was credited with having prevented a dismantling of much of the nation's space program following the Apollo moon project.

title: U.S. Yacht Beats Aussie
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 27 (AP)  The United States entry, St. Francis V, defeated Australia's Pacemaker by one minute today in the second race of the AmericanAustralian Challenge Cup series for 6Meter yachts.

title: 2 TOP DISSIDENTS ON TRIAL IN SOVIET
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 27Two of the Soviet Union's most active dissidents went on trial here today on charges of being paid agents of a Western group aimed at overthrowing the Soviet regime.

title: Slowdown Is Ended In Panama Canal; 118 Ships to Move
description: PANAMA, Aug. 27 (AP)Panama Canal pilots called off a twoweek slowdown early today and agreed to return to work immediately to clear up a backlog of 118 ships waiting to go through the waterway.

title: Ban on Utilities Shift to Oil Is Proposed to Save Fuel
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27In a move likely to anger environmentalists, John A. Love, director of the Energy Policy Office, announced today a plan to help avert a shortage of heating oil this winter.

title: Allied Stores Lifts Net; Woolworth Profit Is Up
4 Aides of Auto Club in Jersey Must Pay for Insurance TieIn
description: HACKENSACK, N. J., Aug. 27  Two present and two former directors of the North Jersey Automobile Club were ordered today to pay the club $87,540 because they had used the club's facilities to get business for an insurance agency they had acquired.

title: KISSINGER SEEKING ADVICE OF ENVOYS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27Henry A. Kissinger summoned several top American ambassadors today to confer with him on the people, policies and problems of the State Department in advance of next month's Senate hearings on his nomination to replace William P. Rogers as Secretary of State.

title: The Morning Line
description: Horrible though it is to contemplate, the 1976 Presidential campaign has already begun, at least in the Republican camp. Dozens of Republicansand Watergate. is to blame for thisare already working for the 1976 nomination, which suggests that the party of Lincoln, Hunt and Liddy may not be so grimly situated as might have been anticipated after so much incompetent plumbing.

title: City Music Has Its Day at Diversified Folk Festival
description: UPPER SALFORD TOWNSHIP, Pa., Aug. 27City music usually has difficulty squeezing its way into a folk festival and, when it does, it turns out to be children's street songs. But the final clay of the threeday Philadelphia Folk Festival yesterday was filled with Urban Folk Music, as one program was titled, which, in general, proved to be yesterday's top music.

title: Shortage of Newsprint Is Forcing Some Papers to Limit Advertising and Cut News Space
description: The increasing shortage of newsprint is forcing some newspapers to limit advertising, reduce the amount of space for news, eliminate features, and even drop some editions.

title: U.S. Group Visits East Berlin To Open Talks About Quarters
description: BERLIN, Aug. 27 (AP)An American delegation crossed into East Berlin today to begin discussions about quarters for a legation and its staff after the United States and East Germany open diplomatic relations.

title: Belmont Reopens With an Eye to Future
Bridge: Alertness a Leading Quality That Player Should Have
description: If one had to list the qualities most desirable in a bridge player, judgment would no doubt have to be at the top of the poll. Second perhaps would be alertness. Only a player with his wits about him can recognize the time to reject routine bids and plays.

title: Saints Dismiss J. D. Roberts, Promote North
description: NEW ORLEAN. Aug. 27 (AP)John Mecom Jr., owner of the New Orleans Saints, announced late tonight that Coach J. D. Roberts had been released and replaced by John North.

title: Chess: U.S.S.R. Wins Team Event, But All Eyes Are on Spassky
Roundup: Orioles Defeat Rangers, Run String to 14
description: The Orioles extended their winning streak to 14 games, the longest in the major leagues since 1965, by defeating the Texas Rangers, 61, last night in Baltimore Memorial Stadium.

title: LIVESTOCK PRICES DECLINE SHARPLY
description: Nervous livestock traders yesterday drove all cattle, hog and porkbellies futures down their respective daily permissi ble limits on the Chicago Mer cantile Exchange.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Ballet: Guzman's Lava
description: If anything, the Downtown Ballet Company of New York has less artistic distinction now than when it started several seasons ago. At that time its choreographer, Paschal Guzman, was copying from stronger creative models; now the choreography has declined to a level of Broadway manqu. The company shared a program with the Ballet Hispanico at Robert Moses Plaza, in Lincoln Center Sunday evening.musical numbers where working girls dash about having fun, by making a game of everything.

title: PRICES OF BONDS TURN DOWNWARD
Notes on People
description: The Soviet Ambassador's candidate for United States Ambassador to the Soviet Union is Dr. Armand Hammer, the president of the Occidental Petroleum Company, which has a lucrative trade contract with that country. The Soviet Ambassador to the United States, Anatoly F. Dobrynin, announced his choice after spending a weekend fishing off Florida as Dr. Hammer's guest.

title: Appeal for Dismissal Denied at Veterans'
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Aug. 27 Federal District Judge Winston E. Arnow denied today defense motions to dismiss the charges against seven antiwar veterans and a supporter who are accused of having plotted an assault on the 1972 Republican National Convention.

title: Rangers'
description: If Jim Merritt thought it was fashionable to talk about throwing spitballs, the Texas Rangers lefthander quickly found out differently yesterday.

title: Indian Company Bill Set
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 27(Reuters) Foreign companies engaged in purely trading activities will have to convert themselves into Indian companies under, legislation presented to Parliament today. Foreign capital in manufacturing enterprises will eventually he reduced to 40 priority industries and some exportoriented concerns.

title: IndianPakistani Accord on Key Issue Is Believed Near
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 27After ten days of negotiations, India and Pakistan were reported tonight to be near an agreement to resolve the political impasse on the subcontinent.

title: Western to Sell 2 Jets
description: Western Airlines announced yesterday that it had completed arrangements for the sale of two Boeing 737 jet aircraft to a New York financial group at a basic price of $4million each. Western acquired the aircraft originally at a cost of about $2.7million, and as of Dec. 31, 1972, had them on Its books at a depreciated value of about $2.3million.

title: Trudeau Calls Parliament To End Railroad Walkout
Jeb Magruder, Superstar
description: WASHINGTON"Dillinger is very big at neighborhood movies these steaming summer days, despite the usual outcry raised about the motion picture industry's crass romanticizing of criminal types. But considering the public's blandtoeager acceptance of the commercial exploitation of contemporary iniquity, a movie extolling the career of a Midwest bank robber who went to his reward forty years ago isn't really worth working up moral sweat.

title: Several Banks Lift Prime Rate to 9%
description: The Chase Manhattan Bank yesterday increased its prime rate to 9 per cent from 9 per cent, marking what appeared to be the widely anticipated start of the fifth general rise in five straight weeks in the commercial banks basic lending rate.

title: Poultry Wholesalers'
Oil Pressure
description: The great oil pressure play has begun. With perhaps less public outcry from the victims than he would wish, Libya's Colonel Qaddafi is moving to take control American oil interests in his arid land, an openly delivered slap on America's cool arrogant face, as he put it.

title: Reid Earns a Spot At U.S. Open Net
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., Aug. 27Raz Reid of Greenville, S. C., defeated Steve Siegel of Teaneck, N. J., 76, 63, at the Port Washington Tennis Academy today and qualified for the United States Open. Siegel had advanced earlier by eliminating Joel Ross of Old Westbury, 75, 46, 64.

title: WALDHEIM IN SYRIA TO BEGIN HIS TOUR
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Aug, 27 (AP)Secretary General Waldheim of the United Nations arrived here today on his first peaceseeking tour of the Middle East, and said: I am coming in a tense moment.

title: Books of The Times
description: In case you haven't noticed, the nostalgia revival is still gaining momentum. Even official entreaties for an end to our obsession with the past and a return to the more urgent problems of the future have not dampened the apparently irresistible urge to return to those less complex, good old days of the late thirties, forties and fifties. After all, Elvis Presley's gyrations, in retrospect, were harmless when compared to Marilyn Chambers's, and the morality of Summer of 42 was surely less tainted than that of the Summer of 72. And with the creative gears of recordings, fashions and films seemingly all locked in reverse, it isn't surprising that fiction should also reflect that trend. The Bingo Long Traveling All Stars and Motor Kings and The Stardust Kid are two novels that fit firmly in this nostagia niche.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Illegal fishing for Atlantic salmon in Canada is increasing alarmingly and is threatening efforts to restore the highly prized game and food fish to its former abundance, said Wilfred M. Carter, executive director to the Atlantic Salmon Foundation.

title: KISSINGER SEEKING ADVICE OF ENVOYS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27Henry A. Kissinger summoned several top American ambassadors today to confer with him on the people, policies and problems of the State Department in advance of next month's Senate hearings on his nomination to replace William P. Rogers as Secretary of State.

title: E.P.A. ASSAILED ON AIR PROPOSALS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 The Environmental Protection Agency was criticized by environmentalists today at the start of hearings into what standard the Government should apply to keep the clean air in the country from deteriorating.

title: ADHESIVES WARNING ISSUED TO COUPLES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27The Consumer Product Safety Commission urged today those couples who have been exposed to aerosol spray adhesives to consider postponing having children until more information lis known about the possible Iproblems posed by the chemicals.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The current flourish of scandalous activities arising from abuses of power in the Federal and state governments has stimulated intense debate concerning possible corrective measures which may minimize or prevent future such betrayals of the public trust. It seems that many would advocate not merely a mendingofways approach but illusory panaceas. Some have suggested, for example, the appointment of psychiatric watchdogs to government positions or the recasting of our Constitution in the parliamentary mold. These and similar proposals indicate an undercurrent of thinking which, in my judgment, entirely misses the point. An excellent example of this sincere misperception of the issue is found in the Aug. 8 letter from Richard

title: Bogota Air Crash Kills 40, Including 4 U.S. Passengers
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Aug. 27 (UPI)A Colombian turboprop airliner crashed into a hill on the outskirts of Bogota today, killing all 40 persons aboard, including four Americans.

title: Puerto Ricans Seek to Play Bigger Partin Long Branch
description: LONG BRANCH, Aug.27They sell sangria these days at Schneider's Tap Room two blocks from the ocean in an area once dominated by Raiians, then blacks and lately by a rapidly growing Spanishspeaking community,

title: MAIL BOMB HITS BRITISH EMBASSY IN WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 An exploding letter bomb blew off the left hand of the military attach's secretary in the British Embassy today as she was opening the morning mail.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LONDON, Aug. 27 (UPI)Brendan Foster of Britain smashed the world record for the twomile run today with a time of 8 minutes 13.8 seconds in a meet between Britain and Hungary

title: ALLENDE DELAYS HIS NEW CABINET
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 27The scheduled induction of new Chilean Cabinet was postponed tonight amid speculation that the armed forces were at odds over whether to participate in the Government of President Salvador Allende Gossens.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION UP 0.8% IN WEEK
29 More Food Places on List Of Those Violating Health Code
Stockholm Police Prepare to Cut Into Bank Vault
description: STOCKHOLM, Sweden, Tuesday, Aug. 28 (AP)The police prepared to cut their way into a vault in a downtown bank in an attempt to capture a gunman and a convicted murderer who have held four hostages since Thursday, police sources reported. They said that one of the women captives had been raped repeatedly.

title: 16 Elected Black Leaders of Both Parties Meet to Chart a New Political Strategy
description: DENVER, Aug. 27A group of black Democratic and Republican leaders, seeking black unity, has met here to begin charting a new political strategy.

title: U.S. Yacht Beats Aussie
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 27 (AP)  The United States entry, St, Francis V, defeated Australia's Pacemaker by one minute today in the second race of the AmericanAustralian Challenge Cup series for 6Meter yachts.

title: Governor Picks 16 Judges To Act on New Drug Law
description: The first 16 special judges to help handle the surge of cases expected when New York State's stringent new narcotics law takes effect on Saturday received recess appointments yesterday from Governor Rockefeller.

title: Mexico Counts Flood Cost
description: MEXICO CITY, Aug. 27 (AP) Flooding in II Mexican states over the last month killed at least 70 people, left. more than 400,000 homeless and destroyed many crops, the Government said today. It said vial the rains, the heaviest in 30 years, had swept away small villages, flooded risers and burst dams.

title: Carnegie Panel Urges Colleges to Spur Growth
description: The Carnegie Commission on Higher Education urged thel country's fouryear colleges yesterday to admit more adults, veterans, transfers and even 10th and 1 1th grade high school students to counter al trend of declining freshman enrollments.

title: Judge Enters Pleas for 2
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (AP) Superior Court Judge Leonard Braman today entered pleas of not guilty for two of the seven Philadelphia men charged in the Hanafi Muslim slayings in Washington in Janaury. Attorneys had refused to enter pleas for their clients, asserting that the method of bringing the two from Philadelphia to Washington may have been illegal.

title: Charge Is Reduced For Man Once Held In Threat to Nixon
description: TAOS, N.M., Aug. 27 (AP)Edwin M. Gaudet was jailed today on a reduced charge that he shot at a policeman who was trying to arrest him on a Federal charge of threatening to kill President Nixon.

title: The Growing Malaise in Britain
description: The constitutional clashes spawned by Watergate have inspired the usual commentaries on the superiority of Britain's parliamentary system for resolving crisesand on occasion there can be no doubt about it.

title: Even Dollar Bills Cost More These Days
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27If money really does talk, it is probably muttering about inflation just like the rest of us, because the cost of making a dollar bill is going up, too.

title: The Virtuoso
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27The nomination of Henry Kissinger as Secretary of State enables Mr. Nixon to hold out to his critics the pretense of reform.

title: Man Gives Up in Attack on Witness
description: The defendant in a murder case, who allegedly assaulted one of the prosecution witnesses with a metal pipe, yesterday surrendered to the judge who released him on $15,000 bail two weeks ago over the vigorous protest of the District Attorney.

title: On Film: Great Actors in Great Plays
description: The movies can no more do masterpieces of drama than the stage can do masterpieces of literature, so let each concern itself with what it can do best.

title: BOY DIES IN FALL AGAINST GLASS DOOR
description: An 8yearold Staten Island boy suffered fatal injuries last night when he tripped while running out to play and fell against the glass front door of his home.

title: Civilians Begin Directing Traffic on City Streets
description: Twentyfive civilian traffic control agents took up posts at midtown intersections yesterday to contend with problems ranging from a huge streetblocking crane to butterflies in the stomach.

title: U.S. Takes Checkers Title In Tourney With Britain
description: BOURNEMOUTH, England, Aug. 27 (AP)  The United States has become the world checkers champion by thrashing British in a tournament that has been played only three times in 68 years.

title: Mrs. Berrigan Seized On Shoplifting Charge
description: GLEN BURNIE, Md., Aug. 27 (UPI)  Elizabeth McAlister Berrigan, a former nun who is now the wife of the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan, the antiwar activist, and another former nun were arrested today on charges of shoplifting at a suburban Baltimore department store.

title: DR. JOHN LOTZ, 60, LINGUIST, IS DEAD
description: CHEVY CHASE, Md., Aug. 27Dr. John Lotz, a former Columbia University professor who retired in 1971 as director and president of the Center for Applied Linguistics, Washington, died Saturday at his home here. He was 60 years old.

title: SIHANOUK RENEWS DENIAL ON BOMBS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 The dispute between Prince Norodom Sihanouk and the Nixon Administration continued today with a new denial by the exiled Cambodian leader that he had approved the American bombing of his country in 1969 and 1970.

title: CHARLES RAY, 63, N,Y.U, DEAN, DIES
description: Charles A. Ray, associate dean of the College of Business and Public Administration of New York University, died on Sunday night after being stricken while dining at a restaurant in Spring Valley, N.Y. He was pronounced dead at Nyack Hospital. Mr. Ray was 53 years old and lived in Pearl River, N. Y.

title: U.S. Dollar Drops Slightly In Quiet European Trading
description: BRUSSELS, Aug. 27 (UPI)The dollar weakened slightly in (quiet trading on most European money markets today, One banking source said the decline could be because of profit taking.

title: Ban on Utilities Shift to Oil Is Proposed to Save Fuel
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27In a move likely to anger environmentalists, John A. Love, director of the Energy Policy Office, announced today a plan to help avert a shortage of heating oil this winter.

title: SHOP TALK
description: There aren't many custom bootmakers here anymore and Oliver Moore said the other day that his concern, which has been in existence about 90 years, will almost certainly close shop when he is through.

title: Calland Arrested After Gun Incident
description: WHITE PLAINS, N.Y., Aug. 27 (AP)Lee Arthur Calland, a defensive back for the Chicago Bears, was arrested today after he allegedly pulled a gun on his former business agent and accused him of misappropriating $30,000 of Calland's money. Police said the incident occurred in the office of Norman Young, head of Probus Management Inc.

title: REBOZO IDENTIFIED AS HELPING NIXON TO BUY COAST LAND
description: LAGUNA BEACH,. Calif., Aug. 27The White House today identified C. G. Rebozo, close friend of President Nixon, as one of two fihancial backers in the President's real estate purchases in San Clemente, Calif.

title: Chrysler Offer to U.A.W. Is Scheduled for Today
description: DETROIT, Aug. 27 (AP) The Chrysler Corporation will make a contract offer to the United Automobile Workers union tomorrow, according to company executives.

title: How Families Abroad Are Coping at the Market
description: LONDON  The English seem to be eating as well as ever while talking about food prices more than ever,

title: FACT PANEL TO STUDY B1 BOMBER PROJECT
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (Reuters)Secretary of the Air Force John L. McLucas ordered today a special management review of the North American Rockwell B1 bomber program.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
President Park's South Korea: There Is Only One Path, and It Is His
description: SEOUL, South Korea Back in Washington, Western diplomat said, you have the Watergate scandal. Well, in Seoul the kidnapping of Kim Dae Jung is Park Chung Hee's Watergate.

title: State Begins Mailing Out Identity Cards for Elderly
description: TRENTON, Aug. 27 (AP) The State Department of Transportation has mailed out the first batch of identity cards to some 3,000 elderly persons eligible to participate in statesubsidized program of halffare bus rides due to begin on Sept. 10.

title: W. German Cyclists Crash but Triumph
description: SAN SEBASTIAN, Spain, Aug. 27 (AP)Two West German cyclists suffered serious injuries today when their fourman amateur pursuit team, crashed just short of the finish line in the final track event of the world championships.

title: U. S. Joins State Inquiry on Century Bank
description: The Federal Government has', joined the state investigation of Century National Bank and Trust Company's transactions. This became known yesterday at State Supreme Court where the hank filed papers in an attempt to quash a subpoenal from Maurice H. Nadjari, the state's special prosecutor.

title: Weather Reports and Forecast
Thieu Gets Wide Margin In Saigon Senate Election
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 27 (Reuters)  Two proGovernment slates predictably swept yesterday's elections for the Souths Vietnamese Senate, giving President Nguyen Van Thieu a comfortable majority in the upper house, according to results made public today.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Illegal fishing for Atlantic salmon in Canada is increasing alarmingly and is threatening efforts to restore the highly prized game and food fish to its former abundance, said Wilfred M. Carter, executive director to the Atlantic Salmon Foundation.

title: MORTIMER SMOLKA
description: Mortimer H. Smolka, retired president of Smolka, Inc., wholesale plumbing suppliers, and a former director of the American Supply Association, died yesterday at his home in Scroon Lake, N.Y. He was 68 years old and lived also at 245 West 104th Street.

title: Indian Leader Seized in Shooting Of a Fellow Militant in Dakota
description: WINNER, S.D., Aug. 27 (AP) The president of the American Indian Movement was arrested tonight on a charge that he shot and critically wounded another leader of the movement, the authorities said.

title: People in Sports: Sons Of Six Stars on Team
description: Earl Morrall, Tobin Rote, Darris McCord, Roger Zatkoff, Leon Hart and Jack Simmons are National Football League names of the past and present. They are also names on the football team at Brother Rice High School in Birmingham, Mich. Trying to follow in their father's footsteps are Mat Morrall, a junior tackle; Rocky Rote, a junior quarterback, Mike McCord, a senior defensive tackle; Kevin Hart, a defensive end, Dave Zatkoff, a junior end, and Terry Simmons, a sophomore end.

title: 2 Cities, North and South, Show Progress by Blacks
3 WEEKEND FIRES ARE UNDER STUDY
description: RIDGEFIELD PARK, Aug. 27 The Bergen County Prosecutor's office began an investigation today into the origin of three fires that occurred here within four hours of each other this weekend.

title: Gas Service Curtailed
description: The Lone Star Gas Company said in Dallas yesterday that it had informed its industrial customers that their natural gas service would he curtailed by 10 per cent until the company's storage reservoirs were filled to assure satisfactory deliveries to residential, commercial and other highpriority customers.

title: Road From Phnom Penh to Sea Is Cut Second Time in. 2 Days
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Aug. 27 (UPI)Intense fighting was reported today along highways leading to Phnom Penh, and the road from the sea was cut for the second time in two days.

title: Treasury Bills Decline In the Weekly Auction
Psychotherapist's Sword Death Ends Dream to Assist Suffering
J. Edward Knight, Served On Jersey Superior Court
description: ASBURY PARK, N. J., Aug. 27J. Edward Knight, a former State Superior Court judge, died yesterday at Jersey Shore Medical Center, Neptune. His age was 69.

title: Army Transferring Intelligence Head In Germany to U.S.
description: BONN, Aug. 27A United States Army spokesman in Heidelberg said today that the head of Army intelligence in West. Germany would he transferred to Washington next month.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: JUGGLERS Anatole France formalized the legend into a short story, The Juggler of Our Lady, and this morning at 9:30 in front of St. Patrick's Cathedral the legend comes alive. Los Muchachos, a troupe of 85 young men led by harlequins, pipers and jugglers will balance and dance their way into the Gothic cathedral for a historic Circus Mass to be celebrated by Terence Cardinal Cooke.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The owner of a Times Square newsstand in operation since 1919 yesterday won back his license, which the city had revoked on the ground that the stand was impeding pedestrian traffic during rush periods. The Department of Consumer Affairs had suggested relocation of the stand to Leonard Schneider, whose father had opened it on the southwest corner of Seventh Avenue and 42d Street.

title: POWERUSE CURB URGED BY CON ED
description: The Consolidated Edison Company asked Its three zillion customers to cut back nonessential electrical consumption yesterday and said that more hot muggy weather from the Middle West was expected to increase airconditioning demends and make the power situation even tighter today and tomorrow.

title: HEWLETTPACKARD SETS PRICE REFUND
description: The Cost of Living Council announced in Washington yesterday that it had been notified by the HewlettPackard Company that the manufacturer of precision instruments would refund more than $145,000 to customers because of price increases above authorized levels.

title: Israel Reports Exchange Of Fire on Golan Heights
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 27 (AP)Israeli and Arab forces exchanged fire today along the ceasefire line on the occupied Golan heights of Syria, the military command announced.

title: Female Laborer, 18, Joins Road Gang
description: SOMERVILLE, Aug. 27Mary Elizabeth Bissell, 18 years old, went to work today as the New Jersey Department of Transportation's first female highway maintenance laborer.

title: Trudeau Calls Parliament To End Railroad Walkout
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Aug. 27 Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau tonight summoned Parliament into special session to legislate an end to the fourdayold strike that has halted nearly every train in Canada.

title: Call for Vengeance Fails to Stir Vietnamese Village
description: THUY TRUONG, South Vietnam, Aug. 22  A disgruntled politician has launched a Red scare in this peaceful village of 5,091 persons, but no one is frightened.

title: Boy Dies in Highway Fall
description: PICACHO, Ariz., Aug. 27 (AP) A 9yearold boy stepped to his death from the door of a pickup camper as his parents drove along a highway, unaware that he was gone. He was identified as Jack Edward Zeilstra.

title: The Way It Was, the Way It Is
description: ORANGEBURG, S. C.Only people who never lived under segregation would want its return. Either they are too youngborn since 1950or they are from another region of the country where segregation was not written into legal statutes or where it manifested itself in a somewhat milder form. For segregation in the Middle and Deep South was, by anybody's estimate, by any standard, under all circumstancesa bad scene.

title: Stock Average Is Up 7.22 To 870.71 in Slow Trading
Final Arguments Are Held In TexasgulfC.D.C. Case
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 27 (UPI)Lawyers concluded final arguments today in a suit brought by Texasgulf, Inc., to block an attempted takeover of the United States mining and metals company by the Canadian Development Corporation.

title: Roderick Seidenberg Dead; Architect and Author, 83
description: DOYLESTOWN, Pa., Aug. 27  Roderick Seidenberg, an architect and author, died today in Doylestown Hospital. He was 83 years old.

title: Soviet Seaman in Israel
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 27Leonid Fridmanovitch, a 26yearold SovietJewish seaman who jumped off his fishing vessel in Japan last Sunday and came to Israel, said today in a radio broadcast that he had bm planning the move for years. He has been assured asylum.

title: Houk Status Shaky In Next Rebuilding
JapanChina Talks Go On
description: TOKYO, Aug. 27 (AP)Japanese and Communist Chinese negotiators extended their talks again today in efforts to reach a trade agreement. The trade talks, which began Aug. 17, had been expected to conclude by the end of last week, but were extended to today and then to tomorrow.

title: Prime Rate %
description: Several major banks raised their prime rate yesterday to 9 per cent, a new high, from 9 per cent. The Chase Manhattan Bank began the move. This appears to be the start of the fifth general rise in five weeks in the prime rate, the interest that commercial banks charge on loans to their most creditworthy corporate customers. Bankers said that strong demand for loans showed no sign of letting up. Also, shortterm interest rates in the money market continue to move upward. Page 45.

title: Mrs. Mitchell Says She Plans to Stand by Husband
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Aug 27 (UPI)Mrs. John M. Mitch. ell said today that her husbad was broken up over the Watergate affair and they were no longer talking to each other, but that she planned to stand by him at least until all charges were resolved.

title: 2 Plants to Shift to Production of Smaller Cars
description: SAN DIEGO, Calif. Aug. 21  The Ford Motor Company expects car sales in the new model year to drop by 5 to 6 per cent from the record 11.8 million sales in the 1973 model year just ending.

title: FLOODS THREATEN A PAKISTANI CITY
description: HYDERABAD, Pakistan, Aug. 27 (UPI)Floodwaters threatened the city of Hyderabad today as the Indus River gushed to the Arabian Sea.

title: New Amusement Parks: Fantasy Built on a Theme
description: ARLINGTON, Tex., Aug. 21 Click. Click. Click. Click. Click. Click.

title: Spanish Police Call Charge Of Torture a Defamation
description: MADRID, Aug. 27 (AP)The police today denied charges by Amnesty International that po. litical prisoners were tortured.

title: Quarry Offered Million
description: Fourthranked Jerry Quarry was offered $1million yesterday to fight the winner of Saturday's title bout between George Foreman, heavyweight champion, and Joe (King) Roman. Barry Burnstein, president of Video Techniques, made the offer by telegram. Quarry is in Las Vegas training for a fight with James J. Woody that will be part of a closedcircuit telecast of the Foreman Roman match in Tokyo.

title: Equity Financing
description: Minnesota Mining and Manufacturing Company said yesterday it planned to register a secondary offering of 1.5million shares of its common stock owned by the estate of Maude L. McKnight. Mrs. McKnight was the wife of William L. McKnight, former chairman of the company. She owned about 3.2million shares. The shares, to be offered through underwriters about November 1, are being sold to pay estate taxes. The company's stock closed at 85, up 1, on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Detroit's Small World
description: SAN DIEGO, Calif., Aug. 27 It's a small world, Detroit is learning.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Fortytwo New Jersey firefighters returned home Sunday night after spending six days battling forest fires and range fires in the West. Some of the men gave up their vacations to volunteer and help extinguish fires that have blackened 200,000 acres in several western states. Four of the men suffered minor injuries. The 42 fire fighters, most of them from the south and central part state, were based in Boise, Idaho, during their stay.

title: INFANTS SCREENED BY HADASSAH CENTER
description: DENVER, Aug. 26Hadassah has established an unusual program in Jerusalem for screening every infant born in the city, for genetic, metabolic and emotional disturbances that might lead to mental or physical retardation.

title: Greed of Nations
description: The pessimistic annual State of the World report issued by United Nations Secretary General Kurt Waldheim last weekend mentions only in passing preparations for a lawofthesea conferencepreparations which United States diplomat has described as unquestionably the most crucial international negotiation now being undertaken by the U.N.

title: FORD TO SHUT DOWN WEST GERMAN PLANT
description: COLOGNE, West Germany, Aug. 27 (AP)The management of the Ford Motor Company's West German operations decided today to close temporarily the company's main auto plant at Cologne after wildcat strikes and demonstrations by some of the plant's 30,000 workers.

title: 1, 000 Police Protest Brutality Charge
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., Aug. 27 Nearly 1,000 offstudy policemen demonstrated in front of the Suffolk District Court Building here for nearly two hours this morning, supporting a Suffolk County patrolman indicted last month by a grand jury on a police brutality charge.

title: Getty Son Called Suicide
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 27 (UPI) A psychological autopsy of George F. Getty, son of J. Paul Getty, the billionaire, showed that the death was probably suicide, the Los Angeles County coroner's office said today. Mr. Getty, 48 years old, died on June 7 of an overdose of a combination of alcohol and barbiturates. The report at the time said it was not immediately possible to determine whether the death was accidental.

title: Qaddafi Reported To Reject Formula Of Egypt for Union
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 27 Col. Muammar elQaddafi, the Libyan leader, was reported by a Lebanese newspaper today to have rejected Egypt's formula for union of his country with Egypt.

title: Carl Lerner, 61, the Film Editor Of Klute, 12 Angry Men, Dies
description: Carl Lerner, who edited some of America's, bestknown films, died Sunday in University Hospital after a long illness. He was 61 years old and lived at 3360 21st Avenue, Long Island City, Queens.

title: 2 High Cambodia Leaders Strongly Attack Sihanouk
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Aug. 27Two senior Phnom Penh Government leaders delivered speeches today denouncing the former Cambodian Chief of State, Prince Norodom Sihanouk, in unusually harsh terms and in effect pledging their Government to a war to the death.

title: 2 TOP DISSIDENTS ON TRIAL IN SOVIET
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 27Two of the Soviet Union's most active dissidents went on trial here today on charges of being paid agents of a Western group aimed at overthrowing the Soviet regime.

title: State's Publishers Elect
description: COOPERSTOWN, N.Y., Aug. 25 (AP)  Thomas P. Dolan, president and publisher of the Westchester Rockland Newspapers, was elected president of the New York State Publishers Association, Henry K. Williams 3d, president, publisher and editor of The Dunkirk Evening Observer, was elected vice president. and Robert J. Danzig, publisher of The Albany TimesUnion and Knickerbocker NewsUnion Star, was named secretlytreasure

title: 98 Heat Record for Year; City Power Usage at Peak
Pakistan Sets Cotton Ban
description: KARACHI, Aug. 28 (AP)Pakistan has imposed an Immediate ban on the export of cotton to insure availability of raw cotton for the indigenous textile industry. The announcement was made late yesterday in Islamabad by the Ministry of Finance.

title: Robert Dowling Dies
description: Robert W. Dowling, former president and chairman of the City Investing Company, died yesterday at his home in the Pierre Hotel. He was 77 years old. He served on many civic, cultural, educational and professional organizations. Details on Page 90.

title: THOMAS BINFORDI ADMIRAL, 77, DIES
description: SAN DIEGO, Aug. 28 (UPI)Vice Admiral Thomas H. Binford, holder of many citations, including the Navy Cross, the Silver Star and the Legion of Merit, died yesterday in Balboa Nayal Hospital. He was 77 years old.

title: Aaron's Bat Not Enough; Cubs Win
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 28 (UPI) Hank Aaron hit the 706th home run of his career tonight, a 375foot drive in the first inning, but the Chicago Cubs beat the Atlanta Braves, 96.

title: Unity Securities Is Named In S.E.C. Fraud Complaint
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 28 (AP)  The Unity Securities Corporation, a Beverly Hills brokerdealer firm, has been accused in a Securities and Exchange Commission complaint of fraudulently manipulating the stock of Orecraft, Inc., a Utah corporation with its principal place of business in suburban Woodland Hills.

title: Riggins Goes Home as Jets Won't Meet His Price
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Aug. 28 John Riggins, the New York Jets holdout fullback and leading rusher last year, packed his gear today and walked out of training camp.

title: Utilities to Spend 3Billion On Building Power Units
description: A $3billion program to build electric generating stations for northern Ohio mid western Pennsylvania was announced yesterday by a group of five utilities serving the areas.

title: Bill Bradley Considered For Race for Congress
description: TRENTON, Aug. 28 (UPI)  Democratic leaders in the 13th District are considering a notunwilling Bill. Bradley, the Princetoneducated basketball star, as a Congressional candidate, a Morris County Democratic leader said today.

title: Man Killed in Fall at Station
description: Robert E. Philpot, a sales executive for the Columbia Broadcasting system, was killed yesterday when he fell off the Scarsdale railroad station platform and was hit by an express train. Mr. Philpot, 45 years old, was director of sales coordination for C.B.S., which he had joined in 1951. Survivors include his widow, Marian, and two children, Robert and Marian. The Philpots lived in Eastchester.

title: City Pressing to Enroll Addicts in Drug Program
description: With three days remaining before the state's stringnet new narcotics law takes effect, the city's Addiction Services Agency yesterday announced a marathon campaign to register as many addicts as possible in drug rehabilitation programs.

title: Cattle Rustler Shot
description: URBANA, III., Aug. 28 (UPI) A farm wife told the police today that she shot and wounded one of three men who were trying to seal four cows from her barn. Mrs. Alberta Wright said she fired one shot from 22caliber pistol and hit one of the men in the chest.

title: Geothermal Program Set
description: The Calvert Exploration Company said yesterday that it had agreed in principle with the Sun Oil Company to conduct a joint geothermal exploration program on leases held by the two companies in New Mexico and Nevada.

title: POLLEN COUNT UP TO SNEEZING HIGH
description: No matter how you count itand there are several ways to do soyesterday's pollen count reached an allseason high, causing itchy eyes, runny noses and sneezing for the thousands of hayfever sufferers in the metropolitan area.

title: Breedlove Crashes Car
description: WENDOVER, Utah, Aug. 28 (UPI)The former speed recordholder Craig Breedlove, was not injured today as his rocket car crashed on the Bonneville Salt Flats. Breedlove's threewheeled English Leather Special rolled during a test run and was heavily damaged, the Utah Highway Patrol reported.

title: Military Men Again in Allende's Cabinet
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 28President Salvador Allende Gossens reshuffled his Cabinet today and again included military leaders in key ministerial posts in an attempt to cope more effectively with a wave of crippling strikes and terrorism.

title: LIQUIDATION OF I.O.S. SOUGHT BY CANADA
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 28 (Canadian Press)The Federal and Ontario governments have filed a petition in the Supreme Court of New Brunswick seeking to liquidate I.O.S. Ltd., worldwide mutual fund group that has its head office in Fredericton, N. B.

title: DEFENSE IS SHORT IN VETERANS TRIAL
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Aug. 28 After calling only one defense witness  who gave sort of chemistry lessonseven antiwar veterans and a supporter charged with plotting an assault on the 1972 Republican National Convention rested their case today.

title: Joe Frazier's Manager Suffers Major Stroke
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 28 (UPIYancey (Yank) Durham, manager of the former heavyweight boxing champion, Joe Frazier, suffered a stroke today and was listed in very critical condition at Temple University Hospital.

title: A Distinguished French General Is Now a Man of Nonviolence
description: GUIDEL, France, Aug. 17 A lifetime in the military has transformed one of France's most authentic heroes and distinguished generals into a man of nonviolence.

title: Records: Eddie Condon
description: Eddie Condon, who died early this month, was more celebrated for his talking than for his guitar playing. In the late nineteentwenties and during the thirties, he used his acerbic wit to get jobs for his friends and himself. Later, in the forties and fifties, it was an essential element in his role as concert impresario and saloon keeper. Two record collections that have appeared coincidentally with his death give us glimpses of both periods.

title: Penn Central Aide Says U.S. Will Provide Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28 (AP) An official of the Penn Central Company said today he did not think there would be a problem in getting cash to keep the financially troubled railroad running.

title: U.S Envoy Ending Duty in Cambodia; Post Not Yet Filled
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Aug. 28  Emory Swank, the United States Ambassador to Cambodia since 1970, will end his tour here and return to the United States next week, an embassy spokesman said today.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Fatality on Ride Laid to Loose Bolt

title: Equity Financing
description: The Digital Equipment Corporation said yesterday it planned an offering of an unspecified number of additional shares and would be filing a registration with the Securities and Exchange Commission soon. The company's stock was down  at 89 on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Campbell Advances In Amateur
Agriculture Agency May Slash Subsidized Milk Plan for Pupils
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28The Agriculture Department will drop a program that provided supplementary subsidized milk for children in 86,000 schools unless Congress agrees to provide more money, a department official said today.

title: MARCOS ASKS STUDY OF SUBVERSION CASE
description: MANILA, Wednesday, Aug. 29President Ferdinand E. Marcos yesterday ordered a reinvestigation into charges of subversion and illegal possession of firearms against former Senator Benigno S. Aquino. He said the Government wanted to demonstrate utmost fairness, impartiality and objectivity In the prosecution of charges against the accused.

title: Four Die in Massachusetts Tornado
description: WEST STOCKBRIDGE, Mass., Aug. 28 (AP)A tornado swept an area along the MassachusettsNew York border today and the police said that it killed four persons and injured 31.

title: PRICES ON AMEX SHOW SLIGHT RISE
Richardson: Under Pressure
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28The new Attorney General of the United States, Elliot L. Richardson, is an elegant man of elaborate, almost ostentatious serenity, and you could never tell by watching him these days that he is under more pressure now than over before in his varied service to the Federal Government.

title: Ottawa Hurrying A Rail Settlement As Crisis Deepens
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Aug. 28Members of Parliament were hurrying back to Ottawa today to legislate an end to the fivedayold rail strike that has halted virtually! levery train in the country, just) as the economic effects of the dispute were beginning to reach average Canadians.

title: More Purged Chinese Officials Being Rehabilitated
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 28Twr of the highest officials attacker and purged during the Cultura Revolution have joined the growing list of important Chinese Communists who have been rehabilitated.

title: Hoerner Waldorf Requests Permit to Expand Plant
description: The Hoerner Waldorf Corporation said yesterday that it had asked the Montana State Department of Health and Environmental Sciences for permission to construct a $40million expansion of its paper mill at Missoula, Montana.

title: INDEX ON ECONOMY CONTINUES TO RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28 The Government's composite index of leading indicators of the economy continued its sustained rise in July, the Commerce Department reported today on the basis of preliminary figures.

title: AN AGNEW FRIEND SAID TO AIDI NQUIRY
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 28Another key witness in the Federal investigation of the possible role of a number of officials, including Vice President Agnew, in kickbacks from Maryland contractors was reported today to be cooperating with the United States Attorney's office here in return for preferential !treatment.

title: L. James Evans, 58, Dies; Technicon Senior Officer
description: TARRYTOWN, N.Y., Aug. 28 L. James Evans, a senior vice president and director of the Technicon Corporation, makers, of chemical and analytical instruments here, died in his sleep yesterday while visiting, friends in Greenwich, Conn. He was 58 years old and lived at 57 Forest Avenue, Rye.

title: School Board, Reversing Anker, Rescinds Brooklyn Zone Change
description: The Board of Education, reversing an earlier decision by School Chancellor Irving Anker, yesterday rescinded a scheduled Brooklyn high school zoning change that had touched off parent boycotts and demonstrations last spring.

title: McIntire's Pirate Radio Ship Slated To Begin Broadcasts by End of Week
description: The Rev. Carl McIntire, a Fundamentalist minister, said yesterday that a pirate radio ship that he had commissioned was scheduled to take up position off Cape May today and begin broadcasting by the end of the week.

title: CASE STILL OPEN IN PLOT ON NIXON
description: NEW ORLEANS, Aug. 28An investigation of a possible conspiracy to kill President Nixon is still alive, a Secret Service source in Washington said today.

title: Letters to the Editor The HardDrug Scene: This Is a City Under Siege
description: To the Editor: When you live abroad and return to New York you discover that everyone seems very knowing and clever about the hard drug scene. Cute words like ripoff make stealing sound sexy. Chic people have learned to say horse for heroin and OD for overdose.Only later do you realize that there is an unease underneath. You begin to hear the horror stories: Someone bashed over the head with a lead pipe while going home; someone mugged in the hallway getting out her keys. You notice that at night people turn around apprehensively at the sound of footsteps. You, too, look over your shoulder; someone looks back at you. Your parents stay in at night altogether.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: BLOOMFIELD, Aug. 28A pair of carefully manicured patches of green in Watsessing Park here represent the last outpost in North Jersey of the ancient sport of lawn bowling.

title: It's a Circus in the Cathedral Here As Cooke Greets Troupe of Youths
description: The first necessity of a circus, when it comes to a place, is to make itself known. That is exactly what the circus that hit town yesterday did, but instead of staging a circus parade, the performers juggled near the main altar in St. Patrick's Cathedral, flipped cartwheels and built human pyramids on the cathedral's front steps, then dashed downtown to do a fiveminute sample circus for Mayor Lindsay at the base of the steps at City Hall.

title: Information Calls: To Pay or Not To
description: Amid jeers, shouts and applause, the final arguments were heard yesterday on proposals for the New York Telephone Company to charge for information calls in the state.

title: Red Smith
description: BOSTON, Aug. 28Chris Evert, who holds grass in the same high esteem other girls have for poison ivy, practicing on the clipped lawns of the Longwood Cricket Club here for the United States Open tennis championships that begin tomorrow (Thursday for her) in Forest Hills, Queens. Revisiting Forest Hills is a little like recapturing love's young dream, for it was on the turf of the West Side Tennis Club that her romance with the galleries burst into flower. Playing in her first National Open two years ago as a pigtailed pixie of 16 with her neat features set in an expression of sweetly childish intensity, Chrissie captivated the fans completely as she won, and won, and won again before Billie Jean King defeated her in the semifinals. What emotions are uppermost now as she returns to the scene of that popular triumph as an internationalist and professional with chance to lift her prize money for the year over $100,000? Eagerness? Apprehension? Confidence? Anxiety? Eagerness, I think, she said. I'm grateful that I had a good Wimbledon. It convinced me I could play well on grass, after all.

title: Culture Bus Route To Run Weekends
ORTHODOX CHURCH BACKS ECUMENISM
description: GENEVA, Aug. 28The titular head of Eastern Orthodox Christianity delivered a message to the World Council of Churches today reaffirming his church's commitment to the organized ecumenical movement but urging council leaders to avoid preoccupation with sociopolitical aims.

title: PRICES ARE MIXED IN BOND ACTIVITY
Dollar Shows Slight Rise;
description: LONDON, Aug. 28 (UPI) The dollar moved fractionally higher in world money markets today, partly reflecting higher interest rates in the United States and Japan but mostly continuing the dollar's general upward trend.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28 (Reuters)  The American Bankers Association said today that a national survey conducted showed that banks have increased their interest rates for savers without draining funds from other financial institutions.

title: All Clear for Aces Today at Forest Hills
Notes on People
description: Justice Thurgood Marshall of the Supreme Court gave judges general advice on remaining independent of politics. Justice Marshall, addressing the World Law Through Peace Conference at Abidjan, Ivory Coast, said that when judges watch the election returns, they squander the only power they have. But he denied that politics was a dirty business.

title: CIVIL AIR PARLEY IS OPENED IN ROME
description: ROME, Aug. 28The 128country International Civil Aviation Organization started conference here today to consider proposals for new agreements to curb hijackings.

title: Cole Among 5 Giants Waived
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, N.J., Aug. 28The legendary Turk went doorknocking here today and the New York Giants cut five players. The club also placed Dick Enderle and Dave Tipton on an inactive injured list that will keep both linemen out of the remaining two exhibition games.

title: AN AGNEW FRIEND SAID TO AID INQUIRY
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 28Another key witness in the Federal investigation of the possible role of a number of officials, including Vice President Agnew, in kickbacks from Maryland contractors was reported today to be cooperating with the United States Attorney's office here in return for preferential treatment.

title: The Sakharov Dialogue
description: MOSCOWOn Aug. 15, I received a telephone call from the Deputy Prosecutor General and was asked to come to see him. He did not say what it was about, asserting simply that it would be a mantoman talk. I arrived at the Prosecutor's office on Aug. 16 at noon and was met at the gate by an employe who took me into the building, another then accompanied me to an office, where I was received by M. P. Malyarov, the Deputy Prosecutor General, and another man who introduced himself only as Malyarov's assistant. He took notes and participated in the conversation.

title: STATE HELD STRICT ON AIR POLLUTERS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28New Jersey has been found to have the most vigorously enforced airpollution laws and regulations of seven states assessed by a General Accounting Office study.

title: Campbell Advances In Amateur
RAIL LINES BALKED ON DROPPING RUM
description: TRENTON, Aug. 28  A Federal appeals court ruled today that bankrupt rail lines must obtain the permission of regulatory agencies to terminate passenger service.

title: Only an Acre, but to the Rick Nelsons It's a Farm
description: LOS ANGELESFrom the time he was 8 years old, the whole country watched him grow up on television. And 10 years ago, when the daughter of an allAmerica football star and an actress married him, she too entered the fishbowl existence that the children of celebrities either enjoy or simply must endure.

title: NIXON AUDIT FIRM ISSUES STATEMENT
Chrysler Bid of 3% Rejected by U.A.W
description: DETROIT, Aug. 28  The The Chrysler Corporation, designated by the United Auto Workers as the target company for 1973 contract talks with the auto makers, made its !first formal offer to the union !today: an annual increase of 13 per cent in basic wages plus higher p ension and lifeinsurance benefits.

title: Rockefeller to Push Sandman Candidacy For Jersey Governor
description: TRENTON, Aug. 28Governor Rockefeller has agreed to campaign in New Jersey next month for the Republican candidate for Governor in the first of a series of crosscountry political forays that informed Republicans in New York said were calculated to establish him as a candidate for the Presidency in 1976.

title: Increased Prices Sought on 1974 Autos
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28The four domestic automobile manufacturers urged the Government today to let them charge the public an additional $1.25billion for 1974 model cars and trucks.

title: INDIA TO RELEASE 90,000 PAKISTANIS IN PEACE ACCORD
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 28India and Pakistan signed an agreement here today clearing the way for the release of most of the 90,000 Pakistani prisoners held in India and for settlement of other problems arising from their war in December, 1971.

title: WIDE PRICE SURGE INCREASING COSTS PAID BY FACTORIES
description: The nation's manufacturers in the last two weeks have experienced the strongest surge of price increases for the materials they buy since the Nixon Administration's original Phase 1 price freeze ended in 1971, according to a survey of 250 companies.

title: Brandt in Warning on Illegal Strikes
description: BONN, Aug. 28 (Reuters)West German Chancellor Willy Brandt today appealed to West Germans not to demand exaggerated wage increases or raise prices in a way that could threaten the Government's antiinflationary program.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Gregory Battcock, associate professor of fine arts at William Paterson College in New Jersey, is the new editor of Arts Magazine. His appointment was announced here by Alvin Demick, publisher of the 47yearold publication, who said the magazine was entering the most energetic period of editorial expansion in its history, and that the appointment reflected its determination to remain the most authoritative source interested in new ideas in contemporary art.

title: CAMBODIANS FIGHT TO OPEN SEA ROAD
